The room and bathroom were both nice and big.

Location a bit out, but next to bus stop!,

Greenery and cleanliness

Location, comfort and cleanliness of the apartment is excellent! My family and I stayed in the Africa suite and we loved it! It reminded me of home. The host was very friendly and helpful. Thank you Adinda! We'll surely be back!

I hadn't noticed that the incheck hours were limited and the reception was closed when I got there.,

the facilities are simple but complete.

I found the bed not entirely suitable for children, as it was too high. The bathroom also does not have a separate space.,

The location was excellent right near the train station and 10 minutes from the beach. The breakfast was good and the staff was kind and attentive. The room was very clean and the everyday cleaning service was excellent. We also enjoyed a lot the little attentions we received every day: poem, water, desert, fruit.

. we immediately felt welcome and the host was really taking care of us. very good breakfast and mini-bar included in the price. excellent location in the center and very charming house. highly recommended

We weren't given the code for the gate where you actually enter the "Terrasses de Malmedy" area but only a code for the key box to the house. Luckily other people were right there to help out. But make sure your host gives you two codes. One for the gate and one for the key box to the house.,

The place nice and clean. We were unlucky with the weather, the drive way was completely flooded due to heavy rain.

It’s hard to find any negatives here.,

We were welcomed with open arms by hostess Sophie. She had a friendly and caring attitude. She took the time to explain things well and was really helpful with pointing us toward nice activities nearby.The whole B&B was beautiful, cosy and impeccably clean. We stayed in the Oslo room. It looked utterly amazing. A lot of attention to detail. Breakfast was included in our rate, and it was superb! Fresh fruit, and a lot of food choice, freshly ground coffee, glass of fresh orange juice. All with an personal touch.Apple TV with Netflix and other services included. But we hardly used it.

A little noisy could have explained where too dispose of rubbish rather than tell us to bring it with us or pay €5 a bag not cheap @€940 should be no extra costs,

Nice house good location

The rooms can have a few cutlery considering these are Covid times with no restaurants and depend on take away. The staff was not available at 18.00 for support on cutlery.,

We stayed with kids for one night and had a relaxing time. The facility is outside the busy Centrum but accessible by bicycle, car or even walk about 4kms. Clean and well maintained rooms.

It is little bit far from the train station. Check in time is little bit early in the morning at 10am.,

Bed was good enough to have a good and deep sleep. Quite and warm surrounding inside the room. Bath and toilet facility was wonderful and warm to through away cold weather. Staffs were nice and quickly answered to my questioins. Table in the restaurant was quite good for having meals.
The price compared with what you get at this place felt like extortion we wont be back
The hotel was noisy at night. The breakfast was terrible not worth the price. I found some hair in the bathroom too. Overall it was okay, but was expecting better as a 4* hotel.

Would’ve liked to be able to access coffee & tea sachets  guy on duty didn’t know where they where & couldn’t use coffee machine behind the bar .It was after 11 at night think they may just be able to leave them on reception with a gratuity dish for payment ,

The staff is amazing, too friendly!!! And the best was the breakfast. It exceed my expectations.
Great location and building. Friendly, helpful owner

The rooms are not very well isolated, we could hear people in the next room a lot. You need a car if you want to go to restaurants or visit anything.,

Sophie and her husband are very friendly, the rooms are clean and cosy, the breakfast was wonderful! We really felt welcome!

Some issues with unpleasant odours in parts of the house. Opening windows to let it air out helped a lot. Staircase to loft has no balustrade along one side and a significant drop off - poses a safety issue for small children. Otherwise clean and very comfortable.

The food was really good, served warm in the room at a perfect pace

Bed very uncomfortable. ,

Good location, good, cheap breakfast, very helpful and friendly staff.

very friendly staff, rooms are very clean. nice little romantic hotel. located in walking distance of the little town of Aywaille with many nearby restaurants and bars, but still not too crowded. Nice park next to the hotel. There is a nice jogging path along the river. But most of all, try the restaurant of this hotel. Extremely good seafood dishes, good service, nice wine and champagne. Very professional. They offered gluten free bread to me for dinner and breakfast and even offered us a coffee at 6am when the breakfast room was still closed.

Not clean,

Bathroom was big enough and the hotel was close to gare du midi station.

The breakfast was WAY TOO EXPENSIVE,

We thought our host was the best host we’ve ever encountered in our many years of travelling. Lynn went above and beyond any expectations of a host in such a beautiful guest house. This was five star excellence at its best. Attention to detail is an understatement. We felt like a member of the family. And we will 100% return! Love from Mr & Mrs Buckley, Dublin x

The location is not the best if you are looking for alot to do but it is good enough for a relaxing getaway.,

We have a lovely stay. Owner from the place was really friendly. Breakfast was served with a great selections of cheese and cold cuts. The idea of having apple TV in the room was just fantastic! It was a pity that we couldn't make it to a nice restaurant nearby as it was full. There are quite a few nice restaurants in the neighbourhood within 10-20mins driving distance but make sure you make a booking in advance.

De Gouden Kop was comfortable for our family of five with plenty of space.  This would be a great place to stay for an extended period of time as it had a well equipped kitchen.  There are also a number of restaurants nearby, though we didn't explore them on this trip.

Sometime you can hear people walking up the stairs and through the corridor. But it's OK if you are staying in an old castle. ,

It was okay. They had tea and coffee and a kettle in the room and the shower was good. The bar area looked nice and the curtains were good at blocking out the light.

Maybe a bit too expensive with adding the costs for breakfast and taxes,

Amazing hosts, brilliant decor throughout the main house and the suites, fabulous breakfast.

The sink in the kitchen was clogged, same for the shower (to a lesser extent). The shower wall was old and could be cleaned better. The worst was the fire alarm that was beeping every 2 minutes when I arrived (batteries were dead). So I had to take it off to be able to sleep. There was no hair dryer nor the iron in the apartment.,

Leuven is a small town, so everything is easily reachable. What I liked is the fact that amazing biological zero waste shop called "Content" was just around the corner and in front of it there was an artisanal bakery. Really amazing combination just next door.

Parking could be a problem - we always found a space close to the hotel but there is no reserved parking.,

Freshly renovated Hotel with only a few rooms lead by the owner. You can feel that everything is done with love in this property.Room: Size was OK and equipped with nice design furniture. I felt the bed being to soft but thats individual.Location: 5 minutes to reach the the seasideBreakfast: Remarkable variety of high quality foods! Great !The hotel is not cheap but we definitely judged it worth the money.

The only very slight drawback to our accommodation was that, because of the age of the building, some noise could be heard from other guests in the hallway and downstairs in the mornings. However, it wasn't a problem and didn't disturb us too much, as the guesthouse hasn't many guests at any one time and all were very considerate anyway.,

Breakfast was excellent, with a beautifully set table overlooking the canal, fresh fruit, freshly squeezed orange juice, locally made chocolates and continental breakfast on the table already. There was also the option of a cooked breakfast 'hash' and even a complimentary glass of champagne. A great start to each day. The host was very friendly and helpful and recommended various places to eat and drink. Our room was spacious, pretty and comfortable. We had a really enjoyable stay and would love to go back.

nothing really. I would have preferred a late checkout but I understand rooms were needed for the next guests.I did not have hot water but once I told Lynn she took care of it immediately!!,

Everything was beautiful the view of the canal was awesome and Lynn was an awesome host!  She was so helpful and the staff making awesome breakfast was great!!  I would go back there again.I highly recommend this property.Coffee available anytime in the living room.
Very good location, a short drive to Bruge centre, quiet area, a lovely house.

Old blanket and towels with holes,

Food is good. Staff is friendly. Beautiful view. If travel by car it’s nearby old city center.

One thing I had a problem with. Booking.com didn't make it clear on their website that the breakfast is not included in the price. The guy told me that Booking.com is charging them for the service and I had to pay for the breakfast. It was not a big deal E4 and the breakfast was plenty and delicious.,

I was pleasantly surprised how comfy the bed was. The place was clean and the members of the staff were helpful.

I actually drove right past the hotel at first: it could be signposted better.I'd also like to have some tea in the room, and perhaps a small fridge.,

Compact but comfortable rooms, spotlessly clean; and with a Nespresso machine! The restaurant has a limited but very tasty (Italian-style) menu.I loved the 'in the middle of nature' theme throughout.
Located in the town center of Erps-Kwerps in close proximity to restaurants and shopsNicely designed and furbished guest apartments with everything one possible could need
The bed and pillows could do with renewing
Excellent customer service, the staff are extremely helpful!

Was the most beautiful place we ever were! Since the 1st minute we knocked to the door and Lyne showed up it was an amazing experience. She was so sweet when welcoming us, she had ready for us a table with Champagne and chocolates! She explained us everything to do and visit. The house is like a fairytale, feeling like a princess in those beautiful bedrooms. Breakfast is amazing, especially having it with the most beautiful view in all town. The location is perfect, 5-10 min from everywhere. Everything is easy with the hostess, she is really involve with the guess and helpful. We highly recommended this place, there is not place better than Bonifacius, if you want to have an amazing experience this is definitely the best place to stay in Bruges  . Can’t wait to come back. Thanks Lyne for making our stay charming and wonderful.

Bathroom & bed comfort,

Backyard Garden & water lake was beautiful, scenic & lively, although kids playing area was unused & not cleaning from long timeBreakfast & bar counter area was too good & mirrors next to stairs was also awesome

Small upstairs to take the luggage to the room,

Big bathroom and comfy beds

Lack of breakfast in morning and no bread cakes,

Manager was excellent and friendly staff

Den Engel is located in a small hamlet not far from Zaventem airport. The hamlet has a bank and a decent sized supermarket.  The accommodation was very good and the lady in charge was well organised.   Our accommodation was in what appeared to be a stables block of a 120 year old house. The kitchen, bathroom and lounge were on the ground floor and the bedroom and another toilet on the upper mezzanine floor. Upstairs was reached via a spiral staircase.The Internet worked OK and there were lots of channels on the TV.Depending on which way the wind is blowing you will hear aircraft if you sit in the garden.  But the apartment walls are very thick and you could not hear anything once inside.

Would have liked a broom to be able to sweep the floor. The cleaning of the place could have been more detailed eg wipe bins over, wipe the back wall in the kitchen, clean the glass doors in the shower. The power point in the bedroom is loose, toilet roll holder kept falling apart. It would have been better with a block out curtain in the bedroom. Construction work and busy people in the street before 6am not that Condo Gardens can do anything about this.  Not bad for the price though.,

There was a good amount of space. The kitchen was good. When we only had 1 fork and no teatowel in the kitchen the problem was solved quickly. Shop within walking distances. Nice walk down to restaurants and bars. Lots of choice and good food. Parking is available. Parking on the street is free from 9 pm to 9 am.

Nothing,

This is a small boutique hotel which gives a feeling more of a B2B, which I found positive. Saying that, you are not just a number. The owner is so dynamic and communicative, she finds time to spend with each and every guest, to pay attention on the details and make your stay unforgettable. At the arrival I got a rose, fruit in the room and welcome drink, cava or other. Next day we had home made cookies in the room. In the room at your disposal Nespresso coffee and bio tea. Also tea and coffee in the lobby are included in the room rate.Breakfast - is really amazing!!! The variety of bread, jams and hams. at your equest she prepares omelette or any other type of egg and pancakes. I fell in love with her home made bread with nuts and feagues. Cava, fresh orange juice, hot drinks are also served at the breakfast.This is a nice experience, not just an overnighting in an hotel. You won't regret it. I will definitely go back and will recommend everybody!

It got a bit hot but we turned down the heating and opened the windows! ,

Beautiful house and amazing attention to details like the fine crockery and glassware

Very close to the center

the location is quite far fromt he centre,

A complex of studio apartments around a courtyard just outside Leuven centre. The apartment was a little dated, but included a kitchen. For the price it was extremely good value.

nothing,

i would go back to blankenberge just for this place! take some time for the excellent breakfast!

The cleanliness of the bathroom and the rooms could've been a bit better. Noticed hairs in the bathroom around the sink and the floor when we first got there.,

Comunication was great, they are prompt on answering to e-mails and the location is confortabile if you don't have a car
Great place.

This B&B is so charming! I loved its central location. The breakfast was outstanding and such a treat since it was included in our package. Would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Brugge. We wouldn’t think of staying anywhere else if we get to visit again!

There could have been more variety in the breakfast. The floors were wooden and this caused some noise whenever someone passed in front of our room. ,

Good value for money, nice atmosphere in the hotel, nice view from the room (we had a room viewing the garden).

Bed too short for tall people (180+),

Nice hostel.

It was very nice and a great place to stay with our two kids. The owners were awesome.

Beautiful setting, lovely owner

At first we were a little worried as we had not realised that the front of the hotel lay beside a busy road, but there was no traffic noise.   Our room was a little snug - but perfectly adequate for a single night stay.,

Not far from the centre of Bruges. Service and breakfast were excellent and our dog was welcomed. We were able to walk her around the pretty lake behind the hotel.  We hope to stay here again

very friendly reception and staff, excellent restaurant

It’s 15 mins walk from the train station and 10 mins walk from the old town. The split level apartment gives plenty of space for the stay, including a small kitchen area for self-catering.Condo Gardens Leuven was a great base for our trip.

Breakfast very impressive. Beds very comfy, decent coffee machine in room. The location is excellent for Bruges which is only 20 mins away by car and very affordable/safe car parks in the city centre.

Everything, the host was amazing, all the added little touches made for a perfect stay. Room was fantastic, especially the jacuzzi bath. The B & B is absolutely beautiful, looks like something out if a fairytale. Is quite central, is a short walk to main places :)
Great free breakfast, heating amazing,  beautiful gardens, wonderful decoration, reasonable pricing.  Loved  it

The shower has timed faucet system which does not make the bath very comfortable, especially on cold days.,

Bed and room very comfortable and clean bathrooms, toilets not so much. I went on the weekend and there was a band playing at the bar located bellow the rooms. Great nature themed design for the hotel. Nice area for walking / cycling. Restaurant made a very nice (non-menu) chicken salad for my wife after we had discussed GF options.

Although the hotel is good for what you pay, the service for the dinner at night just made our stay unpleasant. We made a reservation in advance. When arriving to the restaurant we were waiting to get seated with another couple. A waiter came to seat the first couple and then started taking orders at other tables, we waited 10 minutes more to be seated. We ordered drinks and wanted to order food immediately but got told we needed to wait 5 minutes, it took 20 minutes to get another waiter to finally take our food order. After we ordered, our own waiter came to ask our order another 15 minutes later. Halfway our dinner we wanted another drink, which we had to cancel after 20 minutes waiting and in the meantime finishing our food already. When we mentioned it they tried to make us not cancel the drink because "they were just working on it", we had to insist to cancel the drink.,

The location is good to discover different parts of Limburg. Price-quality the room is ok and what you can expect. Hygiene ok.

Room was at the front no traffic noise when window shut but our room was just as you cane up the stairs and was woke a few times from noisy people. Everything

Nothing that I can think of. If I really had to pick something, it would be the lack of shampoo/shower gel holder in the shower, but that's really nitpicking.,

Everything you could possibly need was there. The kitchen was well equipped with a huge refrigerator, a coffee maker, bread toaster, dish washer, and so on. We had plenty of space and never felt cramped. We stayed with 4 adults and a dog and really had room to spare. The double bathroom is very nice as well if you go with 2 couples. The location is about 15 min by foot from the town center. We never had any noise issues from traffic or anything. Im usually not much of a "stay at the accommodation" kind of guy but I could relax there for days on end if I had to :).

Close to town,

Nothing stands out. The room is a very tired students residential type squat. Bed was basic and very uncomfortable.

The hotel is located in a street that leads (cars) towards the center of Blankenberge, which means that there is quite a number of cars passing in front of the hotel during the day but also in the evening.Even though the hotel was being very pet friendly, Blankenberge somehow isn't. In a radius of 500 meters, there was only one tiny little green spot (around 20 m2 probably?) where dogs could do their job. This obviously has nothing to do with the hotel, but I feel like having to share it with other pet owners.Wat we also didn't like was the "quietness" of our room. I explicitly asked for a quite room because me and my wife have a very light sleep. Unfortunately we got a room on the 1rst floor, so we had rooms all around us except below us (Breakfast room and reception were below us). From the moment we arrived in our room the first day (around 14h00) until 03h00 at night (!!!) There were people above us moving things around, and heavily and PERMANENTLY walking up and down the room barefoot, working out for a marathon or something...!? (I am being sarcastic about the marathon of course) We didn't manage to rest a single minute after our long journey and neither did we get to sleep the first night. (The next 2 nights were perfectly fine though)Last, but not least, must we admit that one of the staff members were quite harsh to their guests mainly during breakfast. There was for example one other couple from Luxembourg and a German couple that really were not happy with the way that staff member talked to them and treated them, but the staff remained uninterested. Even though we did not have a negative experience, we found it quite disturbing to watch and hear this.,

The location of the Hotel was perfect, a short 10 minute walk to the beach and the town center made it very easy to enjoy the good weather. Also the room was very spacious, modern, clean, comfortable and in our case very pet friendly! Parking spaces are available at a nearby car park or in the streets around the hotel, both at cost though.Finally, the breakfast really was outstanding, I am keen to say that it might have been the best breakfast I have ever had in 30 years!

Owner said the substitute cleaner was doing bad job and it may well be so. Microwave was missing. Location is very good, some hundred meters to the centre. There are some restaurants and a food store nearby, and one reaches everything on foot. Design is modern and adequate. It is really nice when the appartment has sheets and towels and tourist maps included. Cobwebs all over apartment construction works going on in apartment next door cango hammers working from 7.30 both mornings could not relax we should have been informed about this
excellent breakfast, super comfortable room, excellent service

Nothing really hence excellent scoring. Only quibble was the king-size bed was oddly provided with two single duvets under a counter pane rather than a large king-sized duvet. Both duvets were poorly filled. ,

Fabulous location right in the centre on a canal yet very quiet at night. Exceptional personal service from the owner Lynne. Atmospheric historical setting, accommodation and a fine breakfast that would be hard to beat in any larger hotel. If you like staying in something more genuine than a regular hotel (of which there are many fine examples in Bruges), this guesthouse should be on your list for consideration.

The bar closed early 7pm and there was not a restaurant on site for dinner,

The room was huge.  Two queen beds and a large renovated washroom.  the grounds were vast with a nice sitting areas out back and a fountain with some walking trails.  A unique location that was a pleasure to stay in
Aircon broken. Bannister quite rusty, seemed a bit unsafe, missing a curtain

The apartment was not clean. The exhaust fan and light did not work The shower drain was blocked and base of shower filthy There is major building work next door workers look straight into bathroom Apartment on third floor 60 steps no lift,

Location

The apartment smelled horribly (mold/mildew)- despite airing it out every day, the smell was so strong that  it stuck to all my clothes when I left. It was the dirtiest place I have ever stayed- I’m attaching a picture of the dirty/ceiling isolation stalactites because I’m not even sure what they are. The right one also had spiderwebs on it so they appear stagnant at least. The window curtains have weird red stains on them as well. The place is badly isolated- you can hear all your neighbors clearly and the courtyard very clearly- and the place is in a sketchy area (next to the city jail) so you hear a lot of sirens at a lot of times. Heating requires plugging in the electric heater- sockets are falling apart, see other reviews- and smells like something is burning (probably just dirt). Things got worse a few days in when the bathroom started strongly smelling like sewer, I complained to reception but they said the handyman had left and wouldn’t come back until the next day. The smell crept into the rest of the apartment, it was nauseating and made me dizzy. I ended up leaving a day early because I couldn’t take it anymore. If you’re considering staying here because (like me) you’re young and broke, consider staying in Brussels instead and commuting in by train. Seriously, don’t do this to yourself.,

Well, leaving this place was a huge relief.
Everything was fantastic. The level of finish and attention to detail was amazing. The best Hotel I have stayed in for a very long time and I stay in a lot!

The only piece of negative feedback we had was that it was a little noisy at night. The AC rattled when running, but it was too hot not to run the AC (this kept us up) and the walls are quite thin, so we were woken up by a guest arriving next door.,

I had an incident with a man who wasn’t a guest walking through the hotel that knocked on my room door at 10 pm and was following after me. Building gates are open at all times, even during the night which makes it very unsafe. The receptionist named Jasmain called the police who came and interrogated the man. I have an Australian number so I couldn’t do it myself. But then, when I requested to move to a different room as the man knew exactly which one was my room number and where was located, the receptionist very rudely  denied saying that she was tired, she had a long day and she was hungry cause she didn’t eat anything in 24 hours. She said the hotel was fully booked which is not true, as I tried to make a new reservation and the option was still available. She also suggested for me to sleep in a mattress on my father bedroom which was one level up. But she said the housekeepers wasn’t there so I needed to it myself. When I told her if she could help me she denied and then when I requested for her to call the manager, she said she was the manager (only after 2 hours she identified herself as the manager) and she started screaming at me very loud and rude, even coursing me “god damn you” and then she left leaving me alone at midgnight terrified as the man following me could come back any moment as he wasn’t a guest, but the gates of the hotel were open widely. Easy access to my room and the whole hotel at any time by any person from the street. Extremely unsafe. I was terrified, so my father moved the mattress to his room and I slept in the floor. I paid for a room that I couldn’t use. Never been so mistreated in my life. Never been so terrified. The manager jasmien was rude and careless. Morning after, I heard another female guest complaining that her lock didn’t work so the door was open at all times.I repeat, extremely UNSAFE!! I wouldn’t recommend any travellers to stay at this place, specially women.

Staff are not very friendly with just a few exceptions. Check-in takes too long. The gym is 5 machines squeezed into a corridor. No towels provided. Opens only at 7 am. One morning they had even run out of drinking water in the spa and I was informed that delivery would come after 12 o’clock, so several hours later! It took a few discussions and phone calls to arrange for bottle water instead. The crew was almost irritated by me asking although I had just come out sweaty from the gym. A few tips from my side:
• The tiny sport facility is a separate space. Put a water dispenser there, provide towels and keep it open around the clock! The spa can still be closed independently.
• Train your staff to understand the guests’ needs and think a little bit outside the box. Pay them extra for smiling, talking friendly and looking people in the eyes. 
• Make sure your supplies are efficient and your staff pro-active to keep the guests happy. It doesn’t take much!,

1. Money Rip off. Travelers - be Careful! AVOID THIS HOTEL.When I did my booking via booking.com - I have chosen Lux room with 2 bedrooms and indicated 2x adults, and 2x kids 6 an 8 y.o age. Price was GUARANTEED by Booking.com 660 USD WITH BREAKFAST included. When I checked in - Hotel created a story about additional payment needed - to pay for "kids breakfast" and for "kids linen. Tha costed 35 USD extra.At the day of checkout (early hours), at 0600 in the morning, when there was no time to discuss - counter told us we need to pay even more extra "for something". I had no time to argue and it was approx 6 euro on top for "something". That was not a mini bar or any service we used. That was "something with reservation".2. Air condition in our second bedroom - did not work. It was damn hot to sleep. Asked 3 times to fix the problem - nothing was done about this.AVOID AVOID AVOID!,

The bathroom floor can get wet if the shower door isn't shut properly but due to the heated floor it dries up very quickly.  Unfortunately, due to the country, you do have a smell of sulphur when running the shower but that's just a given and the water is still clean and the water in the kitchen to drink from is amazing, so clean and fresh.,

The apartment was in a great location, it was right near to the pond area and we walked into Reykjavik centre which was only a 10 minute walk.  We had hired a car to see other areas outside of Reykjavik and there was  street parking right outside which if you park from after 6:00pm and are out before 9:00am it is free.  If not then the parking was not expensive and very handy to be so close to the apartment.The apartment was a great size and lovely and warm after a day out in the cold.  We ate out some nights but had also visited the larger Bonus supermarket on the way from the airport and the apartment had a hob, microwave, dishwasher and coffee maker and plenty of plates, pans, cutlery to cook with which helped keep some of the costs down as Iceland is expensive to those who don't live there.The bed was really comfortable and the room a good size.  They have a television in the lounge should you wish to watch it The bathroom is on the smaller size and the shower is more like a wet room but the water was powerful and hot and there was underfloor heating which was really nice when you had been out in the cold.  They have a hairdryer so no need to take one if you are limited on luggage.Our other tip was that we took our metal coffee mugs and water bottles so we could fill these up before we left for the day to keep costs down and to save plastic when out for the day.  Lots of leaflets and paperwork as enter the building and a brochure with lots of details in the apartment and contact numbers, restaurant recommendations. We would definitely stay here again.
Quite, cooperative, helpful

The home is somewhat difficult to find. It requires that you turn off on a very small street that looks, at first, like a pedestrian walkway. Use your GPS! Although they do have a small and very nice restaurant near their home in the town, the walk although not excessively long is all downhill, which means that if you walk, the return trip is all uphill. If you have any walking issues, this may be difficult, and we decided that even though it was short we would drive.,

Although this was one of the most expensive rooms during our trip, it was spectacular. The hosts were kind and helpful. The bathroom even had some small sample size products to use. The breakfast was absolutely wonderful with lovely coffee and a beautiful view over the back yard and garden area.

First of all, the service. Girls at the reception didn't want to communicate, nice and I didn't feel welcome to ask any questions or assistance what so ever. I instead used google engine to look for the information instead of talking to them.There was a huge problem with my in-room breakfast. The reception provides you with a card (bad quality printing), with a number of dishes and drinks and no price in it. When I asked about the price upon my arrival, they suggested me to double check in the restaurant. I checked the prices and ordered a breakfast for the next morning. However, I was charged twice of that sum. It turned out that from 7-11 am they charge 25$ for any food ordered upstairs, which was a big surprise. It took me 24 hours to sort this out and the staff was very reluctant to do anything about it.On the friday evening there was a wedding upstairs, so it was very loud and noisy (even though I have requested a quiet room - ladies at the reception offered me to pack my stuff and move to another room at thr midnight). I assume that all the rooms from the 14-15th floor have such a problem. The staff couldn't do anything, so I had to call the reception 2 more times.Do not order drinks at the bar because the wine is not what is seems. I have ordered wine from Chile and it wasn't the one, moreover the bartender added water to the white wine (they use this practice to earn money).,

Overall, the room was nice and it was not far from the Minsk Arena, but I think these are the only advantages of this hotel.

We wanted to order a pizza. I called the extension from the menu card, somebody picked it up after 10 seconds, and told me to call another extension.
It made me look like an indiot.
I called the extension. Somebody picled it up, so i told him we wpuld like to order a pizza. He told me, that he's gonna call me back in a minute. I waited for 3, and went down to the lobby to ask what happened. I saw our room number on a piece of paper. So the guy asked me if i called them. 
I told him yes, and i was waiting for him to called me back as promised. 
He told me he did, which is not true. My partner was with me next to the phone in the room.
They made me feel like an idiot 3 times. I mean this is a 5* hotel. DON'T DO THIS TO YOUR GUESTS!!!!!!
Please tell the guy at the room service (or the waiter) to smile after opening the door. Would feel better.

The houses are probably better for summer than for winter- it was warm enough (with electric heating for about 35 Euro for three days), but it did not feel very 'cosy' (cold tiled floor). The house was freshly painted when we arrived and still smelled quite strongly of paint. The playground in the park felt a bit 'sad', but probably also because the nearby Brasserie was closed because of COVID. It is a shame that you cannot really see on the web-site which house you are booking, because at least from outside they looked quite different from each other.,

The houses in the park are nice and well kept and very functional. The little secluded garden is a bonus. The area around has all necessary shops within 2 min drive or 15 min walk (with a small child). The beach at Bredene was nice and much less crowded than other parts. Everything seemed clean and all COVID protection measures were in place.

I arrived at 19.00 as I had informed the staff previously.  It was raining hard and cold, and the staff had already left (Friday night), but the key code did not work, nor did anyone pick up the phone as per instructions.  Only after calling several times on the external line (from my phone) was my call answered.  However, the person on the line was not familiar with the location nor of the system for checking in, and therefore I was only able to gain access to my room key with the help of another couple who had been at the hotel before.  The room was very nice, but not the best for dogs - access via a narrow spiral staircase (dogs had to be carried). To be fair, it turned out I had been allocated the wrong room.  No doubt wonderful in the summer, and superb for weddings and family holidays, but not ideal for an overnight stay on a cold and wet night.,

Some little things were missing.  There was a coffee maker, but no ground coffee.  A bowl with some mini chocolate bars, but no sugar sachets for hot drinks.  A hairdryer but no shower gel/soap.  A DVD player but no DVDs (particularly missed as we have young children).  A nice enough TV with cable channels but only one English language channel I could find (BBC First). There was a decent fold out bed, but the mattress cover was dirty.  These are only little things, but they are things that made us ever so slightly less comfortable. N.B. 1) There is free on the road parking, but between Mon-Sat/9-5, it is for two hours only (with a permit provided by the owners): 2) Check in is 5pm (!) but emailing the owners got a more reasonable check in of 2.30 pm.,

I dont have the name, a very petite guy walks in and says, it's time for your check out, and starts to clean the room while I'm picking up some last minute things. Its 11:00am at this time. Since I was packed up, just had to wear shoes and walk out. I politely asked him to allow me a couple of mins and wait outside if that's ok? And he says, its check out time, I have to clean the room. Then goes back to cleaning my room and keeping my bag to the door and puffing the sheets almost to my face. Shocked and surprised, I walked out with open shoe laces. I have NEVER even at Starwoods or Relais and Cheateux or anywhere in the world, have seen or heard guests been almost asked to get out. I won't recommend this place because forget the service delight in today's world, this guy literally showed my stuff the door. ,

The room's safe was not working, and we did not want to leave our passports and valuables while we were out. They said they were sending someone right away to fix it, but the person did not arrive for two hours and worked for a good 45 min. Any other hotel would have just moved us to another room, but they didn't. Luckily, we had family in the hotel, so we used their safe and went out to eat. When we came back after two hours, no one had shown up to fix it. We had to call again. Then the person came and worked on it. After a long travel, we were tired and did not like the aggravation. We just wanted to rest. We have been regular customers of the hotel and find that the staff is very friendly, but there is always something not working in the room. Otherwise, it's a good hotel, clean, very well located and close to the best shops.

It was only a 5 minute brisk walk into the centre of Ypres.On street parking is free (paid for by the host) but you have to display a blue dial card on top of your dashboard and you're allowed 3 hourly periods from 9am to 6pm so you have to return to your car at 12pm and 3pm to re-set the dial. This can cause a bit of a panic when you're half-way round a museum but I'm not complaining because as I said, it was free.The stairs from the kitchen/diner up to the mezzanine bedroom are quirky and not suitable for everyone!The host lent us a 2-pin USB charger as we had forgotten to take our adapter.
Highly recommended ... location and service

It would be easy to add a warning sign to the wall. (It does have a warning note in the welcome book, it it is easy to forget and hit your head on the ceiling)The main door lock jammed on our second day and we were locked inside the apartment, though the host arrived swiftly and quickly contacted a locksmith to open the door, we had to wait in all morning until the door was repaired so missed a few hours of our holiday, which was disappointing. The locksmith was very friendly and we had no more trouble after he had completed the repairs.,

Apartment was in a great location, well equipped, very clean, warm and comfortable. The host was easy to contact by phone, and was quickly on hand to resolve any issues. Easy car parking and within walking distance of the main square.
17°C in the room!!!!

3 little packets of chips/peanuts were placed next to the kettle plate inside the cupboard (near the safe and where we hang our clothes) so we assumed it was free to take and was like ‘welcome snacks’. We discovered at the end of our stay that it was part of the ‘mini-bar’ thing, which was placed at a totally different place in the room (the fridge for extra drinks was also not even turned on). In the end, we had to pay 7,50 euros extra for those tiny packets (clearly too expensive for what it was)… We found it very sneaky as it should have been clearly mentioned and put with the drinks from the mini-bar then! The price of the hotel is also not cheap, so why make us pay additional costs like this… Another bigger issue we faced was the parking next to the hotel. Although it doesn’t belong to the hotel, it gives direct access to it and is convenient to use for travellers. We were asked if we came by car but were never warned about one IMPORTANT thing to take into account: we cannot exit the parking until 3pm on Sunday because of the market…,

I just spent one night in this hotel and I was on my own. I have been leaving in Brussels for over 20 years and I've passed by this hotel hundreds times but never stayed there so this time I decided to book a night at Le Chatelain. I know it's a 5 stars hotel so I was expecting a 5 stars room. It was a tiny one (which wouldn't have bothered me eventually) located on the 3rd floor and the view from the window was awful a depressing (a dirty grey wall at short distance). See picture attached.I cannot stand air conditioning so I switched it off but a kind of fan noise was still there...and it stayed with me all night, I could hardly sleep a couple of hours. No way to turn it off! I guess it was the bathroom ventilation.The bathroom was also tiny and the pullout shower head located in the bathtub didn't stay properly in place-straight-so I had to hold it in my hands while showering to avoid water going all over the bathroom. I had one nail broken and was looking for a nail file but there wasn't any. No body lotion either!The bathroom bin didn't open with the pedal so I had to open it manually. I always appreciate a chamomile tea or tisane before sleeping but the coffee station only contained 2 teabags, no caffeine-free infusion at all.In a 5 stars hotel you should not experience all this so I was extremely disappointed and won't return to Le Chatelain.,

A little tricky to find at first as there are many different parts of Vaubanstraat depending on the house number.Once that is known, logical and easy to find, I turned left from the A37 onto Zillibekevoetweg-Steverlyncklaan then further on up the road, turn left into Vaubanstraat by the Volvo garage. La Chambre d'Amis 83A is a short way down, righthand side on the corner, a semi circular modern style property, satnav will probably see you outside number 83 next door.The friendly owner came out to welcome me into a stylish self contained room, with two beds and parking for my vintage motorcycle outside the large window, so you can lie on a bed to gaze at your pride and joy, as owners of vintage vehicles tend to do...The modern bathroom is clean and fresh with an excellent shower and the beds warm and comfortable.Set in a modern well tended area, it feels very safe and secure with a relaxing ambience, especially in the large, well tended lawn, small veg garden and hens in a run which supply your eggs.Breakfast is in your room, with Nespresso machine, milk sachets, sugar, tea, cutlery etc supplied. It arrives at your chosen time in the form of a traditional basket set outside your door and you can smell the warm rolls and croissants as you bring it inside, fantastic! If the weather is good there are seats outside to enjoy the garden as you eat. It,s a pleasant 10 minute walk to the town centre via the Menin Gate, and if you are here to do a poppy run as I do every October, it would be hard to find a nicer place to stay, with friendly, interesting hosts.Roll on next year.

The room is small and old.The hotel doesn't have elevator.The staff changed me from one to another and moved all my stuff without telling me. Our room was called "Sophie's Choice". When I read the information e-mail from the owner, it definitely gave me pause as I wondered what I was going to. Thankfully, all was lovely but...why name a holiday apartment after such a bleak tale?! I never met the hosts to ask.,

Clever use of space in the room. A large, very comfy bed in the gallery, a well provisioned kitchen area and a comfy lounge area. The spotless wet-room has a translucent shower door between it and the kitchen - we were unfazed by this reduced level of privacy but some may have qualms....Lovely garden and courtyard areas; air conditioning that operated silently and well. Atmospheric lights, candles and matches provided; and a folder of information/tips. All correspondence/info was via e-mail and locks were codes for all doors so need to exchange keys. Helpfully, there is a secure luggage store for early arrivals/late departures and secure bike storage in the court yard.The apartments are very central but the city noise just completely stops within the road! A haven of quiet. Highly recommend!

New Matinal is in the central square of La Louviere, and adjacent to the underground car park and other amenities. The Hotel has been refurnished, and the rooms are themed and well appointed, but small. They have paid attention to sound insulation, and the only noise after hours is a buzz from the bar downstairs. The shower room is basic, with a small 'timed' shower cubicle but it is modern. The bed was comfortable with power available by the bedside. There is no air-conditioning. Breakfast is in the bar on the ground floor and is a good selection of local bakery, good fruit juices, fruit, and fresh good coffee from an espresso machine! Entry to the hotel is by key-card and is secure. There is no lift. Our room had opening windows which provided fresh air and no noise. This part of Belgium is very French, and English is not spoken everywhere. There is a good selection of restaurants in the town; Chinese, Greek, Brazilian, (see photo), Italian, Pizza, and 'local'.

One this visit we could not use the airco for whatever reason, and the room was really hot. We had to open a window to cool the room which meant we heard a lot of noise coming from the street. ,

Upon arrival at the B&B we were standing for a closed door for like 20 minutes, rang all the bells on the door but no one opened. We arrived in Kortrijk at like 11:00 but check in is only possible after 16:00 which is a very unusual tbh. I had to call the lady of the B&B and ask her to let us in. When it came to the administration of the check in it is not properly organised at all. The booking i did was pay upon arrival but still they deduct half the cost of my account weeks before. When she asked us to pay i still had to pay +200€ while the total of our booking was 190€ so she totally ripped us off. I ended up paying over 300€ in total. Also she does NOT accept card payments, cash only which to me looks like she is taking bookings under the counter to avoid taxes. I am originally from Belgium and that is not how we run places there!!!
I refused to do cash only and managed to convince her to accept my card payment as i knew she was ripping us off and this way i can file a complaint to booking.com and also claim my money back via paypal for the prepayment she already took of my card. If you pay by cash you have no proof of payment as she does not provide you with any receipts !!!
The room itself was beautiful and the beds were great. The bathroom had a sink that was leaking onto the floor, very poor plumbing, one of the buttons to flush on the toilets was broken and the knob of the shower to turn on the water fell off. We didn't bother mentioning any of it because we did not wanted to ruin our daughter her birthday weekend.
SIDE NOTE: on the second day we were there, there were 2 other girls that arrived at the B&B and again the owner did not open the door for them as she was not present at the house. We let the girls in as they were standing outside for like 15min and it was getting ridiculous.,

I loved the Moroccan style interior, we stayed in the triple room with our daughter and was very nice. The B&B definitely had charisma and felt like home, the lady always made sure there was enough water, coffee and tea for everyone. My daughter also received a small birthday gift which was very nice of the lady.

Everything about the place and the staff was excellent they were so friendly and we had everything that we wanted.

Nothing, everything was perfect and far surpassed my expectations. I would certainly recommend it to friends and I would stay there again if visiting Ypres. It was ideally located and within easy reach of all the main attraction.,

Location - great! next to the metro and bus routeCleanliness and service - great!Breakfast was good

We were a group of 8 adults and two children and we booked 2 apartments. It was perfect. 
The kitchen had everything we could wish for, dishwasher, stove, oven, microwave, even spices, tea and some free coffeepads :) They also have a hairdryer in the bathroom.
It's perfect for walking in the city center, and it also only takes 10mins with the tram to the Train Station. The host was very friendly.

Sometimes you could hear the upstairs neighbors a litte,

The layout of the apartment and amenities were really good

Everything was fine. Alex met us and showed the property even very late in the evening (after midnight) since we delayed on the Customs for several hours longer than it was planned from the beginning. The property looked better than on photos. The host was very attentive to all our queries, kindly explained how to get to the place which was our final destination .

Can not think of anything.,

I travel to this area every week to the client and first time stayed in Ibis Styles Nivelles. Finally found my place! Hotel is new, clean with small gym. Nice staff, good breakfast included. In the evening I did 30 minutes walk to Nivelles city center.

The hotel is not very modern, but - to be honest - it didn't really bother us. Rooms are a bit noisy.,

We liked the location of the hotel, the spacious room, the comfortable bed, the breakfast (especially the excellent coffee and the fresh croissants) and the staff's friendliness. We appreciated that we could leave our suitcase at the hotel to spend the day in town on our last day.

The breakfast is VERY basic (nothing warm - no eggs) and the coffee unspeakably bad. Bring your own instant coffee - because it's worth coming anyway.,

The atmosphere downstairs is really nice, the bed is quite comfy despite its small size, and there is plenty of hot water in the shower. There is a very nice garden. The hot drinks at free disposal are wonderful (at least for the teas, as the coffee is not good.) Also, the value for money is really good. Despite all my criticism I would gladly go back.

Good breakfast and nice sized room.  The WiFi was efficient and consistent, especially for Europe.  The excellent Saturday market is 100 meters away!

Very well equipped and comfortable apartment not too far from the centre of Ghent. Aircon and a lift to third floor were much appreciated. And the provision of good quality bicycles would be a bonus for some.Pre-arrival communication from our host was excellent as was the check-in process.

It is a little basic but it was clean, comfortable and perfectly located for the centre and Menin gate. The chap who greeted us was very friendly and made sure that we were happy with everything. There is free parking available a few streets away but it only cost us 2 euros to park right outside the hotel for the night. The breakfast was typically European but there was the added bonus of freshly boiled eggs. There are probably better hotels nearby but you will pay a lot more for them. Perfectly beautiful location for history of the area. Loved the country setting and quiet! It was especially nice to breakfast with the other guests and share travel experiences. Marc’s B & B is a gem & definitely worth a visit!

The owner of the hotel was rude and the overall cleanliness of the room we were allocated was disgusting. The carpet was stained, the window was broken and taped up and the dust had been there for ages. The TV didn't work and the room was remotely like anything I had seen when looking for accommodation, we requested a different room he said he didn't have any. He informed me I had booked a double and that was what he gave me. He was then told that I had asked for double or a twin but certainly not a dirty room.  He said there was nothing he could do, he didn't have rooms like those advertised that was just booking.com making things up to get more people in. He eventually moved us to one of those rooms but it was still dirty with mould inside the cabinet in the bathroom and towels you could shoot peas through.  There were glass rings on the furniture which was covered in dust and the state of the radiators was sickening. I took a video or the first room and a couple of photos of the second room. We lived out of our suitcases for the 4 days & we were there on our own there were no other guests.I wouldn't recommend this dirty hotel run by a very rude owner/manager to anyone!,

We booked the double room with spa bath specifically because of the spa bath. We went above budget for this specific luxury. However when I was about to enjoy this spa bath, the lightning as well as the different functions weren’t working properly. Then when I used the double function, a lot of dirt came out of the tiny holes and all of a sudden I sat between what looked like pieces of old dirt. We asked the staff to come have a look and they did, but the language barrier made it impossible to work it out, so no spa bath luxury that we looked so much forward to. Afterwards the bath came ‘alive’ (accompanied with an awful smell and a lot of noice) on it’s own twice (!) ones in the middle of the night and ones in the morning. Would’ve of liked to see this differently obviously. Slightly dissapointed as you may understand. ,

Room 12 on 4th floor was comfortable. Staff very friendly. Good location between metro Brouckere and Rogier, not far from the North station. Nice art deco elements in reception/breakfast area.

I loved this B and B! We were very warmly welcomed! The location is great slightly off the beaten track so not touristy as other parts of Bruges are. We left out car at the free car park at Coisseaukaai and caught the shuttle bus to Anna's. The room was quite hot on the top floor but by opening a window it soon cooled down. The Vlissinghe pub nearby is very atmospheric and does great  beers. Central Bruges is a short walk away.,

See above.

Staff should smile more...…..,

Clean property, good value, good location near metro....

We liked everything :) The house is in a very quiet small village by the canal and it it very cosy, with this oldfashoned charme. Hosts are lovely, warm couple that you can see are running this place with love and devotion. They are there for any request or help you might need. The dining room is nice and intimate with classical music during breakfast( breakfast is really ok, not so much variety, but one does not need more for breakfast anyway) The room itself is spatious, Beds are comfortable. Room also has a very personal touch with some nice details. Location is very good if you like being outside of busy urban areas. Brugge and Ostende are both 15 min drive by car, so it is also conviniant for city hopping. The car parking is available on the street in front of a building, and there is also a restaurant just accros the street( which we did not have time to visit). Also one info... they could not accept our credit cards for payment, so we had to pay in cash ( it might be important to someone)

A little noisy at night and in the morning when the trash collectors pick up rubbish. Narrow staircases, but at least on the way up, if you need assistance, you can be helped.,

Fantastic location to Grand Place, De Brouckere and Rogier with all means of transportation around. Even Garde du Nord is merely 10 min walk away.Super friendly receptionist.Quality breakfast.

Nothing as of dislike but could have been better, if a dustbin has been provided in the main room too, otherwise one has to walk into the washroom every time to reach the dustbin,

The place is beautiful and tranquil.

Clean and safe place. 3 nights single occupancy for 165$ without breakfast for 2 person. Close to subway so you cans get any place you want. Supermarket is just on its right. Bar with a cute lady working there. Cleaning service is everyday. So I can advice that place for business trip or for staying 4-7 days.
Extremely warm welcome.  The property was located in a quiet area not far from the E40 for our onward journey to the Channel Tunnel.  Fantastic breakfast
Excellent location, and very interesting hotel in old building that is completely renovated.

There is only a curtain between the bedroom and bathroom in the room we stayed in which didn’t offer much toilet privacy.,

Anne was lovely and helped us map out the main attractions and routes around bruges. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was lovely, freshly made pastries, fruits, cheeses etc every day. The location was great, about a 10 minute walk to the centre but in a very quiet little square.
What was of importance for me was the location just at a metro station (Pushkinskaya metro).

Had to go to other hotel for breakfast. Not a real problem but when I arrived, I had no idea where to go. Maybe make sure there is a sign or something. The breakfast itself was very good though. ,

Very friendly staff and Herentals is a very nice city. I could use a garagebox because the morning after my stay there was a market. Diner in the Hotels restaurant was also very nice.

nothing, everything was perfect, the access to the room is a bit complicated, but I am guessing it is to isolate the rooms from the noise from the hotel's event venues.,

everything was very good, but the breakfast was excellent, and the staff was also very nice !

Kitchen and lounge a little cramped for a large group when receiving visitors with us but it was manageable. Some confusion about charges for bed linen and towels. Booking.com details showed these items as paid for but rental company wanted separate charge for these from us. Couldn't find remote control for the TV.,

Easy entrance, good quiet location by canal but still close to main square. Good number of bathrooms (3). Lots of information left in house for things to do. Good value.

No problems or faults with the property or staff. ,

The rooms are excellent value for money, the owners are very friendly and helpful throughout the stay. Lots of information given on the surrounding area and best ways to get there. The breakfast is amazing too.
Good location, with friendly and helpfully staff.

It wasn’t really that clean ,

The style and decor

Nothing!,

It was a wonderfully calm place. Breakfast was excellent. Anne was a superb hostess with lots of useful information about Brugge. The house was in a superb location. We will look forward to returning.
Very good location...

Very nice lady at reception.
Great bar with fabulous belgium beers !
All good.

Nothing,

That it had everything and more that we could need. Enough places for 9 of us to sit and eat at a table. The children loved the tablet tennis table and the football table. They also really enjoyed the garden with swing slid and big enough to play football

Room was not serviced daily.,

Hosts were very friendly and welcoming. They accommodated our needs for an earlier breakfast serving which was much appreciated. Very comfortable stay. A very good restaurant is directly across the street from the B&B. We ate there two nights in a row.

We had an issue with the power blowing in the evening. I call the owner who doesn't live on site and they arrive in approx 15 mins & switched back on but unfortunately the heating did not reset and room was cold. When I mentioned to the owner he said I should of turned the bathroom heater on, but this was on a timer and could not be felt in the bedroom.,

Owners friendly and happy to help with most things. Perfectly situated

There was no elevator, the breakfast was poor.,

Very good location, good value for money, friendly staff

there is no door between the main Room and the bathroom ,

location is very good in the center of the city 
the owner is very kind
breakfast was good

The breakfast was too expensive compared to the hotel price and local price level (18.50 Belorussian roubles, or about 7.50 €), which did not reflect in quality and choice, although there was both hot and cold food + freshly brewed coffee, etc. Still, paying 30% of the room rate for breakfast is not good (you wouldn't pay 30 € for breakfast at 90 € per night hotel, right?). No air conditioning in the rooms, although the temperatures may reach +30 C even in September. The business centre (printing, copying, etc) was closed on week-end, although, looking at the Minsk visitors' profile, big part of them are people on business trips.,

1980's Soviet era luxury hotel for foreign tourists (renovated in 1996). Glimpse into that era, with touch of contemporary amenities, like super good WiFi. Large room (though little bit noisy, as the hotel is located on crossing of two 8-lane streets), but still OK. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is superb: just 50 metres to Pushkina metro station from where you can reach the centre in 10 minutes (3 stops) for 0.30 € per ride :). Lots of eateries in 50 metres distance, including Burger King, McDonalds and local 'shaurma' (chicken). You can also order food delivery from different places via the Internet, payment by card or cash. Supermarket 100 metres to the other side from the hotel. Good room service and cleaning. Overall - probably one of the best places to stay in Minsk (not taking into account the missing AC).

It’s a bit old and have specific smell.,

Very big rooms and very clean!

Limited restaurant options around the hotel location on weekends.,

Comfortable bed, quiet room, big bathroom. Very well connected region.

Stairs were very steep but we expected that in Bruges.,

It was all good. Location is central and convenient for shops etc but it is in a very quiet street which we appreciated.
We had a very nice stay at this quiet, friendly, cosy little accommodation!Thank you for the special service!
Very good breakfast

Lighting in the room could be better. A lamp for working at the desk would be a useful addition as the room lighting is not very bright, although perfectly adequate if you don't need to work or search in the depths of your luggage! ,

Very quiet surroundings (but only 50m from the main pedestrian shopping area), great shower, comfy bed, friendly staff, small hotel with character. 10 minutes stroll to the Grand Place.

The spiral staircase was not made clear Pre-booking (I don't think). Anyone with any mobility issues would find it either impossible or very difficult.,

Breakfast = Excellent, Location = Ideal.The hospitality of the host Anne.

The road next to the hotel is noisy ,

The room was clean and the bed was comfortable
No conditioner in the shower and the maid took my lotion
Simply wonderful
Excelent staff!!!
Superb hosts and the location is fantastic for cycling holidays, next to a canal with lovely rides to Brugge and de Haan .

Couldn't get safe to work.,

Good location
Comfortable room

The linen wasn't clean. After I've noticed it on reception, they changed it. Still, the impression is not the best. Also, sound isolation was very bad, so I've heard my neighbors.,

The location is great, it is just in the city center. The staff is friendly and responsive.
Nice, clean room, close to everything. The bathroom is very lovely.

Tea and coffee in the room, for when you first wake up.,

The staff spoke English and were very helpful in getting me around Minsk.

Pillows were not good; very lumpy.  Bed only reasonably comfortable. (There is a sort of rubber sheet under the sheets.  Not nice to sleep on. Breakfast okay but only buffet.  No a la carte (ie fried eggs) available.,

Friendly greeting upon check in. Comfortable room. Restaurant pretty good.

Nothing it was great for us as we were cycling. Some may find it a bit rural though.,

Fantastic space with seating area, lovely touches like free drink on arrival and tea and coffee making facilities. Great breakfast that was best value we had in Belgium. Host lovely.

The main entrance door was under reconstruction.,

Nice and helpfull staff, excelent breakfast.

The B&B is located in what feels like a wonderfully hidden corner of true Flanders (even though the entry to the highway is close) -  located alongside the canal between Ostend and Bruges, great for walking or biking,  and with views on fields and sheep from the bedroom window.The house itself is also interesting -  while the house has been re-organized for B&B purposes, historical and personal touches remain, including art.  The breakfast, served in the former living/dining room of the house, is a real treat; the hosts are friendly and service-oriented, and yes, everything is very clean.   We loved our stay there, and recommend it highly.
A great location.

The fridge was broken. There is no lift (I knew that) so if you have large luggage ask for lower floor.,

Nice renovated modern room, spacious bathroom with shower. The bed was really comfortable.

Nil,

Anne is a lovely host. Her breakfast is fresh,  with a great variety of mueslis, yoghurts, cereal, cold cuts, breads and preserves; delicious coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice. 
Our room was on the first floor so the narrow winding stair case was easy for us. 
We stayed on the hottest day (37°c)  of the year. And although there is no air conditioning, the room was cooled down with a fan and the big windows open. 
Our bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was massive!!  
Location is excellent. A short stroll over the canal and you're in the centre of old town, but far enough away to feel like you are a local rather than a tourist. 
If I ever return to Brugge I would stay here in a heart-beat. Highly recommend.
Really cheap comparing to others and with good location and very very clean hotel...recommended

Stayed on the ground floor, and could hear a bit the noise from the other rooms, especially from the room above.,

Very good location, with the supermarket, cafés, banks round the corner, and close to the sea and the coastal tram stop. Very nice owners, pleasant room, pretty patio. Kettle, microwave and cutlery put at the guests' disposal.

The room had the toilet isolated from the bath -  it was strange to cross to the other door just to was your hands.,

The dinner was amazing, they have a pub aside where you can go for a beer after dinner and find very nice people. The deck is good place when summer arrives, or if you want to smoke without noise.

The only thing we did not find acceptable was the electric cooker, the heating elements took way to long to heat up to cook food...,

the house was fine, suited our needs..   We enjoyed our stay, and the house was cozy..

-,

The accommodation is just so lovely and cozy - and we loved the surroundings! Two ponds are around the house and plenty of green wherever you look. In the neighbourhood you can find horses, donkeys and cows - make sure you discover the surroundings by walking or cycling. We had a truly pleasant stay - the bed was really comfortable and the place is perfect to spend some time inside the warm house while it's cold outside. On sunny days, you can enjoy a beautiful view and have breakfast outside. Speaking about breakfast: we ordered that in advance and we had a very delicious, rich breakfast and spent a perfect morning there!Birgit, the owner was really lovely and very responsive - our weekend trip to Logies De Meerkoet was truly memorable. We will definitely come back - thanks for everything, Birgit!

Relatively lack of illumination in the room,

An absolutely good and crystal clear hotel at a calm location, close to public transport.
Good location for people with cars so that you can have easier travel in and out of Brugge. Not a good location to visit Brugge if you're a quick Traveller with bags as you have to take a bus.

Narrow staircase,

Comfortable rooms and very clean

It is not a real minus just more variety on the food menu would be cool. But the kitchen facilities might not be equipped for more. ,

Very nice owner lead hotel in original Art Deco style. Rooms are surprisingly luxurious and well done in detail. Good located between two major Metro stations and close to Gare du North. Plenty of shopping possibilities around. Breakfast looked great, but I did not had one. Amazing place to come back to.

The 2nd time at Anna's and it was wonderful. The room is spacious, the breakfast very lovely and the hospitality shown by Anne just wonderful. Anne got in contact prior the arrival day and send us recommendations for the parking. She greeted us and explained the B&B and the surroundings. The room is wonderful, we had the room with twin bed option, and the bathroom is huge. The breakfast is delicious, fresh cut fruits, a delicious selection of cheese and ham / sausage and different cereals. Anne offered fresh orange juice which was very refreshing. The location is perfect - a 5 minutes walking distance to the old town. Close to shops, restaurants and bars. Just the perfect getaway!

-,

Breakfast

Breakfast was terrible.  With almost an hour to spare before it was due to finish, there was barely anything hot left and no staff on hand.,

Room was spacious with outside space.
Every thing 5 stars! Great accommodation with super nice hosts! Spacious beautiful house with big garden. We only were sorry that the stay was too short. Will be back for longer stay
Was fantastic place for living. Boss lady was so friendly. Breakfast was so nice. We will be see you soon!

- Sounds and conversations from the hallway - front doors are weakly soundproofed - Cleaning lady trying to enter the room at 9 am Saturday morning,

- Comfortable bed - Free coffee/tea and soft drinks in mini bar- Very good price/value ratio- Excellent location- Stuff
Very good host and excellent breakfast. Nice experience

Check wasn't until 16.00 hrs and there is no access to the Hotel before this time so, if you arrive and wish to drop your baggage there for safe keeping, this is not possible!There is no lift and the Staircase is not very wide with Marble steps and, there is no Handrail on the outside which makes carrying luggage up the staircase quite precarious, could be a serious problem for older or less able visitors!,

Breakfast was good and varied, the location was very convenient for sightseeing and the Menin Gate.

The toilet smell of cigarettes and there was bits of cigarette ash on the ground, plus the ventilation didnt work at the toilet so the smell really didnt go away. The bathroom and everything else was spotless clean though. I didnt confront the staff about this matter as I stayed for one night only, but Im pretty sure they would offer a solution. It's just weird that the housekeeping would mark this room as a clean one, the smell was really strong.,

Entrance to the hotel is through a nice lobby bar with brilliant atmosphere. The room is cosy, bed soft, but comfortable. Staff was helpful altough I didnt bother them with any requests during my one night stay.

The mattress of the bed is so light that it moves and the wooden steps to our first-floor room is steep, which make luggage carrying difficult.,

We like the elegantly decorated interior of the B & B. We particularly enjoyed the wonderful breakfast and the bathtub.

Bathroom - water was leaking from sealing. No family rooms were available in this hotel.,

Close to subway station, easy to reach the city centre. Very helpful staff at reception - rearranged bookings so we can stay for another night in the same rooms.

We just missed the 'doudou' festival ;),

Excellent breakfast. Excellent location. Spacious and comfortable bathroom. Friendly hosts.

We were 8 and would have liked a place to play cards or drink a tea before going to bed. During summer there is a nice place outside but during winter this does not fit.,

Warm welcome and great choice for breakfast with fresh fruit salad and boiled eggs, several types of bread. Comfortable beds and nice warm shower.
Could add a small menu for Vegan Breakfast as well and indicate explicitly for ease of identifying.

The beds are a bit small. A curtain in the bathroom would be great. And the house could have been a bit cleaner, there where a lot of cobwebs everywhere.,

the propety was perfectly located for us, close to family and the beach (45min drive). The house and garden are specious, also very great that they allow pets. The house is located in a small street, so there is no traffic noise.

Poor Wi-fi (very slow) for an hotel in EU district.,

Good breakfast in nice room.   Great location for EU district.  Quiet street.

Unfortunately property was unable to accept payment by credit card.  Lots of mosquitoes in the room.,

Good choice for breakfast, quality ingredients.  Good size family room.  Accomodating and friendly host.
Parking not directly at hotel because of street building works - also made hotel a bit hard to find - presumably only a temporary problem

They charge us 10 Euro for early checkinn, even though rooms were ready. The hotel doesn't have a elevator,

Centrally located.Attractions, restaurants, train station all were nearby at walking distance.

good hotel in good location-close to metro, and good and varied breakfast, friendly and helpful staff

Very noisy until 12.30am. People in the garden until 11.30am and also I could hear people them in the bar down from my room. Then again when they went to their room. For this reason I would be reluctant to stay here again. ,

Good location and clean room.

The house was not clean. Spiderwebs everywhere and a lot of dust under the seats. Kitchen closets need to be cleaned-out. Small beds.,

Anne was extremely friendly and welcoming; she even bought my wife a cake on her birthday! The location was perfect- walking distance to the centre and the property was always clean and “home-y”
