far from the town and to be fair beds could be softer but still fine.,

location is abit far from the city center even though metro station is nearby. so it takes some time to go the town but yet for this price it is a very good hotel. especially recepcionist ladies they were all so helpful and spent hours to book us train tickets and answer all our questions about the city and directions.

The owners spoke excellent English and were warm, friendly and inviting.  Breakfast was very good.  The room allocated was large, comfortable and full of character.  I would use this B&B again in any future business trip to Mons.

Large gap about my son's room door. Asked owner to help but says there was nothing he could do. Sandy floor n out room , plus broken tiles in the shower.,

Great location, wonderful breakfast. Great hosts

stay was ruined by a group of young guests/idiots destroying things in the corridor and their rooms at 4am. then screaming at each other at 8am.,

breakfast was nice - location was good

Charming, cozy and welcoming home from the moment we pulled in the driveway (both garden outside and the home itself). Excellent escape from the city and spacious for a family but only 30min drive and easy parking into Bruges.

Room windows are thin, so could hear road construction noise through.
Breakfast has very limited options. On a table was a card sign 'to order fresh egg option, sausages etc', but when asking for it the waitress said to fetch sausages and bacon from the buffet, also chef made a 'poached egg', which was just messed up strings of egg white and hard boiled egg yolk... So please stick to the buffet. ,

Lovely staff, especially a Reception Trainee man (guess French/Belgian one).
Lovely touch to have a complimentary mini bar with water/juice/coke and nespresso coffee. 
Good, soft bed. Clean crispy bedsheets. 
Good location next to metro station.

Right near the main square...parking is by machine till 6pm then free till 8am....not hard to find past the ww1 gate memorial...,

Room was clean .small but couldn't fault it....you have to start the heating by yourself room wasn't pre warmed....TV bit useless ...no international news channel.... WiFi worked well enough....breakfast adequate....no tea coffee facilities in room....want evening meal try the ypres burger bar ....really nice burgers....almost everyone happy to talk English....all in all ...great ...paid my respect's to those who didn't return after the ww1...

For this to be a regarded as a business hotel (which may or may not be its emphasis... I travelled for business, so I noticed it), a few minor changes would make a big difference:- A complementary bottle of water in the room is a minor expense, but would be a very welcoming gesture.- Available power plugs for charging laptops and / or mobile phones; I had to look for one, and eventually I had to unplug a bedside lamp- Do not disturb / please service my room signs for the doors. Again: minor, but could potentially avoid embarrassing run-ins with housekeeping.,

The staff, and especially the manager, were extremely friendly and helpful. The building is beautiful (both interior and exterior), with authentic decor downstairs in the tavern and a modern, sleek feel to the rooms. The location is great (very close to major sights and transportation links), and I found the hotel clean, neat, and a pleasurable stay overall. Having a light dinner and a drink at the tavern downstairs is a MUST; the Croque Madame is excellent!
All was good. Very nice, clean and friendly.

Hotel is too old. It's cold 3 stars hotel but it is as 1 star hotel. In entrance there is no bellboy to help your baggage. Inside of the room is too cold and too old furniture and bad. Also, when i asked some questions to reception about address registration she just told that she doesn't know it and than i asked from her to ask her manager for information and she told me that today just i work and i don't know anything about it. I do not recommend to anyone to stay there.,

This hotel is very close to metro. Also around the hotel some supermarkets and restaurants. Not in center but easy to get go everywhere.

Everything was just perfect!,

1. The owners are great, always smiling, full of energy and they make you feel very welcome. 
2. The location is perfect: close to the train station and very close to the centre of Mons, in a very quiet area, on a narrow cobbled street.
3. The house is absolutely marvellous. The decor is vintage and elegant. The bathroom is astonishing, really stylish and special. The bed is comfortable, equipped with clean, high quality linen. 
4. The place is crystal clean. 
5. The breakfast was one of the best because it had lots of options, all of which were of extremely high quality (jams, cheese, cake, chocolate, butter, milk, yogurt, cereals, different types of bread, honey, coffee, orange and lemon juice, fruits).
Thank you for making our stay in Mons one we will never forget. ❤

Unfortunately the bed mattress was not very comfortable especially for someone who has a bad back and walls are pretty thin that we can hear everyone and all noises. If you’re a heavy sleeper it’s not problematic.,

The property owners were super friendly and the breakfast was good. The location is good and easy free parking. Close to the beach, the village center, Supermarket and tram stop. Very convenient. The room and linen are very clean.

Not very quiet. Noisy motors nearby. No AC. ,

Great location. Welcoming and informative owner. Amazing breakfast. Lovely room.

Very disappointed to have been disturbed by noise next door, asked to be moved to a quieter place away from a kids football team. the next night, having to wake up at 5.50am i couldn’t sleep because of what sounded like a "party" between two men and woman going on. Decided to get up and just check out at 1am because of it. went down to reception fully dressed and ready to just leave, i was given the keys to another room in a more quiet place in the hotel. i really was not happy about any of this, while feeling unwell from a stomach bug i'd picked up. I have stayed in this hotel many times since 2012 and something always happens there. they really need to step up their game.,

There were  issues of privacy.  The on- suite toilette has been separated by  just a curtain rather than by a  proper door from our bedroom making it uncomfortable to use the bathroom (the other person had to leave the room to save both partners from the embarrassment). Furthermore, the window of the room  overlooked a public area just arms-length from where other guests were socialising or passing by. This was also uncomfortable as  the window had to be kept open due to high temperature in the room, so we felt quite exposed to the traffic by other guests. I did not dislike anything really could do with a bit of updating but you get what you pay for in life!,

Fantastic bathroom, usual design, spacious, comfortable.

Good location
The staff could not do more to make you feel like the greatest person in the world. Nothing was to much trouble and they were all way in great spirits.
Excellent ! A large choice of food.The personnel attending the breakfast room was very friendly and professional.

The family room was really spacious and well furnished. Very nice and clean!!!

Great breakfast with freshly squeezed orange juice by non other than Anna herself!  Anna is very friendly and offered to buy  for us flowers that we wanted for our family friends in town. Unfriendly staff at reception. The air conditioner in the room did not work and the hotel could not repair it. The only way to regulate temperature was to open a window that faces a busy and noisy street. A casino and a night club are next to the hotel.
Close to the train station, quiet location, very nice hosts, great breakfast with homemade ingredients, huge bathroom.

Strange smell in the elevator....,

Location is super

No city view for the rooms.,

Great Location, Helpful staff, clean property.

Reception. They don’t like tourists!!,

Location as it beside the ballet the ballet school the only reason I return despite awful staff

Nothing ! ,

Very clean and modern , great location .
All was great. Thank you for the bathtub !!!
Superb location, great hotel and good breakfast!
the staff at the reception was very helpful and  kind enough to carry my suitcase up to my room on the 4th floor.

The houskeeping was too loud - noise from the corridor or the next room woke me up around 7:00 am and continued, so I could not sleep as long as I intended.,

Fantastic localization for anybody visiting the European Commission and the center of Brussels, just next to the Berlaymont building. Close to restaurants very well connected by public transport.

Draconian rules. Check in not allowed until 16:00 not a minute earlier. No food or drink in rooms despite bar closing at 22:00. Massive sign “no picnicking, refreshments available at the bar” outside the rooms in annexe at rear. ,

Location
Good breakfast. Central location.

Nothing,

Older style hotel. No elevator but beautiful sold marble stairwell. Small but comfortable room. Great location right in the middle of the downtown.

Room was lacking few things such as bathrobe or bathroom slippers,

Location was perfect, hotel was clean and comfortable and the service was great. I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you want to visit EU institutions.

My room was up two flights of stairs. I struggled to safely get my luggage up and had to leave my case in my dad’s room as I couldn’t manage it. There is one staircase which is marble and open to the side and this made carrying hard. There was no offer of help. We were first to check in but their response was simply tough, all rooms were allocated, but at breakfast the following morning most were occupied by younger men.,

Father’s room was ground floor
Room service only till 22:00

Arriving by car is a challenge! There is a bus station in front and NO car access. There are also serious roadworks going on at the moment. We found a corner to stop at for a few minutes and went to ask in hotel what to do. 
They have an agreement for good prices (well 9€) with nearby Parking Leopold so it is worth heading there from the start instead of trying to park anywhere on a street corner! It is only a couple of hundred metres away. You swap ticket out in hotel for special price one.
But be warned - the roadworks make that carpark very difficult to get into - we had a 2.5km detour to get there from just 200m the other side of bus station! 
And the condition of that carpark’s foot entrance is a disgrace! There is no lighting on a pitch black graffiti filled, urine smelling corridor. Had to use gsm torch to even find the lift! Glad I was not alone there! I intend to report it’s state to local council - carpark owner (not the hotel’s!) should not be allowed to charge the high prices they do with such bad facilities! 
That said - the hotel itself works hard to make your stay pleasant - let’s hope the car park improves once the road works are done!,

After the ordeal of parking - see below - I was unsure what to expect! The retained faux-marbre original entrance - while classic for it’s time gives an odd impression with it’s dull brown tones - but I respect the owners desire to keep some original features! Reception is upstairs by a tiny old lift. The reception is manned by super friendly and helpful guys. You feel they want to help lake your stay pleasant. The rooms are fine - just like many standard hotel rooms in any modern built hotel. The soundproofing windows - about 15cm wide double glazing sound-proofing work well. It was quiet. The view was obscured by the use of smoke glass - but better so - it was to ugly rear views of nearby buildings. 
Everything in the room was clean and fresh and there was even an empty minifridge in it.
The huge plus of the hotel is it’s location providing you arrive by train - it is right next to the station! 
Breakfast was also good - with bacon and two sorts of egg - scrambled or boiled to your choice of hardness. Plus all usual breakfast fare.
All was clean - TV had only one adult and one children’s dutch channel and no subtitles which was no use to my Flemish hearing impaired partner - but I think there were plenty of French and English channels - though I am not a tv fan anyway.
Sights of Namur were all easy walking distance. 
In fact we slept well and if we had travelled by train would have found everything fine! The car parking issue spoilt it for me! The car park has surveillance but I was a bit worried about the car safety too.
If we go again we will travel by train and likely use the hotel again. Not if we go by car though!

I didn't like that you need to ring a bell to have the door opened for you even arriving relatively early in the evening. Sometimes the front desk girl is busy doing another thing and you need to wait out in the cold until she decides to pay attention to you and open the door. I think that a mechanism where you use your room key to open the door might not be difficult to implement.,

I selected the hotel based on the location, close to museums. It was excellent!! The two main museums are at short walk distance. There are good places to have good and cheaper breakfast nearbuy, just a few blocks from the museums.

This is not the good part of town since it is next to the train station and doesnt feel very safe at night.,

The room was clean and beds are comfortable. The rooms are very quiet so dont worry that it is just across the street from the main train station. They have a reduce parking ticket of 60% off, so.make sure to buy it in the lobby.

Wi-fi speed was a bit disappointing. Would have preferred rectangular rather than square pillows.,

Lovely bright room on the 7th floor. Spotlessly clean and with crisp fresh sheets. Free to use mini-bar (but with limited contents).

Public parking was close by but its entrance was very dirty.,

Good breakfast, facilities met my expectations. Good location. Public parking easy.
Loved the interior design, very friendly staff
Super friendly staff and excellent location :) . Even though is located in front of the train station, it is very quiet.

Nothing,

I only stayed overnight having been in a different and much more expensive Brussels Hotel the previous night.  This hotel was better in every respect at a much lower price.  I think the location may well be the answer.  Closely located to the EU Commission that is usually closed over the weekend, the hotel needs to sell rooms -- Take advantage of that.  You will not be sorry.

Better CCTV as I was robbed outside,

Location
Towels

Only that we didnt  see the instructions for the calefaction in the room (the instructions were in de living of the acomodation) ,

Very beautifull acomodation. Nice historical building in the centrum of Antwerpen. 
The staff is very very friendly and kind.
We would come back again. I van recommend this place for sure

Hotel room provided to me was broken. Heating was broken. Shower, kettle and some furniture was broken.
Though they chaged the room on request, i found torn old beedsheets even in changed room.,

They were quick to respond to request

Outside the hotel is a bit scary and dirty (due to local clientele). Not the hotels fault, it just surprised us. ,

Big room, nice view of the citadelle, elevator, very clean, great price, air conditioning, 10 min walk to really great neighborhoods.

As in many other similar hotels in Brussels there is a narrow staircase - I did not mind it, but if you have a large suitcase and an upper floor room, have this in mind when booking,

Nice option for stay near North station and city centre, nice room that was better than similarly priced hotels I stayed nearby

Very central location ( with the car) , all kinds of possibilities to visit Belgium and Luxembourg. 
Restaurants nearby within 10 min. drive. 
Easy to step out the door and to start hiking or cycling.
Excellent location with the luxury of free parking. Hosts very kind and responsive. Charming old building.

Nothing it was fine,

The bed was excellent and the room was very quiet as it faced the rear courtyard

the crowd in front of the hotel itself (near the station) is a bit intimidating,

Very spacious bathroom and staff that satisfied my request to have bathtub
Excellent hosts  went the extra mile to make our stay perfect

Warm with no airco, but noisy outside so couldn't open the window.,

Friendly staff, fast WiFi, beautiful breakfast room.

The kitchen facility’s could be better there’s no oven or microwave and no bowels or bread knive but for the price you can not go wrong would recommend to anyone ,

Location excellent the room was spotless I was given a courtesy call and a text with instructions for garage parking and door code would definitely recommend and use again I get stressed out easy with parking ect and this was so easy ,the place looks amazing when you first walk in

Tried to get a hold of the hotel several times, but no answer. Very expensive to take a taxi to and from the hotel to the airport. Was told the average cost would be 25 Euros, it was instead 40 going there and 50 coming back. Would not recommend the location for that reason.,

It was a place to stay. the bed was comfortable.

The room lacks some space to open the doors and the toilet is separated from the shower (bathroom is separated in 2 different spaces),

Great reception service, the building seems renovated. You have everything needed inside a room
Location was excellent. The second bedroom beds were not described accuretaly on Booking.com
Great staff super friendly and helpful.

Nothing ,

Staff were every good especially at 2am when we were locked out by our key cards.

We really enjoyed our stay cause our room was very spacious,warm and the beds were really comfortable.The building is wonderful and historic.The location is just perfect to walk around the heart of Antwerp, walking distance to all the sights but at the same time very quiet and peaceful neighborhood.The owner very helpful and warm gave us the best of advice!

Customer service was poor , and they didn’t have anything at what ever  you asked they didn’t have kmt 
There was no heater and the electric heater wasn’t working properly which leave the room cold so u ended sleeping in ur jumper etc..

Location was perfect to get around the clubs and shops

Breakfast somewhat overpriced. Hotel interior a bit outdated, cleaning could be improved. ,

Very kind and helpful receptionists, a true asset. Very good sound insulation (not always the case even in high-end hotels in Belgium!). Room 308 had a good overview towards the beautiful building of the train station.
Very accomodating and helpful, private parking and very good location

extra charges if you check in early,

Good Hotel especially location wise

Sofas look a little bit dirty.,

The apartment is very large and comfortable. The bedroom is not facing the street so it is very quiet. Kitchen is well equipped and appliances are in very good status. There one tv in the living room and another one in the bedroom, big and nice. It is very well located for been working in the European commission's  Cove building.

The reception was not present at all, the cleaning service doesn't work properly, because the monitor that indicated the cleaning was broken.,

The location is not bad, it has the right price and the room is large with all the comfort.
The breakfast was great and Loic at the reception is very welcoming & helpful

There is no faults with this accommodation ,I will be staying here again well done....,

Every thing was spot on we will be going again next year,location wise it's perfect,one word awesome.....

WiFi signal was not consistent. This is not really an issue for us, but worth noting that the room is located on the 3rd floor. You will have to be cautious if you have a baby/toddler around (like we did), such that they do not wander too close to the stairs/edge.,

Very warm and friendly host. Claudine was wonderful. She was very welcoming towards us. Being a grandmother herself, she was very loving towards our <1 year old son. She even offered him toys to play during our stay. The room was very comfortable. In fact, the entire top floor is basically for the guest. So, you will have access to one larger room, a smaller room and the bathroom. Claudine offers freshly prepared breakfast of your choice, with bio/organic ingredients and artisanal bread. She made us omelettes every morning.Nice location, in a low density housing area close to many parks/green spaces, but close enough to the city. Would definitely recommend for those looking for a quiet getaway.

A bottle of water could have been provided, as the nearest supermarket was 10min walk away, and all shops in the area close at 6pm. No soap or shampoo either. Could've used these after a tiring journey. A microwave safe bowl would have been useful. A few chairs in the reception would have been helpful, as I had to wait for almost at hour to check in. Even though my check in time was 4pm, had to wait till 5pm in the cold weather for the office to open.,

There was a well equipped kitchen with refrigerator, microwave, electric cooktops, utensils. Good heating. There was an electric iron with an ironing table, television, good furniture. Very clean and comfortable. Daily cleaning entails a daily charge of 12 euros.

Wi-fi,

Courtesy of staff,location and room

The heater didn't work.
The room is a bit dusty

The price was higher than expected - we had paid for only one breakfast and of course there were two of us, plus the free on-street parking was about 700m away, not 100m, so we were expected to pay €15 to stay in a multi-storey car park near the station. We took the long walk instead!Disappointed that the Cathédrale Saint-Aubain was closed off by builders' fences with no explanation. It's supposed to be one of the top attractions of Namur along with the citadel (which incidentally was difficult to find - follow signs for Terra Nova).,

Checking in was quite smooth. Nice breakfast. Friendly people in the town. Excellent food in Brasserie François at the edge of the square around the Cathédrale Saint-Aubain. We enjoyed a boat trip on the Meuse and Sambre rivers.

GPS coordinates send you via a dangerous road from the wrong site of the premises. Be sure that you approach the B&B via Battice center (first right coming from the centre square)Of course, this is not something the B&B owners can influence.,

Due to COVID-19, the number of rooms was restricted so each had their safe area to enjoy breakfast in their own bubble.Swimming pool was accessable with separate timeslots per bubbleAs usual, room meet a high standard and breakfast was delicious. The B&B setting is just beautiful with an entrance lane which can't be beaten.The location is just wonderful with Voeren, Maastricht and even the High Fens within reach. Don't forget to visit Val Dieux for a peaceful visit and joyful refreshment (beer in my case)The B&B owner was so kind to offer and book restaurant table in one of the nearby restaurants. Take-away may be considered as well.
The location was amazing very handy and the parking facilities were extremely good.
I recommend B&B Salve, It was a really nice experience. Claudine is a fantastic host, we really enjoyed breakfast and a good conversation about Brussels from a local. 10/10
The breakfast was very delicious. The location was also good.

There were some construction work which started aROUND 07:30-07:45 in the morning and I was waken up from the noise,,

Very friendly staff at reception! Excelent first experience. Spacious room.

The bed and the wall around the bed,

Breakfast and the garden

Nothing really,

Loved the Art Deco atmosphereStaff were fantasticLocation was excellentLoved it ……………….

You hear everything from outside, water spill everywhere in the bathroom, no toilet paper-holder, sheets had holes and were brown, wardrobe was disgusting, the smell of bleaching product was so hard in the room, the aircon didn’t work and the room was very hot, tables were full of dust, THIS IS SO NOT WHAT I expected!,

The location was good, high bed and comfortable and you have a big shower.

Can improve on cleaning particularly the entrance ,

Great facilities (AC, fridge, coffe and tea). Central location
Stunning and wonderful place !

the boiler across the road which goes off like a rocket at random time during the night!very "open plan" facilities are unusual.,

Location is great. 3-5 minutes from the gate, 1 minute from the ramparts. Spacious apartment. Friendly hosts.

Leaving...it was a bit emotional.,

Being able to park directly in front of the house was particularly convenient.Immediately upon arrival we were made to feel as though we stepped into our home-away-from-home.  From the spacious bedroom on a private floor (with self-serve coffee and tea), to the pristine, modern, well-equipped private full bathroom, it was obvious that great pride and attention to detail is taken to ensure comfort and create an atmosphere of friendly warmth.  During the check-in process, the proprietor inquired about our dietary preferences and offered evening restaurant recommendations which facilitated a memorable delicious dining experience.  Taking our dietary preferences into account, the variety and quality of the breakfast items, which included fresh organic options, was impressive and created an ideal start to the day.

No hanging space for suits or shirts.,

All good  and Patrick does the best 7 minute boiled eggs! :-)

Don't expect too many restaurants to be open on Sunday in the European quarter...,

When I was there more than a year ago, they promised me a free breakfast the next time I came, (because there was a problem with the hot water). They kept the promise, and it was a very nice breakfast buffet, too!

The bloody spiders and spiderwebs,

The location

- The room was very warm as there is no air con (30+ degree temperatures didn't help. But this was obviously not the hotel's fault)
- check-in wasn't until 3pm when I arrived at 11am, but they did offer for me to store luggage.
- no lift in the property
- the WiFi didn't work on the my floor (4th), only downstairs. 
- My room had a glass screen in front of the shower which has transparent glass around the edge so you can see in from the bedroom and vice versa - not great if you are sharing with someone and value your privacy. As a solo traveller I was obviously fine but worth mentioning. 
,

- The staff were very friendly and helpful. I didn't catch their names but they made me feel welcome.
- Quirky bar in reception area
- Great proximity to some of the city's best attractions and transport links.
- comfortable bed aside from the heat.
- very clean thoughout the hotel.

No hot water the first night and part of the next day; wi-fi wasn't very good in my room,

Friendly, helpful staff; close to lots of shops, restaurants, and a laundromat; easy walk to Brussels Noord station or a tram ride to Brussels Centraal; clean, well maintained room; large shower stall
Spacious room and bathroom, great location.

The room was a bit run down, mold on the walls, it was very small but for one night it was adequate.,

Breakfast was amazing, croissants, pain au chocolat good cheese, very abundant and tasty. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
Very comfortable bed and serenity

We had a wonderful stay at Côté Verger. It had everything we needed to relax: friendly hosts, heated indoor swimming pool, beautiful and spacious garden view suite with separate lounge (COVID-19 measurement), delicious breakfast and diner!

The location was perfect, just a short walk (about 5 min) from the centre of Ypres, the Menin Gate and so forth. We came by train and it was an easy walk from the station too. Although we arrived in the late evening, there was no problem with access. Lovely town house, well equipped, in quiet street. Friendly, helpful hosts.
Good service, cosy atmosphere, calm location. Nothing to complain.
The location is near the city center with lot of restaurants within walking distance as well as a free parking lot under 150 m walk.
Pity no vegetarian option in the bar.Also, pity the breakfast is quite expensive, even if the buffet is top class.
No shampoo, shower gel, slippers and cleaning service.

The bathroom had a floor to ceiling window so if your in the shower you can see into the bedroom and if you are in the bedroom you can see EVERYTHING about the person in the shower. Not sure if every room is like this but it makes it a bit weird when traveling with friends.,

The hotel clerk was excellent! Very helpful and even carried some of our luggage up the stairs. The building is very old and doesn’t have an elevator.

The area the hotel is in isn't great. And you should bring earplugs because it's really easy to hear people walking through the corridors. The shower was ok when I could get the right temperature but it basically had a mind of its own!,

Netflix app built into the tv and a good wifi connection. The bed was clean and very comfortable.

The only weird thing is that the entrance door is wide open during the night and closed for the day. ,

Comfortable and classy hotel in an old building right across the road from the train station. Beds are comfortable, aircon works well, double window frames isolate the sound from the road.

Still dirty underneath the bed and table.
We had the smell of weed from the window.
There were road works going on in front of the hotel,

Comfortable bed, nice staff, the heating

Privacy of the bathroom,

Big room, very clean, comfortable bed, excelent  tasty breakfast, beautiful living room and terace. 20 minutes nice walk to city center.

The map led us to a wrong first address (a parallel street leading to a dead end)- be attentive with the instructions you follow.We would have appreciated a message ahead of our reservation with the address-details from the host, as it was not very clear.,

Local products in breakfast (bigger portions would have been welcome), the host was welcoming with nice tips.Beautiful setting, nice decoration, warm and very clean room!

I liked it all.,

Fabulous city centre location, secure parking. A lovely property.

There was nothing to dislike.,

Everything was fantastic! Claudine was such an amazing host. Very helpful and friendly. Besides, she is a wonderful cook. She made us feel at home. The room was super clean, bed, pillows and linen extra comfy. Shower with nice warm water. The wifi was very fast. There are lots of restaurants at a 10 min walking distance. The Neighborhood is nice and quiet, mostly family residences. Perfect for walking. We are already planning our next stay with Claudine. Highly recommended!! Thank you Claudine for everything, you definitely made our stay more pleasant. Big hugs from Mexico!

Our room was up four flights of stairs, so it would have been nice to have tea/ coffee facilities in the room!,

Very welcoming and beautiful accommodation. The shower was excellent.

The location for my purposes, the premises, the breakfast offer, and above all the excellent service in terms of both attitude and efficiency of the reception staff (Mrs. Laura). Congrats and thanks a lot!

The bathroom stank like drainage. The dustbins in the room are tiny.,

Good wifi.

Friendly lady at the reception managed our stay even so her computer went crazy. We ended up in the studio and will not complain about the change in room
The bed is comfortable and the staffs are nice

You can’t fault this place. You really can’t.,

Very clean.
Easy location to find and have access to Bruges
The hosts.
Quality of breakfast was incredibly good.

A real example of how a B&B should be run.
The B&B is located on exceptionally beautiful grounds. The architecture feels modern and authentic at the same time.Classy place, as is the hostess!

I will recommend this B&B as I have no complaints or see no shortcomings.,

The B&B is in a quiet location and it is extremely clean and tidy. The host is very friendly and the breakfast she offers is fresh, tasty and hygienic.

Probably some time ago it was possible to smoke inside because we could smell it in the corridor and at the stairs. But it was not that terrible :),

Very nice house! The host is a very friendly gentlemen :)The kitchen has all the stuff one needs for cooking.

Wifi speed was very, very poor only 6.1 Mbps when I tested it (see photo); This alone would make me hesitate about booking again. Room felt a little gloomy with the curtains drawn which was necessary because there was another hotel opposite who'd have been able to peer straight into your room; coffee making facilities only, no kettle or cups large enough to make a cup of tea (no milk either).,

Lovely clean room, very comfortable bed, complimentary drinks in the mini bar; coffee making facilities;
Situated close to parking and city center
Very nice Staffel, perfect location!

You get a feeling of being in a dormitory. There were trash from food on the hallway, people having parties at 2am in the next room, no other facilities except accommodation. Ok for one night, but if you wish to stay longer find another option.,

The room is cozy, clean, everything works as it should, near the tram so really convenient location with loads of other hotels, cafes and bars in the area.

The neighborhood around the train station is a bit rough, but the hotel was lovely and walking distance to the centre and the citadel.,

Friendly staff, modernly refurbished rooms, silent even though situated next to the train station.
I loved and enjoyed the staying wonderful spot

It is a good 20/25 minute walk into town, and nothing really to blame on anyone - just something to be aware.,

Fantastic 2 days in Bruges. Our hosts were always on hand if needed, from providing an efficient check-in to comprehensive instructions about parking, directions into town and places to eat. Bed and room was very comfortable. The breakfast selection was amazing! great start to both days with plenty croissant, coffee and cheese :) plus homemade apple juice!They are next to a brewery but didn't get a chance to try the beer this time.
We enjoyed our stay with our 2 little kids, our hosts were very friendly. The location is beautiful. We will for sure come back.

Could of supplied towels otherwise everything was great,

Location was excellent, easy walking distance to fantastic bars restaurants, meniem gate, museum and as a bonus a very secure car park.
The owner is a very nice person. Her home is very cozy and clean. Delicious breakfast. I would highly recommend. If I have the opportunity I will definitely come back here.

The dinning room a bit dark. I would rather to have the blinds open in the morning during breakfast,

The view to the river from the room
Delicious breakfast - especially the pastries. Comfortable spacious room with bath, Nespresso machine, and kettle for tea.

Cleanliness needs to be upgraded, it had spiders web all across room , on roof,

The towels and pillow cases had a few marks on them.

Good location, great hotel (with a lovely art deco lounge/bar/breakfast room), and friendly hotel staff. 
Room was huge and plenty of storage space. Bed was really comfy. Bathroom was spacious and shampoo and soap provided, as well as a decent hairdryer. 
Breakfast was nice with a few options. Various teas and a choice of coffee which was nice. 
Thought it was well-priced considering how nice the hotel was and how expensive Brussels can be.

The room needs a deep cleaning,

Great beds

There were hair on the bed so we don't know if room was actually cleaned. ,

Double windows are very good for cancelling noise from the street.
The staff was really customer friendly and the breakfast was really nice .
Tasty breakfastVery interesting brewery close to the houseVery comfortable bed.

Fantastic stay. We were looking for a little escape in a scenic area and it more than delivered. The rooms were great, having the swimming pool was wonderful and breakfast was fantastic. Enjoyed every minute of our stay.

Very good location. Private parking space. Outdoor area.
The host was very friendly and welcoming and made a fabulous breakfast!
Patrica is a very nice man, he picked me up at the railwaystation.
Location, cleanliness of the room, excellent breakfast.

The room had everything I needed, and how it was advertised.

-,

It's close to the Grand Place. It's really nice to be in the centre of the city. The staff is helpful si the room is clean.

The room is nice, not very safe neighborhood, so if you are traveling alone it is better to get to the hotel when it is still bright outside.Nevertheless the hotel is value for money, there are breakfast places nearby, good transportation connection.

The wifi connection was often not too good. The room could have been bigger a little bit (too close to the toilet and shower in the bathroom).,

The staff is friendly and helpful. The room is clean, comfortable and really quiet despite noisy surroundings. Good location near train station but walking distance to historic center and other attractions. Discounted parking is very close too.Breakfast was really nice, with a good variation of food.
Very good value for money, exactly as expected, very convenient location near Gare du Midi, smooth checkin and checkout.

The room was very big, with a big and comfortable bed and the bathroom was new and clean.Very nice and tasty selection for breakfast too, overall I felt very welcome and comfortable. The owner is incredibly lovely and will help you with anything you need. It's located in a quiet area, about 15 minutes walk from the city center.

Minium Breakfast, remote.,

Nice host, Quiet, very clean.

They didn't find the sauna till the last day and didn't know that towels weren't included. Also, got a parking ticket outside, as they weren't told that they needed to put a pass in the car.,

Accommodation good and the location was excellent.
The view is amazing and Claudine (the owner is super nice and cheerful)
Very professional staff. Clean and comfortable room, very well located next to Berlaymont.

Small desk with no working light (but the type of room is probably not designed for work). A nice hotel in the centre. A stylish room with a noble look. Friendly and helpfull staff. A small refrigerator in the room was useful. A comfortable bed. A cosy restaurant.

cold  from the closed window and from under the door. Mold in the bathroom, dirty kettle from the inside.,

The fact that there were 2 bathrooms and plenty of room

The house is located in the very calm and nice neighborhood, was very clean and comfortable. The host was just amazing, I was staying alone and having a conversation with her in the morning was very pleasant. The breakfast was very good, she even asked me before head what I prefer to have on breakfast. The breakfast room was very nice as well, with a beautiful view to the garden.
Room was also nice, has everything what you may need. The private bathroom is in the separate room, clean and big.
The house is not in the center, but a metro station was not far away and there is  a direct line to the central station, so for me it was not a problem.

I didn’t not find any negative points. ,

Very nice location. Comfortable and clean rooms.

Terrible staff and organization. Reception locked during working hours. When I came to check-in it was closed (even it was working hours).,

Rooms are nice and clean.

Location: nicely situated near the station and the city centre. We had an amazing time at cote verger. Stunning location, beautiful rooms, pool with a view and above all the warm welcome of our hosts made it a truly memorable experience. Cote Verger is the perfect place to take a small break from the normal every daily craze and recharge the batteries!

Nice, cosy, old townhouse newly renovated and located in walking distance to the ancient centre of Brugge. The guest house is a nice, quiet location where you easily can relax.  A spacious living room and terrace can be used by the guests and  antique furniture is supporting the boutique style. Very good homestyle breakfast with homemade juice and honey and delicious bread, croissant and buns from the nearby bakery. Our host Charlotte had been very caring and attentive, making us feel home right from the beginning. We really loved our stay and will surely be back in the future. Many, many thanks to Charlotte ....

Quaint b&b sounded by nature.  If you want to have a relaxing visit to Belgium I highly recommend you stay at this B&B.  The owner makes you feel at home and is very attentive.  Nice pool with great view.

Small rooms, but it has everything one might need and everything was clean and worked well. Location is perfect at 5 minutes walking distance from the South - Midi train station. Price is very reasonable considering the location and the quality of the room.

The only thing that was a downside for me was that the floors and walls don't block sound out and the floorboards are creaky so we could hear the people above us but it's OK if you are a heavy sleeper or don't mind earplugs. Also the bathroom has no walls so if you're a pair of friends just set up a system!,

The B&B was so cute! Breakfast was AMAZING, Charlotte really put out a beautiful spread, you will not be left hungry! The B&B is only a 20 min walk along the canal to the main square and we felt completely safe walking back at night. The owners also own a brewery next door with locally brewed beer (Fort Lapin is even sold in stores and bars so they're really legit!). We stayed in the room with a garden view which was lovely. The common area was lovely with a coffee machine, honesty tab with Fort Lapin beers in the fridge (only €2!), and loose leaf teas.

Everything at B&B was amazing. Claudine is a great host, she took the time to talk to us since we had so many questions about Brussels and even drove us to the station. We felt at home and would definitely go back.

Everything, the staff from start to end were very nice and helpful with information about the city. The rooms were always cleaned and well presented. The breakfast was great along with complementary mini bar. Loved it.

A fair amount of smokers however I smoke myself.,

Very nice host, good location, if you want to explore the south eastern parts of Brussels. Tram/subway connection to downtown and trainstation

Hotel is very representative, look so good and neighborhood is so beautiful and safe. You get shampoo, gel shower and body lotion so you don`t have to bring those. Also you can make coffee or tea in the morning in your room.

The property feels like home. Almost everything you need in an apartment is available. The host was very very welcoming and when I had an issue with the heater, it was replaced immediately.   Alots of restaurants close by.

Nothing - we could have stayed longer than our 4 nights!,

Charlotte and her husband Kristoph are great hosts. Charlotte provided an excellent breakfast and went to great lengths to accommodate our coeliac friend. Comfortable ensuite rooms with a lovely lounge/dining room and garden for common use with the other guests in the three room B&B. Excellent honesty bar from their brewery next door. Kristoph has extensive knowledge of brewing and is happy to share - both verbally and by tour if you are interested. We were! They also have a tasting room in the brewery that opens as a low key pub on Saturday until 6. B&B is on the route 4 bus into town that goes to the train station too. A wonderful welcome and an excellent stay. We will be back!
very nice, beautiful, quiet house. House owner is so warm and helpful!

The rooms are very dark. The water drain in the bathroom, also not great.,

Helpful stuff that know how to smile (with exceptions of course). Very good location, metro station is very close and the walking distance to the center is also very acceptable.

In the room, there is no wardrobe, only a small console beneath the tv set, so you have not got much space to keep your clothes, but actually, I was not a big problem for me.,

The staff is really friendly, there were no problems. The center and the train/bus station is pretty close, I guess around 10/15 min on foot. Nearby, there are carrefour express and great callisthenics park!
The apartament was nice and had everything we needed for a short stay. The host was very communicative and helpful. We really appreciated the option to store our bags after the check-out.

Baths services... more Towel please.,

Location and entrance Parking was initially not really clear due to road works in town and not recognizable by GPS. Strange and marginal people hanging around in the vicinity of the hotel which is located across the train station which may give you an unpleasant feeling of being not safe.Although there's a facility in providing a protective glass door which prevents splashing water while taking a shower standing upward in the bath : one ends up in a swimming pool when stepping out of the bath after being showered ( wet floor ) as water flows in between the glass door and the bath => tried preventing this the next time by putting a towel in between that gap ...  but unfortunately in vain :(,

It was actually pretty goodTHe reviews are not the best, yet it is a very good place, good room and everything.

Everything was fine.,

We had a lovely large room at the b&b with a very comfortable bed. The room was very clean and quiet. The bathroom was large and there were plenty of towels and toiletries.We were able to park outside the house with a parking permit but you can park quite nearby without needing a permit.We stayed for one night and were the only people staying there. We were able to use the downstairs sitting area to relax when we got back from Bruges centre. There was tea and coffee available whenever we wanted it and there was a very reasonably priced honesty bar.We had a very nice  continental breakfast in the morning with fresh croissants, bread, cheese, ham and jam.The hosts are very helpful and pleasant and showed us round the small brewery that they run next door to the house. It took us about 20 mins to walk to Bruges centre either through the park or through some small streets. Both routes were very pretty.The b&b itself is a lovely old-style house in a residential street. It is beautifully kept and very comfortable.

Every single bits and pieces  was just perfect. The staff was so polite and helpful and friendly. The room was so clean and great. Breakfast was amazing. Worth every single penny we paid. Will be back very soon for sure and recomend it to everyone.   The hotel realy deserve to be 5 star.

Doors let in a bit of cold, not much of an issue as heating compensates fully, but it is a pity.,

Perfect for our family + dog.

This B& B was excellent. The owners were lovely, as was the room and facilities. Breakfast was nice too. It was a really excellent stay with everything that I needed. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, it was very comfortable.

Great location. 15 minutes walk from the center.Good light breakfast. Very tasty!Very polite and helpful hosts. We could leave our bags after check-out and took them before the flight.Good place for its money.

Reception available 24/7. Clean sheets and towels, comfortable bed, sink with warm water and mirror in our bedroom was very convenient, good value for money. We stayed on the third floor and our wing had two rooms only and was very quiet. Does the job for one night sleep. Good location near the highway and free parking was great!

The location was not good. Very hectic during the day, very tricky to find a parking space. After about 7pm most of the bars and restaurants were closed and the area was full of people begging for cigarettes, or money, or food. Quite scary.,

Huge comfortable bed. Friendly staff.

The room was very clean. There is a desk with two chairs for working, and a closet with mini bar and safe. 
The mini bar can be turned off with a remote so it doesn’t make any sound while sleeping. A nice touch!
The bathroom has a big shower, which was really nice. 
Wifi was perfect for watching a movie or get some work done. 
The view (I had garden view) was really nice. When I opened the curtains in the morning I was greeted with a squirrel climbing a tree :)
When you arrive, they ask you to checkmark a list with all the things you want for breakfast. I really appreciate this act against food waste!
Breakfast itself was tasty and plentiful! It was clearly prepared by people with love for food.
I was on a work trip (alone), but definitely considering coming back for a weekend with my partner. This is an ideal stay for a get-away!

Poor service, use COVID as an excuse to not give value. You need to pick up your breakfast down, 1 shower gel
For 4 etc 
For 230 per night service is terrible ,

Suite are big and wifi is good 
Beds are comfortable

Nothing really. ,

Great value for money
 Room was of a decent size, clean and comfortable.

Well used and old style facility, but clean.
The room was too eary.
The radiator heaters were very efficient!,

Perfect location ... very close to the beach and the center.

Honestly nothing ,

Very friendly staff, bed was super comfortable, and location was excellent

We liked everything!,

The very friendly Family, very attentive to your comfort and wellbeing.The room was great, very large, very quiet just what we could wish for.It was a very pleasant stay!!!

It was hard to find in the industrial estate. Look out for the sign! ,

Very clean. Great shower and toilets. Lovely staff

We had a great time at this hotel. Location at 5 min from the center and right next to the train station. Clean rooms, well soundproofed, confortable large beds. Professional staff couldn't have been better.

Really convenient location for trips to the European Commission. Couple minutes walk from Schubert metro station. Rooms are modern, clean, spacious. Perfect for short business stay. Would definitely book again in the future.

Super location near the centre of the municipality of Anderlecht.
Very cozy apartment with a great view.
Well equipped with cutlery.
Friendly staff.
Good price.

Sound isolation, tv position - it is too high.,

Its in 5 minutes walk from the Zuid Railway station

They were still renovating some parts - probably this was delayed due to Covid-19 - It didn't bother us as such, but soon the place will be even better.,

The room was bigger than we thought and the breakfast service and food were excellent. Staff spoke several languages. They have a respectable menu and bring in fresh products from local sources. (I think even the yogurt was homemade).
Great breakfast and dinner! (lots of homemade locally sourced products)
Localisation, room service, cleanliness

It's a bit worn out, compact rooms,

I stayed here second time, as expected the room was clean with comfortable bed, kind staff.
I first stayed at this hotel about 18 years ago and I was so impressed with its location, decor and historic charm that I have visited there almost every year since.

hotel is really old, and there is no elevator to the higher floors, and the stairs are really narrow. I have to say that the breakfast room is too small and too cold, I had to eat my breakfast in my jacket. And 13€ for a breakfast with no scrambled eggs or any kind of warm food is just ridiculous.,

staff was very friendly and helpful, the hotel is in great location just 5 min walk to the city center, and free coffee at the check in! Rooms are really clean.

The bathroom was a bit tired and the shower could have done with a bit of a scrub. The sinks didn't drain very well.,

Breakfast was served in the room and was a tasty croissant and rolls. Room was eclectically decorated which I really liked. Quirky but comfortable. Rates were very reasonable for two people. Location was good for most things, but not directly central.

No private bathroom and the shower and toilets on the corridor weren’t very clean... one shower with no hot water and the other one with a really short spray...,

Free parking
Acceptable breakfast

We were pleased with everything.,

This hotel is in a good location for exploring Namur.  While there is no parking on the premises, parking is very close and discounted by the hotel.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean, comfortable, and well appointed.

Under construction ,

Location and cleanliness

The location is a bit far from the center but the metro stop is very close by which makes it really easy to quickly reach anywhere in the city.,

Super clean apartment and accommodating host which made it easy to enjoy the property and my stay in Brussels.

- no 1h earlier check-in was possible- neighborhood is a bit sketchy, but overall okay- room smelled a lot like a cleaning agent,

- Good price-value combination- 20 min walk from the city center, very close to Brussels-Midi- nice TV program selection

The only negative point was Covid-19.There were no further comments at all,

The Hotel is located in the beautiful village of Houffalize and is an ideal base for exploring the region.The owners immediately make you feel welcome and are very helpful.They have an extensive selection of local beers and the owner is a fantastic cook!The dishes are very tasty and based on local fresh seasonal products.Vegetarians are not forgotten either! My wife is a vegetarian and the vegetarian dishes were original, with fresh products and very tasty!The breakfast is extensive, including home-made yogurt.We can recommend this hotel to everyone!we will definitely go back.

The hotel is on the outskirts of the town so a car is needed to go out into the center. The hotel is on a main road so slight noise of cars during the night but nothing too difficult to handle.,

I don't think I've ever stayed in such a clean hotel! Everything was spotless. The owner was lovely and welcoming. Room was a good size with a lovely on suite shower room. Very big bed with comfy mattress and linen. Breakfast included fruit, home made yoghurts and jams, ham and various cheeses also available as well as eggs cooked to your preference.

The toilet paper scrubs too much :-(Few coffee/thee for multiple days stay, also the shampoo/shower gelThe heating doesn't work so good, takes a long time to heat and never reached 21+ degrees,

Very nice room, comfy bed, the TV and the facilities were excellent ! Shower was very comfortable !

they did not refill the  coffee and the boiler was not that clean plus the location of the hotel itself is a a place you can call it poupler,

the view was amazing we were in the 7th floor , there is a fresh buzz in the toilet :)

I stayed at the fourth floor and the street noise made me feel like I was just at the corner of the street. No noise reduction at all.,

Location.

I booked this through booking.com and the hotel clearly advertises spa facilities. When I arrived and inquired about this I was told by a rather rude lady at reception there are no spa facilities. She told me that there is the possibility to book access to spa facilities elsewhere however that this needs to be done in advance. In my opinion this is a case of false advertising.The shower room plug hole emitted a really foul smell which permeated the whole room.,

location

In my room there was a kettle, two cups and two sugar lumps.  Draw your own conclusions.  The shower was just a dribble and it was impossible to adjust the temperature to something comfortable.  The dribble was either too hot or cold then when I tried to get it hot again it took another 3 minutes for the water to heat up.  All these people are interested in is the CASH. They don't give a damn about the guests.,

The Wifi worked.  The TV worked.  The hairdryer worked
It's a functional place to get your head down. Just off the motorway. The room sleeps three, it was clean if a bit warm. The shared facilities were clean.

The only thing that bothered me was that it felt very warm in the gangway between the lift and the room. The price for the breakfast (which I didn't take) seems fairly expensive (about 20€ if I remember correctly).,

I liked the luxurious aspect of the hotel coming from the entrance to the reception. And I equally enjoyed the modern feel of the room which is well equipped. The bed was comfortable and the air condition was so much appreciated on that warm day!
The hotel’s lokalizatorom is perfect, close to the European Comission. Room is dowcipie, very convinient with very Nice bathtoom well equipped with cosmetics. Good value for money.

It was super near to the metro station and a grocery store, there was also a Greek restaurant owned by the host and it was just nearby, so if you want to eat there is that.
The apartment was clean and well equipped, we also had a small balcony and TV with international channels. 
Our host Dimitri was very helpful and a really nice person, he welcomed us very well and he helped with all of our necessities. If we go back to Bruxelles we are going to stay there once again, 10/10 recommended!
Rude staff, it took them more than one week to send me their invoice (as they failed to give me one upon check-out)

It was a bit of a shame we were not flexible to choose the time of dinner ourselves. The room downstairs is quite noisy, since it is that close to the reception, the kitchen and the exit. Also the fridge on the room is quite loud.,

We loved our dinner: presentation, taste... everything was really nice from starter to desert.Nice room with modern bathroom.Loved the attention for sustainability: big bottles of shampoo and soap instead of small bottles. Also the breakfast was very good.Access to Netflix was a nice extra.
The location is great, the stuff is also great☺️. It’s clean, you have everything you need. I highly recomand it

location, cleaning, bed, bathroom,

the best things are the photos on booking, is far away from reality

parking,

its i superb location, near the beach and the shops and the bars. It is not modern, well priced. good breakfast

The lift is missing, the bathroom small, the main entrance needs renovations, stairs are extremely narrow and a bit dangerous as well.
No kettle for tea/coffee in the room but they provided hot water. 
Clean Towels were missing twice (in 3 days).,

The hotel is located in the city center, close to the main attractions and stations.
Bedroom furnitures are quite new.

It is a house where a young family lives on the ground floor and rent rooms. You have to ring a bell to get attention; the lady is preoccupied with her very young children (understandably); and wants to go back to her children asap. I felt that I was intruding to someone's family and I tried to keep out of them as much as possible. There is no reception or entry. The room is quaint but again, like an old house: the lids of the tv hanging, one has to decide either to plug the tv or the heater. The light in the bathroom is economy, so it turns on after you have already been in the bathroom. Reminded me of my parents' house...,

Great location and some old charm character. Clean bathroom.

No toilets in the room. Toilets are cleaned automatically. Robots are not perfect.,

It was a great experience! The location is great and very near to the city. The personnel is friendly, helpful and speaks more languages than you can imagine. The view from the windows was breathtaking. We didn't took any breakfast, but we saw it in the vast dining room, and it looked and smelled great. A must visit for everyone who travels close to Herstal, Liege or Maastricht. We will definitely come again.
I could smell second hand smoke in our non-smoking room.

Location in the business or Europe part so i dont recommend it for travellers who want to enjoy Brussels, maybe for business man ,

Its really nice and clean

Nothing,

Everything

I had some irritations after sleeping there.. I have a really sensitive skin though..,

the price and the location were good for brussels
Everything is good.

There was no hot water when we arrived, all facilities closed due to covid.,

Staff were friendly, well located, functional room

Better to have breakfast at every morning ,

Good lactation, 10 min walk to the Brussels North train Station , next to the tram station, near by  Brabant street , every thing was Comfortable

The lights on the landings and stairs were motion activated and/or on a time delayed button. Quite scary when getting out the lift at night into pitch blackness and not knowing when the light switch was. Ended up using the torch on my phone to navigate to my room.  The lift had a tendency to stop in between floors as it descended to the ground floor. I witnessed several guests panic as they struggled to get it working as it descended to this floor, and the same happened to me on my last day as I was leaving to catch my train. I’d say use the stairs but as I’ve stated, they were usually dark. ,

Great location, 2 minutes away from the sea front, public transport right on your doorstep. Staff were friendly & helpful.  I had an issue with the loo in my room and I was immediately moved to another room that was far larger and spacious. Breakfast was nice, continental style buffet. My first room had a sea view and a little shared balcony that was a nice surprise.
Nice hotel near Rogier. Good room and an excellent continental breakfast. As a bonus it has a lovely old bar downstairs. Plenty of restaurants close by if you need an evening meal.
Nice hosts, excellent bed / mattress, best shower ever, central location

Hygiene ,

Literally nothing !
Everything is perfect!!
This hotel is very nice, I did not expect that at all, very friendly stuff and for a very nice price.
Nothing to complain about!

WiFi was very slow in my room,

Very close to the train station, good for 1 night

The hotel is located next to the main road and there are almost no sidewalks towards the station/city centre, only parking spaces.,

The hotel (and restaurant) are at a short distance from the station. The room is big, modern and clean, with a huge bed, which is quite comfortable. The owners are very welcoming and the breakfast is excellent. This is the perfect place where to stay overnight in this region.

We struggled a lot to find the underground parking of the hotel. At one point the hotel providid is with a instruction paper and than we made it. 
Contact the hotel before you leave about the parking! ,

Modern, new hotel with great facilities. Very clean and quiet. Location right in the center.
Cool hotel with friendly staff

no airco in the rooms,

good breakfast, many choices
Great location with very helpful staff.  Room and bath clean and comfortable.  Stairs could be an issue for some but staff very willing to help with bags.

Lovely! Lovely house run by a considerate and kind host. Excellent location (close to the trainstation Zuid-Midi, and next to the metro), also if one has oppointments in the European Quarter. Very good value for money.

In no way should this establishment be listed as a Hotel, it is just about the most basic worker hostel level accomodation and apears to be used solely for single male occupants many of whom would appear to be immigrants . I did not feel at all comfortable to sleep  in this establishment and promptly left to seek an alternative rest stop .,

Nothing to like here
Great location, pleasant staff, spotlessly clean and comfortable

The shower wouldn't drain properly. It must have been blocked up or a pump not working?  Nearly flooded out the bathroom. I had to have a super-speedy shower and couldn't rinse properly  :-(   Not nice.  Also, the bar was just about to undergo refurbishment and they had no beers on tap and v little stock generally.,

Breakfast was excellent. Definitely worth including if, like me, you appreciate a decent breakfast. Room nice, bed comfortable, staff nice. And general cleanliness was v good.
Very comfortable, good kitchen to cook your own meals, clean bathroom and TV with Netlix. Also the host was really kind and friendly

Small lift, very noisy on Friday/Saturday nights - loud music and people yelling from the club next-door near after midnight until about 3AM next day.,

Just about 400m from Zuidstation (Midi) and convenience stores, staples, restaurants, all within 2 minutes' walking distance. Comfortable stay overall. Very helpful staff and they have a small cloak area too to park your luggage after check-out.
Due the Corona virus we did not enjoy a normal breakfast, but in any case it was acceptable.The spot in the town is perfect.

The WiFi didn’t work the last day I stayed, 1st January, but it works very good in the lobby. The lobby is small. Sometimes In the midnight is a bit of difficult to fall asleep because there are people yelling in the street.,

It’s very near from a tram. Also, to get to the center city is very near, but is recommended not to walk near the nodstation, is a “complicated” zone. The TV has Netflix. The warmer works very good. You can get a room with a sight of the Atomium.

It’s all a bit dated and is in need of some renovation. Breakfast is average.,

Great location, wonderful art deco café, clean.

if you are staying on 5th floor the lack of an elevator is a problem. The girl from the reception desk was not very nice or helpful. As an advice, please double check your booking, because they will try to trick you and make you pay more for less.,

The hotel is ok, well situated-closed to the city center  and has a very good breakfast .
my kids enjoyed the beds :)

nothing,

Good location within the city. Very good breakfast. Great restaurant recommendation by the front office desk. Rooms are clean and large enough.

The bed was a little small for us, but i am a big chap.,

Low price.

The hotel is located smack in the center of the "lower-part" Charleroi which has been renovated in recent years, close to the station. it is integrated in a big shopping mall but the entrance is just outside the mall, you have to take an elevator to get to the reception. Rooms are nice and comfy.

Very cold and it is turkish 3 stars,

Clean small room

After seeing the photos on the website I was disappointed to be given a very budget room overlooking the neighbouring wall,  Double bed was comfy but took up 2/3 room, I had to rearrange the furniture to avoid tripping over it in the night!  The hotel had an air of faded grandeur about it, but this room had faded quicker than most.,

Location was excellent for a concert at the Kursaal  Casino and the seafront.  The double rooms on the front looked very nice from what I could see when the cleaner left the door open.
Staff was very kind and helpful.  Room was very clean.

We loved staying in the apartment. It was clean, with a lot of space and comfortable. Next to it was a greek restaurant owned by the landlord of the room, so he was always available to us if we needed anything. Plus, it’s really close to the subway in a safe neighbourhood. 5 stars!!

Very nice staff .Everyone very helpful.Very limited food because of covid19 .Gym closed.Nice comfortable hotel.

Location is excellent, the Hotel is in a great neighborhood in my opinion (Saint Catherine square). The room is comfortable and so is the bed. Lovely bar / reception at the ground floor in a art deco style.

Hotel is right in front of the train station. The rooms were well isolated against noise and they were clean.

The rooms are very clean and very confortable. the location and the price are excellent!

The best cost for Value rate. The room is just outside of the metro station and there is a mini supermarket opposite of the road. Moreover there is the Greek restaurant of Dimitris near by.
its location is good if you want to stay with Middi station
wifi slow that day or from my room

-no shower head-broken hand shower holder-extremely dirty bed-full of dust under bed -full of dust on phone stand-waited 2 hours longer than the check in time- bed lamps not working- electricity not working on one bed side - disgusting pillow cases -toilet product smell all over the room-terrible parking place,

Very small shower with curtain around - it is challenging even for small person to move around. For the 1st floor rooms - while they do have access to balcony, there are no separators between rooms (you may not feel comfortable leaving balcony open even in the heat as you never know who may access your room through balcony).,

24/7 reception which is quite rare on the Belgian coast. The hotel is few metres away from the Casino and the beach. There is public parking (Kursaal) available right next to the hotel (24/7).

Hotel was under renovation and was actually closed but we were not made aware of this.We had booked breakfast but bar floor was being revarnished so bar and breakfast were not available but we were not made aware of this.  We were not charged for breakfast but were just told abruptly that breakfast was not available.Television did not work and when we complained we were told that no televisions in the building were working.Noisy work on the renovation went on until 10 to 11 at night.Unusual room in that whoever was having a shower was visible to the other occupants, not so bad if just your partner but not really suitable when your daughter was in the room.Not to do with the hotel itself but walking around in the evening was disconcerting given the number of families sleeping out on the streets between hotel and Grand Place and them arguing with each other as to who should be begging off you.Hope the hotel will be renovated sympathetically, it just would have been good to know what state it was in at the time of our visit that should not have taken place, who was at fault? Hotel or Booking, don't know. Hotel said they told booking so would have expected a message from Booking assistant.,

Nearby parking was close and safe.Reasonably situated.

Shared and not clean bathrooms and shower,

Fantastic hotel, very helpful staff and very comfartable bed. Location is great and if you don't mind walking the city centre is only half an hour walk. Can't fault anything, had fantastic stay.
Very nice apartment. Perfect location next to the metro station. Very friendly owner 😊 Thank you
The area isn't the best but the proximity to the centre is good. That said, we didn't have any problems,  it's just a matter of taste.

Child bed not made up on aarival. Only 1 caffeinated coffee. No hair conditioner.  Lots of stains on the carpet.,

Comfy bed. Modern room. Large TV with English channels. Bar area and staff were pleasant.

The best thing was the jacuzzi bath and the bed was nice and bad and very comfortable . The staff were very helpful and friendly.

Very good sound proofing, room not too hot, comfortable beds, clean bathroom. Great breakfast, good choice of items, and welcomed by a member of staff when we arrived at nearly 1 am. As an added bonus a great beer bar down the road.

The room had an old, dusty smell, even if it was clean, probably because of the old furniture and carpet.
I think the window had a problem because I could hear all the car noise from the street, even if it was a quiet area.

Brilliant design, super comfortable bed, good service and helpful staff, everything was very really really good. Actually me and my partner were positively surprised by the quality of our stay, so much recommended!

Great Hotel, rooms are clean and luxurious. Facilities are great too.

The room I had was one for persons with disabilities ( though I didn't ask for one ! ), almost empty, no cupboard door, no minibar, no hairdryer, no sofa and no alarm clock ( all these were in the description of the Superior Double room I have booked ).There was no desk to write or work something.The room was cold when I arrived and it took until next morning for the AC to raise temperature from 19  degrees C to 22, in the bathroom there was no heating system, so the atmosfere was very unpleasant. No rack to dry the towels.The toiletries were reduced to douche gel, shampoo and a small soap, no paper tissues, but plastic cups, and paper cups for coffee .    I was supposed to have a double bed, but there were 2 single beds, united (uncomfortable !).    The cleaning lady entered the first day, arranged a little bit the bed, emptied the trash can from the room, and didn't touch anything in the bathroom ( no cleaning,no fresh toiletries, no towels, no emptied trash can from bathroom ).And nobody came again for cleaning, until I left. Very far of what I know as a 4 star hotel room, and definitely different from the presentation on the hotel site.     Very disappointing !,

I arrived at the Brussels Midi south train station by bus around 7 :30 pm, I did get instructions from the hotel and google map directions to the hotel but I was working from a different exit and got a bit off track. Alrthough getting help from locals it took about 15 mins to get back on track ,the road which runs parrallel to the one suggested was strewn with uncolected garbage all over. There were many unoccuoied ssemingly abandoned buildings along the way,frankly I was feeling a bit worried but was eventually confirmed I was on the right direction to the hotel which shiuld be 5 mins away. Coming from three towns in France,Rheims,Leon,Grenoble which are beautiful, where I was seemed like a ghetto from the Third World.I eventially found the hotel on a little sleezy looking street , menories of Salvador In Brazil worldcup 2014 returned. The front desk was speaking english and pleasant and tried to resuure me the hotel and surrounding wer fine and safe. He warned me about how to use the elevator as the controls were not working well, I still did get stuck for a moment,quite discincerting. The room is small and old but had all the necessary conveniences. As usual I am eager to go outside and see the surroundings and I was informed by the Front Desk on places to have dinner and that it was safe. The initial outside of the hotel is really Third World dirty tiwn looking and feeling but 5 mins walk to the left and up the road the place is transformed to a fairly nice European city with nice restaurants .My dining was good,I have no complaints.Finally on my departure the next morning ,I made sure to get the correct routes and it was indeed 5 mins and a completely different landscape with proper buildings Trams and hotels. The best asset of this hotel is its nearness to the Trains Station.I would say its worth arounnd  Eu30 per nightnnot Eu50 . That neighborhood is under reconstruction,perhaps when that is complete, the whole experience will improve.

Be prepared for the 2 flights of  narrow steep curved stairs to the apartment. The breakfast is, as expected, a "do it yourself continental" type but without cold meats or cheese. (Milk  sachets, orange juice, nespresso coffee, (a few) tea bags, white bread , jam, water, cans of coke, butter, 2 large bags of crisps and a tray containing assorted chocolates, cakes, sweet & savoury biscuits is provided).,

The apartment is spacious, modern inside, well lit, very comfortable, beautifully furnished and equipped. The quality of towels,bedding etc is high. BBC1 and 2 are available on the TV as well as assorted other channels. WiFi signal is strong. Nadia was very VERY helpful about collection of the keys and our arrival plans. The location is ideal for the Expo centre, Atomium and Mini Europe attraction nearby. To reach the centre of the city use  the Metro or Tram system both of which are easily reached from the apartment.  There are 2 large supermarkets a 10  minute walk away, plus a fruit/veg/ small supermarket a  5 minutes walk away. We enjoyed a meal in the very good Italian restaurant just around the corner.
Very friendly staff! Able to accomodate a room for us after cancelling from another hotel which was complete trash(Sun Hotel) Couldnt have been happier with the stay here!

Upon check in the recepcionist told us that due to Covid 19 protocols the housekeeping service will be reduced at minimum, just to straight down the bed and to change the towels if we previously left them on the floor. This is unacceptable I run a hotel myself and we clean the rooms for our staying over guests as we have done before the pandemic. The only thing we require is the window has to stay always open while making the room and the guest must be away as usual. Our staff is protected with mask and gloves in order not to take any risk. As the pillows provided are so big and thick we asked to the maid and she kindly provided two long and thiner ones which allow us to sleep and rest better which we could not do first night.
The shower was great (rain type one) however the handle to regulate the temperature was missing so in order to get hot water (maid did not check previously neither technical service could left at the warm temperature at least) because to be able tu turn it with bear hands you hurt yourself I will attach picture in this report)
Last but not least even staying in the middle of the wallonian Ardennes the company that runs the restaurant is from Flandes so you better speak their language or English. Funny!!!! Only few of them do.
Breakfast was not Covid minimum standards. Staff where wearing mask at all times and gel was available at the entrance but coffee and dishes where on the table long time ago exposed to contamination.
