Beautiful old main building, well kept in authentic style. Annex is nicely decorated. Nice bathroom and good bed.

The fire alarm was blinking right above the bed, so after turning off the light and trying to sleep, a flash of green light disrupts the darkness and your hope of falling asleep. I stayed up until 5 am so I could be so tired to sleep with the major light on, cos sleeping with the big light on was at least better than a green light flashing in between unpredictable periods of seconds. For the next night in Brussels I booked somewhere else to save my sanity.

5 days with no WiFi, the hotel said they contacted the technician.,

Really clean, good shower bath and with no fluctuations in water temperature even when the hotel was at full capacity. House keeping actually clean the rooms. Close to town and tram stop. Helpful staff.  Great quality of sleep and comfortable bed and comfortable and bright room.

The floors were rickety though. I believe they needed to replace their flooring.Warning: the stairs from the ground floor main door to the second floor were very narrow and steep. The stair case was around 1 meter wide which tapered off to around 800 centimeters on the last 5 or 6 steps going to the second floor. We had great difficulty bringing our 3 large suitcases up and down. A simple misstep could cause us to fall down. It’s a serious issue when hauling a large and heavy suitcase going up and down. I wish the owners could address this issue immediately.,

We stayed here for 4 nights from July 12 to 16, 2019.Large spacious apartment. Living area, kitchen, dining, toilet (no bath) and laundry in the second floor. Two bedrooms and toilet and bath on the third floor. Large shower area.There is a TV set in the living area on the second floor with limited programming. But there was another TV set in one of the bedrooms on the third floor with better programming (in English).No AC. So we opened the windows to let the chilly wind in. There is a separate washer and drier. When we ran out of laundry detergent, we asked for some from the owner and she readily gave us some.Full kitchen with complete equipment for cooking and preparing food.Large fridge.Free WiFi with more than satisfactory speed. No issues with it.The owners left 4 bottles of Belgian beer in the fridge and bread on complimentary basis. It was very nice gestures. We enjoyed the bread. But since none of us drink beer, we did not touch the bottles. We stayed in this apartment to use as our base to visit the Ghent city center, Antwerp and Brugges. It was 2.5 km from city center. Instead of walking or taking the bus, we opted to use our car and park it in one of the public pay garages.There is free on-site parking in the apartment . It was a safe and secure covered parking with locked doors.The apartment is close to Campo Santo, the old cemetery in Ghent that they usually compare to Pere Lachaise cemetery in Paris. We could see the tombs from our windows. (See photos) The gate to the cemetery is only around 20 meters from the door of our apartment. The apartment is literally in a quiet neighborhood.A Carrefour express (with parking) was around 200 meters away at the end of the road.A much larger Carrefour Hypermarket (with spacious parking) was around 2.5 km away.The hosts/owners were responsive. They had a payment facility for credit card payments.

Room beside the lift, I could hear the lift going up and down most of the night. Difficult to rest.,

hotel is older but nice, the staff was pleasant, check in went smoothly, they even borrowed me a book-a tourist guide for Brussel- thumb up. the room was big enough, it had also a ketlle and a fridge. comfortable bed. nice breakfast - you could choose from many things. the best way how to get from railway station MIDI Brussel, is to take the tram to Orban station for 1.80euro and then it is 4 minutes walking. if you travel to/from Brussel Charleroi airport, it is close.

Only negatives I can think of is that the stairs were quite steep leading to the apartment, so if you have trouble with mobility be wary of that. A bit out of town but didn't bother us, you could walk to the centre in 25/30 mins. Last minor thing is that the curtains need to be thicker in one room as the sun lit the whole place up, some people like waking up with the sun but after many beers its not ideal!!  I'm nit-picking of course,

The apartment was fantasic. Great open plan living area with comfortable sitting space, dining table leading to a great kitchen that opened up onto a spacious balcony, great to sit and have a tasty Belgium beer that Martijn so kindly left for us. Bedrooms were extremely comfortable, as was the bathroom, with literally the biggest single shower I have ever used (and it was powerful)! Martijn was a great host, very friendly when meeting us and he has made a little tourist book with helpful tips (best bars in Ghent the number one of importance). He's done a great job!!! Taxi only 8.50 euros in the day and 11 at night to get straight into the centre of town. A really great place to stay!

This is a loft apartment - so two flights of narrow stairs to climb with luggage - and internet was slow and intermittent. Apparently a problem in the town rather than the hosts wifi which was working well with strong signal.,

Facilities really excellent - the sort of accommodation you wished you owned - with owners' vegan restaurant on ground floor (closed unfortunately due to holidays during our stay).

My family and I stayed here, and the location was fantastic. However, the online pictures don’t really tell the entire story. The basement/kitchen is creepy and not satisfactory for a family. If you are bringing your family to Brussels this place is NOT for you. However, if you have a younger group (college age) with no kids and no elderly people then then this is a place for you.

There was little to dislike. The whole place is gently scented with lemongrass so I guess if you don't like that, you are not going to be as happy as I was.,

The place was lovely: attention to all details and everything of the highest quality. For instance, the breakfast meats, fruits and cheeses were all top quality; the towels were sweet-smelling and fresh; the toiletries pleasant. The rooms are sparsely decorated in a chic but simple way that I found delightful. A gentle background of classical music plays all day in the living area and at breakfast. A particular pleasure was entering the breakfast area as the morning light hit the french doors, all the place settings perfectly laid out on a range of small tables in a tableau straight from an Old Master. Moments later, our hostess appears offering a range of cooked options and drinks and bringing a glass of orange juice, which was genuinely freshly squeezed.

I booked the flat for 3 to 6 March.
I've checked in on the 3rd, in the evening, and there was no hot water. I notified the flat, thru booking message service, about the problem. Even though I repeatedly tried to get an answer from them, I've sent 5 messages and phoned twice from 3rd 2100 until the 4th 1200 asking for guidance, I received no answer.
I clearly specified in the messages that if I did not receive an answer by 4th 1150 I'll check out and rent something else.
I was in Bruxelles with business and I had to leave for work on the 4th around 1200. In the work space I had no possibility of using the phone so I had to make sure that at least for the remaining days (4,5,6) I'll have proper accommodation. On the 4th, after noon I've rented another hotel to make sure that when I return in the evening I won't have to go thru the same ordeal and I also asked booking for a refund.
Around 1300 Booking notified my that the flat has the intention to send someone at the apartment, but,  by that time I had already made another reservation, non refundable.
However on the 6th I received a very nice message from the flat, as if nothing had happened, to let me know I have to check out before 10 AM- a nice joke.
I'm now waiting for Booking to make the rental understand that they have to take responsibility for their business, as they are receiving our money intact and on time, not  with delays or shortage.,

This is a small privately owned hotel, the proprietors and staff were so friendly, helpful and even purchased an air conditioning unit for our room as the temperatures were in the high thirties.  Excellent food, all homemade breads, pastries, jams and yogurts for breakfast. The dinner menu was extensive, all fresh ingredients and cooked to order, served  piping hot and beautifully presented either outside in the garden or in the restaurant. The room was clean with very comfortable beds. Parking was either just outside or in a car park two minutes walk away. We also securely park our bikes on the premises. This hotel was a real find. I would totally recommend to anyone to staying at this smaller hotel as the service, value for money and whole experience surpassed our expectations greatly.

1. When we arrived on the first day, we could not connect to the wireless network. After trying many times, we found that it was the equipment problem. The next day the landlord replied that someone would come to fix it, but when we got home in the evening, we found that no one had done it. When we contacted the landlord again, he did not reply for another night, and the next day the very official message said that we hoped to have a pleasant experience in Brussels and reminded us of the check-out time.
2. Before I arrived, the landlord sent me an email saying that the apartment was located on the fourth and last floor, but it was only the last attic.
3. The apartment is located on the fifth floor, with no elevator, a spiral narrow staircase. Passengers with large luggage are advised to book carefully.
4. The toilet is in a separate room, where the hand-washing area and bathtub are not in the same place as the toilet, which is very inconvenient.
5. On the third night there was no hot water, and on the last day there was no hot water.
We stayed here for three nights, including Christmas Eve and Christmas day. Apart from being close to the city centre (about 3 minutes to the main square), there was no wifi, no response from the landlord, no hot water and a very bad experience. First time writing that long review! Not recommended at all!!,

We arrive to the place and the entrance is ugly, dark, old, we try to find de keys on the flat entrance and totally dark and complicated, once in the flat it seems correct but when we try to turn on the heating, it doesnt work, in the evening it was cold, the listing on booking says it has heating, we make a claim to booking and the next day appears the owner. He tells us is not possible to use the heating because the hot water for heating only works if the room is at a minimum temperature, and not when we feel cold. He tells us in summer is 20 degrees so you dont need... The weather in the early morning was 12 degrees and not 20. It's 1 am, we are working in the flat we LITERALLY only walk to the batroom and sit on the flat chairs. An african woman at around 1am knocks the door, she tells us he cannot sleep beacuse of the movement of the chair, we stop moving the chais, another time, at 1:30 the woman comes again and tells us she can hear when we are walking, and she tells us that the flat on booking is an illegal business that she has lots of problems with the persons that rent the flat... Totally uncomfortable situation. We tell the problem to the owner and he tells us, well you can make noise only till 10pm.... We were literally just walking!. We tell booking we can't be in the place without heating and with the problems with the neighboor and that we want to move to another place no matters if we have to pay the day we were there, we want to cancel the next days (we had a 7 days booking). Booking contacts the owner and he refuse. The owner tell us he cannot cancel because he has lost several of persons interested in the flat before of our arrival, not real cause we made the booking just one day before of our arrival ....
Honestly talking, this place was awful. we were worried to even go out and leave or things inside.

This accommodation was truly amazing and one of the nicest places we have seen, a real home from home.  We stayed 3 nights but would love to have stayed for 3 weeks!  It is a cosy, self-contained property with its own front door and has a bedroom, bathroom, kitchen and lounge/diner.  Parking is available right outside the door.  The rooms are very spacious and nicely decorated/furnished and the brick ceilings give it a lot of character.  The double bed is very comfortable, blackout blinds keep out the light and the area is silent at night so you get a good nights sleep.  The kitchen is well equipped with microwave, kettle, toaster, fridge, electric hob and all the crockery and utensils you could need.  A breakfast bar makes a handy place to sit and have a drink or a quick snack.  The lounge is very comfortable and a dining table with four chairs is a great place to enjoy a good meal.  The whole property was spotlessly clean, the wifi was good and there are plenty of electric sockets.  The hosts, Virginie and Eric, are lovely people, so friendly and helpful.  They left us a lot of information on the area and were happy to answer any questions that we had.  One of the best parts was the wood stove and free firewood, and Virginie & Eric came in each evening and lit it for us so it was warm and cosy when we arrived back.  The location is great, on the edge of a small village but only a few minutes away from shops and supermarkets.  It is less than 5 minutes from the autoroute which gives quick and easy connections to other parts of Belgium.  A perfect base for exploring Wallonia with plenty to see in the area, and only 20 mins from Brussels Charleroi airport.  We would love to return some day!

The breakfast is poor. There are no hot dishes such as any kind of sausages or eggs or anything. Its just several kinds of salami, cereals and drinks.,

Location and having the whole house which was very clean

The reception staff were merely adequate, not very polite and certainly not friendly (very noticeable in unfailingly polite and friendly Brussels). The Nespresso (really?) machine is not intuitive to use; it makes noise and produces... nothing. Some posted instructions would help, rather than assume everyone knows how to operate these stupid coffeemakers. Really frustrating in the morning when you really need coffee and the machine seems all form and no function. Also, why was all the heating off in the room and bathroom on a freezing night in January, with giant windows looking onto an internal courtyard? Once the room is reserved, would it take so much to make a pass and turn on the heat so it's not a fridge when the guest arrives in the middle of the night? Highly unpleasant, and not expected at this price point.
HOWEVER. That is nothing compared to THE DEATH-TRAP BATHROOM.
This gloomy cave in dark wall colours and no bulb above 50 lumens is all sharp angles in concrete and tiles, with metal edge strips for added lethal potential. The bathtub/shower comes up to the mid-thigh and there are no handholds anywhere on the walls, making it a lovely treat to anyone with dodgy knees or mobility issues, risking toppling over getting in or out. There is no effective partition, so water sprays everywhere on the slick tile floor, adding another fun "am I going to die now" dimension. But the cherry on top is the 2 cm invisible step from the bedroom floor to the bathroom tiled floor. Too low to register in mind's eye, especially in the gloom of the room, but too high for one's foot to miss, especially as it's not expected. It also had a fun metal guillotine edge. I nearly broke my toes four times, getting angrier every time. Plus it made me stumble each time, forward toward the sharp, metal-edged corner of the bathtub. One day someone will trip, fall headlong onto that corner and crack open their forehead. It's absolutely ridiculous. Fix this.,

Wonderful location, basically steps from where I was (the extra night in Brussels was a last-minute decision) and where I wanted to be. The hotel is clean and functional. However, the design is a bit generic "funky hipster", like every boutique hotel in the world, which is getting a bit boring. Also: WAY too dark in colour choices, especially at night. You can't really see anything in your room, since they don't seem to believe in bulbs above 50 lumens. But clearly they tried. And it was fine for one night.

We arrived in Brugge quite a few hours before the check in time at the hotel and the host Nadia invited us to leave our bags at her shop so that we could explore the area freely, which was most appreciated. She was super friendly and helpful and I couldn't fault her! The location of the shop was easy to get to and Nadia walked us from there to the apartment. She gave us a quick tour and made sure we had everything we needed, even giving us a map and some water. The apartment was in a perfect location, minutes away from shops, restaurants and sights, meaning we could really make the most of our weekend away. It was also really clean, the shower worked perfectly and the beds were extremely comfy.

Sound insulation could be better as the street noise (police sirens etc) woke us up several times.There is no elevator to the 6th floorBathroom sink is rather low.No street parking in front of the hotel but several parking garages at walking distance,

I have already visited about 15 different hotels after the enforcement of the Covid rules. And this is by far the only one where the breakfast is still so rich and enjoyable as before Covid. In this hotel, pre-packed has not meant industrial, lower quality food, but nicely prepared and cooked portions with lots of choice and freshness. 10+ mark for the breakfast.Great bathroom fixtures, stylish, modern  and SOLID, while 80% of hotels seem to have problems with the shower fixtures not holding water or not holding position etc., because when they buy them, they go cheap. Fitness area small but intelligently planned. Very good quality dinner at the hotel restaurant. Lots of parking space, free of charge

Scraped my ankle on the edge of the tiling in front of the shower. Am nearsighted and the pattern is such that I didn't see the edge. They should put some silicone or something on it,

We stayed in room 4 on the 2nd floor and the first 2 nights were amazing, but the last night we noticed so many mosquitos in our room. No idea where they were coming from but we killed so many and caused us not to sleep well. Woke up the next morning with a lot of bites on both my husband and I. I ended going through the reviews and saw that at least 1 other person had the same complaint. Other than the mosquitos, I enjoyed they stay.,

I loved the location and convenience of the property. We parked at the interpark within a 5 minute walk and our room was on the 2nd floor. Stairs were not a problem for us but could be for others, there is no elevator. Our tv worked, A/C worked, and our room was clean. Complimentary water and hairdryer saved the day! There is a great Italian restaurant right next door. I loved how innovative the key pickup and drop off was.

The night staff was nice and efficient.
But the morning staff was a disaster! I came 10 minutes too late for breakfast. I asked if I could exceptionally get some food from the kitchen, being 8 months 1/2 pregnant. I was simply told first that food had been put away in the kitchen and that it was not possible. Then the lady changed her version saying that they had already thrown away all breakfast, to make sure I would not insist on getting some food I guess...
When I asked if other hotels around would offer some breakfast, she answered that everything was closed by 10am without checking with other hotels. When I told her that I would then have to order a taxi to try and find something in the closest town, she showed absolutely no willingness to help and simply said that this was my only solution.
Good that I went to the nearest hotel, the PentaHotel, where they were serving breakfast until 11.30am and welcomed me in the nicest way.
I will never go back to this hotel for this very reason. Showing no flexibility even when obviously the person needs specific attention is unacceptable.,

Location was practical. Equipments were fairly good and it was clean.

Good value for your money. The hotel is in the heart of the city of Hasselt. The room was quiet (which I asked for in advance and received a notification from) and breakfast was very good. The personnel was very hospitable and gave good suggestions on my questions and new the local parking situation (which saved me a lot of mo money, so when arriving by car please ask!). Also I forgot my toothpaste, but that was something they could solve. Sounds like a no brainer to many 'die hard hotel visitors' but to me this made a difference. Also the personnel at the breakfast room were very kind.

Air conditioning wouldn't chill, only heat. Reported it but was told it only kicks in if its hot, it certainly didn't!,

Friendly staff, looked after us with lunch bags when the restaurant closed due to Coronavirus.

The closeness of our bed (in room 2) to the door and communal hallway. Due to the position of the fireplace, windows, etc, it would be difficult to move the bed to another position but it meant our heads were only a few metres away from people going up and down the stairs. Other guests were very respectful so we slept well until being woken up by a staff member refilling the coffee and tea cupboard just outside our door at 8am. After 10 minutes or so of trying to ignore her I got up and to let her know that we were trying to sleep. To her credit, she went elsewhere immediately.
I don't believe this would be an issue in other rooms, only room 2. And this was only an issue for us because we were really looking forward to catching up on our sleep and the check out was not until 11am. ,

Everything else was great. I'd certainly stay there again if I could have a different room. The coffee shop across the road did a lovely  breakfast, parking was easy to find, and there was plenty of choice for other meals within 5 minutes walk.
Good location for those traveling by plane and need to have quick access to the airport.The hotel has a free shuttle service to the airport.

This time the problem came unexpectedly,1) Some guy could not checked-in due to his payment fail. He had received the email that his payment went wrong but room was still reserved for him. BUT NO ROOM WAS RESERVED, that really awful as the hotel had not took into consideration his own emails. I had the same case several days ago with my payment try was declined. I received the email: 'your payment went wrong but the room was still reserved for you'. If I didn't pay that time, I would have missed my booking as well. It would be a disaster weekend2) The receptionist declined 'late check-out' service for my friends stayed the same hotel, saying they were overbooked. No info about late check-out was about no-possibility to add 'late check-out' option when  you are checking-in3) Room 403 - mini-bar refrigirator is not cooling and remained hot. That made me throw away my salat. It was really unpleasant situationRoom 103 - the sink was blocked and water did not go away easily,

Marivic and Frederik have given us a wonderful stay. They will do everything to make your stay unforgettable. They took us on their motorboat and even let us drive a motorboat ourselves.  Hospitality is very important to them, which is why they invited us over several times for a nice evening and a delicious Belgian beer (be sure to visit Bierkasteel in Izegem, the beer is super delicious). If you have a car, you can reach a lot of beautiful places in a short time from Izegem. Bruges (was by far the most beautiful place for us, you must have seen it) is only 20-30 minutes away. The beach (we were in Knokke Heist) is only about 40 minutes away. We also visited Lille (a city in France) which was also only half an hour away. Within half an hour we also drove over to the Netherlands (we were there at the beach in Cadzand, also highly recommended). All cities had their own charm and we liked them very much. We felt more than comfortable on their cute and cosy houseboat.

nothing,

From start to finish, it was amazing. The personal touches and warm reception, the boat ride around the canal and dinner recommendations and company were fantastic.   Frederic and Maricia are amazing.   Ccyling routes are all around and many great routes near Ypres.

Nothing to dislike !,

Excellent location for hikes and visits, all facilities present (even more than expected, small gifts included), very clean upon arrival. On top of that, Gite Evasion has superfriendly, welcoming hosts who are readily available for help or tips.

Very nice homestead near forest and nature. Great amentities and very nice hostess. English is spoken fluently so it is a very easy place to stay and the hostess helps you a lot with information about travelling in Belarus. Great walks are available in the area.

She is an excellent cook and served us great lunch, breakfast, and dinner all from the natural ingredients.The room was very comfortable. Last but not least - although the house is located in a quiet place it's easy to get to the town of Naroch (about 10 min drive by car) with all the stores and restaurants.

We visited during a heat wave and the room was uncomfortably hot. They placed a portable fan in the room and provided us with bottles of water but it was still difficult to comfortably sleep or rest in the room. One side of the room was French doors that faced the afternoon sun so while we’d be out the room just turned into a hot box even if we closed the blinds and curtains to stop it a little. It eventually would cool off once the sun went down, but again it’s summer so this happened late. ,

The lobby and rooms were beautifully decorated. The bed was comfortable (on the soft side). Only hanging space for those who like to unpack during their stay. Breakfast each morning was nice. Included bread, meats and cheeses, scrambled eggs, yogurts and granola. The breakfast room was small but we never had to struggle to find a place to sit. Short walk to the metro and Grand Place.

Unmatched quality of sleep. Overall comfort and quite surroundings. Long walks among pine trees. Deers in the forest. Getting there may be a bit tricky as it is far from the center, but there is no other way to meet the nature anyway - just take taxi.

Cost of breakfast is really high. There is a off smell inside the room when we entered. But after staying in it for a while it wasn't there anymore.,

The only thing I could regret is the price, a bit expensive for our budget, but it was no surprise. I just want to tell travelers to count the different extra prices in their budget : dinner, breakfast, sauna... everything is perfect so you will want to try everything and that will grow the bill !Also, no options for vegans BUT Irina is so cool I am pretty sure you just have to tell before you come.,

The place was perfect, real Russian sauna with a small river nearby, adorable dogs, extra comfy room, delicious food... and, most importantly, Irina, who welcomed us, is an amazing person, so interesting, funny and warm.Her English is perfect (she is a translator) which was very appreciable during a trip in a country where nobody understood us.We had a long trip driving all around Belarus and this stay was a well-appreciated pause.

The bathroom and the room were clean but a little old.,

The restaurant  and the breakfast are more than average.

there are a wedding in the same building of the hotel , the music during all the night until 2 or 3 o'clock in the morning , we can't sleep never because of this , and we were obliged to dont go in the morning to work . we pass a horrible night , i am going to ask my money back. !!,

the room is clean and the man in the reception so nice and helpful .

Rooms noisy. Could overhear the neighbor on the phone and follow complete conversation.

The hospitality. The hospitality that the hosts showed us during out stay was second to none. We arrived after the latest scheduled arrival time for 10pm but they were still there to greet us when we arrived and even invited us over to share a beer. They were informative on the area, offering us a lot of great ideas for planning out our next few days of activities, and the next day when we ran into trouble in Bruges they were quick to offer us a helping hand that turned a miserable night into a memorable one. The room itself was fantastic as well and very unique. A cozy cabin on a boat with all the amenities you could need. The terrace above was fantastic for a late night beer while looking at the stars, soaking up the sun during the day, or for more a morning coffee looking out over the canal.  I could not recommend the Spits-Lucie B&B enough. If you are staying in the area and looking for a unique place to stay with great personality then this is it.

It was pretty hot and our room only had a portable air conditioning. I believe that might be troublesome in the peaks of summer. ,

Great location, super nice staff.

Jacuzzi didn’t work fully - jets were out-of-order,

Great stay at Hotel Malleberg.  The location is exceptional, only steps away from the major Markt and Burg squares.  The manager went out of his way to make it a great visit and was very helpful with suggestions of things to do in the area.  The breakfast was delicious with many choices and lots of great fruit, yogurt, breads, meats, and cheeses.  The Family Room was even larger than expected - actually was two rooms connected by a private hallway with a toilet room and shower/bath room in between - and could easily fit two couples or a full family quite comfortably.  I also thought the price was quite reasonable for such a large room in such a great location.
Beautiful location and the host Irina is such a nice person, felt like staying at home. Fantastic breakfast, prepared with ❤️❤️❤️, thank you!

Me and my wife have just stayed three nights at Hotel Malleberg and had a wonderful time. The hotel is situated in a fantastic location just a short walk from the historic centre, the shopping areas, and the Christmas markets were only a few minutes away. The hotel has a lovely basement which is the breakfast area, and the breakfast food was certainly plenty to keep us going for the morning. The rooms are of a decent size, importantly very warm for the time of year and the bed was very comfortable. The owners are very friendly and helpful and told us of local interests to visit also we received two vouchers for a free boat trip because we stayed for three nights.

The equipment of the room did not fully correspond to the description. Especially  accessories in the bathroom corresponded more for 2star hotel. The towels, no bathfoam, only one shower gel in a big flask..... The fasade  and surrounding of the hotel was under reconstrution.,

The breakfest was really exceptional, so many varieties of hight quality food and drinks. Nice atmosphere. Staff tried to be helpfull. The hotel is close to the public transportation stations - metro, bus, even railwaystation.

There was really variety of food for the breakfast however scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages I took were not a surplus.,

I like this chain of hotels. Really good.

Absolutely lovely stay. Friendly and helpful welcome from the host. Very comfortable and clean room. Great breakfast, both in terms of quantity and quality. It is clear that the host puts a lot of efforts to ensure a great customer experience. Just perfect end to end!

Open plan bathroom ,

Well presented and furnished
The house was very clean and very cosy. Nothing bad to say!! Also the owners are very kind!

Nothing it was all good,

Literally one minute from the market square this hotel is perfect as a sightseeing base and for those looking for nights out.
Nice self service continental breakfast
Staff lovely 
Family room a really good size
De Irish coffee in de bar was écht niet ok.
breakfast was "normal", nothing special. Location very good.
Great location! A spacious room, everything recently renovated. Agna is an amazing host, very dedicated and a perfectionist. The breakfast was delicious and quite generous.
Very comfortable beds, excellent continental breakfast. The host gave us a very warm welcome and was very helpful throughout our stay
Fantastic place, wonderful location, great breakfast & a warm welcome. We'll be back!

The lobby was under renovation which although did not impact our trip, it was a bit off-putting when we arrived as did not know how this would impact the room. Some warning of the renovation would have been appreciated. Thankfully the renovations did not impact the room.,

Very good room, clean, spacious and comfortable.

Agna is extremely friendly and takes care of her guests. She does not hesitate to give all the necessary information. The breakfast was excellent. The fruits are fresh as well as the bread and pastries and the quantities are generous!
Very friendly host, beautiful property and lovely breakfast.

We liked everything about B&B 11 Exclusive Guesthouse.,

We loved everything about B&B 11 Exclusive Guesthouse.  The location was close to the main square and easy to get to.  My husband and I stayed in the 1st floor suite.  It had a separate entrance, living room, small kitchen, large bedroom and bathroom.  It was extremely clean and the hosts of the B&B were wonderful.  We enjoyed breakfast each morning and great conversation with other guest.  The host of the B&B provided great instruction on what to do and see along with options for restaurants.  The next time we visit Brugge we will definitely stay at B&B 11.

Pillows for your beds are cushions leading to a very uncomfortable sleep.
They're having renovation works but we were not told beforehand at any time.
Noisy from all the renovation works.
We felt like we were in the way of the workmen and unsure if the kitchen was still operational. ,

Incredible location.
Staff were friendly.
Stairs were a bit dangerous

Stated that parking was available nearby which was actually street parking around the corner but the host kindly allowed us to use his local parking permit. ,

Walking distance to Grote market and Cloth Hall. B&B is located on the third level accessed by a narrow staircase so our heavy suitcases stayed downstairs in the main house. We were given the keys and due to host working we were given free reign and didn’t actually meet. But a friend warmly greeted us in his behalf and kindly prepared breakfast for us before she left for work which was delicious! Lived the eclectic collection of vintage items and the room was tastefully decorated with plenty of tourist brochures available.

Some furniture is a bit worn out and the bathroom need proper door (instead of the curtain).,

We liked that the door had a code and it was easy to enter and leave the apartment. Also, the host left clear instructions how to use everything in the apartment. The apartment was fully equipped and clean. The location is in the city centre, close to many shopping and dining places. The metro stop is just a few minutes away on foot.

Nothing,

Everything, location peaceful, all facilities clean and comfortable, spacious property. 
Not much in the little town except a very good bakery 😁

Bride stayed the night before the wedding and husband joined after the wedding!
The room was amazing ! The staff was soooo kind! 
Would 100% recommend and also we will be back to enjoy it once more !
Loved all the rooms we booked for the family and friends !
Amazing place to stay x

Firstly the bed’s mattress was soo bad, u will suffer while sleeping. Secondly,  noises outside were soo annoying specially during the day if u would like to have a nap. Thirdly, during our stay which was 3 nights no one changed our bed sheets and pillows and it was dirty and need to be changed.,

Location was great and the stuff were good. I would recommend the location.

Nothing to mention!,

First of all I want to mention that Gaston is the best host we’ve ever seen. When we entered the apartment it was warm, because they waited for us. Thank you so much, it was so nice!
Th guesthouse is cosy, well furnished and has all the necessary stuff. The spacious bathroom with shower and bath was always clean. 
Breakfast was delicious, especially scrambled eggs which were prepared for every guest individually. 
The location is great, you are in the very center of the city. 
I really suggest that you visit this fabulous place!
Jimmy's welcome and friendliness during our stay was excellent.  The guest room is very well appointed in a unique quirky way.

the keyword for the entrance doesn't work,

the room is very big! my family enjoyed staying here a lot
it was wonderful.  owners very kind and helpful  nature  was amazing thanks for everything. hope to go there again

I believe there were people smoking in the room next to us as their was a strong smell of cigarette smoke in our bathroom. Nothing the hotel can be blamed for though. ,

Their breakfast is amazing, definitely the highlight of the stay!
Everything was amazing! Incredibly friendly and helpful hosts. We loved our stay and would definitely love to come back.

at the first floor on the main road was a little noisy,

in the center of Bruxelles, 2 min walking from Grand Place, the rooms are clean and confortable although not large

Missed having a kettle in the room as I like to have tea or coffee first thing in the morning and at night.,

Large spacious room. Lovely bathroom. Safe in room. Traditional older building with very nice decor. Nice breakfast.
Breakfast was very good and fit for a day on a bike. Nice decoration. Bedroom is spacious. Host rents good bikes and knows a lot about biking tours.

Everything was great!,

Very good location and very comfortable apartment. Great choice to stay in Brussels!

nothing,

Everything and especially a marvelous breakfast end the owner's extreme kindness and availability

Nothing,

Lovely breakfast, clean rooms, good location, friendly host

The internet is not good,very slowThere is renovation in the reception,

Yes the bed is comfortable
Close to everything, large and comfortable room and bathroom, clean, they change towels every day, very kind host.

Patricia is a great host and perfectly accomodated to our needs. She even installed a bed and high chair for our baby.Her appartement is spotlessly clean, very practical and confortable, well decorated and cosy.We recommend and hope to come back.

Not applicable ,

Warm welcome, very helpful host, Erik. Also spacious accommodation. Really exceptional breakfast, freshly prepared orange juice, plus local cheese and ham, no cost cutting as some places do. A real pleasure to stay.

nothing,

Everything was just as you'd expect it: location, room, great breakfast. We had the perfect spot for our weekend getaway!

The apartment is clean and spacious, but you need to complete some shortcomings and care, such as shelves in bathrooms and hangers.  Some of the basics for the kitchen, maintenance of bathroom floor, changing pillows for the bed, setting a table beside the bed and lighting in the bedroom, in general the apartment is good and I would recommend living in it.,

-Excellent shopping site.
-Cleanliness.
Its brand new and well furnished. Breakfast was great, they take your order for eggs and such. Parking is near to the hotel so just a short walk from the car to your room. Very comfortable stay!
Very well located comfortable property.  Staff was exceedingly personable.

The size of the room is really small, even the toilet is small too. The shower room is the only normal size in my room. ,

The girl in the reception, when we chick in. She was friendly, helpful, respectful, and so kind. The hotel’s location is great as it is in the heart of everything. The hotel’s lobby is under renovation but do not worry. I really loved my stay there

Cherry on the cake would be tea and coffee facilities in the room.,

Excellent location.  Rooms lovely, clean and spacious. Excellent breakfast with a wide choice.  Superb host, very friendly and accommodating, with lots of advice about the area....will be back.

The apartment exceeded our expectations. It has all the basic needs and essentials. We didn't want to eat out as much cause of the pandemic and it was acutally quite nice to eat at the apartment since it looks really nice. Communication with Patricia went smoothly.

Not having a shower option. There is a hand shower in bath. ,

Being able to have a bath.

There are several cupboards, even tailor-made, however, in none is a fridge to be found. With regard to the marvelous beer and delicious food, this would be definitely nice to have. But as I said: "nice to have", not dramatically necessary. // We have indeed experienced the noise that was described in earlier reviews. Some young folks gathered in front of our window, on the little square. However, we were able to talk to the guys and they became consequently more quiet. Keep that in mind, guess it'll help. ,

Actually, we liked pretty much everything about our stay in Bruges at Chester. The location is superb in that you don't need to walk far in order to explore the city. The appartement is exactly as the pictures have suggested. No concerns regarding covid19, everything has be arranged perfectly, even hand sanitizer was provided. Check-in was smooth and contactless. Stairs may be too steep for elderly people, but there's also a certainly nice place to stay on the ground floor. Daily housekeeping was alright.

Nothing!,

Unique interiors, fabulous location, tasteful breakfast and a super host! Entire floor at your disposal — a great place for a visit to Mechelen.

Public parking,

Bikes were very good.

No negatives,

Everything was ideal

The noise of traffic all night long. I recommend more double glazing. Also the curtains did not cut out all the street light - slightly wider curtains is all that would be required.,

The apartment was spacious and very good access to city centre.
Super nice hotel, very clean, very quite and the staff was super friendly

The location of this beautiful guesthouse was perfect for exploring Bruges, which in itself is a magical place. The house is wonderfully decorated and furnished with many lovely little touches. Breakfast was perfect, and the owner of the guesthouse a pleasure to speak to and very informative and helpful.

tiny bathroom.. ,

minute away @ Grand-Place & other attractions...
Great Location, friendly staff and a lovely spacious room.
Beautiful apartment! Very clean and cosy and with all the facilities you need. Also good location, not too far from Spa and Durbuy. Definitely recommend!

Nothing really, I found everything fine.,

The breakfast that Erick served every morning was tasty and there was plenty of it.

There was quite a lot of noise from the street, the stairs and the door of the B&B which sadly is the case for many hotels in cities. The bathroom was a little bit smelly. Breakfast was served by a different person every morning and although everyone was polite, it felt a little bit impersonal. ,

The B&B is overall beautifully decorated and our suite on the ground floor was very spacious and very pretty. The fireplace was simply amazing and created a romantic atmosphere in the room! The honesty bar was very well equipped and prices were very reasonable. The breakfast has a lot of variety and it was quite tasty.

The facilities are excellent and Serge is absolutely an excellent host. The breakfast was extraordinary, very complete and burgundy! We stayed one night with our two kids (3yrs & 1yr) and were able to go out for a drink in the bar closeby (200m), while the kids were sleeping. Parking and electric charging in front of Lunatree

So first, Peter his really nice!So welcoming, available and friendly, always there to help or give some good advice to visit the area 😊👌The situation of the appartement is really easy, not more than 6min by bicycle from the building to the beach.(and we can borrow the bike from Peter which is amazing!) And also near to all supermarket, shopping and the train station.But it's really a quiet place, and also not far from The Zwin. Inside everything is clean, the mattress is comfortable, and we had all we need.We gonna keep the address for sure! :)

It is not that I didn't like it but the rooms could use a little bit of an update.  Newer carpet & furniture would be nice.  But it was still a nice room.,

The hotel is very nice & clean.  The lobby area is more up-to-date than the rooms but the overall experience was nice.  The staff was so friendly & went out of the way to help you.  The location of the hotel is within walking distance to take public transportation.  We were very satisfied with choosing the Van der Valk hotel in Antwerpen.  We did not eat in the restaurant so I do not have a comment regarding the food, etc.

The sofa bed wasn't comfortable. The 2nd room by the stairs has little light. The shower can't be locked and has frosted glass, which can make it uncomfortable when you're staying with friends of the opposite sex since you can see it from the 1st room. Wifi in the room does not work, but we can still access wifi from the lounge.,

Location is great. Walking distance from the metro and the Grand Place. There are also restaurants and shops nearby. Lay out of the apartment is simple and yet functional. Minimalist yet modern.The lounge is also accessible. You can leave your luggage if you arrive earlier or leave later. They are also friendly and can speak English fluently.

It would be great with a big mirror in the room and an el-point in the bathroom for a hair dryer or a curler. ,

Charming hotel in very nice neighbourhood. Very cosy place. Great host! Very good breakfast. Big, comfortable rooms.
Great location. Very helpful staff with great recommendations for the best places to visit. Very private and perfect for a couples getaway.

The ground floor now is under renovation and it's not really comfortable. But the stuff is very friendly and helpful. There are no racks in the bathroom,

The room is cozy and clean, though a little small

Not a big problem, but if mobility is difficult stairs to rooms my be troublesome. No lift due to age and style of building.,

Very spacious rooms and ensuite. Lovely breakfast, staff welcoming and attentive. Building beautiful and in great location.

Excellent apartment on a great location! Patricia welcomed us and explained everything we needed to know about the accommodation and the surrounding area. Very cosy, well equiped and clean apartment! Definitely recommend to everyone. We will be back!
Erik was a marvellous host with tips and info in addition to an exceptional breakfast.  The b&b had those lovely additional items like fluffy dressing gowns.
Superb room - friendly welcome and absolutely amazing breakfast. Perfect location for seeing Bruges

Would have been nice to have been warned about the rock festival!,

Personal touch plenty of room. Outdoor seating. Fab breakfast. Lovely family business
Everything is was to the high standards

The staff is amazing. Very helpful and nice.
The restaurant and breakfast has great quality.
I truly recommend this hotel.

The curtains do not block well the light so if you need dakness to sleep, bring your sleeping maskThe noise isolation could also be better,

Size, convenience and location

Very steep, shallow stairs.,

Friendly staff, felt like home. Well located,  just a walk to lots and lots of bars.  I know as my husband took me to most of them.

no air conditioning - may be critical in hot summer,

Good location, comfortable bed, free baby crib on request

Two flights of stairs with no lift, we didn’t expect this. Glad I had two big boys to help carry our bags. :),

Big rooms. Clean. Friendly service. Decent breakfast
Great location, super clean, good space for four, and check in was most graceous.

I wish if there was a swimming pool also .,

Sauna was so nice and good .
 The hotel location was perfect .
The breakfast was good .

Decor in room need refreshing as it doesn't look as if it's been wallpapered for over 20 years.,

Owner veery helpful and let us check in early. Room + shower room was spotless and breakfast was very good 😄
Heel de accommodatie is top!!

Nothing there to not like.,

Eric the owner was amazing and supplied a very hearty breakfast. A perfectly clean and well situated B&B to see the battlefields and Ypres.

There was nothing to dislike.,

The welcome from Stephanie and the information given.The spaciousness and comfort of the room. The location was excellent. The choice at breakfast was very good. The fact that we could leave our luggage there and collect later.
the house was shared with the owner

Sehr einfache Unterkunft

The room wasn’t as nice as expected after seeing bar, restaurant and reception however it was spotless, comfortable and had everything you need, including proper coffee machine:) ,

Everything! Great value for money, excellent and professional staff, beautiful property, would definitely stay again. Car park was a huge bonus.

Fridge not working. Requested a fix.
Was Told someone will come next day to check. No one turned up.
Next day 2nd request. Told someone will come next day. 
Told could use office fridge.
We paid for an apartment with working appliance for 2 nights.
Unable to stay in to eat, drink.
No compensation given.
Unacceptable and unfair to travellers.,

Location.
Apartment.

I think a small scale boutique hotel should be able to provide non plastic free products, something more ecological. For example portioned jams and butter, plastic coffee capsules & plastic bottles water.  I would prefer to see more care and thought in this area.,

The bed was super comfy and a big bathbforn2 that fills up rather quickly. And as we had the suite we had a private entrance.

The lobby is under construction and they didn't inform before check in.,

Location

The location is excellent, only 5 minutes walk to the main square and Christmas market. The facilities are excellent and very comfortable... The property owner is very friendly and always on hand if you need anything. On arrival he showed us key points on the map and recommended walks to take. Having stayed at the Guesthouse Mirabel I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Bruges.

Nothing negative: I wish I could have stayed longer!,

The apartment was modern, stylishly furnished, well eqipped, super clean, great shower!Perfect location: Apartment is located in the centre of Aywaille easy walking distance to restaurants, train station, and supermarkets.Patricia is a very gracious and friendly host who goes to great trouble to help her guests.

The reception when we arrived was lacking hospitality. We were not greeted by the desk, we were asked for the cards immediately. Then, the amount that we were asked to pay was higher than the price. Even though we made it clear that the booking was through booking.com, the receptionist told us to pay the price. Without any further explanation, we were told that they would charge us some extra money just for 'deposit'.  We only learned this, that they would pay the card after the check out, after we asked several times. It would be better to give the information, the reason for the extra payment and other details before trying to charge the guests extra for no apparent reason. Even though the room was almost exactly the same as in the photos, the number of the plugs and the placements of them were really odd. There was no plug next to the bed, not anywhere accessible. Even the coffee machine, which was placed by the hotel itself, was unplugged because there was no plug available. Lastly, the lockers in the sauna were all broken/not usable. There was almost no instructions on how to use the lockers and we had to leave our belongings without locking them.,

Location of the hotel was really good, it has easy access to metro and walking distance to the city center. It's very close to the train station (Gare du Nord), which is another good point. The neighborhood was also good, there were few supermarkets, cafes and restaurants if you don't want to go to city center just to eat. The view of the room was nice at the 17th floor, even though we did not book for the room with the city view. The sauna was really good and had an awesome view.

It wasn’t a problem for us, but just be aware that there is no elevator & the stairs are steep.,

The location was fantastic!  The husband & wife owners were both very pleasant & helpful to us, especially with restaurant recommendations. They also accommodated our travel plans by allowing an early check-in. In addition, the husband carried our heavy suitcases up the stairs for us to our room. The room was small, as expected, but it had everything we needed. A good value for the money.

very warm upstairs in the bedrooms (airco will be installed late ‘20). 
the noise of the motorway that runs 200m behind the house is quite noticeable when sitting in the garden. The house itself is very well insulated, no noise noticeable.
,

clean and newly renovated house with lots of amenities located in a residential neighborhood. very friendly and hospitable owner with an eye for detail. 20minutes from maastricht and 10 min from historical center of Rekem with nice restaurants (by car). supermarket at 500m from the house.

Information suggested there was a washing machine. This was not the case. We were able however to go to a laundromat about a km away which worked well,

Very comfortable bedEric is very hospitableA lot of effort taken with breakfast

Nothing!!,

Breakfast was fab - lots of variety, fresh & plenty of it, even a glass of bubbly too.  Our suite was beautiful, the fire was just what was needed after a cold day & the shower was fantastic. The room was exceptionally clean & well maintained, clean towels on both days too! The location was great, everything within a short walking distance.
Serge was a friendly and generous host who provided an abundant breakfast tailored to our wishes.

We only missed a kettle for making a cup of tea. Also the breakfast did not meet our expectations at all. We are used to Van der Valk in the Netherlands where the choice is almost endless. Also the fish in the restaurant comes with way too much oil on the plate.,

We liked the room. It was spacious, clean, with an amazing view. It had everything we needed. Bed and pillows are amazing.

Elevator,

Location and spacious
We had a wonderful time!The room was beautiful, the breakfast amazing and our host very friendly and helpful!If you want to come to Brügge, it's the perfect place to stay!

No air conditioning.It was 35/36 degrees.Felt suffocated.No fridge in room but Lidl supermarket very close,

The staff were so lovely and friendly.We had a flood in bathroom and lots of extra towels were provided.Tbey gave us nice clean quiet room

Coffee making facilities would have been a help,

The location of this guesthouse is perfect for visiting all areas of bruges, it was also within walking distance of the train station.The host "Gaston" was really helpful

A large modern hotel with the usual selection of facilities. We only stayed for one night as a break of journey having arrived late in the evening on the Eurostar from London. However, the hotel was clean and comfortable and very conveniently located adjacent to Rogier metro station which gives good connections to Brussels Midi station and the rest of the city centre.

The decor is starting to look a little shabby, but it is a lovely old building.,

The beds were very comfy, and it was very clean.

Perfect location, beautifull house with all the luxury and extras you could wish for, very clean and spacious, large green garden with good outdoor furniture, hope future guests will treat this prperty with care ! This can be a very nice home to stay in all year arround, fresh flowers on the coffee table and welcome chocolats, the little extras ! Bedrooms are spacious and comfortable bathroom perfect !The host is very friendly professional, would like to stay here again. Is very near to all bycicle paths, beautifull surroundings, very green and at this time of year is very peacefull and quiet.

We would have appreciated brighter lights in the bedroom for our old eyes to make reading easier.,

The friendliness of the hosts, willingly answered all our questions about the area and made good suggestions.  Excellent breakfast and parking on site.  Enjoyed sitting on the outdoor deck adjacent to the room.

The room we stayed in was excellent, the only draw back was the steep stairs.,

The breakfast was lovely, plenty to choose from, even offered a glass of Champagne with it. The location was perfect, close to the market and the many shops. We would recommend the B&B Chester and would certainly return if we came to Bruges again

There could have been more light in the room.,

The location.
The owner was friendly but not intruding.
Good

No lock on shower door, needed more lighting in the glass room, not enough pillows,

Location, size and windows that opened, easy to check in

The floor boards in our loft room did creak a lot, but I guess that was just part of the character.,

The building is lovely with heavy oak beams, contemporary decor, and quality fittings and furnishings.  Very accommodating and available host.

no view from room, very small sink in bathroom,

no aircondition in room

No tea or coffee making facilities. ,

Host very helpful with local knowledge. Room was very comfortable. Location was good.

Swimming pool? Decor/carpets a little tired but still acceptable.,

Good value for money considering the great location.

Nothing, everything was fine.,

The breakfast was continental style, as expected, with a nice selection of choices. The bedroom was spacious and very clean. The location of the hotel, was in a quite district, but it was only a few minutes walk from the main square of Bruges.The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and also arranged for a taxi to take us back to the railway station, on our departure afternoon.

Nothing.,

The breakfasts were quite tasty as well as being filling; there was no scrimping on either quality or quantity of food.  We were also welcome to use the kitchenette (microwave, refrigerator and kettle), dining area and soft chair area at any time.  And it was very nice to have a bedroom for that could be darkened completely.
Beautiful little place, perfect location and friendly staff.

Anything said I didn’t like would be just because it does not everything I have at home. Perhaps soft drinks in the fridge, but that is a minor thing.,

Fantastic B&B in great location. Wonderful decoration and furnishings. I must admit I did not know what to expect from the Japanese style bed but it was really comfortable. Welcome was outstanding and breakfast was just what I needed to start the day with both hot and cold options.
I ask to have the room at 2pm.  I receive an aceptation and at my arrival, room was not ready

LOUD, right next ot a busy street and window insulation is inadequateFor those who actually cook rather basic … no forks, no ladels, no sharp cutting knives,

NIce big room with atmosphere
This place has a great location, beautiful rooms, lovely staff and a fantastic breakfast.

The rooms don't have aircon, so we were given a standing fan that basically swirled hot air around. The rooms facing the street are quite noisy for all the bars and pubs surrounding the hotel. The room rate included breakfast which we were told could not be provided due to renovations at the property. Pillows are awful.,

Rooms are clean and modern. Good location, easy walking distance to shops and Grand Place. Close to transport services and the Eurostar station is less than ten minutes by car. Staff were very helpful and apologetic about the renovations/lack of breakfast.

Steps but not allowed a lift :P,

Location, facilities, host, breakfast

-,

Everything

Stayed with my 2 sons aged 18 and 20, lovely big room with 3 single beds. Fabulous continental breakfast with lots of choice. Hotel is right in the middle of Bruges. Would definitely return and recommend to friends and family!
Home from home,  friendly and excellent hosts, was able to put motorcycle in garage

My wife and I loved this place. Very well located. The owner was great and prepared amazing breakfast everyday. We stayed in the suite and it was very comfortable and cozy with the fire place. Will definitely book this place again if or when we will return in Bruges!

Nothing,

The place offers a lot of space comparing to local hotels. It is one floor in a town house with restored original features which gives you that lovely feel of authenticity. It is very close to centre so in walking distance you may get to local restaurants. The host is one of the most lovely and hospitable people I have ever met and would go miles to make your stay as per expectations. Can't recommend enough and if it is available next time I'm in Mechelen, I shall certainly try to come back, even if just to have a chat with Serge!
For a 4 start hotel at that price and a 8,3 rating, we expected more.

little noisy. apartment not sound proof. can hear next room talking. all the buses and ambulance at night. i stay at room 302 and 301. its a duplex. room its upstair. stairs were dangerous for small children. bathroom should have cover. can see shadow when taking bath. its not conveniece if you take a bath and others walkjng at the hallway.,

i like it its easy to enter the apartment with the pass code. kitchen is fully furnished. got washing machine and dryer. its located on the shopping district. 300m to grand place. and walking distance to other attraction.

Nothing,

Very attractive large attic room 
Friendly and helpful owner.
Splendid breakfasts
Great location

Nothing,

Very good bathroom, nice room, lighting was good, I do not remember the minibar whether it had or not,  a small balcony, the bed was comfortable, the lobby was cosy! Location was great and 2 minutes to Center by walk
Brilliant service, exellent staff, very clean and so close to the centerof the city. Very helpful staff.

Every thing was perfect except i had an issue on the room cleaning Service and the Duty Manager Mr.Jeremy promised to investigate the Subject.,

The location is centralized and the neighborhood  is safe.The Room is equipped with all needed facilities.You have a metro station just few steps from the hotel entrance.I had an issue/complain during my stay and i admired the response and reaction of the Duty Manager Mr. Jeremy Remacle where he apologized and clarified the issue to me and even as a Good Will he offered me a free Airport Taxi ride .

Quite a few stairs but not a problem for us.,

Comfortable, clean, quiet and very close to the main sites on foot.

Erik and his wife were the perfect hosts. Very welcoming, making our visit home from home. The room was very comfortable and the breakfast was very filling, with a great choice. Erik happily adjusted my breakfast as I am vegetarian.

Nothing ,

Great central location in the middle 9f Brugges.  Very comfortable rooms and nice buffet breakfast.  We were able to leave our bags at Check Out in the morning them collect them later in the day.

Nothing significant, the  bathroom is not attached to the bedroom for those who can care about that detail...,

Warm welcom by the mother of the owner (a big thank you to her, his French is still very good and we appreciated this first contact!). We appreciated also a lot the Breakfast which was prepared by the Daughter of the owner.As mentioned in the other comments it's a old typic house very well located with a nice deco and all the comfort.Congrats to the Owner to share this house with guest. We hope they spent a good week end in Italy !

I was assigned a non-renovated room, which was not clean properly. The non-renovated rooms are so outdated and should not be used. The panel behind the air conditioning was dirty. This was sorted out properly by the Front Desk agent.,

The new room product looks good.

Motion lights in hallway stayed on long disturbing people sleeping in glass bedroom. Some mold on ceiling in shower and loose tiles.,

The location.
The bed was crisp, clean and extra comfy. The breakfast was absolutely beautifully presented. Our host Tania couldn't have been more accommodating.

Nothing negative really, except we had to keep asking for tea bags and milk each day for our room. But apart from that it was faultless! ,

Lovely hotel right in the centre of Brussels, great location. Nice decor and very clean rooms. Had a great sleep here, it was so quiet despite it being located right in the city centre. 
L’occitaine toiletries was a nice touch.
Very friendly owner, great location and very clean, would definitely return and recommend.

The bathroom could be cleaner. Car park was very expensive. ,

Quite close to the city’s attractions. The breakfast was real good. Beds were comfortable.

There's no elevator but the place is beautiful and the staff helped me with my luggage,

Big room, very clean, cozy, cute patio and great location. Breakfast was very good and staff very kind

Nothing to say on this.,

We were welcomed into a comfortable home with all the facilities that we needed. We were well fed at breakfast time, and offered assistance and advice on local amenities and attractions. Many thanks to Erik and Rosita for a lovely stay.

Nothing -it was really perfect!! ,

Beautiful B&B. Both the lounge/breakfast area and the room was modern but cosy. Lovely staff. Breakfast was gorgeous and the location was perfect for seeing everything in Bruges. Comfortable bed and clean, modern bathroom with a great shower.
The host is great. The place is a beautiful walk through architecture. It has a perfect location with a view of the church in the central square. And it is very romantic for couples.

At the time,because I did not have to book another hotel I agree with extra cost but if you are going to book this flat it is better to verify all things included before go. Hassle-free self check-in with a code, no need to make arrangements and time your arrival or stress when delayed. Downtown location, very central to shops, bars and restaurants. Very spacious and clean. Very good heating and great water pressure which helps to shower the cold away.

Almost everything. Everything is well-cared, the decor is really tasteful and the crew makes everything to make you feel comfort. Also, the location is more than anyone could ask for: a few steps away from the main street and the main square, but in an incredibly quiet and reserved street.

- The sound of restoration work.

- We experienced our the worst parking process. The name of park house is Indigo. I paid totally 36 Euros for two days and after I wanted to drive out. We jammed in front of the exit by car because the parking ticket did not function although we paid. With the help of construction workers, I reached the authorized person. They told that I have to pay. I told that i had already paid. By the way, to pay with cash is not possible and there is no any receipt which indicates that you paid. Fortunately we logged in our bank account and we showed the transaction information. Afterwards the authorize person told that I did not drive out in 50 minutes. Fortunately there is also a time which shows when you paid. It was not even 20 minutes. When I was alright then she couldn't have found any other excuse and has given us an another ticket to drive out. 
- In the parking garage, the ceiling is to low so watch out when you open your baggage door.
- Parking places are too narrow. I lost at least 5 minutes to be able to find a suitable place to fit my long and wide car.

There was no selective waste bins at the apartments! We suggest you put the same model of bins you have in your lounge area, with normal plastic bags so that cleaning staff can handle them safely and put everything already sepparated in the final municipality bags at the street. This would be more in line with Smartflats modernity and send a message that Smartflats are environmentaly friend apartments (Ence more "smart").If you put a small table or support for suitcases at the bedrooms, plus some hangers, that would add some more confort.,

Kitchen and eating area big, practical and nice. Lots of space. Confortable linen in the beds. Nice and attentive staff. Very close to central attractions. Probably the best racio quality/price in Brussels for a group stay of several days!

Travelled to Ypres with my 19 yr old son to experience the War graves, Menin Gate last post & the general surroundings. B&B Fresco was a great choice & perfect for what we wanted.

We liked the convenience of this location in proximity to the shops and main square.  The property is decorated in a clean, modern chic with relaxing earth tone colors and tasteful furnishings and artwork.  Stephanie rode her bike to the property to meet us and explain the key system, etc. in a timely manner.  Parking our car in a nearby garage worked out well, and the location was walkable for all of the tourist areas of Bruges.  Breakfasts were beautifully displayed and we had a lot of carb options to pick from, as well as freshly prepared eggs.  Overall, it was a lovely choice for our two-day visit to Bruges.

Structure under construction. ordered lunch (Kroketen) that arrived frozen! They did offer a free beer as compensation. Okay. But what was the cook drinking?? Free parking but overloaded. Takes 20min to find a spot. Bad area, full of eurabians. Upside< Close to the highway.,

Smartflat has a bad customer service.
I booked online via booking.com and I paid for my staying. 
Then two day before my staying, they contacted me through WhatsApp asking me to pay an additional cost of € 150,00 as warranty (deposit money) 
So I had to fix that asap to confirm my staying cause if I didn’t my reservation would be cancelled and I would loose my money, I already paid.
So I did everything. Now 3 weeks later, I’m calling, texting their customer service to get my warrant (deposit money) back. They not answering or sometimeS when they answer, they say that already released my deposit but I haven’t got it till now. 3 weeks afters. ,

Location was amazing, really great place for couples or families, right by a lidl and Aldi and loads of places to eat, we don't drive but did not struggle to get around as the bus stopped right outside and we got the train to the city of Geel,we also rented some bikes from a bike shop up the road (10min walk) just above Aldi that cost us £10 a day to rent and the bikes where good quality.The communal showers where great,really clean,didnt see anyone else even using them, normally puts me off using communal ones but these where better than most hotel/air bnb private ones

Stayed here 5 years ago and it is lovely to see the owner has still got a real passion for making everything perfect, so many lovely touches from cake left in the room each day, sweets to help yourselves to, free coffee/tea, plenty of advice on places to visit or to eat and the breakfast always came with care and imagination :) On top of this beautifully decorated rooms, clean and very comfortable.Ypres is just a short drive away as are a lot of War cemeteries, we also found some lovely walks so made the most of the good weather for this time of year.

Fist impression was very bad and it was my trip to Brussels. When we arrived, there was no lobby, no reception, no concierge... only a counter with one person and not even with a hotel uniform. This was more like rent a room rather than a 3star hotel as it is advertised. The hotel’s webpage says nothing about the renovations and Booking.com  says that construction will end by Sept 10, which was not true, not even close. The room does NOT have air conditioner so if you want to rest during your vacations this is not the place. It has a fan (not a ceiling fan) not big enough to keep the room cool and if you leave the glass door open you will listen all the noise from the street and also all the light will come inside the room. I sweated all night. Bed and pillow are not confortable. There is no an ice machine. The day we left the only elevator thy have was not working to take the luggage down. For the approx. $125 per night that I paid, or maybe paying a little more, I would have find a much better place. I did not move to another place because of cancellation fees and looking for a hotel at last moment would cost much more. I definitely don’t recommend this place. The only good things it has is the location. ,

The hotel is very close to lots of restaurants, cafes, bars, shops etc. Even though it was close to everything, it was quiet at night. There is some renovation work being carried out on the rooms, but we weren't disturbed at all - no noise etc. We are planning to return to Brugge again, at some stage this year, as we didn't have time to see everything during our short trip. Will we be staying at this hotel again? Yes!

Classic standard place in Antwerp in a quiet (in Winter time at least) but a little bit peripheral quarter (20-30 min walk from Central Station). Still - easy to get to, and bus stops going to Central Station or Berchem 5 minutes away from the place.The quarter itself is very interesting, since it's a cultural mix with people from all over the world, very nice. And a park and spacious squares in the vicinity - good for jogging. Supermarkets close by.Shared bathrooms per floor, and a big nice shared kitchen (with all utensils) on the ground floor.I stayed in a small single room - pretty basic, but not different than any other I stayed in Antwerp throughout the years.Definitely not for staying in for hours, but that's not why you visit Antwerp;)Room, bathroom and the kitchen clean, no issues with that.Host very helpful and quickly responding.

First of all we loved the hosts. The warm welcome, care, openness and sense of freedom. The love for heritage and books.

Third, we love the aftertaste of our stay. We keep smiling and we will return. Actually it is weird to write so much good and then hope that we will be able to find a slot to book again and bring our friends. But we need Katleen to keep spreading this happiness because she makes this world a better place. With love Maija & Jan

Beautifully refurbished old house, without disturbing too much the original, the host was just delightful, gave me a tour of the house (they also have a beautiful library), the breakfast was just amazing, with delicious home made jam, bread, waffles and locally sourced cheese and ham. Hopefully I’ll be back in better times. 5*!
P.S. I traveled with my dog, and there was no problem to accommodate her.
