You can also get a bike for free to travel to the center wich is great, because traffic in the city is very busy. The furnishing of the rooms is excellent and I will definitely come back when I visit Ghent again.

Very little to dislike! Our one observation is that the bedside reading lights are very, very bright, and not dimmable! A small thing really,

The location is superb - central so we could walk to the old city in 5 minutes. There is on-site car parking. The building is superb, a 13th Century monastery adapted to a modern hotel. The original church is still used for weddings, and is worth a visit in its own right. The breakfast is very good, offering a range of continental options, plus fruit, cereals, and scambled eggs, beans etc breakfast too, all self service.

Everything was great,

Very clean. Nice staff. Helpful Managers, thank you Peter and Liesbeth

Everything was amazing, the location is exactly in the center of Brussels, friendly staff and very good amenities 
Excellent value for money, will book again when I return to Brussels

Nothing,

Location primarily, didn’t have dinner but breakfast was good

Everything!! The grounds, room, breakfast but most of all Katleen! The best night sleep in 2 weeks in Europe! It was a fantastic find!!! The pictures are after our stay but so wonderful!! I would absolutely stay here again.

I’ve stayed with this chain in 4 other cities (Manchester, Vienna and dusseldorf) and the augury I’d the Brussels one is less than the others. No USBs near tables, no kettle and make sure you don’t stay on level 0 as we did (twice this year). We had the room closest to breakfast area and I could hear the commotion in the morning, not to mention the faint metro rumblings,

Clear. Central. As good as I can expect from Motel One. If you can ignore the points below (in the what I didn’t like section), then you’re all set. Would I stay again? Yes but I’d request anything other than level 0

the rooms are a bit simple and small (typical of a lot of European hotels), not a lot of room to move around.  The shower, was a tiny square with 2 intersecting doors that opened enough to get out, but on the plus side it had really good water pressure.  The bed was low to the ground, but wasn't particularly uncomfortable.,

The location is right by the market square in the town center, close to most of the sites and near plenty of restaurants.  The public parking is across the street and is very reasonably priced.  The value was great, considering it was in the city center, and included breakfast.  Also, this was the easiest check-in ever.

There was no one at the property when I arrived. I wasn't told that I needed to phone the owner to be let in.,

Very clean

Only minor things: parking in front of the house is partly payable, though there is free parking 5-10 mins by foot away; there's no dishwasher; the hairdryer is too weak for some.,

Tasteful, clean and comfortable interior and spacious, sunny terrace; proximity to supermarkets, stores and main square around the corner; plenty of parking space in front; super-friendly host ensuring smooth key handover and providing some treats and useful material & information on the region.

Breakfast seems to be rather expensive,

It was conveniently situated.

It says breakfast included but this was a fixed breakfast with no allowance for dietary requirements or likes and dislikes.,

Right in the heart of the city with plenty of restaurants to hand. Staff very friendly and rooms clean and modern.
Very warm atmosphere and fantastic hospitality.

Washer and dryer would have come handy. No hairdryer.,

Spacious studio with spectacular view. Quiet and peaceful, with central location, everything within walking distance, beach, stores, etc... Kitchen well equipped, efficient bathroom.

There was no air-conditioning, and it was very warm when we visited. Could have been cleaner overall in the cottage. Perhaps nets on the windows would be beneficial to keep insects away.,

The location is wonderful, and the whole park is very pleasant. Overall, it was good value for money.

Maison Mielou was a lovely place to stay. The room was beautiful and spacious and the host very nice. Please check in advance if they have availability should you need parking as they only have one spot for guests. However there was free street parking about 700m away. The bed was comfortable and the room lovely but it is an old house and there are creaky floor boards and quite thin walls. You definitely heard it when your partner used the bathroom at night! The interior is very lush and a bit eccentric. They even provided candles for a romantic ambiance. :-) Also note that the breakfast is not included in room price and it is served in the room. We found it relaxing to enjoy our breakfast in our pyjamas in the comfort of our room but the choice is limited to what's on the tray. It was a good quality continental breakfast (croissant, bread rolls, cheese, jam, brioche, boiled egg, yoghurt, fresh fruit), the first morning more generous than on our second day. There was also coffee and tea making possibility in the room. The house itself is gorgeous but the neighborhood is not the best. But it was an easy 20min walk to the city center. Maison Mielou also has bicycles to use. We did that and thought it was a great way of getting around and exploring also the outskirts of town. There are bicycle lanes everywhere and cars are used to bikes so it was very easy and enjoyable. Overall a good experience and I would stay Maison Mielou again.

Old-fashioned bathrooms (albeit partly renovated), lack of working wi-fi in the room.,

Central location, very close to the Coupure so easy access to university sites and public transport. Lots of active pubs in the area so highly recommended for those who want to combine activity with quiet and rest at the Monasterium.
De douchestang was defect.

No option to adjust aircon in the room ,

Great location very comfortable

No air conditioning.,

Gardens immaculate for afternoon drinks. Evening meal was Michelin star standard absolutely superb. Rooms although compact have everything you need, bathroom modern and spacious with walk in shower.

The atmosphere, the location, the authenticity, the quietness and the kindness of the hosts! That's not counting the amazing breakfast prepared with love and care, with everything either home-made/homegrown or locally sourced!
An amazing getaway to relax and breathe in peace!
Great service, location was excellent. Clean rooms.

Lights did not work in the bathroom, but one was changed for us while we had breakfast, so I guess I cannot complain.,

Great location!  Nice room, but it was a little maze like in the corridors of the hotel.  Folks were friendly.Hotel is right on the square of the Grote Markt.
Nice location.

The two terraces overcooking the city were special, we had breakfast on one terrace and some evening drinks on the other! Martine was so welcoming and we were touched by all of the extra little thoughtful things she includes. A great apartment to come back to after long days of cycling!

There is a constant humming sound when you open the window, but it's rather inevitable because it is in the center. Also easy to get used to it.,

Typical european meal, everything for everyone. The hotel is in the center of the old town, close to everything for sight seeing, also the tramway station is close but cannot hear it.
Completely free bar from 5.30pm to 8.30pm - great touch
Warm, welcoming hosts. Excellent modern room and fabulous breakfast. Best we've ever had! Booked the suite for 3 persons for our sons as attending wedding nearby.

It would have been nice to be notified that there would be renovations taking place in the room nest to us. ,

The view and the location was excellent 
We loved the sea side view. My girlfriend enjoyed her birthday

The farm smell outside our lodge. It was a very long walk to get something the children left in the car.,

There were so many activities to choose from and the pool was fantastic - the children were in every day.

not really a lot of options to eat outside,

beautifull decoration, nice details. incredible good darkness, perfect to sleep

Shower too small.,

Room was very spacious and surprisingly had a sitting/dressing room. Huge bathroom.Bed was reasonable. Good variety of food for breakfast. Easy walking distance to city centte and tram

We stayed for 7 nights room was not cleaned and bathroom floor was disgusting, obviously not cleaned for a very long time. No security, no one in reception so keys for rooms and bike shed were easily available to anyone. Needs tlc and someone in charge who cares enough to oversee the cleaning and general organisation.,

Food was good but expensive . Room decor was very tasteful

The bed was so uncomfortable I bearly slept! The noise from the construction work started early in the morning, 6.45am.  We were not made aware of the major construction work at booking or on arrival. The man on the reception was not welcoming and didn't offer us any further assistance after giving the room key, I had to ask where the lift was and if it was okay for us to have a map so we could walk into Brussels city centre.Although the bathroom had a bath it had a crack by the plug which had some kind of putty in it, and the bath panel was broken along with the door frame. Strangely the sink came over your legs when sitting on the toilet so you had to sit at an angle. Shame as the bathroom was a good size.,

The breakfast had a wide choice and was tasty. The sauna was nice, clean and comfortable.
Wonderful room.  Excellent service.  Superb food

Nothing, the only slight improvement might have been a kettle in the room,

Amazing house and rooms, lovely breakfast. Kathleen is a great host.

Excellent hotel located near the center a few minutes walk from the Grand Place, very convenient for public transport and for visiting the most important monuments. Nothing is left to chance. The bathroom, although blind, was spacious and functional, the sink a little small, but the shower is large and very bright. Do not expect large spaces, but it is fine for a 4-day stay as we did with a room that although small and without particular support is well organized, the furniture is essential but functionality and rationality are the masters. The staff is always present at the reception and is prepared and very kind. Excellent experience.

The last night we were there a water line broke above the door to our room and began to flood the room. I went down to the front desk to tell someone and I could not find anyone for over an hour and after I did find someone they didn't seem to worried about it. I just hope they got it stopped before it ruined to much. ,

The location could not have been better. Right in the main square of the city.
Nice and cost, good park out the front

Nothing that would come it me. They take every step to make your stay comfortable,

I stayed with my wife for a period of 12 nights due to work in Ieper  and I am quite happy with the stay. The reason is this place is get high rating is that, it has every stuff you need for a long stay (Kitchen, utensils , toaster, oven , coffee machine, etc.. ) but also that your Host really helps you during your stay. I mean to say they are genuinely in the business of service with assist you to things and information you need. It is this attitude that makes everyone welcome and happy to say.The location is equally good, with options for car/bicycle parking in the street. Overall we had a  very good stay .

Staff at check-in were very short with us, and unfriendly.,

Incredible location, reasonable price, small but very clean and comfortable room and bathroom.

Overprized
Junior Suite is a Standard room with a table and 2 chairs? 
Breakfast is cheap
Payment upfront
Cheap interior
,

Location, bed

The patio area was overgrown and it wasn't particularly pleasant to sit out.,

Amazing facilities and caters for all ages as we had a 7 year old and a 70 year old in our party! The activities were easy to book on the day and the aquamundo and discovery bay were fantastic.

Everything was great!,

Lovely room. Great shower. Good value for money.

Maintainince at a low standard.,

The hotel is build around a old church/monastery. In the hotel information it said that the remodel was done in 1998, well there are some maintenance chalances in the current time (sep-2018) that should be addressed. We enjoyed our stay, and that’s what counts!

Nothing appeared to dislike.,

Just everything. Is a lovely hotel with Charme as the name of the hotel. Great location, Free parking, Free Internet and playground if traveling with children. Breakfast was excellent served by 2 hard working women (Nadine & one more) pleasing everybody by running around if training for the olimpic games. Great experience.
Excellent breakfast and location is exactly in Brussels City Centre.

The ist room was  small,

The service was excellent. The staff pleasant and kind and efficient

The host Kathleen was the best host I have ever experienced so helpful and spoke very good English. Slept so beautifully as the area is lovely and quiet. The whole B&B was so cosy and romanatic. The breakfast was so delicious a lot of it homemade. Loved having a sauna in the room. Just could not fault our stay at all and would definitely stay again if in this area.
Very nice, helpful staff. Comfortable bed. Great shower. Close to the old town, yet quiet.

Paid parking 9am to 6am. Can park for free a short walk away and parking free overnight during the week.,

Location brilliant -right in centre of historic town. Room small but comfortable. Breakfast great Although choice limited. Reasonably priced

Well, the floors are creaking and it is true that the house is not very sound-proof. That didn't bother me apart from the fact that I didn't bring my headphones and had to listen to music as low as humanly possible.,

The location is great despite looking at the map it might look like a little out. All is really good there and it is very easy to find. That is not always true in some places.

I have no complaints,

Very Comfortable apartment excellent host and a few lovely little unexpected touches thrown in. I would highly recommend this property so much so I will definitely be staying again.

Slightly bigger room would have been more comfortable.,

Perfect location. Excellent breakfast. bed very comfortable. Staff responded to request for extra pillow immediately with no fuss.

I loved everything, from the luminous entrance with all cristals around to the decoration, the artistic atmosphere and style of the the enviroment, to the excellent service, very kind, to the very good breakfast and the cossy rooms...we will stay again, for sure¡ the best hotel in Antwerp¡¡¡¡

The food served in the restaurants was quite expensive and not great quality. There also seemed to be a lot of cars on the site which made it difficult to cycle with the kids. We couldn't use any of the booking reference provided to us on the Centre Parcs APP, which meant we could not pre book any events, bikes etc. This turned out to be quite a negative as a lot of the things on offer such as rock climbing and hiring bikes where fully booked by the time we turned up.,

Accommodation was clean and in a nice setting. Aqua Mondo was great, Staff were nice, and there were plenty of playgrounds for the kids to use.

There was no single thing I didn't like during my stay there. ,

Beautiful studio with all the necessary amenities for a great stay. Nice and quiet location. Sandra - the proprietor - is amazing!

Secure parking good but 15 euros a night more than one usually pays in city centreBreakfast adequate but also not really worth 15 euros,

A quirky property which is a former monastery a couple of blocks from the main historic sights. Rooms stylish and comfortable with great bathrooms. Only recently opened and a few housekeeping blips need sorting but I'm sure they will soon be resolved. Reception staff very competent and helpful

shower over bath had chain too short, set breakfast with little choice,

The decor was very stylish, felt like a country home.Dinner at restaurant was excellent,  100 %value for money. Compliments to the chef !!

A/c not that cold..there was construction going on in front of the hotel they provided ear plugs thu
Parking available for cars below 1.9 M but outside parkings are widely available (pay per hour before 6pm afterwards its free till 9:00 am),

Location was great. Staff were very helpful and friendly.

Nothing.,

A really great, family run, hotel.  Wonderful food....and just what we wanted for a night on a long journey....in a beautiful Quiet situation, but not too far from the motorway.

The bed,

Quiet, beautiful, comfortable, friendly
Clean

Room are small
,

Close to Menen Gate 
Good breakfast

there was no washer and dryer like I was expecting. the stove was not operable, you could only microwave, and toast.,

it was very nice, and the wifi was excellent

Fabulous Apartment,  right in the centre of town.  Wonderful facilities and a great  host.  Perfect  space for a brief stay  in Ypres,  a really  high  standard of fixtures and fittings + a lovely  'welcome package'  of wine,  beer and water.  Also, two  fabulous balconies which  would be perfect  for a relaxed evening later in the year!  Cold and rainy  when I visited... I genuinely couldn't fault anything, if only  all  aprtments were as good as this!  Very much  look forward to  returning . Top  job all  round!

Small rooms. No fridge 👎🏻,

Fantastic location. Great breakfast 👍🏻
Awesome hotel

There is that thing about Center parks that you have to pay for everything extra (thats what you get used to) but one very unnecessary payment of €4.50 for using a pram stations?!?!?! I was quite appalled by it!,

We had lovely time at centre parcs Vossemren Flanders. The swimming pool was great, and food court yard as well. Food was acceptable both at the restaurant and the swimming pool (could be a better selection of healthier option).We stayed at the hotel in 2 different rooms. One of the rooms was modern- downstairs(almost like its been done) the other room was on the top level - there was nothing wrong with it just a bit dated but beds were comfortable and both balconies had a great view. Breakfast at the hotel was great -had a lovely selection of continental and cooked breakfast and it was included in the price of the stay in the hotel.I will recommend this place and we will definitely return.

It’s a bit outside the city center (approx 20–25 minutes walking), but we didn’t mind at all since we were able to park our car in the property’s garage. :),

The property was super cute and charming, and Sandra was super friendly, communicative, and accommodating. We drove to Ghent and she kindly let us park our car in her garage, and even went ahead and dropped our hotel key off at the restaurant where we had lunch reservations. Would definitely go back!

Breakfast is only ok - if I stay there again I will have breakfast elsewhere ,

The staff are lovely, our room (superior) was really nice with a superb bathroom. Cool atmosphere and features like the chapel

The lack of dedicated personnel on the reception. On the other hand, it is expected in a small town, in a small hotel.,

The overall cleanliness of the room.

The billing: I checked out in the morning and I was in a hurry to read the details of my receipt. While at the train station, I accessed my receipt and realised I was billed for city taxi twice which I never used;  breakfast was billed twice yet I had indicated I was to have breakfast once. Otherwise, the rest looked ok.,

I liked:1.  the Reception staff Ridouane. He was  very friendly and welcoming.2. Those who cleaned the room 2211

Near perfect, but of course there is always something to find - the dining room gets a bit too warm for our liking.,

Super friendly staff, comfortable and cosy hotel, superb breakfast, for a relaxing holiday with excellent food.
The vintage feel, the nice host and excellent location.

No mini-fridge, no safe-box and no phone in the room. No CNN or BBC channels!,

10-minute walk to the city center and central station. Clean and comfortable room. Great lobby bar with attentive and helpful bar staff. There is a Carrefour across the street!
Great breakfast

Only thing is that no soundproof at all.,

Everything is very new. Shared athroom is very spacious, 5 star! Kitchen/living room is big. Oven and stove are not in use. My room has no window, but is good enough for me.

Martine's apartment is 5 star accommodation. It is beautifully furnished with great views over Ypres from the outdoor terraces. It is conveniently located to the train station (10 minute walk) and only a short stroll to the Menin Gate.

The shower water temperature will getting extremely hot and cold in 1 second!,

Employees are so nice, especially the lady in the restaurant who provide heating tea pot and microwave service. So we can always have hot water and heated food for not waste. Really appreciate.

The room was very cold and clinical, no character or warmth, very small bath/shower and the glass walls of the bathroom do not give any privacy, it was obvious that the hotel was built on a budget, stark white lighting in hallways etc makes it feel more like an office than a hotel. We stayed in room 209 and every morning from approx 8am we could hear alot of noise i would assume from cleaning staff above us (sounded like tables or chairs being dragged over the concrete above our room, this lasted for hours, very disappointing as me and my partner love to sleep in. The bed was super soft which was not comfortable, and my partner who has allergies noticed that the room was very dusty.,

Friendly staff, good location, outside courtyard was nice.

The food at all of the restaurants was not the best. Some of the extra activities were too expensive, considering the price that was already paid to stay. The cottage also got very hot on some days and because there are no screens in the windows we could not just leave the windows open to get some air.,

I liked the location and the access to many different activities. The cottage was also spacious. The staff was very friendly. The water park and discovery park were awesome and my toddler really enjoyed herself. Us parents also enjoyed all the activities.

It was a bit cold in the house. toilet door was not working but I fixed it so was fine.,

I liked the atmosphere in the house. The landlord was amazing.  The house was clean. The mini kitchen was very practical and nice.

The bathroom could have been cleaner, but it wasnt appalling.  Suite TV's have Volume Control/Lock.  I dont intend to blast it, but i am a bit hard of hearing.  So, it would have been nice to go above 12, ha!,

We had a very stay in this gorgeous facility.  A short 5/10 min walk to historic center.  Far enough to have some quiet.The staff is incredibly nice and helpful.  Ghent is beautiful and I intend to make this my spot when visiting.

The check in was a bit hasty and we did not get a lot of information.,

Beautiful room, beautiful hotel. Great breakfast.

Wake up at 7.30 with the crazy noise of the reconstruction. Ask the reception and the answers :
-you really hear that they work on the 3 rd floor
-we can not control them another company
-we can not inform you we dont know when they start
"The receptionist" on July 16 th 9 am. and "his college" behind the desk...both of them are very impolite and couldnt understand that they are working at a hotel and clients are "Guests"..dont know the simple word "we are sorry".
Excellent value when you know the deal is half board in a high quality logis.

Not many restaurants in the immediate area but with a car reachable within a 10 minute drive.  Regarding the property itself, there is nothing to improve.,

Ample and well furbished room and large bathroom. It wasn't very warm outside when I arrived and I really appreciated that the room was already heated when I arrived. The hosts are very nice and provide lots of information about the area. The breakfast was extensive and made of home made or local products. The property has a library and very nice garden that are free to use.

The room is too small and compressed. There is no fridge or mini bar in the room, no toiletry provided and there is only a very small table and a chair. It is not really convenient to stay in, unless you are just staying for a short night.,

The location is easily access to different tourist attractions and the room is clean. There is a car park just next to the hotel (Indigo Park) just Costa €18 for 24 hours.

The hardwood floor was noisy.  Breakfast coffee machine is a bit rough.,

Great location in the centre; very convenient for local sites.  Decent breakfast with a good range of items.   Good view of the square from the attic room.  Room was fine for us.
A lack of iron

Street parking was expensive during the day but free parking was accessible for daytime and overnight on the street was free. So it was fine. ,

We loved the apartment, the location was just up the road from Cloth Hall and around the corner from Menin Gate. Martine was lovely and welcoming. Two terraces with nice views of old Ypres. It was perfect.

-not enough place to open two luggages simultaneously in the room -no hair drier,

-excellent location for a city tour (but not so close to the train station)-good breakfast, including the opportunity to do your own waffles and make your own orange juice -very friendly service staff (cleaning staff particularly)

However, value for money was not there for me. I stayed with my colleagues for business the first night and with my partner for the second night. For a work event there is no issue as the location is most important. For a personal get away I found the room no good value for money. The rooms are far too "minimalistic" for the amount of money we paid per night. I would not have paid more than 75EUR for that room (we paid <100EUR),

The hotel was in a great location and I have to give it to the terrific staff, very friendly and very helpful. Was pleasure dealing with them throughout the entire stay.

Tried to change dates over a month before. Accommodation available but Center Parcs totally inflexible. Booking.com also inflexible. Both companies blaming each other for not being able to change booking. Feel like we'd been scammed. Not using either ever again.
Near to major bus routes or you could do a short walk into the centre of town.

Screens on the windows against bugs would be nice.  It was warm and we had the windows open. ,

The uniqueness of the place. Beautiful historical building with modern rooms.
Noise at night - a machine started to work regulary

29th floor hallway carpet was extremely dirty. The room was next to the laundry room and every morning around 7 am the room was literally shaking from the laundry machines. Kinda bad experience.,

The location is good, right outside of Rogier metro station.
Comfortable with lots of character, staff very friendly and helpful

Location
Very friendly
House is beautiful

The breakfast room and the lounge are, just like in other Motel Ones, too small for the number of rooms. The room was a bit too warm and there was a permanent hum just outside the window so that it couldn't stay open during the night.,

Staff at check-in was very friendly and the process was quick, the room was a typical Motel One room, compact but big enough for a few nights. Breakfast selection was great, everything was fresh and tasty. The bar had many Belgian beers to choose from as well as the typical Motel One choices at an okay price. Parking is available but doesn't belong to the hotel. Reasonably priced with 18 EUR / night.

Bathroom too small, beds too low.,

Breakfast was good. Central Location.

no fridge,

Good location, clean and nice hotel

All excellent,

Martine gave us a wonderful reception and tour of her lovely apartment which is located 2 minutes walk from the main square. The apartment is spotlessly clean and very homely. The roof patios front and back meant we could sit out and take in the views in the evening and for breakfast. We would highly recommend this lovely apartment.

Less electricity points and the vending machine has no sandwiches.,

Location, breakfast and cleanness.
Location, everything, very nice hotel
NIce apartment and outdoor area and close by swimming pool.

It was magical. So much thought put in every detail in the suite. We stayed at the Belfort Suite (the blue one on the pictures on Booking). It is huge. The bathroom is exceptional. Bed is very comfortable. Due to the high ceilings it is harder to get the room very warm, so have that in mind. We still had a great sleep, since the blankets were extremely warm! The suite looks even better in reality. It was such a pleasure to stay there. Of course nothing for people who can´t live without a TV but they are most probably not going to appreciate this amazing place anyways. Very uncomplicated and pleasant communication with the host. She was so calm and friendly, such an inspiring person. I really cannot understand why would anybody pay more to stay in a big hotel chain, where you get half the space, not even half the luxury and a very impersonal attitude. Breakfast was also exceptional, served in the room. Would absolutely recommend it to anyone travelling to Ghent. Big thank you! Would definitely love to stay there again!

Why I chose this hotel (and pay a higher rate) was because of the experience of staying in an old monasterium. Our room was in a newly built building in the parking lot next to the street, not in the Monasterium. Even though it was a quiet street, if a car drove by you could hear it and wake you up. Imagine paying to stay at a castle and then that your room is in the shed next to it. The receptionist was zero helpful and zero friendly, it was a really bad experience. All the pictures show the old rooms and the Monasterium, which is what I paid for and at the end we arrived to something completely different.,

I imagine staying at the monasterium is great, but I wouldn't know. It looked really nice.
The staff were unbelievably kind and friendly. I felt very well looked after and was a lovely place.Big bonus for a last minute, cheap booking on the road.

Very noisy plumbing and buildings work and checkout staff not attentive.,

Proximity to Metro

A friend recommended this hotel but for us it's a little off the beaten track. We had to travel an hour from Bastogne to get there but that was our fault for not checking and not the hotels. We were advised to eat at the hotel so we booked dinner, bed and breakfast.  The only issue was that the evening meal was a set menu which was fine but not the fine dining experience of lobster we had been told about and we were not offered an A La Carte menu which we would have been happy to pay extra for.  I'm also not sure why there were tables in the dining room with linen covers and silver service and the conservatory was not to the same standard.  It made us feel slightly like outsiders looking in on the main event.,

The hotel is very comfortable with lovely gardens and a conservatory where we dined. The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was good with a very good choice of hot and cold food.

Restaurants in the location are few & far between,

Katleen is a superb host,nothing is too much trouble for her she made us so welcome the hotel is a credit to her

Nothing,

Great location

Nothing,

Good central location. Quiet. Good breakfast. Clean
Could'nt get invoice, only after asking for it 3rd  time i got invoice.

we had to park the car a fair way from the apartment to avoid parking charges,

the location was first class...close to everything we needed

Everything was great except it's little pricy,

Location is perfect. Staff is extremely kind and helpful.

The staff is not capable of solving any problems that you might encounter during your stay. They do not know how to operate gas heater, do not provide ironing board or iron. Cleaning is below average. Rooms have concrete floor and ceiling, and are very dark. 
Payment policy is the most ridiculous out of all places I’ve been. Property will block full price of your room few weeks in advance before free cancellation period is even over. Then they cancel it and do it again. And even after they had blocked the money, they require payment upfront. We were not able to check in until we paid for all our rooms. I had to pay for the room of one of my colleagues, and after she paid for her room from her credit card the next day, the hotel could not put money back on my card. Unless there are no other places available in Antwerpen, I recommend to look elsewhere, if you don’t want to ruin your vacation or business trip. ,

Location
The villas were not cleaned daily, not well maintained and cheap uncomfortable beds.

Public transport access! But that was not the fault of Maison Mielou!,

The welcome. Everything in fact. Secure car parking was a plus.A
The room was full of mosquitoes. We barely slept 2 hours and spent the whole night trying to kill them all -> evidences on the wall .. ( sorry for that) Our body is covered by bites

Extremely small and shabby room. Not at all like the photos they show online. The door to the room opened to the outside. Not even a decent curtain.,

Location

No slippers, toothpaste, bathrobe. No ironing available in room. No swimming pool. Nothing in minibar except water. Design is very ordinary. ,

Good location, especially if you travel via airport.
Excellent breakfast, BUT it cost me only 16€ at the place, instead of 26€ if book it online

The old ambiance in this magnificent chateau surpassed all expectations .. and so did the organic and very tasty breakfast. Extremely welcoming hostess!We will certainly come back to enjoy the old atmosphere and culture and good taste - -and the fruity breakfast with delicasies from neigbouring farms
Fantastic location, within walking distance to everything. Hotel was very clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. A great atmosphere about the hotel. Would definitely recommend Motel One.

O,

I was only there two nights but I was quite pleased it was clean comfortable and the breakfast was good.the location was great right on the square.
Perfectly located guest house - almost in the center. Extremely clean. Well-equipped kitchen. I would recommend!

Tv would have been nice if staying for more than a couple of days but thats all.,

Superb terrace views of Ypres. on both sides of the apartment. On top floor but has a lift for getting up and down.Nice and quiet . and very short walk to center.Spar shop just up the road for groceries  etc.

Rooms are clean but they feel less than basic / wifi didn't work / the heating was not sufficiently strong to heat up the room, it was cold. I paid 180 EUR for a night ... for this price I could book a 5-star in the same street,

hotel is very old and not up to modern standards,

We were upgraded to a suite upon arrival, since the hotel was fully booked.  The room was very large and comfortable, with warming racks for the towels in the huge bathroom.  We enjoyed a wonderful dinner at the hotel restaurant, which was also beautifully decorated for Christmas.  The service was friendly and professional, and the food was outstanding.  We had four different entrees, and everyone raved about their selection.  Breakfast in the morning had a wide selection of breads, pastries, cereals and hot foods, too, though they ran out of bacon and it was never restocked during our meal.
Great location and good service
Beautiful hosts that made us feel very welcome

The staff was nice and welcoming with us. Also the location is perfect for exploring the city and is also near Brussels Central Station (if you want to take a day trip to Bruges or Gent). The room was comfortable and clean.

Great location. If you are there in March or August check to see if the carnival in in town. Amusement rides and techno music take up the square. Hotel is basic but convenient. Decent breakfast. Pretty good value overall.

Toilet seat was a bit broken, other than that - no complaints.,

Good clean accomodation with a nice kitchen. About 12 minutes on foot to the railway station, close to the port.

The lift was very small. The hairdryer was very weak. ,

The location was amazing for exploring Ypres and the surrounding area. We enjoyed eating our breakfast outside on the terrace every morning. The bed was amazingly comfortable.

Minor wifi problems but fixed in 2 minutes 
Air conditioning needed some time to cool,

Location is perfect, very comfortable bed, great shower, very sound proof and perfect for this budget! Would definitely recommend, especially since you're right in the centre.
Prosecco at check-in and the happy hour appetizers and drinks is GREAT!! Room are modern/industrial styled. Great location, great staff, great hotel! My third time staying here and I love it.

Park is very run down compared to our last stay. Gardens have not been maintained, leaves are not brushed up. The pond behind cottages ,110 to 150 is nothing more than a black smelly swamp( dangerous) be better filled in and turned into a flat grass play area. 
The glass covering the the pools needs a good cleaning . Activities are very expensive the worst being the cost of cycle hire. Electric BBQ to buy in town €17.00 yet we had to leave a €50.00 deposite for the lend of one.  Side walking gate that accessed the road to the canal dock is permanently chained and locked this could be on a code lock. Home now suffering from a bad chest infection, I suspect the swimming pool water quality. We paid for a towel package however one set of towels was expected to serve us 1 week.  This was our second stay at de vossermeren  and there will not be a third. 
,

Petting farm was great for the kids but too far away for regular visits.

An amazing building , beautiful rooms  and good breakfast with plenty of choice.

Great location (about 5 min from train station, 2 min from metro station), close to city center. Wonderful breakfast, comfortable bed.

Katleen is a wonderful host, she suggested me things to see and served a very special home made breakfast. 
Room and bathroom were huge and well decorated, there was a sauna in the bathroom and a relaxing view on woods.
Staff, location, position very good.

Room assigned was on the road (with road noise) even thought the hotel had very few guests. The wall are very thin. I could hear the guy next door snoring.,

Stay in this house was just a pleasure, very neat, amazing decor and very comfortable bed. Just outside the house there's a Velo Bike station where you can borrow a bike. Close to the city centre (especially by bike). Very nice staff. I highly recommend getting Antwerp City card if you'd like to go to museums. (it incl. lot of museums such as MAS and Rubens house which alone cost around the price of a card).

The apartment owner( Martine) gave clear instructions on where to meet, and even met us outside the front of the property . Making this one of the most easiest arrivals we have had. The genuine warm welcome we received and the apartment itself helped make this the best holiday we have had in Ypres, "now our sixth year". The apartment was spotless, and location with the added bonus of two rooftop terraces meant we had a very pleasant place to relax and unwind.

The room was spacious with a balcony to enjoy a coffee in morning overlooking the lake. Spacious double sink bathroom which was very clean. I loved the fact that we had a mini fridge in the room. Close to the swimming pool (market dome), fabulous breakfast with lots to choose from.

Very dark room. Little daylight but inadequate blinds to keep street light out. Dangerous beam running through the bedroom. Noisy corridor outside he room. Our son stayed in a cheaper room in the same hotel with much better facilities in fridge and bottled water.,

I travelled to Ypres as an Aussie especially to visit war graves and attend the Menin gate ceremony. The apartment is very comfortable with every facility and good wifi, and at the centre of Ypres (important locations, restaurants, etc.). Parking in the street is free from 6pm to 9am and a couple of hours mid-day. Otherwise about one euro per hour. Very highly recommended (and not only for the warm welcome!)
Good location, walking distance to all point of interest

On the 5th floor and 1 elevator, and a very noisy one at that. Took a while to get to sleep with the constant noise.,

Location was great, communal are was nice.

Parking your car at location a bit hit and miss as car park small,

Comfy and clean, in a great location

I did not take breakfast because I believe it is too expensive,

Perfect location, close to city centre, close to metro and Gare Nord railway station. 
Perfect view from the  room on  25th floor. Perfectly clean. Very helpfull staff.

The elevator was a bit dirty and the hall at the ground floor quite smelly (but of course our host was not responsible for that!). Due to cobble stone roads, traffic can be a bit loud. The bedroom however is on the back of the building and you can't hear a thing.,

Perfect tiny, clean and comfortable attic in the heart of Ypres with two beautiful terraces overlooking the roofs and the monuments. Unfortunately it rained and we could not enjoy the outdoor seating, but we can only imagine how pleasant it must be to sit outside and enjoy the view while sipping coffee or some wine. The apartment on the 5th floor is small but very functional. The host is extremely kind and helpful. Even left some breakfast in the fridge and lots of books and maps to visit the war sites. Very easy to find street parking just outside the main door. The apartment is next to all attractions, including the Menin Gate, the cathedral, shops and restaurants. It's a great place and we will definitely go back.

Wake up by early morning trams outside the hotel.  Breakfast is simple and has not much choices.,

Excellent location, close to all interesting points.  I had a wonderful walk after the dinner and enjoyed the quiet and relaxed mood at the square just outside the hotel. Waffle self-making in breakfast is quite interesting.
Great location and Very nice staff!

My only suggestion is to make the breakfast earlier than the 8am start. ,

I enjoyed meeting the manager of the hotel who looked like Lurch from The Adams Family who effortlessly navigated the low doorways. We received the room facing the road with the Bay window, which provided an enjoyable place to retreat to late at night.

Very good value for money. Very good breakfast. It is worth a 5 stars hotel. Kindness of the hosts. Ideally situated between Gent and Antwerp. We visited Gent on day and Antwerp the other one. This was a very good option for us, instead of staying in expensive hotel in the middle of the city.

Squeaky floors, and noisy plumbing can get in the way of a long nights sleep. Rooms are small, but adequate.,

A great location on the corner of the Market Square. The self-service breakfasts are good, bacon/eggs, fruit/yogurt, ham/cheese & smoked salmon. There is a restaurant for evening meals - great for carnivores. There are numerous bars and restaurants within easy walking, and the Cloth Hall, and the Menin Gate are both very close.

The main bathroom does not have a real separation from the rest of the space (the apartment is organised in multiple levels and one is the bathroom) and this may an issue depending on the level of privacy you want to have if you are not travelling alone.,

The apartment looks newly renovated and it is organised in a really pleasant way. It is well furnished and we particularly appreciated the fact that everything (from furniture to cutlery) looks new. The host was very approachable to talk about the check-in and the property.

If anything, the lack of shower gel.,

Breakfast was amazing, room very comfortable and spotlessly clean.

Cot could have been prepared for when we arrived, but that was a minor annoyance that was fixed quickly.  Bathroom could have been bigger for the size of the room, but again, this wasn't a deal breaker on the comfort of our stay.,

This is a very well positioned hotel, sitting right on the Ypres Market Square.  From here you have the Menin Gate, In Flanders Fields Museum and Visitor Information right on your doorstep.  The hotel is perfectly located for restaurants in the Market Square.  There is no onsite parking, but plenty of parking on the Market Square - just make yourself familiar with the parking charges and times.*Top Tip* If you're attending the Last Post ceremony at the Menin Gate, find somewhere to eat early as it can be difficult to find places still serving after the ceremony (at around 8.30).  Although we were a small family, we were in a large family room which could sleep up to 6.  The room was clean, although the bathroom was a little small given the size of the room and the number of people it sleeps.  In the morning, there was a good choice of food in the well appointed breakfast room.  The management was helpful.  We had a cot in the room but hadn't been supplied with sheets for it.  When raised with the Manager, he sorted it out straight away. Overall, this was a good place to stay in Ypres, particularly for a family with small children, and a good base from which to see Ypres and Belgian Flanders.

We had a wonderful stay here, the apartment was spotless and our hosts were very welcoming and friendly. We were so happy we could bring our dog and we had a lovely enclosed garden for her to walk around in. Would love to come back.

Staff at the reception was very "robotic", certainly too busy to properly reply to your questions. Even though I fully paid my stay with debit card at check-in, they still temporarily charged my credit card at check-in (not to mention I already gave credit card number at booking stage...). Never happens to me, and I travel a lot. The biggest failure was that one towel smelled like someone was cleaning cigarette ash trays before washing - very bad smell, disgusting. I certainly expected more from a hotel in that price-range.,

The location was nice, check-in and check-out was smooth. Free coffee with coffee-machine and water in the room was a nice gesture, appreciate it. Bathroom was nice.

The room is quite small but it's acceptable.,

Modern bathroom, clean bed, and other facilities are perfectly great!

Fabulous house and a very warm welcome from Erwin and Luuk who were keen to share their enthusiasm for the conversion and their new B & B venture.  Breakfast was lovely and beautifully presented.

A fabulous location at the main square of Ypres, with the cathedral and the rathaus right next to the place. Restaurant downstairs. Reasonably priced, considering the location.

Unusual, charming and fascinating place. Excellent breakfast. very helpful staff. Large, quiet bedroom.

The food selection was fantastic at breakfast and well presented, however, the hot food had gone cold- the heating lamps do not seem to keep the food warm e.g. scrambled eggs, bacon and mushrooms.,

The greeting from staff at the reception desk and breakfast was the most friendly and helpful that I've experienced in many years of traveling. Our booking request for a room with a view was also provided without us having to ask again, which can often the case. The hotel decor is fresh, fun and everywhere is immaculately clean. The holiday decorations for the Christmas/New Year period were an added pleasant touch in the reception area. The location is beneficial as it is between the railway station to the airport and at the top of the central shopping district (10 mins walk to Grand Place), which is actually more convenient than staying in a hotel beside Grand Place.

I stayed only one night at Motel One, so I cannot say much. However, I can certainly state that room and bathroom were perfectly fine and extremely clean. Remarkable shower, thumbs up! Quality sleep. The hotel is well located, short walking distance from the central train station, metro stations and all amenities. Certainly recommended!

The house faces the street and the outside table is actually in the sidewalk. However, it is still nice to have it. The thermostat of the heating system can only be set between 19 and 21 degrees Celsius. Fortunately, as this is not enough for many people during the winter, there is an air conditioning unit on the bedroom that can be used for heating. It does dry the air a bit and is not located in the best place for heating. Since the apartment is highly "technological" it would be nice to have some instructions available to know how to use things. Also, some kitchen paper could be useful, especially for people that are staying only for a few days and are not planing to carry so many things or spending too much time in supermarkets. The walls are thin. We were luck and did not have immediate neighbours - or at least not noisy ones - but one could clearly listen through the walls.,

Before our stay I contacted the owner twice to ask about the temperature of the shower (there were comments mentioning a problem with it) and about the availability of bikes in the area. The owner/manager answered very quickly and in a very satisfying way. Indeed the shower issue was solved and we could use bikes for free during our stay. This last point made our stay particularly pleasant. The bikes were very decent and we could enjoy the area. Before the arrival, we also received information on available take-aways and food deliveries. This was very useful, especially during this semi-lockdown, and I recommend ordering breakfast from the suggested people. The apartment was pleasant and well furnitured. Good amount of towels and amenities. The small sauna in the bathroom is an asset, especially considering this is a small apartment for 2 guests. There was a coffee machine (as described) and a few coffee pads, which I very much appreciated. There were 2 small bottles of water in the fridge which was also a nice gesture. TV, wifi, sound system in the shower, etc were fully working and good quality. You can check in and out at any time following the instructions you receive prior to your stay. The location is ideal to go for bike rides and visit some natural parks.  Ideal if you want a break for your busy (yet currently boring) days in a big city!

The breakfast was a bit basic.
The last night of our stay, the restaurant reopened after being closed for several months due to covid and the evening was a bit of an unorganized chaos. We understand that it was all new and weren't too upset but we really hope for future guests that they'll get better organized,

We liked the view and the BBQ they arranged due to covid restrictions. The pool and that whole area was great and there's a lot of great hiking trips you can do in the area. The staff was very helpful and friendly.
Was quite big, in the center of Bruxelles, next to Grand Place and embassies, parking at no more than 3’ walk. Very good for whom wants to visit the center of Bruxelles easily.
Food and very friendly staff.

Excellent location, comfortable and huge bed, clean room, i also liked the design of the place.

Tiny room. Tiny bathroom,

Great location overlooking main square. Good breakfast.

Very centrally located. Nice little flat for a short stay.  Shops, restaurants, etc. all within easy walking distance. Proprietors were dealt with remotely but were pretty efficient in responding to queries. Codes instead of keys was quite handy.

Only the extractor in the bathroom was a bit dusty. Except to that, everything was just perfect.,

Clean and comfortable room, absolute friendly owners who serve you a delicious breakfast. We would really recommend this place.

Good facilities very clean and modern apartment in a quiet location and still only 15 min drive to Maastricht centre. Private parking. Perfect for families and couples. There is a cycle path to Maastrich in an amazing scenary by the river. Marc our host was great. Highly recommended.

Just the problem with the stroller of our new born. There were some stairs to get to our room. And the floor made a lot of crackling noise when we walked and baby's sleep was disturbed.,

Inside the Red&Breakfast many beautiful and unique pieces of art, handmade from local artists, which really makes a "Wow" effect. In reality this guest house was better then on pictures. The rooms are clean, and the jaccuzy just made my evening. The location is about 7 min of walk to the city center. Definitely would be happy to stay again!

The room it's self was clean and tidy with little to no out side noise heard. There's  kitchen extractor flume close to the window... We had the room window wide open all night, with no problem or kitchen smells.
Being the upper / top floor it's was lovely and  quiet, we didn't really hear any other guests on our floor or using the lift. Rooms dosnt really have a view of the towns square as it rear facing... 
A cracking guesthouse / hotel which is located within the main square. 
The breakfast was amazing with an excellent selection of breakfast items. This is a continental  breakfast with ample fresh fruit,  meats, cheese, salmon, jams, spreads, 3 different types of fresh bread rolls as much tea, coffee, orange juice and water to drown yourself in, with the benefit of cooking your own boiled eggs also the opportunity to have fresh scrambled egg and bacon.

Great location, modern finishes in apartment
Very nice Bed and Breakfast with comfortable and "artistic" rooms, very friendly owners, excellent breakfast!

relatively small room painted dark khaki green. Makes you think the walls are coming at you. We were located in the Ecuries. I'd suggest a light colour when rpainting the wall. Except for this remark, tidy, clean, bathroom very ok. I suppose it's also a matter of taste....Of course in COVID period we had to spend more time than we liked in our room during evenings....,

Fluid check-in, easy to find, very nice and clean place, well maintained. professional service. Kitchen (take away in these days) was excellent ! Superb region !

At night it is very noisy, but if you close the double-glazed windows you hear almost nothing.,

It is a big apartment in the very center of Brussels. The apartment was clean, well equipped with bed sheet set, towels, kitchen towel, hygiene products. Also the kitchen is well equipped and everything is functioning. We were there with 2 adults  2 adolescents but the apartment is big enough for 6 persons, when using the large and easy to handle bed couch in the living room. The apartment is very safe: during the day there are 2 locking doors and at night 3 locking doors. Philippe and Esmara are very friendly.

The room is not really soundproof so there was a lot of outside noise. Also the windows (in the room I was staying at) look directly at an office space. It would be great to have some foil in front of the windows for privacy. Finally, the breakfast could benefit from some hot iyems like boiled eggs.,

The location was great and very central. Also the girl at the front desk was very helpful with restaurant recommendations.

Location & Breakfast, we spent little time in the hotel and ate out.

We are disappointed that Smart Flats allows prostitution in their apartments (google search: Eva prostitution Liege - on the pictures you can see a Smart flats apartment with roof terrace) . We came across (in the elevator and hallway) different clients who where not wearing any mask as this brought a higher risk of COVID-19. Smart Flats is aware of the situation, but find it not necessary to act on this matter.For future guests with Smart Flats be aware that there is a chance of coming across prostitution and/or their clients.,

Beautiful guesthouse in Liège, tastefully decorated with thoughtful touches. Great hosts, very pleasant and helpful and a good source of information.Well located in a residential area, just a short walk to the city centre and easy to get onto the highway from that location.

We came to spend a long weekend here with our friends with teenager kids. There are so many facilities here that we had a fantastic time here without moving out of the domain. 
Even on a rainy, cold day we could enjoy the heated pool and the sauna, and the kids could choose from the many board games offered by the domain. 
All Corona- related measures are in place, I felt secure during our stay.
Very good location, comfortable and clean, nice and helpful owners.

We didn’t know that we couldn’t eat in the breakfast room before booking it but the room had a nice set up and we could eat there comfortably.,

We got upgraded to the junior suite which was a really nice surprise. The breakfast was nice though it would’ve been nice to have options like fish and chicken for the non-ham eaters.

The room was quite small, there was no where to sit, other than on the bed (only 1 chair provided in a double room). Some fittings looked cheap - thin lino on the floor and damaged skirting boards (looked like there had been a flood from the bathroom). We stayed in room 327.,

The location was brilliant, everything was on your doorstep to see the sights of Ghent.
excellent breakfast , very large hotel with a homely feel, very helpful staff and central location, very clean and comfortable room

As if someone tried to put together a room by picking different styles from an interior magazine, trying to make it look cool and trendy but completely messing up by mixing everything. I wish the room had the atmosphere of the old buildings we were staying in. Also the road to exit the grounds was badly damaged.,

Many facilities were included such as bikes, games, the spa area, mini golf and much more. The breakfast was alright, nothing special. They made sure the stay was as comfortable as possible with the current restrictions, so they set up a shop to meet all your needs.
Everything was perfect.  Very cute,  clean apartment. Nearby parking garage.  Right by the center

Good location, reasonable prices, nice fully breakfast.  The bed was good, clean and soft linens. Welcoming stuff. The hotel parking was fully booked ( we didn’t get reservation in advance), but concierge recommended good public parking 2 min. distance by foot.

the room was very cold, tried to put the air conditioning higher, but without success,

Breakfast had a wide variety . Clean
Very centrally locatedLarge comfy apartmentGood ShowerEasy CheckinCar park nearbyEverything worked, nothing was broken

It is the most satisfactory accommodation of our trip. The room was clean and beautifully decorated. Location is convenient. The hostess Nicola is talented, talkative and helpful. The host Michel has good taste in recommending scenic spots. Breakfast is extra charged but plentiful and tasty.

The shag carpet was a little 70's kitch. The TV reception was flakey. The breakfast was not worth the 14 Euro. The coffee machine was not working for multiple days. There are no refrigerators or microwaves in the room, yet if you can manage to bring your own breakfast and french press, you will be fine. There is a microwave in the convenience shop and a kettle in the room. Do to COVID, the Sauna's are not operational and the bar with the fabulous selection of beer is closed. The value for money was not great, yet for a nice place to go for New Year's Eve in COVID times, it was in fact worth it.,

Beautiful Domaine. Wonderful atmosphere. Good opportunities for hiking. Great Place for a get away, not so far from Brussels. The heated pool was amazing (when there were not too many Children splashing around). The bathrooms were well renovated. The staff were friendly and the dinners were good. All plates and cutlery are biodegradable, so let's hear it for sustainability. I would suggest some over 18 time slots for the pool, e.g. 9-11h and 19-21h.

There is limitation on the check in time, so may be not the best choice if your arrive late.,

Great location, the room was spacious, the bed was comfy, kitchen are sufficiently equipped. Philippe was really attentive.

The pillows. Everything else was great, but the pillows are just terrible. Nothing too traumatic, but maybe good to check is the smell coming from the pipes in the bathroom, it has a foul smell. We just closed the bathroom door and solved, but good to look at.,

The rooms are small but modern and very convenient. The location is fantastic and the staff was very friendly. The bed is quite big and is very comfortable. Overall the hotel has a modern, hip and cozy ambiance. The rain shower is so nice!

Property could do with a little TLC, spot of paint here & there.,

Fantastic location & good bar with very helpful staff.

The rooms are a bit small, but very clean and comfortble,

The rooms are clean, very nice and comfortble, staff is so nice and polite! Had a wonderful stay thanks to this hotel!
The atmosphere at the hotel is lively and accommodating . Great place to relax after a day exploring Brussels City Centre. Excellent Bar and Bar service staff. I really enjoyed my stay there.

Very little ventilation in room, but it was unseasonably hot weather. You would need fans or Aircon if staying for more than a night.,

A lovely big room with nice personal touches like sweets on each bed. Breakfast was really nice with  pley of choice. The place was right on the main square, near to everything in the centre and plenty of places to eat. Parking isn't difficult either. Recommended

Nice castle stay
A very clean and cosy apartment, located in the heart of Brussels. Very good hospitality aswell. Great experience.
car parking

Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent location right in the centre of town, and great view from our window. Room was clean and comfortable. It was exactly what one would expect from an Ibis hotel.
So central
Fantastic place for time to rest after work meetings. Perfect location (next to the St Michael and St Gudula Cathedral). Thanks! Keep it that great :)

the superior room is spacious but the use of the space is awkward, very little space for your clothes, int the bathroom the rack for towels is just above the shelve, so they cannot be properly hanged, you get a dressing gown, but there nowhere hooks to hang them, you need to lie down on the floor to use the safe as it is just at that level, plugs are at locations useless for your computer use unless the cables become traps when you walk. The choice of colors is cold (grey and green) and the bathroom materials on the cheap side. If you like to take part in the life on the street, rejoice, the quality of the insulation of the building allows you to enjoy the noise of the street works during the day and the sirens of police/ambulances during all night,

the staff is courteous and efficient

Good location, pleasant lobby & bar, nice room.

Nothing really, it was a good inexpensive hotel in a prime location.,

Excellent welcoming hosts. Walking distance to centre. Very clean. Excellent breakfast.  Will definitely book again on my next trip to Liege.

The stay in the hotel was really a very nice experience. The staff was very polite. We arrived at the hotel around 9:30 AM and although the time for check-in is scheduled for 2 PM the receptionist, Radovane, was so polite to give us a room. Great facilities and super great location. I'll choose this hotel again when I visit Brussels in the future.

Comfortable room, very clean and quiet.

We travelled for my partner's anniversary: I booked a superior room and I wrote to the hotel to double-check that we have a nice room. However, the room we got looked a bit basic and had no bathtub, which is challenging with a young child. The furniture was quite shabby and we had two extra beds that we didn't need. I would have preferred if they wouldn't call this room 'superior', but rather a 'room with a view' and paid more attention to clients' requests especially if someone comes for a special occasion. In general I found other reviews suggesting that the food is overpriced and rooms in the castle quite basic to be accurate. Nevertheless, the location makes these things not too important if you want a relaxing long weekend in a family-friendly place.,

The surroundings are gorgeous and it's an excellent place to stay with kids. Playgrounds, games and activities are also very helpful if you travel with children. Staff was very friendly and we had a nice view from our room. Baby cot was available for free. They made an effort to make some food availble to eat in the rooms due to Covid measures and a small shop with free coffee and snacks to buy. A kettle in the room was also very helpful.

Slightly tired decor that needs updating.,

Excellent location, large apartment, quiet, comfy bed,
Alles was top

Other visitors enjoying Ghent nightlife came around 4 PM with a lot of noise in de stairways. Not the fault of the hotel off course.,

The hotel is directly in the center of Ghent. This means that it's very nice to go for a walk in de city centre. Everything is nearby! On the other hand, we forgot to book a place in the car park of the hotel so we had to search for another one. 15 minute walk with luggage was not very pleasant.  Hotel staff was very polite though! Breakfast was very good! Room was a bit noisy but doable for one night.

There was construction all around the hotel and booking.com did not mention that which I found very decieving. After I complained to booking.com I received a call from a very polite young man who said that they contacted the hotel and that the hotel will be in touch with me. Of course the hotel did not get in touch with me and the staff had no idea what I was talking about and couldnt care less. At the check in I had to change the room 2 times because the rooms were not clean or had a defekt.

Staff was kind and helpful. Motel is very close to city center and specially to train station, location is great. Loby is like a pub :) Happy people were enjoying... I stayed there last weekend, then i travelled out of Brussels in weekdays, i just booked this motel again for next two days. That means i am already happy with staying here, so i book second time...

Very nice owners, they also wanted to help in booking a nice restaurant. The 'wentelteefje', sweet pastry as a surprise when having breakfast was also very tasteful.Nice atmosphere, on walking distance of city center. Nice to have a walk with good wheather (which we had)!

Poorly maintained property and room. A bit more effort and the price for a room would be acceptable.,

View and Spa are excellent Friendly staff
Location is ideal, in the very center of Brussels. Friendly host. Nice modern room.

In the morning the bathroom was freezing cold and no immediate heating device. Since I had to leave early I was not able to take a shower,

No fridge, nor safe in the room. You could hear noise from rooms next door and from the street  in your room.,

Very good breakfast, very central location. Modern and clean room. Friendly staff.

Excellent modern rooms, quiet surroundings and overall very comfortable. Rich breakfast. I was planning to stay only one night and ended up staying 3. Michel and Nicole are wonderful hosts, had great ideas for sightseeing in Liège and were a great support. Great value for money. Perfect.

Walking routes could have been clearer and better described. Food was extremely disappointing, and honestly for the price a stark rip-off (though the wine great!). The look and feel of the castle is nice, however hostel-like vibes with no decorations, flowers or service at the table at the bar. My room smelled, I ended up having mosquitos as I had to open my window for the smell. My head bed wall shook whenever the neighbour opened or closed their door, and I could hear them - even as I asked for a quiet room. This explains the 3 star rating probably. I also asked for a big bed, and got 2 singled pushed together, including singles bedding. Floor was creaky and loud, they should consider investing in the bones of the castle to offer good hotel rooms, or mentioning this somehow. There was no cafe or opportunity to get a drink or food at the wellness area/pool. Except a vending machine that was broke and ate your coins. What I was looking for (peaceful hotel, with a good bed, food and spa to relax and take walks) was not met as well as I had hoped. Felt more like a very elegant hostel if I'm truly honest! Which is fine, if that's the expectation, alas as a boutique hotel I expected more. Needs an update and renovation here and there in my opinion.,

Gorgeous castle, scenery, wine was great, and available info for games, excursions. The spa massages i took (although 3rd party and took a while to set an appointment) was lovely and relaxing and original. The wellness pool area was great, individual saunas cute, and overall Covid measures seemed appropriate. The staff was lovely, though it depended on who ;)

I rarely write reviews but as this hotel has everything a seasoned traveller requires thought I would elaborate.  Located right on the Market Square with parking outside.  As hotels go I would mark it 5 star value for money.  The accommodation is not swanky but it is clean, has plenty of hot water, good size shower, a window that opens, very comfortable king size bed, extra pillows, tea/coffee making facilities and very clean.  The breakfast was incredible, possibly the best hotel breakfast I have had in more years than I wish to recall.  We had dinner in the restaurant which also was excellent and as hotel guests were given a welcome drink of our choosing.  The owner and staff were very helpful and friendly and spoke multiple languages.  Can not recommend highly enough.

Since the rooms are basically built on top of each other row by row, the layout is a bit strange at first sight. Carrying your luggage 2 stairs up and through narrow corridors was a challenge.
The double bed we asked for were twin beds put together with a top mattress. We still had separate blankets, so something didn't add up there.
The breakfast was ok, nothing special.,

The room was nice and clean. It was a bit cold and it took a while before we found out we could regulate the temperature ourselves. The bathroom was clean as well and the shower was (after warming up for 2 minutes) really nice.

There's no kettle, coffee and bottle of water in the room, little fridge and maybe little wardrobe.,

The bed is extra comfy and also the breakfast with gluten free bread option is bonus plus and the coffee is very good!

The family suite is not big but thoughtfully designed for comfort and style, sober and clean, warm and cozy. Feels roomier and nicer than on the pictures. The view to the market square is beautiful. Good breakfast, great croissants!  Owner and staff kind and helpful. Free parking a short walk away. Outstanding value for a two-star place. Will be happy to come back.

The location was initially difficult to find due to a closed bridge. ,

The owner  was very helpful. The breakfasts were great.
comfortable and spacious apartment. local supermarket within 100m plenty of parking spaces near by. great location for visiting WW1 sites.

In the comment below you can read that the owner claims we have stolen things and that we made a lot of noise. This is not true. After arriving home from our trip the owner claimed that we had damaged things in the house and he asked for 500 euros. We immediately called him to settle this because we didn't do anything, but he didn't take the calls. We didn't hear from him afterwards. We hope you don't book an apartment with this man, because it is not okay at all to try and claim money from your customers. I have been a loyal client from booking and never had any problems before. This claim has ruined our trip. We will never book here again.Booking has now deleted this apartment from the website. This was the last room available near to the Menin Gate that accepted dogs. We would have stayed in the same hotel as my son and family but, unfortunately, they didn't accept pets. Our room was clearly meant for family occupation, having two singles and two bunk beds squashed into a dark and dingy room with a view of a partition wall right outside the window. The bathroom was horrible. The door didn't close fully, the lock had been vandalised and there were other signs of damage in the room. My son and family had breakfast with us on one morning and were charged E20 each although there was no charge for the children. When you’re staying in the new building, you might as well be staying in any new hotel. There was, however, no airconditioning in the rooms, and we happened to be there on a very hot day. Little things are missing, like a towel hook by the basin in the room. Also just a heads up that it’s a quite a walk from the parking to the rooms. The biggest problem, however, was one of understaffing. The receptionist was friendly, but clearly overworked. Besides her, the only other person around was the bar lady, whose first day it was. She had clearly not received sufficient training and could not cope with the pressure.  There was no manager around to assist or to deal with guest complaints. There is no service on the terrace (which is a nice place to sit) so you have to queue at the bar and hope for the best. Importantly, the blame is not to be placed on the inexperienced bar lady but on management.,

When we arrived at the hotel, at around 6 p.m., we didn't find anyone welcoming us at the reception: there were only different keys on the table for different guests (to be honest, anyone could have entered the hotel and picked them up from the table because there was literally no one...). In fact, we picked up our key and at first we stepped on the wrong strairs, so we had to go search for our room (it would have been useful to know this information from the receptionist).When we entered the room and the bathroom, we could tell that they were clean: too bad that when we opened the toilet lid, there was some toilet paper in the WC (maybe it was a mistake, but it was disgusting to see it).The worst thing was that, after taking a shower, a smell of sewer came out of the shower (we did not feel at ease after this).The next morning my boyfriend kindly explained in French to the owners of the hotel (a young guy and a man) that we found strange not seeing anyone at the check-in, and they answered that it was our mistake because we said that we would have come in the morning (the check-in time is between 3-9 p.m., as shown on booking.com, so we thought it wouldn't have been a problem); anyway, the young guy was very nice with us and apologised, while the older one was not.We also kindly asked if it was possible to leave them the luggage for some time before leaving, and they said yes and that they would have been around all day, but when we came back to pick up the luggage no one was there.,

We stayed at the Pentahotel Leuven to visit the „Rock Werchter Festival“. It‘s located in the very Centre of Leuven,having lots of Bars/Restaurants and little shops. To get to the main train station (where the shuttle for Werchter departs),you have to take a 15 minutes walk.The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself has everything you need and is very clean. Breakfast wasn‘t presented as a huge buffet,but included everything you need,from eggs to ham/cheese,fruits and vegetables,bread and sweets,...If we think of visiting Werchter again next year,this will definetly be the place to stay.

I booked this room last minute (30 min before we arrived). The host did not speak any English but he was so welcoming and gracious. When we had trouble finding the way down to the boat, he got in his car and drove us to show us. The boat is roomy with a large comfortable common area living room, kitchen and dining area. There are four rooms on the boat, each with private bathrooms. The two rooms in the front have an amazing river view. Above there is a nice deck with tables and chairs, lounge chairs and a hot tub. The city center is a 5 min walk. Lots of shopping, restaurants and a grocery store. The included breakfast was wonderful. Fresh bread, homemade jams, cold cuts and cheeses. I would love to stay there again.

When we turned up, room was not ready. Ended up getting keys 2 hours late. No apology  was just told their staff didn’t up. They let us put our luggage in luggage room, but it wasn’t locked or supervised - so we were apprehensive. 
Electrics in bathroom were appalling. An accident waiting to happen. I had to keep warning my children not to touch any plugs in bathroom. This would be illegal in the UK even in a private home, never mind in a hotel ! 
Shame because this place is great for location so has so much more potential. Building needs some moderate investment to bring the safety standards up to acceptable levels. 
But having said that, if I ever visited Bruges again, I would seriously reconsider it - purely for location and reasonable price.

They have three kids so know what it is like trying to find a room for everyone to fit comfortably, that is not extortionate.  Our room was lovely and spacious and they had arranged for the kids to sleep upstairs and for us adults below.  The bathroom was very clean and well lit. Apparently built 10 years ago but it looks brand new.  The furnishings were warm and neutral, a bit like a chalet in the country: Lots of raw wood and French carved lamp stands and exposed beams.  We had a balcony / terrace backing on to a wooded area which was nice.  It felt as if we were in a treehouse.

The hotel is in a very nice area of Brussels . Few minutes away from the central station and the Centre. Staff are extremely helpful and go out of their way to guide you . Breakfast is also very good with a great  variety to choose from . Will surely use this hotel again if I visit Brussels . Highly recommended.

Sorry Ibis but you really dropped the ball on this occasion. AND €2.50 for a Twix or Snickers ? Not big sellers then !!,
