The owner/chef Wim(?), ruined our time at this location.  He is a hot head with a chip on his shoulder that ended up being the downfall of our time there as well as two Americans also staying there that we befriended.  As John Paul, our Belgian American friend said "this guy is really bad for Belgium."  Not to prolong the misery but the incident arose after we were gifted by Van Steenberg Brewery near Ghent a magnum of our favorite Belgium beer, Tripel de Garre.  We told the staff we wanted to share it with others and the young son showed us we had a fridge in our room.  I then told Wim we met their guests from America and wanted to get some cheeses to offer them when we shared the bottle. Wim directed me to the store.  We met our friends on the public patio outside well away from the B&B and restaurant.  there was no one in the bar or restaurant.  I asked the young worker if we could use four glasses to share the beer and he graciously agreed.  After about 30 minutes of quietly enjoying the view and the beer, Wim stormed onto the public patio, told us we were not allowed to drink our belgium beer there and insisted we leave immediately.  We said OK and started to gather our belongings but Wim shouted "right now, you must leave immediately!" He then claimed in 20 years no guest has ever had the audacity to share a beverage on the public patio.  At that point, we had to ask him to calm down as he was acting threatening, but the rant continued.  He even told us about the size of his mortgage as if drinking our gift had deprived him of significant value!  The said thing is our simple celebration with new found friends is not what is depriving him of income.  It is the atrociously sophomoric culinary experience he offers.  It was also the low light of our eating in Belgium.  This guy really should not be in the service or culinary business.  To prove the point, aside from the four of us, only one other couple ever showed up for dinner.,

The place is up a steep hill but accessible if you've got stamina or a car.  The views, especially from our room #2 were dramatic of the city and the Count's Fort.  It had a lovely "public patio" (quotes to be explained later) and our room also had a grand outdoor patio.

As a result the room was so warm in the middle of winter (we were there end of January) that we couldn’t sleep even with the window hof open! The shower had no pressure at all and only cold water was coming through which made it super uncomfortable showering for ourselves but also dor our two little kids. Next morning we reported those issues and requested for another room. Pur request was accommodated and we got a room where everything was functioning good. So kudos to the receptionist hearing us out and actually doing something about it but Holiday Inn really needs to invest some money to renovate their hotel rooms. I made an error with the check in time, I believed the check-in time was up to 9pm, thinking that most hosts prefer earlier than later, I turned up at 5.15pm and noticed that check-in time is between 18.00-21.00. Staphanie’s husband let me in and showed me to a very comfortable upper bed room and lounge, I was grateful and ready for a shower travelling by moto. Technically I could have been charged an additional fee, which was waived. In the evening I had a meal in Arlon; 7km, returned to the house for an excellent nights rest in a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was excellent, continental style, cheese, meats etc. and great coffee. Easy journey to the Channel ports, left at 9.30 I made good time for the return ferry and transferred to an earlier departure, arrived home while still light, mid-October. Southern Belgium is great moto country, I was in transit from SE Europe, next time I’ll stay longer, explore the area and fuel is cheap in nearby Luxembourg.

Recommend by 2 happy weekenders from Luxembourg.

We had a Studio Room on the 1st floor. Didn't like the following: plastic mattress cover under the sheet, the toilet location (next to the kitchen), dank mouldy smell in the entrance hallway, the bathroom that turned into a steamy wet room because of no ventilation and there did not appear to be an easily accessible fire escape for a place that has wooden floors and stairs (although I must admit we did not ask).,

Location was good and an easy walk to the main square. Nearby parking was very secure even at 22 euro a day.
Comfortable and spacious room, nice breakfast

The rooms decoration is really minimal and without personality. It is a cold atmosphere even for a business hotel.The balcony is big, but in our case the view was on a really sad street and buildings in front. The services are good, but the line at the reception was always super long for anything and there was always quite a big crowd hanging in there which didn't make it very reassuring from a Covid point of view. the food for dinner was ok for an "emergency" dinner but quite overpriced for the quality.,

The staff was kind. The location was central despite not super nice neighbourhood.The service for the dinner was quick and the breakfast was good. The size of the room is big. The common parts at the are really nice, but not enjoyable at this moment because of the covid restrictions.Overall the experience was positive, but the hotel and especially the rooms, lack charme and personality.

While it’s a dog-friendly apartment, the immediate area isn’t good for walking dogs. That isn’t the owner’s fault, of course, it’s just how it is. The room was nice and had everything we needed, but the double bed didn’t have a proper frame so was on the floor. That may not be a problem for many people, but for me it was because I have very bad knees and can’t get up easily from the floor. Also, the bathroom was very nice but has a metal floor (I assume so that it’s easy to clean), which was VERY cold in the winter. However, we did mention this as a suggestion on Seb’s suggestion board so hopefully that won’t be an issue soon. ,

It was very close to the motorway, and quite close to Namur centre. We liked that they allow dogs and that they have all of the facilities you’d need (beds (one double, one single), table and chairs, kitchen area including sink, microwave and kettle) were all in one room, with a separate en-suite bathroom. It was great that we could both check in and check out late, and Seb is really friendly

On 2nd floor in family room it’s nice to have curtains on a bathtub. Friends on 3rd floor had newer bathroom.
But that hasn’t changed our preception of a great stay.,

Very nice and helpful staff both at the reception and at the restaurant.
Comfortable family room. Great pillows.
Amazing breakfast.

The only problem is that there are no "rules" for the pool. Parents drop of their kids, and they terrorised everything during our stay there. Dropped people's phones in the water, spit and coughed in the water, parents were nowhere aloud. This was a big issue for me and my friend as we really looked forward to finally having a Holiday. As per rest very very nice stay!,

Loved how friendly the staff was, amazing room, amazing rooftop, nice and clean heated pool. Will book again for sure!

The shower leaks all over the floor, the ‘double bed’ was 2 single mattresses on a double frame which made sleeping standards much lower.,

The staff let us check in at 9am when we arrived and were extremely friendly. Air conditioning worked well and stayed on even when key was out so room was lovely and cool to come into after a heatwave outside
No curtain in the bathtub - Taking shower results in splashing water all over.

All of the above!,

The location was fabulous. Unfortunately, the hotel could do with being bulldozered into the ground. Our room had a toilet so small that my knees were against the door whilst I was sitting on the throne. It was the size of a broom cupboard, with neither a window, a vent, or an extractor fan to 'freshen' the air after use. When finished, we then had to cross the room to the tiny bathroom to wash our hands. The room had a prolific damp problem, whereby large parts of the carpet were wet, and the whole of the hotel had a musty, mildewy smell. The breakfast was ok, but the selection was quite small. The cellar, which is the dining room, was the best room in the place, in my opinion. The staff were wonderful, and couldn't be more helpful, but that wouldn't be anywhere near enough for me to go back there.

No refund given....COVID 19,

Nothing...

The fact we had two simple beds instead of one double bed . The wellness room was also pretty small and we could not go to the Sauna or Hammam ,

The breakfast. The swimming pool. Thé beautiful room. The fact we could get one extra bottle of water.

some sound insulation could be nice. you hear the people walking upstairs and also too much noise and cold air coming from the windows. the door is also very old, doesnt make you feel safe in the room. we had a kitchen in the room but just with a microwave, kettle and some cups. no oven, nothing to cook, even no cutlery. had a coffee machine, thoug.,

staying at an apartment frm 17. century is a nice experience. the room was nicely decorated. the owner is also friendly, he leaves his tips for Brussel in the room so that you do not need to spend a lot of time on internet looking for what to do or eat. the location is also good, 15 minutes walk from the city hall. there are nice restaurants aorund.

cold shower if you do not know the tricks of the kind engineer,

kindest staff

The lighting is the bathroom was almost absent, it would be nice to light up the bathroom. Also the room was poorly lit to our taste, but guess some people might like dim ambience.,

Very nice location, spacious room and comfortable bed. The shower was also good and relaxing we had to pickup from the buffet and eat it at our room, nonetheless the breakfast was good and typical of what you could expect from a decent hotel. There is a paid parking right next door, very convenient and with some discount from the hotel it costs 13,5€/day. Had good stay and will not hesitate to come back again.

Seb's place is conveniently located not far from the main road to Brussels so useful if you're driving. There's an Aldi close by so we could buy and make our own food at the studio. The private bathroom and WiFi made our stay easy.
The shower had no powerful flow
Super pool for chilling during the heatwave and grat. location to start exploring Brussels

No complimentary water even considering the unbearable heat
Air Conditioner was very low. It was not cooling the room at all
No telephone in the room to even call the reception ,

Central location.

No lift to actual floors so you have to carry cases up and down a narrow winding staircase,

Great location,good restaurant,close to bars,restaurants,river.

It is a 2 star hotel so it was pretty much as expected and would be wrong to complain about stuff that pretty much matched the star rating! Small room and basic furnishings and toiletries...buy as I expected so not a complaint,

The location is worth it! Right next to the Bell tower and perfect for exploring around the Centre.
no breakfast;Smallest room

There was nothing to not like.,

The location of the hotel was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The family room was great, very open and a lot of space. The breakfast was just unbelievable, everything was just delicious. This hotel is A MUST.

A bit drafty from the patio doors and shower head had water spraying all over!,

Great location to old Brussels.  I liked the independent access to the room.  Shower had nice hot water available!  Landlord was very accessible.  An easy stay in the city.

Bathroom when arrived in the room was not totally clean.,

Location, size of the room. Very friendly reception. Had to change room due to noise (next to the lift) and the hotel gladly changed it.

We stayed there 2 nights, including NYE. There were unfortunately a few parties (not allowed) but the hotel handled it well and called the police. The first night there was also quite some noise in the room above us, but again, the hotel was not to blame for this. No other complaints at all.,

The studio with kitchen was great for us (2 adults one small child). It was very clean and the location was perfect, very close to the train station and also walking distance to the historical city center. Breakfast was good value as well.

Having to sit or kneel in the bath for a shower. The key did not come out of the lock in a usual way and this should have been indicated. There was a need for more more paint to have been used. The floor was in need of some better covering.  The crockery was not of an acceptable standard. I think it was the worst place my wife and i have ever stayed in.,

Not much. The price was good, but standards should be better. The beds were comfortable, but one was a futon with little access to it.

couldn't get it warmer then 18 degrees.. evening after eating entered .. was 16 only !whole hotel cold.. in swimming pool.. in restaurant in morning also not too warm..,

space2 double beds

There was no air conditioner in the rooms. I can't imagine it would normally be a problem, however it was an extremely hot streak of temperature during our visit (37C) which made sleeping quite difficult.,

Lovely quirky decor, polite staff, very clean, reasonably-priced parking, location is wonderful - on a tram stop and in a lively neighborhood with wonderful coffee bars. The rooftop bar has a great view and coctails.

Didn't have a refrigenerator,

Very good reception ;)
No aircon

Very uncomfortable beds, giving us extremely aching backs and trouble getting to sleep. 
Thin walls making it very noisy. ,

Great location.

Our family had a great stay. The room was big, functional and spotlessly clean, with a nice view over the whole neighbourhood. The kitchen is equipped with all you might need. A supermarket downstairs is extremely convenient.
Very nice hotel,super friendly staff...the wellness is a big plus.the location very good and not so far from the beach.as well the breakfast delicious..a lot of choice...best breakfast ever.

Funky, vibrant hotel in a great location.  Staff were friendly and helpful re the hotel services and places to visit.  Fun and lively atmosphere throughout.  Splendid view from the rooftop bar and terrace.

Coffee facilities and some free water in rooms would be a place for such trips.,

Very nice hotel with very nice lobby bar and in a good location which is walking distance to the EU Institutions and close to Park. Restaurant across the road from hotel is also very good.

It has a minibar -  but not tea or coffee making facilities. The breakfast was a bit disappointing for the size and quality of the hotel.,

Amazing hotel, it is like a labyrinth though, with lots of tiny and crazy staircases. Each time we left our third floor room  we ended up going a different way to the reception (and once was though the kitchen!!). Bot wow what a room, more a suite really, it was quirky, comfortable and beautiful with a fabulous spa bath. The best room we have stayed in! The hotel is also only a short walk into the city centre.

Spare pillows in the cupboard looked like they hadnt had clean pillow cases on so couldnt use them. Pillows most uncomfortable.,

The quaintness of the hotel and close to the centre of bruge.

The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Unfortunately I do not have the name of the lady from the check-in, she was really great, but Alejandro from check-out did also a fantastic job. I can truely reccomend this place.

Nice airy room, good saunas and staff at the reception were helpful and thoughtful, we had few troubles with arriving late and wanted to cancel but they found solution so we stayed there.

The apartment is accessed through narrow hallways and by narrow wooden stairs (gives the feeling of a very old house), nevertheless the apartment has a cosy feeling inside. The doors of all the apartments are quite old and don't have the proper sound proofing, so you don't feel isolated from the rest of the house. Also the locks are ordinary old room locks, do not seem very secure.,

The apartment has a cosy and warm vibe to it. The space is generous and nicely organized. The check-in and check-out are efficient (no reception).

In the room - only the synthetic curtain in the bathtub - if it gets damp, it is a bit unpleasant. I did not understand the system of guarantee and did not have a credit card, but fortunatelly, I did not have to provide one in the end (until now, I don't understand what I was asked for and why).,

I stayed in Bloom several times 10 years ago in 2009 and I was delighted to return and find that everything was more or less the same in 2020. I liked unique decoration in each room, it is certainly refreshing to find such concept. The rooms are reasonably large, have everything one needs especially for short stays (tea, coffee etc.), and the breakfast is great. And I felt that the price has actually dropped in comparison with the high rates I was used to from the past. Close to the metro station (Jardin) Botanique. I loved it back then and still like it.(I did not find the rooms in particular "need of renovation", they were just fine and good value. I am actually a bit sad that the artistic decorations may be gone fafter the planned rennovation this summer and the place would become more ordinary.)

Room was not 100% correct, missing wall paint. Some lights don't work...have to be test before please.,

Staff very kind and professional Suite bed is very comfortable !
Two thumbs up!

Cool rooms and decor. Good prices and pool bar plus wellness option available. Spacious room.

Again, the lack of phones in the rooms is a let-down.  It wasn't until I woke up in the morning that I decided on a late checkout.  The lack of a phone in the room meant I used my phone to call the front desk - which was an international call for me, by the way.  They insisted I had to go down to the desk to arrange and pay for my late check-out.  That was really inconvenient.  It would have been nice to do it from the comfort of the room.,

Just like the previous time I stayed here, I really enjoyed my stay. It's a shame that I only had one night as I would have loved to stay longer. And I like the fact that I could do a late check-out and, basically, stay till 3pm.  This was really good for me as it enabled me to get some work done.  And I can see the attraction for couples because they don't have to rush to get out by noon :-)

Charming as it is, the house is old so prepare for creaking floors and minimal noise isolation. But it adds to the charm as well :),

An enchanting, historic, 17th century house, with amazing decoration. It is not just accommodation but the pride and joy of the owner - who is very friendly and welcoming. Well equipped, well located, a house with a character!
The staff were very nice and friendly.

More channels on room TV? Nothing else comes to mind...,

Everything was great. Food was great both at the hotel restaurant and breakfast with room-service (price-included). Ventilation in the room was helpfull during hot summer night. Swimming pool, elevator straight from underground parking, etc. It was a pleasure.

I understand the owner does not charge cleaning fees and that is why they are requesting the guests to clean the dishes they use in the small kitchenette, but nothing is stopping them from charging those cleaning fees and save us the trouble of having to wash dishes on our vacation. For a short 2-3 days stay, I found that to not be very enjoyable. A good cutting knife would be handy too since the kitchen is provided, so guests can make better use of it; salt and pepper would have been much appreciated too.
The reason why I mentioned cleaning was not the best is because there were web cobs hanging in the top corner of our door, otherwise the room itself inside felt quite clean.
Wifi not very strong and at some point we couldn't connect to it anymore, not sure if this could have been fixed if we asked for it.
Please note that as the listing says, this studio is in a very old building with very squeaky stairs and flooring, so if you are a light sleeper, this might not be the best place for you, as you can hear people coming in and out of the building, walking around in the apt above or next to you and there is also considerable traffic noise throughout the night coming from the street outside, even with the window open. This was not a major issue for us, but it is important to be mentioned, if you are looking for a quiet accommodation.
Lastly, it needs to be mentioned that the bathroom, although private, inside the room, has a slight feeling that it was later added within the room space, in what might have been a wardrobe, as the doors to the bathroom look like wardrobe doors and they don't really close properly, so it makes for some situations to be a bit uncomfortable - definitely would not recommend it for new couples, unless very comfortable with each other and no privacy issues. It does serve its purpose of having a private bathroom, albeit the shower cabin is tiny, but the water pressure is good, the water was hot and there were plenty of towels...,

The size of the room was great, it also had a nice comfy sofa, the small kitchen had most necessary items and even some jams and chocolate spread available for guests to use - please note there is no stove or toaster available, so maybe not suitable for long stays if you are planning to cook for yourself.Location was good too, not very central, but easy to find at the end of a street coming from the centre. We were able to walk all the time and it wouldn't take us more than say 15 minutes from the grand plaza.I can comfortably say this is very good value for money if you are looking for an authentic experience and staying only for a few days. Communication with the host was also very good.

Despite us politely explaining that we’d come back early to meet the timings they told us, that there were 4 people in the bar with full drinks, that it was a special occasion and we didn’t plan to be long, he said no and just shrugged.
Really disappointing as the hotel room was very nice and the small bar looked lovely - if only we could have enjoyed it. ,

Property lovely but manager unnecessarily unaccommodating.

Heater didn’t work at first. Was fixed in a jiffy though. ,

Very beautiful. Nice terrace/balcony. 
Love the space. 
Full kitchen facilities.  
Convenient location. Wow factor. 
Parking is near the unit

I didn't like that the booking.com site claimed there was a big last minute discount, while in the end it was simply the regular rate for a very mediocre room. There was some dishonesty here.,

The location is incredible. The closest you can get to the hot spots in Bruges.
Construction site next to hotel.

everything was great .,

Breakfast was great ,and location was good not for from train station.
The building was attractive. The grill was very good for dinner with a great atmosphere.

twin bed is kind of slide,

The room can cook.Room space is big And comfortable.

The front desk reception was very unfriendly at the check in. 
No any words of welcoming.
I didn’t have the same ID with me as the one I used for the online pre check in. This was a big issue😳 I almost left the hotel, so unbelievable unfriendly.
I am the owner of hotel in The Netherlands and I would immediately fire my employé with this kind of attitude. Send him to a course to learn him hospitality!,

It is a cool hotel
Amazing room, good facilities, perfect location
Loved this apartment, perfect central location. Excellently stocked kitchen and lovely welcome (thanks for the bottle of wine!). Highly recommend and would happily stay again.

Dirty old room with bad mattress and stains all over.  Do not recommend it to anyone.  Rude employees.  A business made to take your money and offer the worst possible experience.  Big problems with the room.  Very dirty overall.  Avoid at all cost.

Amazing stay. I wen't to Belgium for professional reasons and i found that this hotel was really perfect. Calm, modern decoration, very friendly staff and near the Detla station and Carrefour, this hotel has everything we need to spend a great and productive time.
Thank you!

The Wi-Fi wasn't great. It wasn't stable, which made using it really annoying. Also, we were on 3rd floor, which doesn't get much sun, so the room was coldish, so we had to get extra blankets!,

The location of the hotel is superb - everything is at walking distance and the Brussels Central train station is near by, which was very convenient for traveling via train. The room is very compact and comfortable. It's being cleaned every day and the towels are changed frequently.

Would skip restaurant - service was slow, food mediocre.,

Nice hotel.  Trendy.  Clean.  Our room was a little outdated but felt safe and comfortable.

Nothing,

Really friendly and helpful hosts in a super property

There was no fan or window in the bathroom hence the bathroom was very smelly after use.  Although  it was very quiet on our floor I could easily hear the people upstairs. We got one of the rooms without sauna and jacuzzi and even in the middle of the night at 1 am I heard the noise of people upstairs in their jacuzzi. The room was also very dry, generally I would improve the air conditions system. ,

The property is indeed a historical building with very interesting inner architecture. The room was spacious

The room was a little dusty and bathroom was not as good as the rest of the room,

The room size, the location, and the staff were very friendly
Great, funcky place in Brussels. great for kids and couples.

The bathroom was very small and did not have hooks or rails to hang the towels,

The room had character and was comfortable. A generous continental breakfast was served in the room, which was a lovely way to start the day. The shower was excellent. The hotel is only a few minutes' walk from the Markt.

Nothing.,

Beautiful spacious apartment  near center of old city

The small tv was a nice addition, only few channels, and often bad signal.Other than that, I can't say anything bad.Met the expectations of a budget holiday, basic, but you get everything you need!,

The location was excellent, very close to the market, next to the belfort.It is a budget hotel, so it's a little bit basic, but it had everything I needed.Small kitchen, a bath and a nice bed!When I first came in, the room was very clean.The staff was very friendly, I came to check in, and I was offered a room with a kitchen, as my original one didn't have one.
The hotel was modern, clean, staff was extremely friendly, and had a free breakfast. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I had a problem with an invoice. After the check out I was said that I cannot obtain an invoice because the room was paid via Booking.com. So I leave without any invoice. But in the confirmation from Booking.com is written an instruction about the invoice from the provider! A have paid via Booking several times and in all cases a have obtained the invoice at the hotel! Booking.com do not provide an invoice but only a receipt.,

Breakfast was perfect. The hotel is clean and comfortable.The place is very good.
alles was super!

Nothing. ,

Building is full of character - beautiful and quirky. Excellent location for the town centre.

Big bottles of water in room,

Location close to railway station

My other colleagues talked about your delicious break first - a bit annoyed to not have access to it but anyway, next time :D,

Everything was enough, i enjoyed my stay.

Check in was amazing but staff after that where OK, when we left the maid jumped in the room and we left over 2 hours before check out and upon check out we where not asked how our stay was.
Alos cot was not put up we had to chase it up. 
The coffee/tea cups are so so small. ,

Location and it was very clean food is also amazing.

The location was excellent, except - on Friday night the nearby nightclub music was blaring well into the early morning making sleep very much impossible. I don’t know how this can be remedied, but short of noise ordinance after 0200. Most of my stay was during the weekday, and except for Friday, it was quiet and perfect!!!,

This property is BEAUTIFUL! Clean, classy. A kitchen to prepare meals if you don’t want to eat out every night. The living/dining area is very nice plus, there is a rooftop deck patio for dining. The location was on a square surrounded by dozens of fine eating, drinking and dining and is easy walking distance to everything.Fully recommend!

You are supposed to hear ring bell from Belfort. It's not annoying but sometimes... you may be surprised.,

Very close to the markt and belfort. You can see the Belfort in your room! If you want to travel Brugge based on the Makrt, this hotel would be great choice for you.

The rooms are nice but could be a bit more complete given the price. They could provide more shampoos etc and more wardrobe space.,

Nice design of hotel, friendly and professional staff. Great location. Comfortable bed.

Room was very cold. Even with full heating on the was feeling of cold air. 
All furnitures are heavily used. ,

Location is the best part.

nothing,

Breakfast was fantastic as with out previous stay. Outside in the garden with home picked fruits, home made yoghurt, fresh eggs from their own hens and honey from their bees. The best breakfast we have had in a bed and breakfast and is our standard to beat. Rooms very comfortable and as it hit 40 degrees on our visit the air conditioning in the bedroom was fantastic.
All at the top!

The only thing I can think of is that you have to close one part of the curtains, otherwise people walking down the corridor or sitting outside their room on the terrace could look into the room. ,

The room (nr 707) was a nicely decorated suite, with a well equipped and clean kitchen (but only used Nespresso machine and kettle, with provided coffee and tea). Kids on the sofa bed, us parents on one of the most comfortable beds ever. Bathroom was nicely decorated and very clean. Outside is a small (roof)terrace with a few chairs and tables. Parking is next to the hotel, you get a 5 € discount from hotel. Very close to the shopping street (2 min walk), but about 15-20 min to Grote Markt and surroundings.

Bathroom did not smell nice the first day,

Swimming pool and roof top bar

It’s all good,

Good quality fixtures and fittings

Nothing of note.,

Very easy key exchange with the owner.
Location is amazing

Highly recommend this wonderful little gem. Perfectly located, quiet street and was stocked with more staples than any other place we’ve stayed ( ie: coffee, tea, cereal, clear and accessible information). My 7 year old daughter was thrilled and feeling like a princess in her own attic bedroom...
The only note is that it is NOT for anyone without high mobility as the first staircase is extremely steep and the second staircase is more like a ladder... and all beds are upstairs. There is, however, a comfortable couch on the main floor. We would certainly stay here again if/when we return to fairytale Bruges.

The room is very small. Travelling as a couple with two suitcases made it difficult to move around the room.,

The property is very comfotable, clean and has a great location. Its within walking distance from Grand Place.

The costs for the parking were high, 27 euro for 1 night,

The room was big and tidy.
Lovely hosts, beautiful house and garden, fabulous breakfast! We recommend this B & B without hesitation and we plan to make a return visit.

/,

The location, staff, breakfast
Stayed for two nights and had issues on the second night with the room and was dillingently relocated to another room in a upper floor.

Breakfast,

Nice room and kind staff

Our room (Marilyn Munroe Room) was at the front of the property, over looking the t'Zand and had lovely high ceilings and large windows, lovey and airy and beautifully decorated.  Property was very close to the t'Zand underground parking in Bruges and central for all of the old city.Continental breakfast was served in the comfort of our room, which was great.Staff very warm and welcoming.

Bedrooms were quite hot - maybe a couple of fans to cool them down would be a good idea. ,

Great location for exploring Ghent. Spacious for 4 guests. 
Outdoor terrace to enjoy the sunny weather.
Excellent location. Great value for money. The man at the reception was very friendly, informative and helpful.10/10

It’s nothing to say.,

Very close to City centre!

Not much; no safety box or kettle in room.,

A very nice, comfortable hotel in a good location, near to the centre and only a few minutes walk from central station. Rooms were very clean and modern and the lounge was a great to relax in. Breakfast was excellent with high quality, organic produce. All the staff were very welcoming, helpful and friendly. I was able to check in to the room earlier than expected, which was really appreciated and the lady in reception (I think Sandrine was her name) was very helpful in giving information on transport and directions to nearby places etc. When I needed to cancel one of the days, Tammy was very helpful in sorting it out. Would highly recommend this hotel and will come again during next visit to Brussels.

limited amenities..no slippers..,

breakfast.spacious room with coffee,tea machine and iron in it.housekeeper very polite..temperature could be adjusted as you prefer..reliable wifi..staff 5*..
Very clean rooms. Very friendly hosts. Amazing breakfast made from locally produced products.It was great. I highly recommend it to everyone wanting to discover the neighborhood around Ieper

Style,

Good hotel, good restaurant and good value for money

the bathroom interior in one of our rooms was a bit tired.,

Serviced appartments - own kitchen, Central location (2 mins walk to train station, 10 mins walk to the old town), spacious rooms, clean, modern.

Unfortunately the restaurant was renovated during our stay and the replacement breakfast was a little expensive (5€) for what was offered (pastries, bananas, apples, yoghurt and coffee). However, we really enjoyed our stay, not really a downside.,

We especially liked the interoir design of the hotel and the bar and pool area. The view from the rooftop is spectacular. The hotel is in one of the nicest areas of brussels with loads of nice Restaurants and Bars nearby!

No reception, unusual entrance through the restaurant or back door, steep stairs. These small inconveniences are acceptable but you should know about them in advance.,

A room on the second floor with a view on tiled roofs, the tower of the Basilica. The staff is always ready to help and answer questions. Seating area in the room is very cozy (comfortable armchairs, tea corner) and gives you great chance to discuss your day drinking a cup of tea. The breakfast distinctive served in the room was very atmospheric and tasty. It is a GREAT ADVANTAGE of the hotel (still I have great desire to repeat it).

The apartment has a beautiful roof terrace overlooking Gent. 
Location is perfect with all major sites within ca. 15min walking distance.
The apartment is beaitiful, well equipped with a lot of space. 
The landlord was super nice. Xheckin/out was easy as there is a restaurant in the same building which helps to manage.

The bed is horrible. Not confortable.,

The location is perfect. In the city center.
Location and helpfulness of the host's was excellent

No tea / coffee making facilities in the room.
,

Everything else
I was not expecting a bathtub, so that was amazing! Unique design to each room - great idea and investment! Very clean, very quiet, great breakfast options.

Loud neighbours. Didn’t like that, but not owners fault.,

Very nice stay. Place is comfortable and styled in a warm and origanal stile. Hosts are very welcomming and breakfast is just fabulous. Unfortunately there was an unusually loud party going on late in the night by the neighbours. No fault of the owners, but it messed with my sleep. Great beds also.

We asked to film in our room and it was not allowed till to ask the manager,and the manager wasn’t around,so we didn’t do what brought us to that city,we regret,

Was soo clean

The location of the apartments was great - right in the heart of everything. The apartment was nice and clean and the amenities were good too - everything we needed for a family of four for our two night stay. The only negative was the lack of security at the adjoining carpark - our car was broken into on our first night! The hotel offers a slight discount to leave the car in this car park but be careful if using it.

There were renovations going on so there wasn’t a restaurant for a proper breakfast and the games room wasn’t open.,

It was very clean and had a lovely terrace and pool area.

Nothing it was all perfect.,

Absolutely outstanding, loved having it bought to the room. Such a lovely touch. Plenty of choice and boiled eggs perfectly cooked. Set us up for the day.

Stairwell smelled really bad. Kitchen was okay but could have been better equipped for those who wanted to cook much.,

Fantastic location and beautiful apartment.
Very nice place and friendly people.

The location of the place within Bruges was amazing. Quick to reach everything by foot while not having all tourists look into you window when you are cooking or having a meal at the nice table in the living space.

No kettle or room facilities of that sort. They have a common iron room. Need to walk some 10 minutes from central station. With luggage it is bit difficult.,

Can have a short walk to tram station to reach nearby place.

Dinner in the restaurant took an age. A simple entrecote and fries took 50 minutes to arrive from the time of ordering. I was told it was very busy. People were complaining to the staff so I'd check waiting times before ordering in the restaurant.  ,

I have stayed here before. It has good, spacious, clean rooms and a good little fitness centre. The hotel is well located close to Botanique metro and the staff are helpful and friendly.

Everything was great. The owners take care of every detail in this B&B.Breakfast is azing with all home made food, we liked especially the jams, the yogurt and the fresh bread.It is also close to many WWI sites by bike or by car.
The restaurant and facilities are very beautiful and nice

The breakfast was a bit pricey. Travelling with 2 children and the price was the same for all of us when my two hardly eat anything!,

The room was very clean and spacious. Plenty of towels.

dim hallways.  game room was closed due to renovation.,

We liked the sleeping arrangements;  very unique design.  The hallways were too dim for my taste but everything else was good.  Very clean;  staff was accommodating.  Enjoyed the tiny pool; and the rooftop bar.

Not a dislike but staff is not always around I think. I’ve waited some time for anybody to open the door.. Again at check out, I’ve looked for somebody to drop the keys off. It took some time.,

Location can not be better! Great comfort! Superbly clean flat!

Ventilation and shower facilities can be imlroved,

Location is the best feature. Hotel room tends to be noisy due to other guests talking and smoking in the top floor terrace in late Night hours. Breakfast is ok, constraints due to COVID regulations understandable.ventialtion and air conditioning in rooms can be improved.
Beautiful home. Welcoming hosts. Great location. Perfect property to spend our Christmas in! Thanks again
Beds extra comfort. Clean.

The bed was a little hard but not really bad. The room was quiet but if you are near the elevators you hear sometimes the doors opening and closing and the people who use them talking. Again, nothing really bad.,

Big spacious room, comfortable bathroom. Safe, coffee maker, fridge and complimentary water. And an advent calendar with chocolates ! The towels had a decorative lining the same color of the bathroom sink. Good touch. Very good location, near metro and tram, you can go anywhere easily. Also near gare du Nord. Good and helpful staff. Excellent Wifi.Shops nearby, including rue Neuve in 10' walk. Restaurants nearby (mostly turkish at chaussee de Haecht, all types between Rue royale et Madou)
Its the third time we have stayed at this super property...................I think that says enough ? beautiful house superb hosts. If only you could award 11 out of 10 !!
only one point is the surcharge of 4 euros (not a big amount but a surprise), as I registered via Booking....

It's a shame there's no daily cleaning. Just basic stuff like beds made, fresh towels, and stocking up of coffee and soap would make it perfect.
Mattress & cushions a bit on the soft side, but that is very personal of course...,

Perfect location, friendly staff and clean, modern accommodation. Did not use kitchen facilities, but very well equipped and perfect for longer stays.
Would certainly repeat.
Great pool and rooftop bar

The beds were rather hard and not very comfortable.  Our two teens opted to sleep on the couch, which is HUGE.  My kids are very tall and fit fine,

This place is exactly as seen in the photos.  There is a big wow factor when entering!  The location is fabulous!!  It's an easy, short walk to everywhere you want to be, there are lively pubs on the street, a fruit market and public square are right out the door.We liked almost everything!The toilet is separate from the rest of the bathroom.  This was very helpful for our group of 4.We would absolutely return.Be aware that it is on the top floor, so step climbing is mandatory.The upper balcony is a fantastic place!!!
The furniture was old...

Only one toilet
,

beautiful house for a weekend!
The staff

With the high price I paid for the breakfast they could have had some more items, such as fried eggs and maybe hashbrowns, to cater to international guests. Also the juices in the breakfast were not kept cold and few of them taste very bad as they were off by end of the breakfast serving time :( It is best to keep milk and juice cold for safety reasons!,

Very nice hotel, breakfast was one of the best I have had on my trip so far! The room was very spacious and clean! Staff were also very professional

Nothing,

Facilities were fantastic. Breakfast was excellent with home made fruit juice, yoghurt, fresh fruit salad, breads, cheeses, meats, jams eggs. Just fantastic. Honesty bar with a great selection of local beers and wines. Comfortable beds. And recommendations for places to visit and eat.

Very noisy. The room was next to the restaurant and under the roof top bar. So a lot of noise until approx. 11 PM. At around 5 AM the cleaning of the restaurant floor etc. started, so not much quiet time.The pillows weren't great.Dining at the grill restaurant did not meet expectations. It sounded great, but was just about mediocre.No safe in the room.,

Friendly service, location close to city center.The room was very large with a nice bathroom.

Both tv’s reacted at the same time with the rc, parking sucked. But the rest SUPER!,

Super room :) terras was nice and beds were confy

It was very hot so not possible to sleep in the cupboard bed and had to move onto the floor. The hotel provided fans but they did not reach all 5 people in the room. 
,

The room was stunning, views incredible. The kids loved the (tiny) pool. It was lovely.

The stairs!!!,

Extra comfy beds!!!

Not much to say, the accommodations were great,

The room was clean, wifi was strong, bed was comfortable and I didnt hear much of the outside world even with window open. Its slightly off main tourism so it helped

While description does tell you about steep stairs house is on 3 floors and the only loo is on the ground floor. We chose it to self cater, only a microwave.,

Traditional, light airy, clean. Nathan and Lyn friendly.

There was nothing I could fault it on,

Loved the location, the bed,the staff and the decor. Will definitely come again and recommend.

Noisey rooms. Clearly audible Humming sounds of aircon in the room, noise from the street because of older window closings.,

Personnel was super friendly
Wonderful breakfast and accommodation

Surprisingly, some of the little things in the room were missing.  For example, there were no tissues in the bedroom, and no trash can except the one in the bathroom.,

The room was very clean and a good size.  The bathroom was very big, and had both a shower and a bathtub with a jacuzzi.  I had a meal at one of the restaurants at the hotel, the food was excellent, and a great value for money.
They only clean your room once a week , and that’s not enough ,,, but extra towels are always available at the reception

Feels like an example of style over substance at jam. I get they’re projecting a style and creating a cool brand to appeal to a youngish, funky clientele. However I still expect some basic level of service at E250+ per night. Parking was a joke and after a 6 hour drive I don’t appreciate the stress of having to run from bars to various shops and cafes near the hotel, to get change for street parking. If the hotel can’t provide a better parking solution, it should at s minimum be able to offer guests change for the street parking. Room was boiling hot but shouldn’t complain about the weather - a curtain that opens to allow the window to open easily would’ve been useful. Roof bar and pool terrace was nice. Looked like a number of clients were dealing with Saturday afternoon hangovers / come downs. Fine if that’s your thing but maybe not the place for a youngish family. Breakfast was ok and really pushes the self service to its limit. Providing a hot plate for hungover hipsters to cook their own eggs and burn themselves was pushing the minimalist style / service offering too far for me. An actual, real person cooking eggs would provide a better experience and wouldn’t break the bank. Jam has a defined style and could be special by turning up the service levels a little, themselves.,

Location, design, funky roof top vibe

We liked everything ,

All of it. Great location, in the center of the city. Very good apartment,  big rooms, high ceilings, clean, well decorated,  comfortable beds. We had such a great time there.

The TV is a long way from the bed and is a small TV so pointless where it is. Bath is a little dirty.,

Location was great
Beautiful design house, very kind owners wonderful location

It was all fabulous.,

The staff were friendly and helpful and assisted with extra assistance as I am a wheelchair user. The breakfast was superb - organic, fresh produce. I lovely stay. The location was very central.

The decor in the rooms were a bit dated and the sheets and pillows were not the most comfortable. There was also no room service so you have to go down to the restaurant to eat. The location is also not the greatest in terms of sightseeing in the city.,

Staff was very friendly and the restaurant provided good options for dinner. The workout room was also spacious and had a good amount of equipment.

Rooms too hot,

Staff
The room was comfortable

Breakfast was a real disappointment- space , plastic utensils , cardboard cups , limited choice ...terrible either do it well or don’t offer it , unless it’s free,

Nice cooling off pool and bar

Nothing ,

Great flats in the centre of town, superbly styled and comfortable.

Breakfast was extra cost and I didnt try it.Room was small and beds were almost pilled up.Room had dirty carpet and the towels had hair from other people.Bathroom could surely use a renovation(reminded me of old hotels that were renovated back in the 80's)As long as i had the balcony door open the room was okay but after one hour that door was closed the smell of the dirty carpet and the not properly air ventillated room was intense.Televison had only 10 channels (none of them in english audio or english subs)Television was "smart but didnt have wifi connection" plus no internet connection on the TV itself.The faucet was damaged and spilling water to the ground.Curtains had poor light insulation due to being worn out and one of them was out of guide rail.In the back side (terace) there is a pub and it was loud until 1am.,

the room that i got offered had a nice balcony.

Our bed was uncomfortable,

Staff was helpful, especially Rachid who helped us with all the information regarding the transport to the airport.

WiFi in room was spotty and very slow ,

Spacious room, central location, close to metro and supermarkets

The shower screen could be better fitted, so that the floor wouldn't flood every time one takes a shower.,

Comfortable bed, spacious room, great curtains.

I couldn't sleep because of the noise of the ventilation ( not airco ) . A real catastrophe .I thought is was the hot off the kitchen , but no .,

Size of the room +terras .
they are advertising pool temperature at 28 degrees, yet it was definitely not heated on both our stays there

Thje hand basins were too small and we would have preferred a proper shower not one over the bath,

The location was great apart from noisy concerts in the nearby square
It was next to the Grote Markt! Excellent location!

the shower was higher up on the floor than the rest of the bathroom floor. this led to the floor being wet all the time
the hotel is nicely located but it was uphill all the way there which was annoying,

very fresh. nice people working there. good price and close to almost everything

Reception asked multiple times for the booking confirmation because of problems with booking.com. Even called me after the stay. Very unprofessional.,

Very comfy chair. :)

Initially we were placed in a room with broken air conditioning, the unit dripped directly onto the bed. It was obvious they were aware as there was an extra fan in the room.  We we called the front desk they did move us but initially threatened that if we moved that night we would just have to move rooms the next day. In the end we were able to keep our new room but it could have been handled better by the staff
a little dust on the table

Paying for on-street parking outside was a bit of a faff as the hotel car park was full. The pillows were not very pleasant (one is a bag of cotton wool, the other a very thick memory foam). They're the only negatives here, everything else was great. ,

New, modern and slightly unique decoration in the building. Really nice. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and presentable. Location is not bad, 10 mins walk from a busier high street, and not far from city center.

Great location down the street from Friday Market -- walked everywhere.  Apartment as seen in photos, clean, great atmosphere, loved the exposed brick walls, gas fireplace, nice decor, terrace, views of church towers from bedroom windows. Book this apartment if available.
Very spacious and very clean.

Lacking room facilities , like ware-drop, no fridge , no coffee facility , no vanity items , small room  ,

Great location , calm but central

Not a fan of the bathroom. Wallpaper looked used and had stains. The shower curtain also had stains. The bathtub and the showerhead were small.,

Location, breakfast, huge and well designed room and hotel, fast check-in and check-out.

The room interior was fairly poor (since we are talking about a 4 star hotel). The room itself was very dark with a very tiny window (basically no natural light coming in). Furnitures will definitively need a refurbishment.,

The position was great, the hotel was overall clean and friendly staff.

It really needs to be clean before guests arrive. My husband actually got the hoover from the cleaner and hoovered himself. It’s a shame as that was the only negative but with the amount of dust and dirt it was a big negative.,

Our room type was great for a family. It’s in a great location and has everything you need for great value including a fully stocked kitchen it even had dish washer tablets and paper towels! Super helpful and friendly staff and easy parking.

Family room for five was generally set up in a nice way due to the bunk bed concept. However, for 5 people and luggage the room was small. Certainly not the place to spend more time than for sleeping and bathroom. The place can have somewhat of a youth hostel feeling, it needs some initiative from the guests to get stuff done.,

Nice hotel concept "charming concrete" which generates a quite unique visual identity. Many details (bunk beds for kids with sliding doors etc). The rooftop pool looked quite inviting and also the bar on top is very nice with some view over the city. The staff is friendly and helpful when approached.
We love it !!!

Rundown and poorly maintained room
,

Proximity to all important sites
Fantastic nice motel!  Staff super friendly and helpful.  Was very impressed and enjoyed our short stay.

The location is convenient to metro and in walking distance from city centre, but the neighbourhood is not interesting - few restaurants and no shops except small supermarkets.,

Quirky (Artsy!) decor, nice large rooms with coffee making facilities and safe, very good facilities for working in the room (rarely the case!). Very good breakfast buffet with healthy options.

No welcome when you came in. We were early,  we asked when we were able to get into our rooms, were told 3 PM. Came back, had to wait 20 minutes to be seen. No welcome. Then told that only one room was available and that the other employee was "stupid" to have told us otherwise.  Parking situation was also not explained although it is worth code and away from thehotel. My bathroom smelled funny. On the third night , after it got hotter outside I had to hold my breath to go in there. Smelled like sulphur. It was better in the morning,  but when I asked for a different room, they simply denied that there was a smell although a young woman who went with me to my room initially said she had smelled it before and could smell it now. While we were at breakfast they sent in someone else and then called to tell me that there was no smell. We left two days earlier than planned as I didn't want to inhale whatever it was for two more nights. There are also an untold number of awkward stairs in the hotel which my elderly mother struggled with. I would not recommend this place to anybody.,

Breakfast was good an the breakfast staff was very nice

Kitchen facility was kind of broken. No towel on Day 1,

Very convincing, close to both of centre and station. Very kind stuff

The rooms facing the main road and down the side were noisy from traffic, people but, above all, from several trams that only stop for a few hours at night and that ring a bell as they go up and down the road. 
The hotel was very busy and the pool and bar area were often too busy for their own good. The pool is a lovely touch but so small as to be little more than a place to cool down if really hot. 
One staff member contradicted me several times when I mentioned our room was noisy, even asking me why I thought the rooms at the back would be quieter (p.s. we moved to one on the second night and they were quieter, by a long shot!) She also told me that the endless and louder than loud trams were just 'the normal noise of a city' and generally talked back at me as if I were an annoyance instead of a paying customer. Having just had to pay upfront for our room, I didn't appreciate this at all.
Breakfast was ok but not impressive and the staff was unhelpful. You fry your own eggs on a hot plate. Very odd 
Some rooms were hot. There is no air con but you get a fan. In some rooms the windows don't open. ,

The vibe was cool and the retro design in the rooms well done. The pool, though small, is a nice touch and the area around and it and panoramic bar upstairs are genuinely pleasant. 
The beds were comfortable and the showers were excellent. 
The location was good and well connected.

Location in Kemmel is very good for hiking in general and for visiting World War 1 sites.  Apartment is very near to town square and its restaurants and has a grocery. Old church yard and several WWI sites are also within short walking distances.    Many restaurants are within a short drive as well as many beer breweries.  Apartment was very clean and spacious.  Parking on the street is pretty easy and accessible and possible on site depending on capacity.

The second bed was not comfortable. There was no iron. Sometimes we could hear the tenants of the building, and the dog of the tenants which was friendly came into the house when we left the patio door opened for some minutes.,

This house is located in a very quiet and beautiful neighborhood of Brussels, near to a tram station that takes you to the city center in ten minutes. The house was beautifully decorated and you could buy whatever you liked, since every object of the house was for sale. The layout of the house and the garden was very convenient. The twin bed was comfortable and there was hot water in the shower at all times. The kitchen was well equipped and the bathroom had everything we needed. It is perfect for a couple.

Kemmel village itself is a beautiful, lively and friendly place, well equipped with places to eat and drink and to buy provisions. We will definitely stay here next time we visit Flanders.

We needed an address for the parking space instead of a guide, as it helps to be able to put it into the navigation system.This is no fault of the host or the apartment, but Charleroi is kind of depressing. It's like it's a city that "has been" and some Googling afterwards confirmed that we were not the only ones to think so. It's hard to explain, but everything is grey and no one smiles at you. When we had parked the car, some young kids threw around fireworks/maroons; scaring the s... out of us. We actually ordered food by Uber Eats because we didn't want to go out.,

The communication with the host was good. All the details were explained and as late as the day before arrival I had some additional questions and they were answered really quickly by text. I've spent from 5th to 9th of July in this amazing b&b: it's set on Belgium country, but at the same time in a strategic position to reach each single corner of Belgium (we drove also to Amsterdam in 2:30 hrs..!). It's an old house completely renovated by Bernard and Martine: ask to them to show a small book with lot of pictures taken during renovation.Every morning breakfast was a pleasure: fresh fruit, home made cake, sweets taken fresh every morning, italian coffee served hot, plus home made marmelades, yoghurt, omelette... the best way to start every sightseeing tour on a city!Rooms are very tidy, with a beautiful bathroom with a giant shower with a view on country side (every morning we saw many rabbits!! so cue!!). Coffe and fresh water are complimentary all day long!In conclusion:  I've never seen a b&b so tidy, familiar and beautiful (with a real affordable price) like this one!Thanks so much to Martine and Bernard!#travelcampamichy

The mix up that started our holiday off on the wrong foot:Because of the overbooking, we were moved to another 'similar' hotel for one night, and then had to return another night. The cost of the other hotel, which was not as new or nice as the Premier Suites, was 299 euro for one night. We would not have gone to Antwerp if we needed to pay this cost per night for a hotel! The hotel staff said that they will try to reimburse us even part of the amount we paid, but I haven't heard anything from them nor seen any reimbursement. As for the hotel itself:There is a distinct unpleasant smell on the 7th floor. A guess would be some kind of sewage. There is a smell that permeates the property that is not very nice. There is a structural issue somewhere.,

The staff were genuinely nice and trying their best to managed the overbooking during the Easter weekend. The property is well cared for and nice. The pool table is a nice feature as well as the small deck. The room was nice, very clean. There were annoying little things in the room that could have been fixed, like a light switch next to the bed wasn't working, etc. But overall it was well appointed and for the most part pleasant. The breakfast includes eggs/bacon as well as yogurt, veggies, coffee, pastries. It's ok. The pastries were not good (seemed refrigerated or not really fresh) and there was limited options for hot meals. But for the cost it was fine.

Jo could not have done enough for us, he met us at the station in Brugge & listened to what we wanted to do whilst we were in Brugge. Once at his place he made us a coffee & then drew us a scenic route to take to see the best of the city and pointed out the best places we would enjoy visiting based on what we said we wanted to see.The location was perfect, a short walk from the station and into town. We took the scenic route down the canal opposite to walk into town, which took a little longer but we managed to view a lot of the sights before hitting the Christmas Markets. We stayed in the L Suite and the room was truly stunning, Jo is an interior designer and he has styled some amazing rooms. The handmade bath was beautiful & so relaxing- hands down one of the most luxurious rooms we have stayed in. The beds were also super comfy & the place was extremely clean.We can't recommend Kind of OJ enough, if you are thinking of booking, you will not be disappointed!

This property is a nicely furnished hotel in Berchem, a southern district of Antwerp. We booked Deluxe King Room. We needed a place to overnight, and found this nice accommodation perfect for that. Antwerp Expo is just a few minutes away by foot. Public transportation is close to the hotel, and you can easily reach Antwerp city center by tram. The staff was very friendly and willing to help. Room not totally clean - dust and dirt inside the wardrobe (obviously not swept / vacuumed for some time); one of the coffee cups provided had not been washed thoroughly; surfaces dusty (i.e. around and underneath coffee machine); water standing in both kettle and coffee machine (not sure whether filled for our benefit or left by previous occupants, therefore better for both to be empty to avoid confusion); our room was not cleaned during our stay and when we asked for our coffee pods to be replenished, we were advised there was a charge - it seems disingenuous to advertise a coffee machine as a feature and attraction of the room, but then not offer guests free pods do that they can use the machine throughout their stay; shower gel receptacle empty and hand wash receptacle virtually empty - better to remove these altogether if you only want guests to use the mini toiletries provided. The information given on booking.com is VERY misleading. It says the hotel opened in 2018- this IS NOT a new place. In fact, the apartment was very tired-looking: dirty grit and sealant, broken towel rail in the bathroom; blocked drain in the bathtub (standing in water way above your ankles when taking a shower is not a pleasant experience!) and the toilet filled up with water every time you flushed it. Also, on the list of the room facilities there are a few things, which simply are not available in the room: dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer (although washing facilities are available in the hotel), NO BIN in the kitchenette. The Elemis toiletries were a great treat, but we were provided with 30ml bottles of each product (shower gel, body lotion, shampoo and conditioner) for 4 people. The two big dispensers by the washbasin and bathtub were empty and looked like they were never filled up. The kettle was dusty and RUSTY inside! I had to give it a good scrub before being able to use it.I'm not sure what the hotel means by 'hypoallergenic' but feather pillows and dusty surfaces gave us all runny noses! Lastly, the car park. On the website it says: Public parking is available at a location nearby (reservation is not needed) and costs EUR 13.50 per day. However, only when you ASK about the parking, the receptionist will give you a EUR 5 voucher. We went to speak to the shift manager to let him know about the bathtub and the missing bin, he apologised and...it never got sorted. Very, VERY disappointing.,

This is NOT the fault of the staff, but a rookie mistake on my part. My partner and I decided to go to Bruges on the first weekend of Lockdown because travelling is still allowed in Belgium. We knew it would be quiet but we were okay with walking, driving, getting takeout meals, and seeing the sights. Unfortunately, we booked through Booking.com and chose the "excellent breakfast included" option, as it is slightly cheaper than paying once you've arrived. We didn't know that the kitchen/restaurant would be completely closed (that, in fact, the hotel itself would be closing on the day of our departure) and that room service would not be an option. Bagged breakfasts were provided, and while they had a variety of cold items (pastries, yogurt, fruit, juice, water), it was not worth spending 17+ euros per person per breakfast. I have learned my lesson not to pre-book breakfast but to buy it, if available, on a day-to-day basis. However, I commend the staff for a well-organized layout, easy access to hot tea and a variety of coffee drinks throughout the day, and real plates and cutlery available for guests to use at breakfast or for their takeout meals.,

Very clean; friendly staff; modern amenitiesIt's helpful to know that this hotel is slightly outside of town, and the views aren't much - buildings and a parking lot. However, once you get out of the parking lot and across the street, you are surrounded by the gorgeous scenery of Bruges. It may take 10-15 minutes to walk to the Markt (main square) area, but within two minutes of leaving, you will find that the walk is completely charming!

A perfect stay - great modern cottages, well equiped, super clean, quiet surroundings,.A short bicycle ride away from the city center and the beach. Loved having a terrace with table and chairs and a even a small garden with comfy sofa.Everything is very well thought of.

I asked for a quiet room and got a room facing the courtyard, away from the lift. I could sleep without problem. Thank you!The metro station is only 40-50 metres or so away. Free tea and coffee is available in the lobby.

Cons- The roof-top bar was booked-out so we could not visit it.- The pool hours only went until 1900, and most hotel guests would be out and about during that time.,

Pros- The room was a great price and large! Our room had a nice view of the street below, was spacious, included an air cooler (!!) that worked very well, and was cute. - The location was not as close as some other hotels might have been to the center of town, but it was near many stores and tram stops. This still made it very easy to travel around the city.- The hotel had a bar/restaurant inside and a pool.- Parking was only $15/day and was directly next to the hotel--very convenient. - There is a cat cafe (!) literally right next door for anyone else who loves cats.

The beds were comfortable and all ameneties to highest standards. A great place to relax and chill out!
Perfect location directly to the racing circuit

What's not to like?,

Nathalie runs a beautiful guest house.  It is well appointed close to centre of historic Brugge and has been very sympathetically renovated to ensure that guests feel as if they are in a home rather than a hotel.  Nathalie's breakfast is superb!
Clean room

Room smelled badly. Inclined wall right on top of the bed's head. No blinds on the window and the curtains were very thin so the sun went through. No sound isolation - could hear everything from the outside and hallways/other rooms.

The tv that turns on on its own gets tired very quickly. The breakfast buffet was very carb- and sugar-heavy: lots of breads, croissants, jams and sugary spreads, but few healthy options. There were yogurt and fruits, but it would have been nice to have more veggies for those who want a savory breakfast.Another weird thing: no lock on the bathroom door. Strange.,

The bed and pillow were super comfortable - we slept like rocks.The common areas are very large and nice. The location is also perfect.

The room wasn't very soundproof.,

I was only here for one night, but I enjoyed this hotel.  It is close to several casual restaurants with good food.  My room was small, but comfortable.  The rooftop bar and sitting area was very nice and gave you a nice view over the city.

Everything was really good.,

establishment, studio, location, staff, etc.

I was missing an extra power socket in the room. In order to charge a phone one has to disconnect the table lamp.,

The moment you enter the hotel you immediately feel welcome there! Which is not always the case at budget hotels.. Well deserved 10 points for that alone!Very pleasant and professional staff is there to greet you at the reception and provide with all the necessary. Very beautiful lounge. Although we did not have breakfast at the hotel, the breakfast offer looked very appealing.The location is great. Still very central but a little bit aside from the busy streets. Besides, parking on the street is for free on weekdays.

- Even though we were the only ones using our shower (thus private), it was in the ground floor (we were in the attic) which made our staying uncomfortable since we had a small kid. - Our private bathroom was also in the ground floor. Another bathroom existed in the first floor (below our bedroom) but it was shared.- The ladder leading out of bedroom (in the attic) was steep and not very convenient for a small toddler and a pregnant woman (like I am). - The "seaview" characterization is theoretically true but in practice it's just a small portion of sea viewable from a small window in the attic. - Wifi was not strong in the attic where we spent most of our time, when staying in the house. If Wifi is necessary for you, you have to go to the ground floor/public space.,

- Very pleasant and welcoming hosts. - Free parking.- Good common facilities (spacious kitchen and breakfast room and nice/calm terrace).- Proximity to the sea, only 3 minutes walking distance. - Breakfast was good (fried egg, ham/cheese/bread, salmon tranches, coffee & juice, cereals, milk and pastries).- Even though we didn't use them, there were some nice amenities like the shauna and the jacuzzi. The host was kind enough to borrow us a bike for free.

Check in procedure was a bit haphazard but staff were very helpful.,

Room was very comfortable and in a perfect location for Spa Circuit
Breakfast was lovely and plenty of it!You could make a coffee all times of the day in the breakfast room.

Food on site is limited, and no room service.,

Nothing in particular, I would said that overall this is a good experience as long as if you don't expect anything extra.,

the hotel was on construction, we didnt know about it. if i knew i wouldnt book it, cos i was with my little son, i dont like he breathes the dusty air in the hotel. the staff seemed very unexperienced. one time she called for taxi, and she didnt inform us about how long the taxi will come, we were outside waiting, and after 15 minutes i went back to reception to ask, and she called the taxi, it took him another 10 minutes to arrive. during breakfast, there was one lady looking after everyone. we had to wait to be served, i think after 20 minutes she came over to take our order. they dont have open buffet which wasnt convenient. the options were very limited, and not the best quality. there were workers on our floor all time, as the construction was going on during the day. they had their industrial cleaning tools and machines on the hall way just left like that. so the money i paid was definitely way too much to our experience.yes, room was nice and spacious. thats the only part i enjoyed.,

is the best accommodation we have stayed. The upstairs studio is beautifully arranged. Light and airy with tasteful decor and great facilities Isabel and Marc are very welcoming hosts. The studio is ideally situated in a lovely rural location yet within easy travel distance to vibrant Tongeren

You will need a car or a motorbike to get to the market, restaurants and other places.
However, I think the need for your own transportation is standard for most European vacations unless you stay in a more crowded urban area.
This is a very nice and quiet setting in the beautiful farms and quiet country lanes of Belgium.,

Marc and Isabel are great hosts.  
I am a cyclist so the location was excellent to start bicycle rides and  hiking in the quiet country lanes that go through the surrounding farm fields and also to some interesting outdoor art . It was very nice to cycle from the apartment to the Netherlands and other places in Belgium to watch the spring classic bicycle races.
The apartment was very clean and functional and I think it works very well for 1 to 3 people.  It has a nice kitchen with an electric stove, teapot, coffee maker, microwave and cookware.
 The kitchen is well ventilated with the hood above the stove. The large shower is also very nice with plenty of hot water and the skylight in the bathroom is very pleasant when the sun comes through in the daytime.
They have a very nice soft mattress that is good for people with back issues and the skylight with closable shade above the bed it's also very nice.
The dining room table, chairs, sofa and television are great for relaxing.
I was able to keep my bicycle in there attached garage which was also very helpful.
There is also a very nice yard behind the apartment with table and chairs to sit outside.
Room cleaning had not been done until 9pm, even though we checked in 3pm,..I don't know why.

I reserved my room, a standard double room. I did my checkin late in the evening and they gave to me the room 112 , the last one available probably. It was a bit warm and I went to the windows to refresh a bit, but they were locked windows, it means just the glass with no possibility to open in any way. I am clausrofobic and I immediately went at the reception to ask for a different room. The guy at the reception told me that they could not do anything as the hotel was fully booked. I asked to have the money back that I have to him 5 minutes before and he told that he was not authorised to give money back. After 10 minutes, and even though he said that he was afraid to call the boss,  finally he did explaining the situation and the hotel manager said : 'the guest can only stay there..or there or nothing, we can change the room only Tomorrow". I informed again the guy at the reception that probably I would have not arrived at the day after if during the night I had got breath problems. I asked again my money back . And they told me NO. I wanted to call the police but I didn't because it was very late and I was super tired. I slept with the door open. How can you turn your head if someone is talking about health?Moreover at the checkin they charged 100 euros without to show me the payment machine. The rooms were quite warm 24.5! and we could not turn the heating down. We had the window open but then you have the noise from bar downstairs, not much but so that you notice.  The hotel is near European parliament and the natural history museum but a 25 mins walk from the old town. We were here on a Sunday and the worst thing is that the restaurants and cafes are not open around that area that day, so be aware. We ordered hotel food which was excellent, even for vegetarians, and delivered to our room. The bar serves outside on terrace and that was nice too. But it's on the street, not a cute backyard. Be aware if you have kids. The breakfast was confusing. I had to ask 3 times and was still not quite sure how it worked. But bottom line is it's 25 EUR per person for a takeaway breakfast. I think in Covid times they could just do a basic 10 EUR menu with coffee, croissant, juice and some fruits and yoghurt. Not anything complicated. We didn't have it in the end but had breakfast around the corner at a cafe outside. The staff were welcoming. Peculiarity includes that they'd rather you go to your room and dial 9 for everything. Perhaps it's a cocid measure. They don't want you to ask by reception. 9 works, they transferred us to the right person each time. Service was swift. So I'm happy with the service.

Very close to tram stop which made getting around very easy. The area is very quiet, choice of bars or restaurants approx 15 mins walk away or a short tram ride. Supermarket nearby if required.

We didn't have a reliable Wi-Fi connection in our room. Only in the reception and dining room on level 2.

There was nothing to stop the shower water from going onto the drying area and toilet! No screen!
There didn't seem to be any internal sound proofing from revellers who kept us awake for quite a while.
As with most hotels,  the breakfast was cold.. e.g. eggs, uncooked bacon.
. ,

We were pleased to have been upgraded... our room was lovely and spacious. Our bed was huge. It was new and modern and very clean. The bed was really comfortable.

Good choice of breakfast food... nice coffee etc 
Liked our big panorama windows in our room. All in all, mostly pretty good!

nothing- the price we paid for for a  hotel did not meet a three star hotel expectation at all. I would never stay here again. ( please stay away). The photos shown vs reality of the hotel doesn't match too.

Good location, staff was friendly, bed was very comfortable.
Great flat in a wonderful location. The owners are extremely nice and helpful. We'll definitely come back.

Good location near to the centre of Brussels but it wasn’t noisy. Good size room with comfortable bed.

Good location, with parking nearby, big room with nice design, very comfortable bed and microclimate, big TV.

I was so disappointed because we visited Belgium in Summer and we were quite sweating in the room although at night it was A BIT chill (there was a small fan tho), but still it was so hot inside the room. When we opened the window for the air to get in there were some noises from the cars and garbage bins and other source of noise. I just hope the property informed the customers about this. I understand it’s cold during winter, but I also hope they understand it’s hot during Summer. But overall it was fantastic!,

The pool and gym were very clean and spacious. Even in times of COVID-19, there was a nice management of the pool and gym so everyone can enjoy them. The air conditioning was super nice to have and was on before I checked in so the room was already cool. The staff was always super kind and helpful.

Sometimes you find a dirty oven when checking in, sometimes you can find the dishwasher machine with dirty dishes inside.

The only thing missing was any kind of food service. But that is not their fault. It's a pandemic, after all. I just wish that had been clear when I booked my room, because my booking said that breakfast was included. It was not. :-/,
