I was booking a room at ~23:00 online from the road. In particular, I needed a parking. The selected Accor Hotel disposed of one. At 23:30 I get a call from the hotel saying I would get another room in another hotel in Brussels - to do some, please come to the initially booked hotel. It was already difficult to find the hotel I have booked due to endless construction areas and one-way-streets. The new hotel was in the pedestrian zone and did not dispose of a parking. It took me 25 min to get there (constructions, one-way-streets, walking ...). I spent another 30 min to bring my car to a public garage and was in bed at 01:00. The bad rating is due to the fact that a room was offered with a parking and and the end I did not get it as booked. The employees tried to do their best.

Initially I was put in a room  without air-conditioning (I didn't know this hotel had such rooms because I always had air-con on previous stays here).  Temperature was 37C - 34C during my stay (which was for studying and an exam, so I was in the room most of the time) and not even a fan in the room.  After I complained I was given a room with air-con which made a huge difference.  I really do like this hotel, but with a caveat: in the summer you MUST insist on air-con or book elsewhere.  Also the wifi drops out more often than it should I think.,

Staff are excellent - really helpful.  Gardens are beautiful and peaceful, backing onto the World Heritage Site (Great Begijnhof Spanish Quarter).  Location very good for me as I was sitting an exam in the university.  I enjoyed my stay after the initial problem of air-con was sorted.  I've  stayed here before and would stay here again, and would recommend it to friends (but... air-con is a must because the Belgian summer heat can rival Spain, which is great if you like it hot and you are sight-seeing)

Didnt like the fact that I paid hotel 45 days in advance. Whole amount. I know it was non refundable rate, but first time in my travel life I have to paid before check in. So please dont repeat it was non refundable. 
So anyone who book via booking will pay right away, what can be crazy if you book 90 days in advance. Expecially if you stay longer and your company is paying. 
Other Hotel offer discount for early book, and in this Hotel you will pay as soon as you book (if you choose non refundable rate).
Not nice. Managers sould think abiut this kind of move. I understand it was non refundable, but it is just crazy to make me pay so many days before check in.
I will arrive again, because I liked Hotel, but please change this policy. ,

We had to order and pay for our breakfasts for the two days in advance, 15 euro per person. The breakfast was very poor value for money indeed. No choice of cereal, just corn flakes in a plastic tube. The cheese slices curled at the edges, no fruit. Just orange juice (no choice), cornflakes, roll with some ham and cheese and coffee. 15 euro!! We have stayed in Yores hotels before so know that by comparison this was VERY poor!  On the last morning, there were no cereal bowls or cereal - we had to ask for some. The stairs to bedrooms share access to the cafe WC!  The door was always open with a constant spell of urine etc emanating up the stairs. The stairs and bannisters were wobbly and insecure. Both bedrooms had curtains which did not close properly due to missing hooks. The carpets needed a good clean. Two of our party were in their early 80s. We were on the 2nd floor which they could manage okay but there was no light up the final three steps - it was broken - and though we pointed this out it was not fixed.Paid staff were friendly but the owner was not - no welcome or enquiry as to our stay. The whole stay at Old Tom was a big disappointment.,

Location was central.  Bed linen and towels were clean. Cafe was nicely decorated.
Hospitality and service was impeccable.    We look forwards to returning.

Even if breakfast is not included, the owner nicely provides croissants in the morning plus coffee or tea self served. Area is easily connected with many public transports, and 15 minutes walk from the Cathedral. Rooms are nicer that expected, and brand new (a nice terrace not shown in the photos)

Minibar could be filled with drinks not only 2 mineral water in cans. ,

Friendly staff. Easy check in check out. Clean rooms, nice bath rooms, big rooms with lots of space.

Not any item about this to say, all was wonderful and fine.,

From arrival to departure you're in a great place, safe and confortable. We enjoyed the calm and the nice accommodation. The owner came introducing himself and was very kind to offer a drink.

I didn't like that you can not charge things to your room. As a business traveler it is more convenient to be able to have access to all the hotel offers (restaurant, bar, etc.) without having to worry about carrying cash or cards on you.Also, although there is a workout space available at the gym next door, it does not open until 08:00 which is 2 hours later than I like to exercise.,

1) The designated fire escape from the room was an old, rusty, vertical ladder that was accessed by climbing out the bedroom window; 2) The banister running up the stairs was insecure; 3) The bathroom had been recently refitted but it was cramped, there were exposed wires next to the sink where the electrical socket had come off the wall and the shower wasn't cleaned thoroughly; 4) Towels and bed linen were threadbare and mattress was old and unsupportive; 5) Door to the room jammed and door handle was coming off; 6) the room decor was very old and shabby, as was the furniture; 7) We were woken up at 05:00 by doors slamming downstairs,  this went on for at least an hour (the bare walls and floor in hall and stairs amplified the sound). I could list more but I think this description is enough to illustrate the poor condition of the accommodation.,

Nothing. Everything was absolutely wonderful!,

The interior of the building made a great impression on us. The photos reflect the nature of the place in 100% - everything fits together in every place. We were positively surprised before we got to the facility - the host clearly explained how to get there and where to park. On the ground floor, right after entering through the beautiful, large door, we could use the living room, where we could relax with a welcome beer or coffee and feel like in a small cafe. Delicious breakfast is served in the same room, options for vegetarians and vegans were a nice touch. The host is on site practically all the time and is very helpful - full of professionalism. The rooms are on the floors, there is no elevator but that only adds to the charm of this magical place. Both the room with a balcony overlooking the street and the room overlooking the garden are beautifully decorated, clean, with comfortable beds and an equipped bathroom. Fast WiFi throughout the building and the proximity of a tram stop (literally 10 meters from the building) are additional advantages of this place. Thank you for your hospitality!

This B&B is located close to the centr of Ypres, just a short walk from the excellent Flanders Fields Museum, and Menin Gate, as well as close to a range of very good bars and restuarants. The property is very tastefully furnished, rooms are spacious, and very comfortable, and there is a lounge and garden sitting area too, our hosts were welcoming and knowledgable about the local area, helping us to plan our stay and get the most out of the time we had there. Breakfast was delicious. And in the current Covid time - everything was clean, all precautions were followed, and local retuarants etc also all appeared to be following proper procedures, wiht masks mandatory in the town centre.

The staff was really friendly. We had a really warmly welcome and our stay at the hotel was really pleasant. It was my birthday and because of that I received a bottle of wine!! Also it is great to know that breakfast was until 12 o'clock!! The hotel is 5 minutes walking from European Parliament and from the bus station with busses leading you to the centre in 15 minutes.
For sure I would recommend this hotel.

I am never disappointed with Old Tom. I enjoy staying there, and appreciate it for being a small well run hotel.,

I have stayed at Old Tom on a number of occasions over the past 25 years, and will stay there again when I next visit Ypres. For me Old Tom is perfect - excellent location, staff and restaurant. The restaurant has been redeveloped over the years and is very "light" and has a good feel about it. The accommodation remains the same as it has always been, and although some may consider the bedrooms to be "old" I think of it as querky and very fitting for the building and its history. The bedrooms are comfortable and clean and have everything needed for a short stay. If you are looking for a 5* hotel experience then go stay in a 5* hotel. If you are looking for a friendly, small, well run, comfortable hotel that serves very good food and is ideally located on the town square, then Old Tom is perfect. I shall continue to return.

Central good location with nice and quiet room.

The bathroom was not too clean, the room was cold at our arrival. There were no carpets which made it feel even colder.,

The location was good, the hotel is in a small square with nice restaurants and very close to the city center with all the attractions.

There was plenty of choice for breakfast, hot and cold , cereals, juices, breads, pastries however anything hot went cold very quickly when it hit the cold plates...they need a plate warmer!It would be handy if staff seated guests, as every morning the breakfast room was full and people were left to look for their own seats and ended up asking for help. There were lots of families looking for larger tables of four and 6 and some of these were occupied by couples and we even had someone ask if they could share our table, and there were three of us. Some forethought is needed when the hotel is busy to accommodate breakfast seating. We left our room at 10.30am and when we returned to our room at 3pm...it had not been cleaned, so we went downstairs to have a drink and returned at 4.30pm and saw that the "Please make up our room" card had been removed and assumed it was ready, however upon entering this was not the case, the bed still needed making, towels needed replacing and bins needed emptying...we decided to give them another 30mins and upon our return the cleaners were still in the room. It had rained the whole day and was still raining and by this time we just wanted to rest and get into our room. We explained that we had already tried three times to enter our room and had been waiting since 3pm. They said five more minutes...so we ended up waiting in the hall and finally after another 10-15 mins the room was ready, unfortunately the soap had been taken and not replaced which was an inconvenience, but it was our last night and let this pass. I understand that at peak times this might happen and if potential delays to room service had been communicated to us we would have planned our day a little differently and made plans to return to the room at a later time.,

The hotel is newly built and quite modern, good for tourists and business travellers located right next to Brugge station and public transport.We ate in their restaurant the first night and while the menu is very limited, we were not disappointed...our steak was done to perfection and the meal was delicious. Breakfast itself had great variety and value for money. We had a family room and it was spacious, modern and clean and handy to have USB ports beside the bed and in the phone. Towels and Toiletries were plentiful and ironing board in the room was great! Parking was literally just outside the front door and very cheap and remember to have the hotel validate your parking ticket during check out. For three nights parking it cost us just under €10.00. It was approximately a 10 minute walk into the centre and took a little longer if you chose to walk through the park. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Everything was great!,

Katrien and Steven ,Our hosts, were so kind and helpful and made us feel so welcome. They went to a lot of effort to give us a huge amount of information about where everything is in the town and what to see.. also there is a fascinating link with the history of Ieper in that Steven’s own grandfather who lived at La Porte Cochere was a stone mason and with his brothers actually built the Menin gate, and the lions on top and many of the allied head stones ... he had all sorts of amazing photos of Ieper before, during and after the building of the city after the end of the war.The B&B itself is elegant and beautifully decorated and very comfortable.. the rooms are large and the bathrooms likewise .. well equipped and with everything you might need ..plus the bed was VERY comfortable and large!! Location couldn’t be better.. moments from the beautiful heart of Ieper and all the eateries and shops and the incredible Cloth hall where the museum is , and the Menin gate. All this and yet really nice and quiet at night.Breakfast was excellent with eggs and meats and cheese , and lovely bread and Steven’s home made jams!! Thank you SO much Katrien and Steven for being so lovely, for the great chats, and for making us feel so very welcome . We had a truly lovely stay, and have in the mean time recommended you to friends and family alike!! See you again! X

Great accommodations, beautiful interior design and a great breakfast service. The host was also very helpful and communicative, we couldn't have found a better place to stay while in Brussels. Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a cool and welcoming place to stay.

It was great place stay in Minsk and owner is very helpful for eveything. For sure I'll consider here as first for my next stay.

a little expensive for a single room,

friendly staff, good breakfast, clean room. decent hotel!
This B&B was by far the best we have ever stayed in, great hosts, beautiful house and fantastic location

Unfortunately this quiet and beautiful place is out of the city center, so you need a car if you want to go to a restaurant or to go out for a walk. The Herentals city center is just 5 minutes by car.,

I am italian and I usually travel 15-20 days a year in Belgium.In 4 years of travels, this was the best room I have ever had. Indescribable comfort, it is perfect to relax yourself!Very quiet, the view on the canal is beautiful and peacefull.

In house parking price could have been more guest friendly, otherwise everything was fine,

The overall art nouveau atmosphere of the house was splendid! Also the breakfast was proper, fresh and ready upon our request at a rather early hour:-)

Doors not very sound proof. The cleaning lady came in twice without knocking in the morning while we were sleeping (at 8 am).,

Short distance to the European Parliament. Good breakfast.

the rooms are quite old (and it's not evident from pictures), strange policy to preauthorize 50 euro upon our arrival and they justify it as a rule of all NH hotels, even if you paid all the money online!,

the rooms are big. not so far from the center. not really looks like a 4 stars hotel.

Nothing, good value for money,

Location, close to many restaurants and accessible for many business centers as well. The staff was very helpful also. Breakfast was delicious.

Its not easy to find the entrance.,

Nice modern room, very comfortable beds.Excellent breakfast and very friendly staff.
Friendly and helpful staff. Good breakfast. Good advice. Bike rental.
The bed ia great, nice big comfortable room and nice professional staff!

Motel one is incredibly central, 15 min from Brussels Central Station, 10min from Cathedral and Central Square "Grand Place".The place feels brand new, the ground floor lounge is very nice.The bedroom was very small but very comfortable.Only small "not so great" comment is about check in and check out time, it is a very large hotel, and we had to queue more than 20 min to check in and check out too. Maybe more check in counter could be an idea to pursue especially as everything check out and check in is concentrated between noon and 3 pm. Otherwise would definitely recommend as great value for money.

Bathroom very worn down. Breakfast for 12 Euro was a rip-off. ,

Good location. Friendly staff. Comfortable beds.
Excellent location, friendly staff, brilliant facilities (complimentary tea and coffee) and very clean

I’m visiting Minsk quite often. That was my best experience. Lovely host, great location. It was way better than I expected. Looking forward to come back at stay at the same place! 
Thank you very much!
Fabulous staff who really looked after us well. Very modern hotel with great facilities in a quiet location but within an easy walk to the centre.

Nothing not to like,

The owners were so welcoming and informative, their knowledge on the local area and history was excellent, nothing was too much trouble, they spoke excellent English and entertained us with local stories and generously shared their local beers on the terrace

Not that I know of.,

The place is amazing though not very central. Having said that I was there for a work meeting so can't complain. The facilities were above my expectations and the owner was very helpful. I was served with a wonderful dinner and breakfast. All in all, a very nice place to stay alone or family.
It was simply a great time spent in Brussels. The owners are very willing and forthcoming people who make your stay to feel like home - and feel really the good old Brussels. Thank you very much!
Great location without it being bang in the centre of town but close enough to walk to. Lovely staff and service.

They took 45 Euro for  breakfast when you dont book breakfast in advance, which is around double the price when you book in advance. 20 Euro for a breakfast is already to much even if it is ok. I made the mistake that I did not asked for the price for the breakfast. So I took the risk to get tough questions from my company how I can decide to go for a breakfast for 45 Euro.   :-(,

Hotel has a nice style with different pieces of art in each room.

Room was on the small side.,

Super charming and cute spot - great vibe overall. Nice addition of free coffee and tea, and beautiful little courtyard. Room was well equipped (though small), and staff were very kind. Loved the toiletries they provide.

No normal tea bags only ones with funny flavours. Only very small cups designed for expressly coffee,

Spacious room with lots of windows. Good air conditioning comfortable bed. Quite room. Good breakfast.

Breakfast was good and included in the price.  The silly thing is I assumed the eggs would be scrambled and they came out fried.  Delicious but I should have clarified what eggs I would like.,

The hotel team are great, answering every question and nice and polite at all times.  The rooms were spacious with netting to keep out the flies and good curtains to keep out the light.  Love the honest box for the coffee in reception, happily pay for good coffee,

Even though the brasserie next door has some options and a great terrace, the location of the B&B can make it difficult to get alternatives for dinner. Decent restaurants, some with delivery services (e.g. Bella Ciao), are available, but it costs and can be complicated to arrange. But that's rather minor if you order well in advance.,

Comfortable and clean rooms, friendly service. The terraces of the brasserie next door look directly into the green. COVID-friendly thanks to the spacious rooms that allow taking/bringing meals (including breakfast) indoors. There's plenty of parking space.

Unfortunately, No mini fridge w/drinks, no phone and no coffee machine/electric kettle available inside the room. Don’t know if they have room service but I always go down in the bar to get my cold/hot drinks.,

The 7th floored hotel is welcoming and cozy with a lounge bar nearby the reception. Staff is efficient and kind. The location is 7min to the train station, 10min to Grand place by foot and from there you can already go in every tourist spots. My room is always tidy and clean. I love the restaurant Floyd’s infront of the hotel. I recommend this place and would definitely come back to stay.
Hotel in the city centre.  Near the bus stations.
Everything great and very nice staff
The only thing is on 5th floor & don’t have lefts to carry up on 5th floor that was pity :( but the rest was perfect I hope they can do something abt it in future
Great room and facilities

Nothing,

We loved everything about it -  the décor,  bedroom and facilities, the breakfast and above all else the welcome we received from Steven and Katrien. We have already recommended it to friends and would definitely stay there again.
Spacious rooms, great hifi/TV equipment and nice view on the river.

In my opinion a small change I wish for is more separation between the bedroom and bathroom, and more soundproofing, but we recognize this may be difficult for this particular space/architectural plan. It was still ok for us. We would absolutely stay there again.,

Across street from tram in a beautiful local (non-touristy) neighborhood of Brussels. Very hospitable owner family. We like staying in places with local character and this place has it, yet the rooms are modern and very clean. Good bathroom and shower; comfortable bed and linens. The price is right.

Disposable sheets; they are uncomfortable, static and not sustainable. We already read about this in the comments, so we brought our own sheets and put them around the duvet and the pillows. We also think the amount of towels was too little for the time we spend here. Especially because we used one as a carpet in the bathroom, where the floor was very cold.,

We loved the small, cozy cottage!! It had a nice fire place (you can buy wood in the small village), comfortable bathroom with such a good shower !! The bed was very comfy, allthough we brought our own sheets, because we read about the disposable sheets provided. Nice surprise was the beer Luc gave us, but also the Dolce Gusto coffee maker which provides a good cup of coffee. Make sure to bring your favorite cups! Hiking trails are right in front of the cottage, so don't need your car to get to a starting point.

Parking prices are a little high.,

Lots of space to park, room service available 24hrs, lots of things to do in the hotel aswell as around the hotel. Bus stops accessible as soon as you step out of the hotel to go into the city centre and to access the tourist spots
Everything was just perfect.
Everything was perfect. A home away from home.

Something that was not so disappointing because everything else was great-the view from our room was on some construction area.,

Hotel is new, rooms are clean and quite comfortable. 
Restaurant and breakfast are good as it’s expected in this kind of hotel.
Parking area is right in front of the hotel. It’s public parking with enough space and very reasonable price of 3,5€ for 24 hours.
Hotel is about 20 mins walk to the city centre and it’s very nice walk through the Minnewaterpark.

A fan should be provided in the rooms in the hot summer.,

Nice hotel in convenient location for exploring Ypres. Can walk to many bars, restaurants, sights, etc. Very friendly and helpful owners, gave good advice for sight-seeing. Simple breakfast due to current restrictions. Very nice and clean room with comfortable beds. On-street parking right outside hotel.

The TV cable was not working but that was due to the provider, but we use the time to rest without distractions so it was not that important.,

The host was super nice and was interested in knowing our needs, breakfast and food very nice and organized despite corona. The room was spacious, comfortable and very clean.
Super clean and spacious enough for the cost. Rooms are basic but have what you need. Staff were very nice and helpful.
Spacious room, close to old city and parking/station, excellent breakfast.

Great location for Xmas markets. Great room for the price with everything we needed. Walking distance to main town centre shops and lots of attractions. Great cafes and restaurants on the same street.
Nice and clean

We booked the hotel for activities in Valenciennes and didn't know what to expect in Peruwelz. It turned out to be a wonderful and relaxed stay. Rooms are spacious. Staff are more than polite and help wherever they can. From there it only takes 2.5 hours to get to Paris.

Extremely friendly hosts, there was no need to visit tourist information as Steven provided maps and suggestions of what to see in the time available.  Location is fantastic, very close to town square.  Breakfast was actually far more than we could eat.  As the weather was so warm a fridge was stocked with bottled water in the hall.  Lovely terrace to sit out in the evening.  Only possible improvement would be small fridges in the rooms to keep any drinks or food purchased cold.
Great atmosphere. Clean and cozy room with great view. Delicious breakfast.
Paul is an excellent host. The great view of the room  on the garden. The  integration of the new realizations in the older ones. The place is well connected by tram 3 and 4

The floor was a bit cold. However heating facilities were more than sufficient to get the house warm. A carpet could help =).,

The location was located right in the middle of the Ardennes. You could start your hike from the property.

Nothing - just be aware it is a 45 minute walk from bus station if travelling from Brussels Charleroi,

Good size room for short stay with tea making facilities and mini fridge which was a bonus! Pool and gym facilities included, I even attended a Bodypump class at no extra cost. Will definitely return on my next visit to Brussels!

Breakfast is ridiculously expensive,

Clean and well approinted room

Very cozy bootique hotel in a nice part of town.The breakfast is great - much better than in your average business hotel in Brussels.Rooms are modern and quiet.The staff is very friendly and helpful.
Good location and verry good staff
Clean and quiet. Staff very friendly and helpful. V good breakfast. Close to Grote Markt.

Lack of plates and bawl available for the hotel guests during corona times.,

Clean rooms, good bar, friendly staff, comfortable bed.

Breakfast was simple but very tasty and we were made to feel very comfortable.

The best place we have ever stayed.,

A quit house with all the facilities. Best for energetic childrens to run over and play in large garden. Excellent view over the entire village. The host Mr. Like was so welcoming and friendly. Suggest for people who wants to have their own time to relax.
Nice Hotel all around

Very low end area, few shops or amenities.

Nothing,

Everything ; the styling, the comfort, the staff, the hospitality, the breakfast and the pool table. The location could be considered a bit far away from the mai attractions but a much safer location. Caroline was very helpful and so sweet, many thanks to her.

Our view was over a construction site.  Not that this was a problem and it will one day be something more attractive i'm sure.,

Very clean, very modern, staff were friendly. Decorated to a high standard.  Room included a bath, shower, safe, fridge, tea making facilities, iron & ironing board, hair dryer, bath robes.  Excellent breakfast with seating outside for when the weather is beautiful.

all was good,

comfortable room with friendly staff, who were coping well with the new Covid regulations.breakfast had to be pre ordered (no problems) with a choice of continental or cooked.

Toilet is very clean but a little bit smelly. I have to close the toilet cover before sleep.,

Very good location. 5mins walk from train station to the hotel and 10mins walk to the scenic spots. Staffs are nice and friendly.

Nothing!,

The studio room had a kitchenette which was very well equipped. The reception staff were all pleasant and helpful. The location was perfect for the Christmas markets.

I booked this apartment 5 weeks in advance, and at that time I had a lot of options. I only wanted two things: 1) a place near the train station and 2) air conditioning. This apartment advertised both. Imagine my surprise when I got there and the air conditioner was broken. The apartment owner claimed to not have known it was broken, but somehow I figured it out in 5 minutes. You better believe she charged me a premium for having an "air conditioner" too. I complained to Booking.com and the apartment owner told them that she would have it fixed first thing in the morning. Never happened. All I can say is if you claim to have certain amenities, you better have them. I was deceived/lied to, and there's nothing I can do about it. This bad review doesn't compare to my hot and sweaty 5 days in that dump, but it's all I've got.

Large open plan room with balcony. Easy check-in, clean and modern. Very relaxed atmosphere.Complimentary coffee and minibar with honesty box and large shared lounge if required.

I chose this hotel because of the pool (I filtered and this one showed up) - since I'm 7months pregnant. But a note near the pool said the water in the pool was too cold to swim in, because something was broken. A lady overthere said I could go in at my own risk.There was no note/email upfront or a small briefing when we checked in. Which would have been kind.Therefore we couldn't enjoy a swim. I shared this with the lady of the reception during checkout, but her only response was: ah yes it will be fixed next week. But what's that helping me? No apologies or something.. Normally I wouldn't have cared too much, but now since it was the reason of my choice it wasn't nice.That's the only minor. Besides this, all was well. Just bad luck I guess.,

Room was perfect. Beds were comfy and seperate which we requested for with ny friend.Starbucks coffee. Clean hotel in general, nice ambiance.Location nothing special but a lot of busses that go to the city centre - also walkable if you enjoy a good walk.

The coffe machine did not worked, one bed light was broken and the whole system of lightning of the room was very bad, and no handmade painting can fix that.,

Excellent place to stay in Brussels.  Very helpful staff, cosy and comfortable rooms, lively neighbourhood with plenty of restaurants and bars close by.

Hotel is not very visible arriving - I were supposed to call Hotel, but man working that night navigate me by phone directly to Hotel door.,

Nice staff, SUPERB breakfast with a lot of choice.Clean and spacious rooms.Parking at the hotel door secured by the city = 3,5 EUR/24 hours!!!! Nothing,

Superb location in the centre, with parking opposite the reception. The owners advised that we could park in free carpark nearby, but we chose to leave it next to the hotel. The owner offered to feed the meter for us while we were sightseeing. The parking was free from 6pm til 9am the next morning.Comfortable room with an excellent breakfast. Nothing was too much trouble...we hope to return.

Wifi ,

I really liked the location of the property. It’s exactly where we wanted to be right near the buses and train station for daily trips out and also near to the square with shops and restaurants. I thought the rooms were incredibly nice for a 3 star and didn’t expect as good as it actually was! The beds were comfy, the bathrooms were clean with hand wash, body and hair wash along with nice other additional things such as shower cap and shoe polish. There were a fair amount of plug sockets in the room which is always a handy and a fridge which I’ve never found  in other hotels of 3 stars - at least back at home. The staff were very friendly always greeted us when leaving and entering throughout our stay and the WiFi was really good too.

The photos  of the appartments that appear in Booking have nothing to do with the reality. The place appears plenty but is completly the opposite. We booked an appartment for 4 adults and the space availiable was really small. For example the wall was 20-30cm from the foot side of the bed, making going to the other side of the bed to sleep  quite uncomfortable.      A few days after we booked i,t we asked for an extra bed but they never said that puting the bed in the hallway (that was the only spot it could be placed) we wouldn't be able to move around the place. Additionally it was not in the appartment and we had to ask it again (arriving late at night).     The blankets had hairs on them.,

In the city centre, close to everywhere. Really clean, free tea and coffee in reception staff were excellent really helpful especially Sebastian when checking us in - gave lots of recommendations and help.

The location of the hotel was amazing, close enough to main square but far enough away from the madness. Staff were lovely and beds were really comfortable!

Marie and her husband were fantastic at every point in our stay - staying up late for our arrival, to the incredible breakfast spread and even walking us in the right direction of the centre! We couldn’t have wished for a better stay. The rooms were incredibly clean and comfortable.

I can honestly say I didn’t have one grumble, other than they were fully booked after we decided to stay a second night in Ypres, meaning we had to find alternative accommodation. ,

The property was incredibly close to the main square. All the staff we encounter were very friendly and helpful. I was traveling with a friend by motorbike and we were able to park our bikes right outside the front door. As a weird twist of fate I had stayed in this same building about 16 years ago on a trip with Army Cadets when it was under a different name, and didn’t realise until I was standing in front of it. I’m so glad to have re-found this little gem of a location and will definitely be aiming to go back with my partner! 
Breakfast was lovely, a standard continental set up, with fresh cooked eggs, bacon and toast if desired. 
It’s not what I would describe as modern inside, but it’s clean, functional, the staff are friendly and the showers were hot. What more could you want!?

Price,

Rooms & breakfast

Double bed but only two single duvets (no doubles available apparently), bathroom fan is EXTREMELY loud also. Also, the room is quite small (we had a queen room) and even for two of it, it was a bit cramped. But we were hardly in the hotel and it was just for the weekend so we didn't mind as much.,

Really great location, really good price and a 24/7 bar! It's literally 5 minutes away from Grand Place and right behind is the cathedral which is HUGE! Staff are super nice and friendly and the area is quiet and very safe!Bed is super comfy - we slept like babies!
Very nice hotel. Close to city center. Only 17 min walk from grand place. Cozy rooms with perfect beds. Clean and warm rooms. Friendly staff, special thanks to Alexandrina who was very helpful.

The room was very comfortable and a great location for an early flight. The transfer to the airport was very welcomed. The hosts provided great information on food near by. I also forgot some items in the room and the hosts ensured they got back to me!

The building, like many in the city, is quite old and the rooms are compact, and the floor of our upstairs guest was musical under their footsteps. A minor inconvenience at best.,

The best part of our stay was the gracious and personable service provided by Paul Asselman. He was exceptionally helpful before we even arrived by arranging parking, and offered wonderful advice on seasonal attractions and dining not impacted by COVID. He personally made us a delicious breakfast each morning and delivered himself. Our stay mirrored the best parts of staying at a B&B without feeling as though you are a lodger in someone’s home. The location was very convenient — a quick and picturesque walk got us to all there is to see in this beautiful, historic city.

-,

Beautyful b&b. Thank’s for owner Paul for the late check in.

Fantastic location, well equipped town house. Very clean and comfortable. Our host was very helpful in recommending restaurants, sites to visit etc. 
would thoroughly recommend it for two couples or a family looking to use Ypres as a base - and would return ourselves

I have to make a serious complaint about our stay in this room. The bed was full of bedbugs. The 1st morning we saw a spot of blood on the bed sheets and asked to change our sheets. It didn't cross our mind that something was wrong about the bed's hygiene. On Monday morning my husband got up with some spots/bites on his right hand and on his forehead. Yesterday morning he got up with many more bites on his right and left hand as well! We had to check out immediately so as to catch our train, therefore we didn't inform the receptionist on 5.40 am that we left. Since we arrived at our homeplace, we visited a doctor the same afternoon and the diagnosis is bites by bedbugs...We are really frustrated, disappointed and it's the 1st time that something like that happens to us! It is really concerning that in Brugges of 2020, Belgium, there are bedbugs in hotel rooms that are highly visited from all over the world.

I failed to fully read the property description.  The price is good... and there is a lot written regarding all the "Facilities" at this location that makes you think it is a first rate property.  However... it was very disappointing to me.  I did not read the description... and I was shocked at the shared bathroom.  Not only do you share with other guests... but you also share with the on-site resident.  There is no "casino", no coffee maker in the room, only hand towels - no bath towels, the room smelled of Fabreeze… so I wondered about that... unsecured parking on the street... both wardrobe and closet were full of junk, one wooden chair, creaky floor, host has friends over in the downstairs kitchen and you can hear them from your room, no buffet, no ATM, not 24/7 person on-site, no shops on site.... it is simply an old house with some empty upstairs rooms that are rented out.  The furniture is very old, simple, and basic.  There is no desk for your laptop to work... unless you use something in the common area.  If you want a cheap dry roof over your head... it is ok.  If you want anything more...,

The internet worked.  The mattress was hard.  The location was good for me.  The price was good... however... You get what you pay for.

Have to say, I don't normally write hotel reviews but felt like I had to with this one. So much could have been better really and it wouldn't take much..We had a deluxe double room but it was so basic. All the basic amenities were missing. There was no safe, kettle, pictures on the walls, the towels (and I don't normally notice things like this) were so thin and small, literally wouldnt use these on my dog! The air con doesn't really work. There were only 2 hangers in the room, when we asked they gave us 2 more but when we said 4 between us might not be enough the manager said there were more coming next week - fair enough but the total of all these things just made us feel like the standard wasn't quite good enough for the £589 we paid for 3 nights I couldn't believe we were made to pay not only for hot drinks but for hot water..!! 2 euros 50 per cupWhen you walked in the room, ive never felt this before but it was a disappointment and have to say as it was our first time in Bruges/Belgium let down the holiday a bit. There's no pictures on the walls and nothing in/on the units - it just feels a bit basic. We didn't sample the breakfast so can't comment on that. The bathroom was small ish - smaller than the pictures but nice enough The hotel interior on the hallways or the floors definitely needed a bit of an update, I'd read reviews on here which said that but didn't expect it to be so prominent - its noticeable and overall you just feel like it wouldn't take much to update these things but money must be being invested elsewhere?,

Location was good - you are only a few mins walk from the main shops/restaurants and right by the Interparking t'zand so extremely convenient. The parking only costs 8 euros overnight so thats great and you literally come out of the parking and the hotel's on your right Staff on reception were friendly and often happy to chat, but often refused the most basic of requests, such as making us pay 2 euro 50 for hot water (we'd bought our own tea bags and milk)

This location is on the new side of Ostend on the docks. You can reach the town by car. A tip, do not drive into town but use the Railway station parking at 1,5 euro per hour. It is brand new, easily accessible and avoids the drive into town. Alternatively take the boat across. The apartment is brand new, design, parking in front of the door (free). The extra bonus is that this lets you discover the dunes (Fort Napoleon), quiet extensive beach and pure nature of Bredene. At the end of the beach promenade on which you can cycle (free use of 2 bicycles) there is a surfers bar for food and drink. For kids, below the Fort Napoleon, there is a huge playground in the sand, the biggest I have ever seen.

Very bad experience in staying in this hotel! Not recommend to anyone!
I stayed here for 8 nights, I pre-paid at a time before my Europe trip in July 13, it’s expensive but thought it’s my birthday trip, I didn’t care much about the price. (I stayed in 4-5 starred hotels in my trip from Amsterdam. Rotterdam all the way to Antwerp Belgium) But the total experience with this Les Nuit turned out very unpleasant and even a nightmare.
Here are the stories, for the first 5 nights I was arranged in a dark green room, big bed is fine, like a museum with worn out & old facilities and so-so hygiene,
1. A worn out hairdryer with very awful screaming sound when powered on in the mid night in the empty “museum room”, imagine that. (changed after complain next day)
2. A Tiny shower room/stand without door (separate from toilet). Water splashed all the way outside the tiny shower room and became a big area of watered floor after showers although showered carefully; The small shower head never can sit still in the shower head holder. During the 5th day morning shower, it fell off the shower holder finally and like a sprinkler, water springs all the way up to the ceiling and to wardrobes in the room, my dry hair all wet! After reports to the staff, I got a better bright yellow colored-room instead with a glass doored shower room/stan and bath tub for the rest of my stay (3 nights)
3. The bath tub walls found dirty with skin dirt when trying to use it in the second room. Told them then they clean the next day!
4. Mosquitos found in Both rooms and biting during sleeps. Didn’t tell them but I left the dead big mosquito I killed in the room and stuck  on the tissue, and left on the glass table for them to see it at my last day!
5. Small flying bugs found at breakfast area and the seats are dirty with small pieces of food left over.
6. Last and the worst---bad, rude, arrogant and hostile  attitude of the woman staff who for check out service at my last day.,

Ok location for shopping but I not really into shopping , it needs around 20s min walk to the the central station and 15 min walk to the restaurant area
It was extremely dirty, we had spider webs in the room, sticky floor, stained decorative blanket, the towels provided had holes in them and what seemed like black mold on the sealing near the shower.

I had the bad luck to be facing the street of the Sheep yearly festival here, with a mega loud party, drunk teenagers fighting next to the window at 3am, plus neighbors talking next to my window at 8am on a Sunday (with the window opened, otherwise it would be too hot).Our receptionist barely spoke English, but we kind of managed.You need a car to find a restaurant, and no regular buses pass by this small village,

The hotel's entrance was under construction.  There was no temporary sign, so we has a ask a construction worker how to get into the hotel.  There was construction noise that started shortly after 8am.  When we checked out and mentioned it to reception we were told that there was no construction happening at the hotel.  The hotel has closed there restaurant/bar/teraace.  There is basically only a breakfast room with a small reception desk and a small bar(not able to sit at it).  The rooms were very tired.  I have stayed there twice and have always enjoyed there property and have recommended it to other but will not be staying there again.  I was extremely disappointed!

The hotel lacks soul and the rooms and decor  are tired looking and outdated. Tile floors in the rooms make it cold and unpleasant. In fact, heating was off and the room freezing when we arrived, which definitely doesn't make for a welcoming feel. And about feeling welcome, there's a warning at every wall or in the lifts or at breakfast: hospitality does not in any way seem to be on the owners' /managers' minds at all. Towels are washed out grey or yellow, rather than white. The mattress felt like cardboard and foam blocks serve as pillows, preventing a good night's sleep. Breakfast was meagre with low quality cold cuts and cheese, old bread and a lady (owner?) shouting after you where stuff is, therefore not allowing for a quiet, relaxing breakfast (it's not included anyway, so you're better off going somewhere nice). Having travelled a lot, we had a laugh with how bad the hotel was and we only stayed 1 night, so it was doable. But it baffled us how a place like this can have 3 stars. ,

We stayed in a budget room we twin beds. Our beds were very tiny it was hard to sleep both for myself (165 cm height) and for my 182 cm partner. It was also cold in the room but was ok after we got an additional small heater. The breakfast was so-so.,

Location is very near to the airport, so it was convenient for catching our early morning flight.

The room was not nearly as big as the booking.com site said it would be (about 21m2 and not 32m2) - so that made our two nights somewhat overpriced. We did not ask for another room, as we wanted to go out and have dinner, and the room though a lot smaller than expected, seemed fine enough.The loud music and the warmth at the breakfast room, apart from the price (€25,- pp) made us having our breakfast somewhere else.The air in the hotelroom was very dry, we had to drink water during the night not to get a very dry mouth.,

The warm welkome by the receptionist, who at 20:45 hrs, offered to book us a table at a nearby restaurant which prooved to be a very nice and warm welcoming one. The bed in our hotelroom and the shower, also were very good.

The pillows were a bit strange and uncomfortable - they seemed to be made of blocks of foam. The windows had to be propped open in order to let any air in (although being directly on the street was a bit noisy to have the windows open anyway). There was dirt in the corner of the room when we arrived, but otherwise the room and bathroom were clean. The bathroom had no window or exhaust fan (and also no candle or air freshener) and plumbing is very loud if you are a light sleeper. Plumbing can be heard also when other rooms shower or use the toilet. Also, the hairdryer did not function well and the water in the shower took about a minute and a half to finally become warm. The check in staff is a bit unfriendly and the website says they speak English, Spanish, French, and Dutch. We tried English, Dutch, and Spanish but only French was actually possible. The website also says checkout is 11:00am, but it is actually 10.30, which is quite early in our experience. Unfortunately, our room was one of the rooms that did not receive a wifi signal.,

The view was wonderful and the location was excellent. Overall, this is a very, very basic room in a great location on the river for a decent price during the summer high season. Free parking within 50-100m was a nice bonus.

Fortunately only spent one night at La Chaumiere. Am sorry to say that the negatives outweigh the positives. Arrived after a 600 km drive arrived only to find roadworks prevented access to hotel. Workmen suggested return 2 hrs later but finally after staff remonstrated with workmen we gained access to hotel. Had booked family room for 2 adults and 2 children. Attic room up 2 flights of stairs (no lift). One side of landing room contained Large double and single with small box room other side of landing and bathroom off. Rooms very clean but rather tired. Fortunately I was able to negotiate stairs despite being disabled, but anyone with greater disabilities or mobility issues would struggleThe restaurant menu was fine but not suitable for an 8 and 10 yr old. No child options. Having travelled to visit relatives we were OK as they took us to restaurants that had child friendly menu. The room was described as having tea and coffee making facilities and mini bar. Tea and coffee provided but no milk and minibar was an empty fridge barely cool. Single beds lumpy and more put you up that anything elseThe bathroom sink waste did not work so running water only and partially used toiletries were available with a pre-used (ie wet) face cloth (ugh). Towels were provided but again rather tired. The shower attachment in the bath barely did the job and useless. It felt as though room not prepared properlyBreakfast was very basic, however coffee was only available by the cup and had to be requested for refill. Despite 4 requests for hot water for tea non arrived.The hotel might be ok for a travelling rep but I would not rate it as the 3* rating. I have stayed in B&B in area at smaller cost. Perhaps the issue with the breakfast was due to a limited grasp of English or possibly because the staff had attention on breakfast tv. On the whole disappointing, not as described, and sorry  but when returning to area later in year will not be booking La Chaumiere.,

The hotel doesnt have a telefone in the room for a wake up call to be made. They had no adapter for international people that forgot it back home and need to charge their laptop and mobile. For the breakfast, there were eggs and bacon, but saucages would have been nice. There was a fruit salad, but in really top-rated hotels one would also find slices of water melon; the frequent tramway passing at the street is an advantage for the location, but a disadvantage for the noise.,

The HYGGE hotel can definitely be a home away from home. My stay there has been perfect: the room was spacious, incredibly clean and plenty of all accessories I needed. The staff (present 24/7 at the reception) has been super friendly and available for any request I had. The hotel itself has a great hygge style and the location is just perfect: right in the heart of Ixelles, near to all nicest spots of the city (by 10-15 mins by walking) and well connected. Once I’ll return to Brussels I’ll definitely stay at the HYGGE hotel again. I thank all the staff for the great stay I had.

It was not intended, and in no way - no way, even not covid - I appreciate it to be reprimanded as a client, loud and clear, by a member of the staff - just because I touched my piece of bread in a way that she didn't liked. A breakfast is the start of the day. It should be joyfull. (The others members of the staff ware very, very kindly - I want to stress it. But these one person was in charge of the organisation of the buffet, so she was important. And and she behaved like an old-school nun towards kids who had to obey, and nothing more.,

(Nb.This was the Novotel, next to the Ibis that was closed due to the corona.) Parking, checking in, elevator to floor was a short excursion. The room was spacious, well designed and practical. There were some nice toiletries present, and the towels were good. The restaurant/bar area is spacious and light with a wall of windows onto the terrace. The terrace and its little outdoor bar is equally open en comfortable. The large, enclosed garden with nice green gras, shrubs and trees surrounding a large pool with poolside seating is a beautiful paradise in the industrial area. The cocktails are generous and the food is really good. TV channels included Classic 21 and Arrow radio.

The host Angelique and her husband were brilliant. Very friendly. Very proud of the obvious hard work they put into modernising their property. Excellent kitchen facilities with high quality crockery and cutlery. Brill stereo, TV and DVD player on the top floor. The kids loved their own 'space' with beds made kid-friendly style by the hosts. Lots of kids books and DVDs available. Beds very comfortable. Amazing rainfall shower. Very modern facilities from blinds to upholstery to bedding. Can definitely tell that a personal touch was added. The hosts left a few bottles of water and some tea and coffee for us o arrival. 5 miles from the town of Spa which is quite charming. Lots of animals to spot. We could have easily stayed for another three nights. The children did not want to leave their 'penthouse'! Thank you for an amazing stay.

The description they gave us was perfect we knew where to park etc. The price was perfect. We tried to find a hotel to stay in and this worked out cheaper for us than hotel rooms. It was perfect. Tea & coffee, Towels, kitchen fully equipped . Shampoo & shower gel supplied. Recycling bins, DVDs to watch,Tv easy to use, air conditioning ( we didnt need this ) Host even offered us the use of their pool in their garden but unfortunately we were too busy to use it.
Beautiful place to stay with a great breakfast!

easy and safe access ; description to enter was good. Location in the center and garage parking within 100m was perfect. The beds were all Cocomat brand with different hardness - perfect to try. Building first floor is a good hamburger place and we were hungry - super in Corona times.

The decor was utter luxury whilst also being homely & comfortable. The breakfast was so lovely that I - a non breakfast eater, even on holiday - stuffed my greedy little face! How could I not, when presented with such an array of goodies; a fruit bowl including pieces of kiwi & passionfruit, yoghurt & granola, scrambled eggs, toast, waffles, danish pasties, a cheeseboard, cold cuts of meat, little bars of chocolate, cereals, tea, fresh coffee, fruit juice and bread rolls. We were offered a glass of champagne but unfortunately I was too hungover to consider it. I can not recommend this lovely hotel highly enough.

The hotel is located in a side street, but actually close to public transport. The room, although not big was spacious enough and did not feel crammed. The bathroom had a window (yay!) and was nice and spotless. For Brussels, it was very good value for money. I would definitely go back.

Very welcoming host, beautiful property, excellent location.
The host was so helpful and had fresh coffee and delicious chocolate and biscuits on arrival.

Let's start from beginning - check in goes very smooth, fast and efficient. You are charged full amount of your stay straight away at the beginning of your stay - that seems to be standard procedure from the Hotels that have very high percentage of customers being dissatisfied about quality and the product being offered. After quick check in we arrived at our room - I will remind everyone here - it's a 3 Star Hotel! Standard room - small, that barely 2 people can fit in it, not talking about luggages. In the middle of the room there is bed, standard bed, queen size in our case, and nothing else!!! On both sides of the bed there were 2 wooden shelves - it looked like the shelves taken from my grandpa old garage. No deposit box or safe! No minibar or fridge! No telephone in the room! No tea or coffee making facilities! No room service - if you wanna have a tea you gotta go down to bar and buy it there! It's 21st Century - even homestays offer kettle in their rooms! Bathroom was so small that you can barely move around - of course no shelves or place to put your cosmetics!We decided not to stay any minute longer in that place! 15 minutes after check in we went down to reception to check out (we suppose to stay in this place for 4 nights). On our way out we have been informed by receptionist to contact Hotel Management about refund for remaining 3 nights - either via phone or email. Unfortunately despite many attempts to contact property both via email and phone nobody ever replies or picks up the phone! We spent the rest of our weekend in Brussels in the proper HOTEL.,

Near Centre location was the only positive aspect of our very short stay in this so called 3* Hotel.

Price of the room was great, very clean and the staff were very friendly and polite.
Accommodating to the dog too so pet friendly.
Breakfast was great, not a wide selection but still good for first thing in the morning.

Windows on the inside had not been cleaned properly - imprints of hands and other body parts were clearly noticeable :)Bathroom was not 100% functional, shower door did not close completely and inside of the door to the bathroom had stains on it, let's say it was body lotion :),

Very soundproof hotel, near the airport and the ring road, yet you could not hear anything from outside nor from the visitors in the adjacent rooms.Complementary coffee and tea as well as mini-bar with soft drinks is always appreciated.

Perhaps the reception staff were a bit on the dry side.,

A hotel in a brewery. Need I say more? It is excellent. Definitely get the chocolates in the brewery shop. The restaurant and cleaning staff were great. Really jolly. A special thank you to the cleaner who helped us with unlocking the window in the room.

the shower over the bath, when u hang the shower head, water squirts everywhere, literally i had to use 2 towels to wipe the water all over the bathroom floors, later on i had to sit on the edge of the bath and slowly shower, floors still wet but not as bad as when u hang it up . the bath glass door needs to widen to prevent water coming out,

The rooms are nicely decorated and very family friendly. You can sit together with a big group and because of the open space, everyone is connected. So it doesn’t matter wether you're in the kitchen or living room.

To get into the building you have to enter a code, which not always working, even if it's correct. It's always smells bad on the first floor and in elevator. The appartment itself are nice, but there are a couple of problems. Firstly, the heating system is really strange, so mostly it was cold inside. Secondly, there is no modem in that appartment (I'm talking about penthouse), probably another appartment on the 6th floor has it. It means that you can catch a signal in the kitchen only. And it's really slow, 6MB/s. Finally, no one tell us that there is a huge construction 5 meters from this building. So it was extremely loud from 6:40am till evening. It will be there for next 4-5 month I guess. ,

B&B Bornedrager is a gem! Low-key sophistication greets you upon entry. The restoration of the townhouse & the refined decor is lovely. The hostess, Kathleen, wants to make sure that you have a wonderful stay, not only in the B&B, but also in Bruges. She is very helpful regarding sites & Tours. Breakfast is wonderful: eggs cooked to order, cereals, juices, fresh yogurt, fresh fruit cup, sparkling wine, if you would like it. Cheeses, meats, a variety of breakfast breads Etc. Our room was large & lovely with tea/coffee maker, fridge, safe. Comfy bed & upholstered chairs for reading. Bathroom is large and has modern furnishings. The location is terrific: you can walk everywhere. This B&B is a gem! We stayed for four days and loved every moment. Thank you, Kathleen☺️

the rooms are very small the staff were very unfriendly and people kept coming into our room at unusual times of the day.. all very noisy are,

size of the bed and view on the tarmac. excellent price. very good breakfast. no noice from outside.

The hotel looks old and is super small (not only the rooms, also the corridors and the lift). 
The walls are very thin and you could hear everything, it was almost impossible to sleep during the night.
Everything is very noisy, you can hear every single person opening or closing the door, and locking the door. 
The floor is made of wood and you could hear people walking.
I got a room on the first floor on the front side, next to the road. I felt like into the road and I could hear people screaming, the bus braking for the bus stop, and cars accelerating. During the night I got woken up several times. I asked to the reception to get another room but I was told that there weren’t others available and that I’m too sensitive and it’s not their problem. He added that if I don’t want to hear noises I don’t have to book a room in the centre of the city (unbelievable!).
Wi-Fi connection was very poor (unusable) and I had to use my mobile data.
Last but not least, the first night I could get some sleep only after 3am as the neighbour from another building kept the music volume super loud. I went to the receptionist and asked him to call the police; initially I was told that I had to call the police(I don’t speak french), not him. After a while he understood that he was the one supposed to call the police and called them.
The worst hotel experience I’ve ever had. I’m sorry to say that but I do not recommend this hotel.,

Only the location, in the centre of Brussels, the hotel is horrible

Clearly dated but functional. Had to change rooms as the shower was broken, along with the air conditioning and hair dryer. Shower pressure in new room was awful but at least it worked.

We have been waiting for an answer (as was promised) from the manager on the compensation that we deserve to get ....until now not even an apology!

I stayed for 3 nights and on the 2nd day nobody went to clean the room. Because I just arrived at the hotel about midnight and tired I did not say anything at the reception. The hotel needs to invest in pillows, the ones I had were really bad.,

Good and quiet location, friendly staff at the reception. Small room, in my opinion proper for 1 person.

The location is awesome if you're just there for a layover, but to go to the center, you need about 10min to go to the nearest (Diegem) train station. But I wouldn't say that this is a major point.,

Superbox single rooms! They're equipped with PS4s and a VR headset in every room, with cool preinstalled games.There are also BT speakers in every room.On every Superbox rooms floor there is a free-of-charge minibar!The breakfast is excellent, variety of things to choose from.Free airport shuttle with the nicest driver.

My room unfortunately didn't have a view. Buildings, the street - any view would have been nice. Mine was sadly like looking down an elevator shaft! I don't mind usually, but having a view like this really made my room dark...and I kept sleeping in late every morning because no sun was shining in through the window!,

The room was clean, warm and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful as always (this is the 2nd time I've stayed in this hotel). I've never had any problems, and staff are literally sat at the Reception Desk 24/7, for whenever you have a question :)

No issues ,

Good location and quiet

The room could be bigger.,

I very much liked the Nordic style of the hotel and its coziness. The staff was friendly. The location is good, not so far from the city centre by public transport and very near Avenue de Louise, main shopping street.
Nice and quit hotel with a good parking facility. Good breakfast with fresh fruits and a lot of variety.

Not feeling welcomed because of our difference (cultural, racial, gender)The lies in the advert about the privacy of the placeTher pictures of the house that we did not have acces to,

The 1 hours of privacy at the "private pool"

The common areas of the building are filthy. They bring all the trash bags in the elevators and leave the liquids that sip out and food left overs all over the floor and walls (I have pictures to prove it), the smell is like body decomposition... I have never felt this nauseated over a smell in my life. We just had to use the stairs all the way to the 5th floor.the cleaning ladies use our apartment (501) as a storage (they never cleaned it, which we knew) so you have zero privacy in the common areas.,

No hot water in the bathroom - a quick apology is what I got. The shower head in room 745 had a leak and dropped all day/night long. Pillows were tall and hard - not conducive of a restful sleep. Breakfast buffet is the only option for almost 12€ even if you just want a cup of coffee. Breakfast people overflows to the lobby area making it very busy and noisy. Staff seemed overwhelmed both during check in and check out times. A very disappointing stay.,

Hotel sits on a main road so it’s well connected. Room and bathroom were well cleaned.

No complaints! Found the facilities and staff very acceptable and superior in many ways to the standard Ibis hotels!,

Good and easy booking in. Pleasant and helpful staff. Good variety of choice for breakfast. It was good value for money.
Food was very of a very good standard!

Room was so cold. There was no proper heating. heaters work only 8 pm to 1 am and it was below 0 outside ı froze in my room. Yesterday night ı comeback to hotel a 1:45 am and entrance door to hotel was locked and receptionist didnt even try open the door for while and did some angry gestures like ı disturbed him and drag him out in his comfort zone. (he was watching tv) he was like "why are you here on this hour"

You can hear everything that is happening in other rooms, when they are watching TV or talkingand other clients were really noisy starting from 6 am (Not the hotel's fault obviously)The room is not 100% clean, but it's still okay,

The hotel is really close to the central station and the MeirAlso, the staff is really nice
Clean, quiet. Staff helped out as possible. OK location, easy to get around with public transport from there.
Charming little hotel with a charming staff in an excellent location for exploring Durbuy and the Ardennes, with excellent breakfast buffet included.

For almost £200 for one night it was odd to be told that they would try to be there when we wanted to check in. And the sole use bathroom was not en suite but across a public landing. We did not realise it was literally a bed and breakfast room in someone’s private homebut thought it would be a small hotel.,

Big clean bedroom

BAD SMELL AT THE FRONT OF HOTEL,

RIGHT IN THE CENTER

We had to report the shower as it didn't drain and quickly filled. The power of shower was excellent and I'm sure this was a very quick fix which should not affect anyone else. No safe in room, advertised there was, although as explained in our review, this really didn't matter.,

This is a very classy, small B&B, the décor is very stylish and quality outstanding, wonderful aroma too, all giving it a feel of a top rated hotel. I am a very light sleeper and concerned to be facing the road. The double glazing, internal binds and black out curtains, blocked any noise or light, enabling an excellent night's sleep. Kathleen is a wonderful host who will welcome you with a smile, she enabled us to check in early. She serves an outstanding breakfast, with varied choice. We had room two, which is a smaller room but adequate, clean and stylish. The aircon is in perfect working order and was left on in the room each day by the cleaners, which meant when we returned, the room was always cool and comfortable. The towels are changed each day and you return to an immaculate made up room everyday. If I had to pick up on anything, I would mention that there is no safe in room two, although the details on booking said there is. That said, you feel very happy to leave your belongings in your room, knowing they will be safe. We are already recommending this outstanding B&B to friends and family!

It was very commercial and jam packed full of people. Impossible to find a seat for breakfast and breakfast food was very basic. Mattress was very lumpy and difficult to sleep on.,

The design was nice and the location was great

Price is on the level of 3 stars hotel, but unfortunately, this is one stars hotel. Booked it because needed someplace to sleep the same day I booked.it's clean and ok to sleep one night, but I felt discomfort everywhere :(Toilet, shower, 2-level bad under my bad... I don't like it, felt like I'm in hospital.

It was not possible to watch TV channels as één, Canvas and many others. This was really dissapointing.,

Breakfast was great with a lot of choices. We take a meal in the evening and also this was delicious. Free shuttle bus was easy to take and on time.  I would recommend this hotel to travellers who have a overnight stay because of their flight.

The bathroom was not clean and the furniture was in a very bad condition. The sink was way to small. The Key to the WLAN was not issued during checkin and not provided in the room. The windows had almost no insulation against the cold from outside or the traffic sound in front of the hotel.
Location + Breakfast + Nice Staff

Be warned, if you're walking from the train stations, it is more than 20 minute walk up a very big hill! We were not prepared for this!!,

The interior design is lovely, helpful staff, and great late checkout time. Nice communal areas to chill out too. Lovely cafe Tich is nearby, or Exki - both do gluten free and vegan options

Location and smell.The property is right next door to Antwerp Tower which has a lot of work being done on it and they start work around 6am in the morning (not bank holidays and Sundays but they are working early on Saturday morning). On arrival, the apartment didn't have a particularly nice smell. This got worse over the stay and it was coming from the drain in the shower. There is no door between the bathroom and the bedroom so it was not that pleasant to sleep in. We bought some gel to put down the drain and aired the room but could not get rid of the smell. We reported it after our first night but it was not sorted despite being told it was being investigated.We also lost power and after calling the property company, we were requested to go down to the basement to reset it (the fuse box was fine). The property is shared with a restaurant downstairs and luckily we met an employee as we called the lift and they very kindly sorted the power issue for us.,

Location. This property could be rated a lot higher. It has a wonderful central location right on the edge of Antwerp Old Town. We were staying in the top floor penthouse and it has fantastic views out over Antwerp skyline.However, at the moment, it's location is also it's downfall.

Shower is a bit small, and it would be convenient to have something to place the shampoo and shower gel on. Hose of hand shower needs replacing. Other than this everything was fine.,

Reception: very friendly, and good explanation of the facilities of the B&B and places to see in Bruges.Breakfast: excellent, good variety of products and excellent and friendly service.Location: cannot be better, and even parking turned out to be not a problem (maybe we were lucky...)Very spacious room and all amenities present.

There is no air-conditioning that we can control. There was no air circulation unless we open the window but we can hear all the road noise.AND PLEASE PROVIDE HOT WATER KETTLE!,

The room was clean and furnished tastefully.

Small room,

Location was perfect

Room service ends at 10pm.,

Excellent facilities! It seems brand new forever. Top clean and very well located.

The window insulation has its limitations. The bedroom at the streetside was quite noisy (we were at the fourth floor). The bedroom at the ‘interior’ was very quiet.
Some parts of the accomodation are a bit run down. Our room e.g. had no functioning curtains, and some appliances miss a button or two (but still worked).
Overall, I can recommend this place.,

Great location and very spacious apartment. Checkin via the codes was smooth.

Parking is an issue but there are meters outside BUT IN NO WAY DOES THIS DETRACT FROM THE STAY AND THE HOTEL.
,

Everything.   Location excellent   hotel quality excellent staff excellent.

The reason people book hotels for their time away from home is to have a roof over their heads and an opportunity to wash themselves. Motel One somehow almost failed both these basic tourist needs for us. Yes, “almost” is the key word here, but the mood and first impression were ruined.
I’ll tell you my story. The day before our booking date I receive an email from booking.com saying my credit card is invalid (my bad, forgot to update it before the trip). It says that unless I updated it within 24 hours, my booking will be cancelled. No big deal, I update it within an hour after the email. In the app my status is changed to “booking confirmed” again. Guess what happened at the front desk? That’s right: they cancelled my damn booking. Absolutely not willing to help and looking at my CONFIRMED booking in the app he doesn’t even apologize. The only room available on the spot is business suite. It seems I don’t have another choice - I pay for business suite: this was about “almost no roof over my head”. What if I was a traveler on budget? What if I simply didn’t have enough money? Not their problem.
Cherry on top to the check-in: it was towards midnight and THERE WAS A LINE for check-in. We waited for 25 minutes only to learn that we’ve been cancelled.
Another cherry: they blamed Booking.com for not sending an email about cancellation (remember this, it’s important for later).
What’s up with lines at midnight? I’ll tell you. The hotel is HUGE. It’s enormous. And only TWO people and the front desk. In our case they called a third one, but it was still 25+ minutes. For this very reason don’t expect special treatment (not even a smile!) because you are not special when there are hundreds of guests.
The shower thing. One morning it turns they don’t have hot water. Just no hot water. For me this was strike two. No phones in the room so we go downstairs to ask. As expected, there are a lot of people waiting (in the line, of course) to be explained. Pipes, they say.
Parking included

Normally, I get rooms that are impeccable at this property. This time, I was in a room that was not clean, toilets were dirty and in general unkempt. unfortunately, I checked-in late and in no mood to change rooms, but I had not expected this lapse, especially because van der Valk in last 3 years have changed their market perception totally.,

breakfast and in general the restaurants/bar at this place is very good. staff is friendly and price/quality of food is excellent. ideal place for business meetings in a relaxed setting.

One of the two apartments weren't cleaned yet and we next to the appartment was a building site, we were woken up between 5 and 6 am! But thanks for the earplugs!,

The common rooms were great! Great (big) space and ambiance!
very nice location 5 minuets walk to center , Kathleen is very kind and helpful , i would come again for sure

Actually the lobby of the hotel is nice
Value for money and friendly staff

NA,

Perfect clean room,  the breakfast was very good, the hotel was fully booked and still you had enough to choose. There was even fresh orange juice

Smell of septic from drains, some furniture stained or dirty, no mattress cover in one bedroom, dvd player not working and not fixed during stay, request for parking and baby cot not addressed until I called 3 days before stay and then they weren't able to accommodate cot request and loud construction opposite flat which will continue for some time,

The apartment was large and spacious

Road noise at night and a bar further up the road had revellers singing and shouting.,

Kathleen the host was fantastic, we arrived early and she checked us in at 11.00 am, the room was ready, she then provided a map and informed us about all the sights and gave us directions. The flat is great. original and fun. It's big, clean and in position A.We loved Antwrep and despite the fire alarm going off in the building on our first morning ,which kind of ruined the day for my already tired elderly partner we shopped and cooked and walked. Loved the baroque and the modern.

Room a little small, but bed and linens great. ( Room #1.)  Also, No CNN channel, so couldn’t get any US news.,

This was a last minute booking on a Sunday by travellers on the fly. What the blurb failed to mention until after we’d booked, was that the managers would give access codes to the key lock, building and lift by email, after receipt of passport copy, 2 days before arrival. We booked on the day and had no roaming internet. Lots of phone calls, photographing and sending of passport.....took us 2 hours to get into the flat. And you don’t expect a penthouse to have stains all over the furniture, a muddy foyer to the building. The ear plugs were a thoughtful touch, but the construction work in the building over the way and on the road below was late finishing and early starting, with builders looking into those lovely windows. Also the toilet is not in the en suite, but by the front door. And the weird shower curtain far from elegant.,

It was very big, with great views through huge picture windows. Washing machine was great. Close to everything in town.

Very classy, clean, beautiful space. The staff was kind and helpful. Breakfast was great!  The location was close to, but outside of, the busy touristy part of Bruges, convenient to all sights and wonderful restaurants. We would highly recommend.
