don’t deserve the money you payed for, no hot water wasn’t working , no phone in the room to call the reception , no safe no wardrobe

Well, once arrived we are surprised by an elevator which is out of service ==> 4 floors to climb, two set of stairs to reach one floor ; not that funny with our bagages, stroller and baby in our arms. (and have to do it each time you go in and out !)The common areas are not clean: sticky floors, rubbishs on the hallways and odors.The apartment is clean but needs some finishing : bathroom's spotlights hang from the ceiling, cable torn from the socket, missing baseboard ..,

The open area in the apartment and his perfect localization. Close to the central station, restaurants and city center !

My review starts with our arrival. All the necessary info regarding our stay was communicated in time and clearly. At arrival at the accommodation the code that was communicated with us was incorrect. Apparently this was not just with us, but with all other people staying. Therefore we were left standing in the rain with our stuff for ten minutes waiting for a whatsapp message with the correct code to enter the building. When entering the apartment we were just simply shocked.- The floors were dirty and sticky;- The tables and kitchen counter were sticky and smelly;- The couch was full of dust and feathers sticking out all over which makes sitting on the couch painful;- The lights in the bathroom were hanging on wires out of the sealing and only one of them was working, therefor there was barely any light in the shower;- The sinks in the bathroom would not drain the water out. Therefore we were stuck with a dirty combination of water and toothpaste in the sinks for the whole weekend;- The amount of water coming out of the shower was just enough to get your toes wet. Showering or taking a bath was extremely unpleasant;- The bath was sticky and smelly. Clearly not cleaned;- There was a bad sewer smell throughout the whole apartment, but especially in the bathroom;- The elevator in the building could not take the heavy rainfall. Therefore we could not make use of the elevator, making us climb the stairs for four floors. Can happen, but no one gave us a call or came by to apologize for this;- The bed in the bedroom was smelly and left me with bites of bedbugs. A terrible stay at Smartflats Antwerp Central for us in apartment 4001.After sending this review to Smartflats directly all we got was an automated an unpersonalised email giving us a 15% discount for a next stay.,

The check in hour is to late (15:00). If you have a meeting in the arrival day you don't have were to take a shower and change.,

The people from the reception were really nice.

My biggest gripe was the WiFi. It doesn’t work in the rooms as advertised. When i spoke to staff they appeared to be looking in to it but really did nothing about it, instead advising us to use reception’s WiFi. There was no modem on 3rd floor and the one of 4th floor had no power so I feel that it has been the case for a while. 
One of the staff made me feel that my complaint was not warranted as WiFi was ‘free therefore I should be grateful’ and it was not my right to complain given they have an alternative. 
The bathroom screen was also broken so water ran all over bathroom floor and flooded the main room, under the bed and so on. Make sure you place towels on the floor to prevent this. 
Rooms don’t have air con so if you are staying in the peak of summer, ask for corner room or you may be sleeping with your door open which we saw a few people do. 
Overall I wouldn’t stay there again. ,

Hotel is in a fantastic location. The metro is at the front and you are 5 min walk from centre, with cafes and restaurants literally at your doorstep. Room was clean, had a great view and the one we had was quite large.

Bathroom in the room does not have a door. But there is one extra toilet outside of the room.,

We really enyojed the stay, the hosts were incredibly hospitable, breakfast was great freshly made with wide choice of food.
Beautiful location with a modern, cosy and smart build. Breakfast was fresh and delightful. 100% will stay here again.

Water stains and damp on the walls, mould on all the grouting in the bathroom. The matresses and curtains  were very dirty and window sill was loose. Door broken on shower replaced with inadequate shower curtain and the shower head was broken. Walls are very thin and we could hear the next door party and downstairs guests. Stair case was incredibly narrow and a big suitcase would not have fitted. There were also very dodgy electric sockets. DO NOT RECOMMEND.,

This is a wonderful place to spend a few days in nature - not only are there hikes on cerf’titude’s doorstep, this beautiful property is also just 20-30mins away from some of the most scenic parts of the Ardennes (where you can hike, trail, paddle in the natural reserve). Isabelle and Benoît are wonderful attentive hosts who offer every morning a delicious - homemade and organic - breakfast. We tried their evening platter and we would recommend it to anyone - their dishes were very tasty and fresh. This b&b also has the advantage of having few rooms so it is quiet and perfect for a quiet relaxing  getaway.

It was, what I was already expected from reviews of others - the hotel equipment and furniture are old (but room and bathroom was clean). Corridors and stairs could have been cleaner.,

I really enjoyed breakfast. It surprised me. There were delicious croissants, cheese, ham, bread, boiled egg. Very tasty coffee and chocolate drink. The location is very convenient - close to sights and to main transport.

The staff was really bad, they told us the first day that we can had the breakfast (but didn't mean to pay for it or how much), and the last day they ask to pay for it (also, too much 10€ per person each day). It was very incorrect! They ruin our trip! Absolutely not to come back to! ,

The room was clean e the position is near the station and 10 minutes by foot from the center.

4.	The heating in the so-called new room did not work at all. I informed the receptionist but he said he can not do anything. It was chilling throughout the night. Balcony glass door was fully covered with dew. If this does not justify the need or expectation to have room heater on at night then I don’t know what does!5.	Bathroom exhaust fans don’t work even if they are present (there is no bathroom exhaust fan in room 22). This means, entire bathroom gets filled up with steam in 2-3 min and the mirrors become useless. I am sure there is a very big mould problem in this hotel but they must be just repainting over the mould to cover it off. Very unhealthy and unhygienic.If this hotel management has even an iota of responsibility then I would urge them to personally verify what I have written. Please don’t treat tourists in this way. Offer something decent please. You are leaving behind a bad taste in the mouth of people due to your irresponsible and unprofessional management. Please set things right by firstly compensating me and then rectifying the situation so that nobody else goes through this hell again. Note: The rooms did not look like the ones advertised by any standards.,

We made a blunder of staying in this hotel at the end of Feb, this year. It spoiled our whole holidays and made us feel homeless. It is an utter disgrace in the name of hotel industry. I have a huge list of complaints against them. I will list down only a few though:1.	Staff is extremely unhelpful and non-cooperative (with an exception of Adil).2.	We were allotted room 55 on 5th floor. The toilet had a disgusting and terrible smell that we had never come across before. Even public toilets would smell as roses when compared to this. It was worse than the smell of the dirtiest toilet, morgue and uncleaned gutter combined. I wouldn’t like my worst enemy to spend a minute there.3.	I decided to book another hotel next morning even if it means loss of money. Luckily, Adil, who was helpful (a very big exception) allowed us to choose another room. This new room (room 22) appeared clean in the day and there was no foul smell. But when we returned to the room in the evening, we realised only one light was working in the room. Adil managed to replace one light bulb but apparently the hotel did not keep stock of different types of light bulbs. This ended up the room being poorly lit in the night. I had to work with my laptop and I could not because it was very stressful for the eyes.

Although the location is close to the motorway (for me the main attraction; a good overnight stop before continuing my journey) there isn't much else nearby - it is quite far from any tourist attractions.,

Good for an overnight stop when travelling long distanced; I arrived late at night and checked in with no problems.

What a surprise! And a good one. I had to find a hotel at the last minute and was really glad to end up here. The staff is really kind and the superbox room is beautiful and comfortable! The decoration gives a cosy atmosphere that makes you want to stay more than one night. Moreover, there’s a lounge in front of the room with a fridge where you can find free bottle of water or cola, really appreciable. The next time I have to stay in Brussels before a flight, I will stay here for sure!

Great location for hikes around Herbeumont, Semois is just amazing there. We very much appreciated the possibility of being served in the room during Corona. The great view and sitting outside after dinner enjoying the sunset with a glass of wine. Next to that the food was good, we did dinner at the BNB itself for two days. Great vegetarian food (especially if you're a vegetarian or can do without meat) and my wife loved the wine.

Contemporary interior design.Apart from the lady who greeted me at the reception on my arrival (rather awkward), all the other staff members were helpful and kind.

The property has been beautifully renovated with lots of attention to detail. It had lots of natural stone and wood and was very tasteful. We stopped there on our way from England to Munich because of the good reviews. We were definitely not disappointed. It’s slightly off the beaten track for an overnight stay, but well worth the detour. Frederic is exactly as everyone describes him, very welcoming, an excellent chef and tends to every need. I would definitely recommend this place to others, and hope to be there again one day. Merci!!

The hotel is close to the north train station and cheap by Brussels standards.
Very nice location, free coffee, everything was great.

Hot chocolate machine was out of order, but coffee and other hot beverages were tasty. We got stuck in an elevator once, but got out after few minutes safely. Luggage policy was perfect. No problems with storing it before/after we checked in/out at all.,

We chose this hotel because of the unique design, good reviews and promisingly looking breakfasts - all of the mentioned met our expectations perfectly. Breakfasts are incredible here. You can choose from huge variety of morning dishes - croissants, eggs, beans, bacon etc. The staff is doing great job and refilling everything needed. Rooms are interesting. We'd say the designers prefer minimalism and design over functionality - for example, if you shower for a longer time than normally, you are risking your room to be flooded. Another example - although the "wardrobes" are nice, it's almost impossible to store more than few pieces of your outfit there. That's why keeping almost all of our belongings in the suitcase through the stay seemed to be the best option. Our toilet stopped working during the last day of our stay, but staff didn't charge any extra fee for that although they could have thought that it's us who was responsible for that. However, we really enjoyed the stay and if we ever happen to come to Brussels again, Hotel Hygge will be one of the options for us, that's for sure.
PS.: We have got some great travel tip for all of you who'd like to taste some local beverages and are not bound to pay tens of euros for that - visit "Super shop"! This place is located a bit closer to the downtown, Rue Duquesnoy, facing Hotel Wawrick on the other side of the street. The owner of this place is a warm-hearted, wholesome man. On the first day of our stay, we spent like 7 Euros there, and he gave us beers at a value of 4 Euros completely for free. The other day, he gave us another beers and on the very last day, he gave us a large, premium bottle of beer for free again. The prices of products in this store were really friendly to our wallets and you will be surprised how come that in country with Euro as a currency you can get local beverages that cheap. Felt like Czech Republic for a while.

This hotel is situated in North Brussels, and I was concerned when I walked from the train station to the hotel and passed row after row of sex shops with girls in the windows selling their 'services'. There were lots of dubious looking groups of men hanging around on the street which made me feel uncomfortable walking to and from the hotel.The room was basic - which is to be expected with a 2 star, but there was a smear of what can only be described as human excrement on the wall, the shower leaked all over the floor as there was a gaping hole in the bottom of the base, we did not have any towels provided on the first night, and the view from our window was an adjacent roof ledge from the building next door which was scattered with empty vodka bottles, nitrous oxide canisters and spoons which I will leave to the imagination the use.Our first night was interrupted by the fact that the room next door decided to throw a room party with loud blaring rap music and shouting/singing which despite trying to ring reception (From our mobile as the room phone didn't work) went on until 5am, with our calls to reception going unactioned. I get that this hotel is cheap in comparison to others, however it is still expensive for the stay we received, and next time I would pay the extra to stay somewhere nicer.

The B&B is located in a small and quiet village 10 kilometres away from Spa. We were lucky to be there in a surprisingly-warm - and dry - March weekend. What if it had poured rain?,

We felt welcome in the property: when we arrived after spending a whole day in Spa, we found bottles of water, home-made cookies, Nespresso pods in our room. The room was big enough to accommodate a crib for our 2.5 year old son. Despite a rich breakfast buffet, the landlady was so kind to ask if we wanted something we couldn't find.

We asked for a quiet room and were informed about renovations on the 3rd floor, so we got the 6th floor offered.As it is below the meeting rooms and there were Xmas parties going on, I preferred not to be just under the 7th floor.So, we moved to the 2nd, with reassurance that works on the 3rd would not start before 08.00 (the moment we were leaving anyway). However, the second night there was a party on the terrace, just below our room, so our quiet room was not quiet at all due to the music noise.I was also suprised that at the check-out we were not asked how our stay was - if we were asked, I would have mentioned this there instead of writing it here.Huge queue at check-in at lunchtime with a waiting time of at least ten minutes. 2 counters and a total of 4 guests ... and one sneaking in with a short question.Last but not least - the amount of emails I got after the booking, at least 4 between the reservation and the actual stay ...,

Very bad hotel, safety and hygiene are the least of their concerns and overall badly maintained- The closet fell down and i almost hit my head- The tap is broken- Dirts are everywhere on the wall, door, wc, etc ...- TV is not working (But it was the least concern ...)- You need to wait 15 minutes for the water to become warm- WC and shower are directly in the room, no real separation- Water leaks from the shower to the room- The neighborhood area around didn't seem safeSee attached photos from inside, so you know what to expectI complained the first night about the closet and the tap but they didn't care much, I stayed 2 nights and i am really glad to leave this place.I absolutely don't recommend this hotel,

From the moment we arrived, Max (the owner) made us feel very welcome! He is a very caring host, with eye for detail, always up for a good chat and willing to provide tips about the region.The chateau itself has a wonderful location overlooking a valley. It's set on a very peaceful property but is conveniently located close to Liege, Maastricht,... Our room was really nice, spacious and clean, very comfortable beds and a really good shower! Breakfast was excellent (and prepared with care by Max)! We've already recommended the chateau to our friends and would definitely book here again!

There are not many facilities in the little village and understandably no dinner was being served as a result of the COVID measures. The B&B is located in a separate part of the house with a shared living room and kitchen. The kitchen had basic furnishing and a fridge with various beverages (beers, wines, sodas, etc.). Our bed room was quite spacious and comfortable.

The mattress, pillows and especially the CARPET need urgent renovation. The kitchen counter is not dirty but degraded/stained, needs to be replaced basically. The carpet is a mess, very stained and used. A horror show if you concentrate too much on that. You can tell that the hotel needs renovation but it is possible to still feel how great it must have been when it was new. One of the small sofas had lots of dust (which I easily cleaned). The kitchenware was very clean but missing a basic breakfast bowl. Nevertheless, if you forget those small details, the level of quietness in such a busy area of Brussels can make you forget all of that (but NOTE: only if you get a room to the back!!) . It would even be better if the windows were cleaner (the rain carries dirt that normally clouds the glass a bit but the fact is that it had not rained for three days, so that means it is not part of normal cleaning or that during the epidemic the service is downgraded a bit for lack of staff...) but opening them and letting the bird chirps come in was really a balm for the mind.,

The quietness. The sheer zenitude of the wide windows facing the private garden and the comfortable single sofas where I could sit looking out.  The cleanliness of the bathroom. The great friendliness and care of the staff. Good wifi. The furniture, especially two very nice tables (with comfortable chairs), very useful to eat or work on. Good heating and all kitchen appliances clean and in perfectly good working conditions.

These are very minor things:*The lift door can sometimes get stuck when you try to open it. *There was building work going on early in the morning at 8am which was quite noisy - so if you want a room that's quieter, let them know in advance.*This is not a negative thing but the location of the hotel is quite tucked out of the way in the city, so do your research beforehand you go so you ensure you know where it is and how to get there.,

*The decorations on the walls in the bathroom is beautiful. *The room itself is nice and spacious and a nicely sized TV.*It had all the facilities we needed for a great stay.*The staff were very friendly and polite.*The reception area is very welcoming and comfy with its hammock style seats.*Breakfast is nice and varied.

Perfect location !!! I definitely recommend this place if you are planning to hang out in Brussel Center, no need to use any transportation. The apartment is nice, modern and well appointed, a loft look.  Easy communication with the Smartflats Brussel team if you need informations.

The house has 3 floors and the stairs are pretty steep, as often in Belgium. Not a problem for us, but keep in mind if you have walking difficulties.,

The house is spacious, luxury and homely at the same time. The top floor is a self-containing apartment with bathroom and toilet. The kids liked Netflix on the TV. Nice main bathroom with bath. Sabine is correct and friendly host, gave us two separate front door keys. The parking place is actually a garage box 5 min walk away, safe and secure, but not very big - if you have a big car, check with Sabine first. It is possible to park for a short time in front of the house (20 min free parking).

The  current available walking path to the beach goes through a semi- construction site and a bike path, but still OK. The surface of the path can be challenging in slippers. I understand that there is another path currently closed down due to works.,

Spacious family room with excellent breakfast ( well arranged in this Covid situation). Location is fine.

I regret to have noticed that the tables were not cleaned well (with the hands only) nor desinfected for the next customers.Only one young boy had to arrange everything alone for breakfast, some moments really to crowdy and busy, he should have assistance by a second person all the time. He was not able to follow-up in time what was needed or refilled constantly.,

Sufficient choice at breakfast. Very friendly cleaning personnal.Most staff being correct, one male member nevertheless found it important to express his personal opinion that I was not allowed to read my newspaper for some moments in the facilities downstairs while it was even empty, using the very weak excuse that this was meant to be a restaurant. I wonder who will come eat anyway, where the Belgian government has meanwhile decided to close completely for one month all horeca facilities! Anyway, I have never been prohibited to read whatever in the lobby or what so one, I am a client so what? Onlly allowed to sit in the room???Adding as well that 2 of the 3 evenings, there was a blackout of the electricity system, so at least one hour no television and no light in the rooms. But you can not read downstairs ....???Stay a little bit reasonable please.

Absolutely wonderful stay in a lovely setting with friendly and welcoming hosts. So fun to see the ponies and the windmill,  and to have such easy access to Ghent. Easily the best place we have stayed on booking.com, and so great for the kids. Comfortable and warm. Thank you so much.

This is fantastic place to stay. It was for us more like visiting grandparents  than apartment rental. Sandra and Johan are fantastic hosts, very nice and kind. Working windmill in the garden, which they will happily show you, Johans oldtimer cars and tractors, horses and playful dog Maxi are assets you will rarely find in one place. Cherries, their own beer and homemade apple cake Sandra shared with us were also perfect. Our kids enjoyed it as well with go-carts races in the garden and all things around. Simply we had great time here and we hope to be back.
Breakfast, price, spacious rooms, clean
Adequate gym and great sauna. Lovely and helpful staff. Very quiet place to spend the night.

Alot of stairs.  Enough stairs that if you left something on the top floor, you really gave some thought about whether it was worth it go up all those stairs to retrieve it.  If you have mobility issues or knee problems, this property might not work well for you.,

Beautiful modernized traditional Belgian home.  Very clean and well kept.  Only a 10-15 minute walk to the centrum, shopping, and restaurants.  It was a wonderful base to explore Ghent and the surrounding Flanders area (Brugges, Brussels, and Antwerp are all less than an hour away).  Parking is offsite, but only a 3-5 minute walk to a secure garage in a gated enclosure.  Washer and dryer onsite.  The host is very friendly.

A bit of a walk to the main street of Middelkerke, but we knew that going in. ,

Very large rooms. Very clean. Helpful staff. Fabulous wifi.

The breakfast could be more fresh and should cater better to vegans. The fruit wasn't fresh, and the eggs were very soggy. In terms of the comfort for the bed, the pillows are terrible. Very thin and not much support. Also the bed is quite sinky so doesn't support your back well if you have pain. ,

The staff were polite and proffesional.

We loved our hosts. They're very friendly. There's a windmill in the property and they showed us inside and explained the whole process. Kids loved the go-carts. The beds were very comfortable. And the property was very clean.

Quite in the middle of nowhere:) but it is not so bad if you have a car and you can be easily in the middle of Brussels, Mechelen or Antwerp within 15 to 45 minutes.,

Not a dislike, but something that some travellers might need to be aware of: the stairs in the property are relatively steep and narrow but many houses & restaurants in the area are like this.,

The property is fabulous and extremely good value for money.  Three of us spent a few days in Flanders, sightseeing and drinking the wonderful beer and this was an excellent base for day-trips to both Bruges and Ieper.  We also enjoyed the walk into Ghent city centre as well as the proximity to the nearby Trappistenhuis beer pub/bar.  The house has great facilities and loads of space.  Parking nearby in a lockable garage was a real bonus, as on-street parking is a challenge.  Sabine was the perfect host - communication before arrival and at the end of our stay was excellent.  Highly recommended.

We loved everything about stay in the townhouse, it really was exceptional. Upon arrival we were greeted by Sabine, who was so welcoming and friendly. She took time to show us around the house which was perfect, very clean and tidy. Well presented and exactly like the pictures. She was even kind enough to put a welcome pack of food and drinks in the fridge. She showed us how to get to our destination and the best route to take. I cannot recommend staying highly enough, it was a perfect visit and we are hoping to visit again next year.

Good location for onward travel, not far from motorway. Has a decent bar and food available. There is also a good supermarket about 5 minute walk away. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Very basic, but all I expected and needed.

very calm place, perfect place to sleep well with family.

The only thing is that they could clean the breakfast tables a bit faster when people leave. I must say I really enjoyed my stay an would definitely recommend this hotel.

As it was during lockdown there were no facilities open and nobody even at the reception desk.

Internet: The Internet connection of the hotel is extremely slow. Free Internet only has 15Mbps download speed and another option is paid Internet at 30Mbps for €9.99... very terrible. It's 2020 now and I am using 1Gbps Internet at home already, 15Mbps can do almost nothing. Bed: I am reserving for a king size bed but I got a "King size bed" combined by two single beds. One thing even worth, the bed mattress moved by itself, so there is a relatively large space between the two bed mattress.,

Decoration: The decoration of the room is very adorable. We like it.Location: 5 Mins walking from the center area of Bruges, a lot of restaurants near by.Breakfast: different choices, especially the fried eggView: Canal and garden viewGarden: This hotel has a very adorable garden.

Highly advertised location but promises just promises – as matter of fact a ‘never to return establishment’ – unless you fancy the stench of cow dung first thing in the morning when opening the window.  Upon entering the Guesthouse your first experience will be painful (and continues to get worse) – door frames are perfect for people < 180 cm. I am just 185cm and constantly banged my head somewhere. We had a family room consisting of two bedrooms (Master and Children). The beams in the ‘child’s room’ were 183cm high, in the master room 179cm. No hazard tape anywhere! Good paper listed choice of breakfast – in reality the selection of cheese or ham or jam was precision measured. For each slice of bread half a slice of above mentioned.
Other example: - standard boiled egg (anywhere in the world eggs are boiled hard for sanitary reasons), here so soft as if the hen just dropped it and therefore saved the Hosts the effort to heat up some water.
Our family room (though we booked it as a couple without children) was advertised and presented so with a sauna. You may guess by now: Fake news!
Yes, there is a 2 person home built sauna on the second floor – but only available from 5pm to 7 pm and extra charge of 5E p/p. This is for the sauna only – not even having a tub nor shower.
Major highlight was our last day in this location:
We were told that one of the beds is needed for a family of five arriving soon.
Upps, within minutes the bed was gone….. I want to say that we reserved and paid consciously for a family room for us as a couple without kids, as it was largest room available (with sauna advertised) at time of booking.
Sorry for my sarcasm, but it best describes this location. The hosts perfected the art of saving any nickel and dime while attempting to appear the best ***in the area.
They also have own Farm products for sale like cheese and marmalade etc…. Be aware, I bought one marmalade to complement the (precision measured breakfast) jam.,

Nothing really – location is what it is: a one horse village in middle of nowhere – next available Supermarket (lol: a ‘Grandma’s convenience store’ at best) is miles away.

Great place to stay on business, well signed from main road from every direction, good parking, comfortable rooms and great breakfast, everything you need when you are travelling on business, will stay again when I am in the region.

There weren’t any simple tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Breakfast wasn’t included in the price (as with many competitors). There was an unpleasant smell that came from bathroom occasionally, smelled a bit like drains. There was also a large damp patch on the ceiling of the bathroom. The worst part about the room (room number 4) was that it was right by the hotel lobby and was therefore very noisy. We could hear every time the front door slid open and close, people talking in the lobby, music from the lobby etc. The Hotel isn’t in the nicest part of town and a good 25 mins to the centre.,

The only negative experience which ruined my entire experience was with one staff. At about 10.30pm on a Saturday, I was watching sports on TV and didn't even think the volume was loud. So heard a knock on the door, I was on my shorts with no shirt so wanted to put on a shirt before answering the door. Before I could get to the door, the staff (a lady) opened the door. So I was socked and asked who she was and she said she was an employee, so i got to the door and she told me that i was disturbing and that everything had to be turned off or down after 10pm. Mindful, I was only watching football on TV with a low volume. So I asked her why she opened the door and she said she had knocked three times with no response and as a result had the right to open the door. There was a telephone in the room, so I asked her why didn't she call the telephone? she could not answer and was staring at me like a clueless chicken. What is the point of providing customers phones in their room if you can't use it to contact your customers? I was fuming, because if i was naked in the toilet, she would have entered my room and seen me naked? The hotel claims to provide customers their privacy but this is not correct. She was very rude and was talking to me in a high tone, then asked me not to raise my voice when she was also raising her voice. I told her off and slammed the door against her face. Surely the last time I will ever use this hotel.,

Flat 401 where we stayed looked quite shabby and in need of renovation which has not been done for a some time. Marks, scuffs, scratches, on the walls and ceiling, holes from old fixtures, signs of wear and tear everywhere, gray towels, discolored old sofa with the disfigured armrest - all this does not take much to repaint and refresh now and then, yet has not been done for a while. The access to the property with several long flights of stairs is not easy and friendly for people carrying small children or heavy luggage, so travel light!  Also if traveling by car to this very central location, beware of the Low Emission Zone introduced in Antwerpen in 2017, which requires special authorization for foreign cars (advance application online) - something the host never mentioned when advising on the nearest car park in the central Antwerpen.,

The bed was, without a doubt, the worst bed we've ever slept on in a 4 or 5 Star hotel.  The mattress was harder than the floor, and it had a mattress protector on top of it which felt like it was made from coir matting!  God knows what they put in it.  After the first night of getting almost no sleep we took the protector off and then at least we only had to sleep on the solid mattress.  We were so happy to get home to our own bed.Another gripe - mostly because we're both tall - is that the shower is a rainfall one, fixed to the ceiling, at a height of about 5'8"" from the bath floor, and has no directional movement. So if you want a shower you have to squat slightly if you want your head to get wet.,

Hairdryer, bathrobe and slippers provided. Sleeping very comfy, good mattress and pillows, silence.I would definitely choose it for longer stays, where I could profit of the swimming pool and gym room.Convenient also for reaching the European Quarter, 5 minutes walk from Metro Herrmann Debroux, which gets you to Schuman in 15'.If you arrive after 20h00, you need to call the night guardian at 02 6740917 who will open the door and give you the keys to your apartment.My rate was € 89 for one night (single occupier, without breakfast) so very good value for money.Very quiet building in a quiet, safe area.

What a great place. Thank you, Eva and Mady! I can't say enough good things so I'll start with huge praise for their excellent communication. In addition to originally being schedule to arrive at a terribly inconvenient hour, I eventually had a last-minute travel situation occur that changed my arrival even more dramatically. As I understand it the hosts are normally on sight in their shop below but were off for the winter before the Christmas market opened. Even though we were not able to meet me in person, they were very accommodating and communicated with me exceptionally well. As for the apartment itself it begins on the 3rd floor (with ground as 1st) and occupies the 3rd, 4th and 5th floors above a gelato shop overlooking Brado, City Hall and the famed Guild Houses. The rooms were all very comfortable and modern, and the entire place was immaculately clean. The kitchen was very well stocked with cooking supplies should you want to ignore all the wonderful restaurants just steps away. I enjoyed my coffee in the morning at the breakfast counter facing the beautiful old Antwerp Guild Houses, which during my visit were glowing with Christmas lights. My kids were all fondest of the very top floor with a lovely loft space, high vaulted ceiling, amazing view onto the plaza, very large sofa and tv. The photos I've attached show the view from the windows looking onto the Grote Markt as the city is setting up for the Christmas market. You couldn't ask for a better location in all of Antwerp!I am sincerely looking forward to another stay here again in the future.

All was excellent,

(Which we die) Enroute to Bruge he even gave us a scenic tour of the local area which was very interesting. 
Overall the actual room and especially the service given by the owners will keep us coming back time and time again.

-It is a bit of a stretch to call this an "Aparthotel" simply by virtue of putting a small sink and a two-ring hob at the end of what was otherwise an entirely ordinary hotel room. - The accommodation is very basic.  It was convenient for a few days; longer would have been difficult,

- The downstairs reception area was bright and cheerful. - The staff were all helpful and polite.  - The location was relatively convenient: perhaps only 10 - 15 minutes to walk to the city centre.  But the Aparthotel Adagio Access is towards the EU quarter and gusts should be prepared for a degree of traffic noise.

Excellent location for a first time traveler in Brugge.  Nice room, superb location, and friendly staff. Very comfy bed. Rooms well appointed. Enjoyable stay. Highly recommended for those looking for comfort. Quite far from Brugge train station. Unless you do not have big luggage, walking would be delightful.

Nothing.,

In front of central station. I was surprised to the price for the good room even if Sunday night in winter. Check in time is from 15:00, but the reception kindly accepted me at 14:20.

Dismal view, but I believe I requested a "quiet" room so that's my fault.,

Exceptional location, lovely hotel and friendly staff.

Only one towel ! Rather cold in the room,

Very clean and new.

My wife and I spent 3 amazing nights at Les Lucioles. Everything was over our expectations: the room was clean, the breakfast was amazing (they provided us with a typical breakfast for the region). Everything was welcoming from the entrance till the room itself!

Parking mentioned on the facilities was paid parking which would have been helpful if mentioned.,

It is located 5 mins walk from the center. There are cafes, restaurants in 1 min walk from the place.

The sauna was cold when we arrived on Friday and because of COVID jacuzzi was not to be used.,

Personnel was super friendly. Good location

Location is good as it is near EU buildings and the surroundings is quite in the evening and during the night. The personnel was extremely nice and helpful.

Amazing stay! Hotel is only a five minute walk from the main square and you just felt like you had the whole city to yourself. The peaceful area made for a fantastic nights sleep! Cedric at check-in was fantastic and couldn't have been more help. Fantastic staff all round!Rooms were beautifully designed, spacious and very cosy. The room was lovely and warm and the bed was divine to sleep in. On my next trip to Bruges, I will definitely return. Thanks Martin's Relais!

The manager and his people weer very nice and helpful. Room was perfect and the food was delicious... we’ll be back!

Given the location next to busy Le Carré which we knew in advance, there are a large number of bar/clubs behind the building which all play extremely loud music until 5am. We knew this in advance and so brought ear plugs to sleep (recommended!) but apart from that all good! ,

We were very surprised with the apartment. It’s very big and very well decorated and taken care of. It was great to have 2 bedrooms each with a bathroom and a large terrace with excellent views. The location made it easy after spending the day in the city. Next to all good restaurants and stores and walking distance from all the major attractions. We parked in an indoor garage opposite for 24 hours for €20.
Great that the owner allows pets too! 
Very comfortable and nice beds.

I could not get the temperature in the shower right for the life of me! Being vegan, the breakfast options were a bit limited. I'm used to this, but it's a bit annoying when you pay so much for it.,

The interiors of this hotel are quite stunning. And it was a treat to have breakfast in a library room! Located a short walk from the Central train station and the Grand Place which was perfect for a short stay.

Overall, it was an amazing experience. The new owner of the place, Renzo, an Italian gentleman with a passion for cooking and hospitality turned our experience into a wonderful one. The dinner is a must have with mouthwatering Italian delicacies at Osteria Sapori (The Italian restaurant inside the hotel, owned by Renzo). They have a wide range of wine menu. The place is strategically located at Maasmechelen, only an hour drive away from Brussels, 20 mins drive away from Maastricht and 45mins drive away from the Three Country Border (NL, BG, GER) at Aachen. It is a great place for both romantic getaways and family vacations. We booked 3 rooms for the larger family visiting from Istanbul, Eindhoven, Dubai, and Vancouver. We'll definitely visit back in summer.

The fact that we were staying there four days, and the towels were never changed and the room was never cleaned. And when we asked it, the hotel say we had to pay for that service.,

The neighborhood
Lovely hotel, great location to explore Bruges and staff were friendly and helpful.

The only downsides were that a few of the reception staff were not so friendly as Suhail, and we would have appreciated a bathmat in the bathroom. Nevertheless we would highly recommend a stay in this hotel.,

We enjoyed our stay at the  Century Hotel from the 12th to 18th February.  On arrival we received a very friendly welcome from Suhail. He explained that since we were early, he would check if a room was ready and asked if we would mind waiting for 5 – 10 mins. After a very short time he was able to give us a key card and told us that we would staying at the 9th floor where they had just fitted new showers and mattresses. The room was clean and tidy and the beds were very comfortable.The breakfast was particularly  good for a budget hotel:  good choice of hot breakfast items, healthy options, and nice Flemish breakfast items and plenty of fresh fruit.A little research shows that the hotel was built in the 1920s for the Antwerp World Exhibition in 1930. On the first floor there’s a long nice breakfast room overlooking the iconic central station.The hotel’s position in very central to the tourist and shopping attractions that Antwerp has to offer. The staff at breakfast and room cleaning were very attentive and friendly.

No tea and coffee making facilities ,

The location was perfect, right in the hart of everything we were looking for.

There were a couple of different emails about how to pick up the keys from a mailbox which were confusing. I tried to check in at 23:30 after a very long day of meetings and travel, and couldn't get in, nor reach someone by phone for the first 30 minutes. I nearly checked in at a hotel down the street. Eventually someone picked up the phone and explained the new mailbox number and code, so I finally checked in just after midnight.,

The bed was very comfortable. There is a good organic grocer just next door. The metro is 200m away.

Disappointed with our room compared to photographs we had seen. We had notified the hotel about my husband being Gluten Free due to health reasons, he asked for GF bread in the restaurant with his starter at dinner and was informed No bread from a very rude man who was waiting on. We asked for GF beer in the bar upstairs only to be told although the hotel have some it was in the restaurant downstairs and the barman could not fetch one upstairs for him!!We had other problems with the food in the restaurant and the attitude of who appeared to be the manager in charge that night. Delicious breakfast was prepared by Owner the house  at chosen time, so we didn't have to be early birds on holidays.  Rooms and bathroom are spotless clean and cosy, furnished in nice style. Hosts were also happy to give us all the information about the activities, restaurants in the neighbourhood. Our room was spacious and comfortable with a modern feel to it. But as I said it looks like they are still doing improvements/renovations to the rooms and hotel itself. The hairdryer in our bathroom was outdated and the shower was a bit outdated as well - the shower was quite small (limited room to move, not good if you’re a curvy person) but the shower head was modern and water pressure was good! Our remote control for the tv didn’t work, perhaps battery was dead. We forgot to notify front desk but for us it was ok as we really didn’t watch tv; we were out most of the day and came back at night. Not a walking distance to central station but there are metros and buses walking distance from the hotel. By taxi it’s about less than 10mins from central station (cost about 12-13Euros). By metro it’s less than 20 minutes once you know the directions. We were fine with the location though.,

Overall the hotel and staff were wonderful! Staff were friendly and extremely helpful.Clean quiet boutique hotel with a modernness to it. Located in a quiet and nice area. But it looks like they are still doing more improvements/renovations to the hotel, which is good. Hotel is close to metros, busses, bistros/restaurants, supermarket, shops and major street. Our room was spacious and comfortable with big windows. The weather and temperature when we came was pleasant so opening the window was just fine for us, enough nice breeze to come in. We stayed for two nights so our beds were cleaned/made and towels changed on point.
the master piece was the very large bathroom with 2 rain shower, side by side.

We maybe just had bad luck...but there was obviously a party in the building the night we stayed. The smell of smoke and noise made sleeping nearly impossible until after 4AM. The apartment was well cared for, but the building was not well maintained in the common area.,

From the postcode it took us several 'sweeps' of Houffalize before we spotted the hotel. It's on the corner of a busy area so eyes were on the very busy road outside rather than peering for the hotel sign which was not immediately obvious. Having found the hotel, we then had the issue of finding a place to park, and by luck we found a car park across the road around 200m, away.Not sure if this is where hotel guests normally park, but I'm not exaggerating to say it was around 45 minutes after reaching the town, that we finally walked into the hotel. We found ourselves with our cases in the main bar/restaurant and someone eventually told us hotel reception is at the back of the hotel, which it was. Regulars at the hotel would probably use a side door, and when we walked out the following morning it looked as if there may have been parking in the street at the back. Meal in restaurant was good, though expensive, and service was slow. We sat waiting for our food for 45 minutes, and it wasn't busy. Served by a friendly man who also had checked us in and seemed to be doing everything, maybe with the exception of cooking the food ! Houffalize pretty town for a 1 night stop on the way back to ferry but don't think we'll revisit.,

The greeting at reception (when we found it !) was warm and friendly and the staff spoke very good English.The room, bed, bathroom and shower were reasonably spacious and adequate for a 1 night stop. We had our evening meal in the restaurant; there were others in the area but we were tired after a 300 mile drive.

When we relayed that, the staff said the dog was not allowed and we would have to sit in the bar. We explained that we had seen a dog earlier in the day sitting in the restaurant. We were seated in the bar and two other dogs showed up and they were seated in the bar area. The third dog showed up and they were seated in the dining room. The staff doesn't seem to know their own rules. We waited for a long period of time for our food and then told they were out of one item we ordered. So we ordered something else. A few minutes later, the original order arrived! Neither a big worry, but we would like to be treated like everyone else, whether our dog is with us or not. The location is perfect ! 2 minutes walk to Grande Place, 5 minutes from the train station by foot. The hotel is very stylis. The room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. We used the concierge service to book a restaurant. He met our expectations 100%. We had a wonderful evening.

We visited in summer but we did wonder if the hotel would be warm enough on cold days. You do need to open the windows to let fresh air in as the hotel doesn`t smell very fresh. The stairs are really pretty steep and there`s no lift so you need to be fit on your feet.,

This hotel has character! I can imagine some travellers being shocked at the almost hidden entrance, the steep winding staircases and wind gusting into the rooms straight from the sea (if you leave them open, like we did) but we thought it was charming. Our dog was welcome and the guests chatted together at breakfast. Nobody used tablets or mobile phones - there weren`t signs up everywhere forbidding it - but the hotel doesn`t attract hich-tech workaholics or bored youngsters. The W-LAN worked perfectly but at breakfast we enjoyed our food. The restaurant was always packed with people eating fresh mussels and other local specialities. The town has beautiful houses in beautiful gardens and no two are the same. The beach is huge whatever the tide is doing. We watched kite surfers and walked for miles in both directions. We ran into the sea in September as did other swimmers because although the wind was strong, the water wasn`t cold at all. The beach was extremely clean. The waves brought in shells, not plastic. There are lovely paths to walk the dog, for example through the woods behind the dunes, and as long as you kept away from the beach directly in front of the promenade, nobody seemed to mind dogs playing on the sand or swimming in the sea like ours did. The picturesque tram stop is useful as well as pretty - we travelled all the way to de Panne on the one afternoon it rained. Dogs travel free. Dogs in fact are treated incredibly well in Belgium. Everyone assumes they are fun and is totally relaxed so naturally the dogs are relaxed too. In our experience everyone spoke English or German or both, or explained in Flemish so helpfully that we understood what they meant. Parking a car in de Haan couldn`t be easier and we never needed to pay. Our car broke down on the way to de Haan and we arrived very late but our host stayed up to let us in and greet us personally. She was always busy morning, day and night but like everyone in de Haan she was friendly and helpful.
Lovely owner who was very helpful. Nice, simple breakfast with really good home made apple/pear juice and preserves.

The Staff were more than great And Helpful we were there during ‘la Tour de France 2019’ and the roads leading to the hotel were closed the hotel sent us one of the employees ‘Alban’ to guide us through the crazy traffic he walked more than half an hour to reach us and another 1 hour in the car trying to figure out the quicker and less busier road to the hotel.
When we reach the hotel the Concierge Team welcomed us warmly with dozens of suggestions on how to spend the next 3 days in Brussels Specially Haluk et Jean in numerous instances they literally went out of the hotel with us to show how to reach a restaurant / Attraction - to my surprise the Concierge Team consist 6 personnel each specialized in a special area... and by the way they were extending the same service to all hotel Guests with the same unprecedented positive attitude at any time of the day.
With the hundreds of hotels that I have stayed with  during my travels I can easily say that I have never experienced a more professional concierge service like the one I have received from The Concierge Team at Amigo Rocco Forte.

As “relaxing area” was an office rotative scraped chair.I showed the receptionist my printed reservation (with picture and all the room specifications) and then I became the proper room.It is truth that I asked in my reservation for a room on an upper floor, but that means not that the room must be directly under the roof and in no case with inferior endowments.The second room was very nice, sunny, with view and very clean.,

The main issue with all the rooms were the beds, which were honestly not very good in our experience. Several of us had a poor night sleep due to this. In this price range, you usually get much better beds than this. Another issue we had, which is by no means a fault of the hotel, is the fact that it was a very long drive to the circuit of Spa-Francorchamps where we needed to be. Booking.com reported a 25KM distance, but due to a lack of main roads, this took about 45 minutes. So I would not recommend this hotel if you need to go to the circuit.,

A dream stay in AntwerpThis hotel is a beautiful nirvana in a fantastic location. We were very luck in that the hotel owner upgraded us to the their best suite. A genuinely wonderful room, with a beautiful bathroom and an arched roof. You could see the wonderful history of the building. The owner also gave a very good overview of the city and how best to explore it in our limited time - he was exceptionally friendly and helpful.We had an absolutely wonderful time in Antwerp and we'll definitely be visiting again. And there's no doubt - we will be choosing Hotel Matelote when we return. If you're looking to support a small hotel during this challenging time, while not compromising on quality or location, then this is an excellent choice.

First of all, a couple of days before check in, the company changed us from this property to another property in Brussels, as we got little notice we had to accept the alternative booking.  This was inconvenient.  They told me by email it was an 'upgrade'  Well it wasn't.  When we arrived at the property the key box where I was to retrieve the front door key was located behind a locked gate.  In order to access the key box I had to force the gate open.  I got the keys from the key box, these only opened the front door and a post box where the apartment keys were supposed to be.  There were no apartment keys in the post box.  The email containing the instructions stated post box B12, there was no post box with that number, once we figured out which post box was correct there were still no keys there for the apartment.  I made 4 phone calls to Smartflats to gain help to access the property.  Eventually after nearly 1 hour at the property a lady arrived with the keys.  She was unable to explain why no keys had been in the post box (as per the bad instructions email).  Upon entry to the apartment we found that 1. the light in the toilet was not working, 2 there weren't 2 double beds as expected from our booking 3 the door to the bedroom with 2 single beds did not close properly and remained open as the bed blocked the door way 4 the hot water in the apartment lasted for approximately 6-7 minutes, meaning 2 of us had to have freezing cold showers on numerous occasions.  This ruined our weekend in Brussels.   I note that Smartflats never updated the fact that they moved our booking to another property on booking.com.  Smartflats personnel made no effort to apologize for the mess on Friday evening that wasted 1 hour of our weekend.  Totally unprofessional and unhelpful.

one morning we were woken up by a loud loud lorry that was parked in front of the hotel, but the hotel is not to blame for that slight disturbance,

Very well located boutique hotel for a city trip, excellent breakfast, we had a very spacious suite with an elegant and very comfortable decor, one of the best hotel mattresses I have slept on for a very long time, the hotel had a nice bar with a good selection of drinks and we rented bikes at the hotel which were perfect for a tour around and through the inner city, beautiful garden to relax in

I prefer shower instead of bathtub,

Perfect position really close to the very central square, amazing view and very comfortable big size bed
Excellent location near the center and a short walk to the train station. Staff was courteous and helpful and the breakfast was very nice.
Staff and service were fantastic, and this hotel has class! Loved it

Nothing,

Good location near the train station within very easy walking distance and also only a 20 minute walk to the centre of Brussels ( which can also be reached by the underground from the closeby train station.  I found the staff friendly and helpful, and the breakfast and room perfectly adequate.  A good choice for a 2 night stay on a budget.
Nice and cheap for family looking to travel.

Warm welcome and very clean. Having a balcony was a great bonus. The bonuses for "client weekend" were an unexpected extra.

I like the hotel is mixed between  traditional and modren...close from the cernter

The hotel could do with some updating. It’s very old school but I knew that when booking so it’s not a complaint.,

We had a short stay at the Warwick. Couldn’t complain about anything based on the price - €116. Staff were lovely. Well located. It was great. We received a complementary drink for sighing up to the loyalty program which was welcomed.

I have absolutely no complaints!,

Where to start! Nancy is incredibly friendly and attentive to details. The place is accessible by lift, which made it quite easy since I was carrying plenty of luggage. The accommodation seems to be oriented towards travellers who prefer a quiet and private stay with easy access to the shopping streets, beach, station and restaurants. The entire place is architecturally lovely and decorated with great taste and homely touches. The common areas feature design furniture (Eames and Le Corbuiser spring to mind), original artwork, plenty of natural light and lovely views of the cathedral across and the station five minutes away. The kitchen has a capsule coffee maker where you can make your own coffee at any time of day without disturbing the other guests.The room in itself is lovely, with a cozy bedroom with original parquet flooring (much like the common areas) and a relaxing bathroom with a full bathtub and vitraux. Plenty of thought went into the design and continued operation of the Windsor, I could not ask for anything more!

Carpet was stained and we were given the furthest room in the very back of the hotel, even though we booked way in advance.  We didn't call for service, but the room was very hot and were not able to adjust it successfully to get comfortable.  The price was very high.,

Staff, bed, jazz music, and location were great.  Very easy walk to the train station.

It was a fair walk into the old part of town. ,


The hotel was close to the station so very convenient. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean.

There was no WiFi available and not enough heating for the cold nights and mornings,

Perfect location!
Internet very bad, no bar, no lobby, no room service, breakfast in a basement

The room was uncomfortable and did not have privacy: street-facing room has no curtains. Pillows are old, towels are old and grey.,

Location is good.
A lovely hotel with old world personality.
Very noisy and room was not confortable.

It went well we were able to contact quickly but when we checked out they told us there is water on the mattress and what can happen if you have children and they make a mess. For that reason they have taken my deposit of 150 €, which I cannot find because water dries naturally. I also said this via whatsapp to them, they said "It's 7 working days after your check-out, it's automatically so no worry you'll have it any days now." But they lied and i did not receive it !!
So I wouldn't book this if you had to pay a deposit !!!! They will look for something small to take your deposit anyway !!!
We had a wonderful stay here! Very close to the centre, Betty and the rest of the staff were very friendly and attentive. I would highly reccomend this hotel if your planning a trip to Bruge!

Nothing! There was Absolutely nothing not to like about this place ,

The staff were unbelievably polite, courteous and professional, very helpful, provided liable information and answered any questions impeccably.. the location is perfect for a couple, right next to a canal and a short walking distance from both most toured and not toured places. Perfection!

Breakfast was way too expensive, did not avail of that on any day,

The friendly staff, excellent location, comfortable room.
Nancy is such a kind person, and the place is really beautiful!
Great location, couple minutes from the main square. Surrounded by all kinds of dining and social options. Famous waffle house across the street.

This is a seven floor hotel made of wood, the stairs and the floor of the 7th floor are made of wood...
Dangerous in case of a fire.

The shower. You were either burning or freezing. It never kept the temperature. There are no chairs for outside use although the setting is suppose to be outside. No umbrellas for the extreme sun. We left the tent open which was a mistake and the rain left water marks on the lounge set. It cost me the deposit. So remember even in extreme heat you need to close the tent (it was 37) this means it gets boiling inside the tent for fruit and veg. Therefore the tents are not really ideal in warm summer weather since it is facing west.,

Will be good with kids. The farm setting is relaxing. The tent is well equipped apart from knifes to cut fruit and veg. The breakfast was good, just way to much.
I requested a double bed and i had two single beds put together which is not a double bed!! So i paid for a double room for nothing!!

Having free car parking, we haver never been charged elsewhere in Europe .,

Lovely old house with outdoor space. Large bedroom with an oddly  arranged bathroom, no door on it just a walk round partition. Very good breakfast/ Charged for parking our car in their carpark.
The best hotel I have ever stay. Room is clean. We are stay in 203. Breakfast for 9 euro. We are satisfied.
There was no grocery store or anything to buy food, beer, etc. to bring to the flat within walking distance. The only restaurants around we’re in the $$$ range.
The staff were very kind and accommodating as we had to cut short our stay to return home early.

The expensive price of breakfast.,

Fabulously comfortable and large bed.

Best location,

Excelent location

Everything was great. thank you!,

The guest house has is very cosy, with nice design items and art inside. The place is very comfortable and located close to the train station, city centre and beach boardwalk.

The bed duvet was too hot and heavy; they couldn’t provide a lighter one but gave us two single duvets which were just as hot. We don’t like leaving the air-con on all night, blowing in our faces. But this is a problem in most hotels, like the lack of space for more than one suitcase!
Also we missed having tea- and coffee-making facilities in the room, but on checkout we were told we could have asked for a “kit” for this - wish they had told us on arrival.
The shower inevitably left a puddle on the bathroom floor; there was a drain in the floor for this but it is inadequate: the slope of the floor should be improved and/or the shower screen should be sealed.,

Liked the quiet good taste of the decor, the location close to the Grand’Place and metro, the extremely nice staff (especially the housekeeping ladies and bar staff), the spacious room and its noise-proof windows, the hooks for towels/bathrobes etc in the bathroom; the pleasant lounge bar.

Had a room with the view to the main street, just in front of the train station. It can be annoying in the morning, if you wish to sleep more, because it is quite noisy.,

Good value for money, good location, nice breakfast.

There was nothing not to like. ,

Everything was excellent
